description: Want to help take Netflix to the next level? We have more than 100 million members in 190+ countries who watch over 10 billion hours of content per quarter; however, we are just getting started. We are reinventing the way people around the world discover, watch, and share TV and movies.   As a Senior UI Engineer team you’ll help brainstorm, scope and build a wide range of product experiments (via A/B testing).  We reside in the intersection between commerce and partnerships and build payments to scale globally through our partner relationships.  Some of our most recent notable projects include  T-Mobile  and Comcast.  We are a deeply cross-functional team; if you desire the opportunity to do deeply impactful work across web, mobile and tv applications this is the right role for you. This is a fast-growing area for product innovation as we expand and look to bring in the next 100 million members.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering UI Engineering Senior User Interface Engineer - Partner/Payments


Want to help take Netflix to the next level? We have more than 100 million members in 190+ countries who watch over 10 billion hours of content per quarter; however, we are just getting started. We are reinventing the way people around the world discover, watch, and share TV and movies.   


As a Senior UI Engineer team you’ll help brainstorm, scope and build a wide range of product experiments (via A/B testing).  We reside in the intersection between commerce and partnerships and build payments to scale globally through our partner relationships.  Some of our most recent notable projects include T-Mobile  and Comcast.  We are a deeply cross-functional team; if you desire the opportunity to do deeply impactful work across web, mobile and tv applications this is the right role for you. This is a fast-growing area for product innovation as we expand and look to bring in the next 100 million members.

  • Big impact - you will directly impact a product that tens of millions of customers use every day across the globe
  • Data driven - we use A/B testing to drive feature and product decisions
  • Speed - we move quickly and iterate rapidly
  • Collaborative - we regularly collaborate with Product Managers, Designers and Data Scientists to design A/B tests that shape the future of Netflix
  • Unique culture - we live by our values, learn more about us at: jobs.netflix.com
    • What's Different About Us
  • Self-motivated and high-performing, with a passion for both the business and technology
  • Expert-level knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML
  • Comfortable writing custom JavaScript solutions rather than relying on existing frameworks
  • React and Node.js a plus
  • Strong communication and capable of collaborating with a diverse array of partners
  • 5+ years of relevant experience and a bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
    • Qualifications
  • Experience with native development for iOS or Android is a plus
  • Experience or interest in web performance
    • The Roadmap for Acquisition

With over 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries, our approach to Marketing is to defy convention, disrupt industry norms and break new ground through innovative, culturally relevant, breakthrough campaigns. We are actively promoting our original, exclusive content that is core to everything we do.We’re looking for smart, motivated, scrappy individuals to fill an integral role on the global creative marketing team for a Coordinator of Global Creative Marketing, Global Series - Drama. The RoleThis role is unique. So is the right candidate. In this role, you will be a key contributor of the team strategizing, executing and managing marketing and social launch campaigns for Drama Series. You will be a member of a small, seasoned and nimble group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, reporting to the Director of Global Creative Marketing - Global Series.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Coordinator, Global Creative Marketing - Series (Drama)


The Opportunity
It’s an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. With over 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries, our approach to Marketing is to defy convention, disrupt industry norms and break new ground through innovative, culturally relevant, breakthrough campaigns. We are actively promoting our original, exclusive content that is core to everything we do.


We’re looking for smart, motivated, scrappy individuals to fill an integral role on the global creative marketing team for a Coordinator of Global Creative Marketing, Global Series - Drama. This is a great growth opportunity to join a team that leads the development and launch of innovative marketing and social campaigns across a diverse range of Original Series (it is NOT an admin role).


The Role
This role is unique. So is the right candidate.


In this role, you will be a key contributor of the team strategizing, executing and managing marketing and social launch campaigns for Drama Series. You will be a member of a small, seasoned and nimble group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, reporting to the Director of Global Creative Marketing - Global Series.

  • Has experience in working on a team that launches premium entertainment properties that connect consumers to entertainment brands and create a passionate following.
  • Has a native understanding of digital with an emphasis on mobile, social, video and display and an ability to tell stories through great ideas regardless of medium. More specifically, we’re looking for someone with a passion for social media and good judgment about what captures people’s attention and gets people talking.
  • Has a creative disposition. This is first and foremost a creative job. The coordinator (alongside with managers) works directly with agencies, and is a key contributor to the creative output on a given Marketing and Social campaign. (See more below under “Core Responsibilities”)
  • Has experience working with the social networks to identify opportunities for innovation.
  • Is an effective collaborator in a fast paced, multifaceted environment. We will typically have multiple launch campaigns happening at once.
  • Is structured, organized and used to managing project timelines, budgets and deliverables.
  • Is a cross-functional team player who is able to engage, listen and collaborate with internal departments/teams to execute elegant campaigns seamlessly, and to see the cross-functional collaboration through launch.
  • Has a hunger to learn new areas of marketing and social, in this ever-evolving digital landscape.
  • A little bit of je ne sais quoi. Our team is diverse. With a mix of backgrounds including journalism, video production, digital marketing, PR, brand, entertainment, social news, and agency experience, we’re always looking for people that add to the broader team’s skillset.
    • We are looking for someone who:
  • Partner with campaign managers to develop culturally relevant and impactful global campaigns that connect with consumers
  • Assist in the creation of breakthrough creative materials - including AV assets (trailers, social videos), digital and other mobile-optimized creative, print, outdoor, etc.
  • Handle day-to-day project tracking and management with internal cross-functional teams (e.g. content, product, publicity, media strategy, social, etc.) and agency partners.
  • Become familiar with details of campaigns in order to keep the team on track and be an effective participant
  • Asset management (workflow / timelines) and transfer between internal and external departments, ensuring timely delivery
  • Provide additional creative support on priority titles
  • Catalogue incoming and outgoing assets
  • Work with internal partners on music requests/licensing and legal reviews
  • Develop, track and maintain budgets for team campaigns
  • Assist in creating presentations and maintaining various documents and charts for various campaigns
  • Shepherd scope, budget, and overall campaign resources.
    • Core Responsibilities:
  • A minimum 3-5 years of entertainment marketing (and/or social media) experience either at a creative agency, network/studio marketing team, or network on-air department with working on multiple film and/or TV launch campaigns.
  • Have excellent creative taste and be a clear, concise communicator in a variety of media.
  • Innate curiosity and excitement to dive into the overlapping worlds of marketing and social.
  • A passion for entertainment and TV (especially Drama) is a plus.
    • The successful candidate possesses:
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.  
  • You are a proactive self-starter, who does not need to be told what to do and will be resourceful in order to find solutions to any challenge. You are not afraid to get your hands dirty.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of the business - especially when bridging the gap between our content and our brand - and have an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!
  • You are an avid user of both your left and right brain. If you live and breathe global entertainment and geek out at the thought of breaking the advertising mold, then we want to talk to you.
    • Personality Attributes:


    Compensation
    Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

description: The TeamNetflix is the world's leading Internet television network available in over 190 countries, streaming more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films. The Media Engineering & Partnerships team (MEP) operates within the larger Worldwide Post organization and is responsible for bridging the gap between the post production industry and the internal needs of the larger Worldwide Post organization. The MEP team is comprised of a mix of technologists, engineers, and vendor relations managers. Together, the team builds and supports deep, symbiotic partnerships with post facilities throughout the world.The OpportunityFueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 120 million streaming members globally. Netflix Original Content has transformed the business from a distributor into a creator. Seeking deep alignment with post production facilities, MEP offers training, technical support, and guidance to the broader post production industry. Join the team that helps our partners overcome technical challenges across the globe!The RoleThe ideal candidate will have a great passion for technical problem solving, file based media analysis, and a high level of intellectual curiosity. There is no problem we cannot solve, and you would be a pivotal resource for our partners when they encounter issues with picture and sound media files delivered to Netflix. A passion for helping people coupled with a love of problem solving describes you perfectly. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is proactive and seeks out knowledge around new formats and standards, while being able to exercise good judgment and prioritize tasks effectively.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Media Specialist


The Team
Netflix is the world's leading Internet television network available in over 190 countries, streaming more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films. The Media Engineering & Partnerships team (MEP) operates within the larger Worldwide Post organization and is responsible for bridging the gap between the post production industry and the internal needs of the larger Worldwide Post organization. The MEP team is comprised of a mix of technologists, engineers, and vendor relations managers. Together, the team builds and supports deep, symbiotic partnerships with post facilities throughout the world.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 120 million streaming members globally. Netflix Original Content has transformed the business from a distributor into a creator. Seeking deep alignment with post production facilities, MEP offers training, technical support, and guidance to the broader post production industry. Join the team that helps our partners overcome technical challenges across the globe!


The Role
The ideal candidate will have a great passion for technical problem solving, file based media analysis, and a high level of intellectual curiosity. There is no problem we cannot solve, and you would be a pivotal resource for our partners when they encounter issues with picture and sound media files delivered to Netflix. A passion for helping people coupled with a love of problem solving describes you perfectly. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is proactive and seeks out knowledge around new formats and standards, while being able to exercise good judgment and prioritize tasks effectively.

  • Support our global network of post production and sound partners when they have technical questions around file specifications, errors and new formats
  • Provide helpful, collaborative support and resolution to our partners while juggling priorities around tight production deadlines
  • Build and leverage strong relationships with internal engineering and production technology teams
  • Bring innovative thinking around scalable solutions to support a global network of partners
  • Develop content for our public facing Partner Help Center in an effort to allow partners to self diagnose and repair problematic assets on their own  
  • Master the internal Netflix supply chain to understand the appropriate team to escalate an issue that is out of your scope, from Master QC to Encoding to International Dubbing
  • Make sound, independent decisions, and manage your time thoughtfully, balancing the need for issue resolution with empathy
  • Advocate, understand, communicate, and exemplify the company's values
    • In this role you will:
  • Experience working with Interoperable Master Format (IMF) packages and audio wav files
  • Experience with Dolby Vision HDR metadata
  • Understanding of DI and Mastering workflows
  • Working knowledge of Master audio formats and specifications including Dolby Atmos Prior experience in a technical troubleshooting role
  • Highly analytical and able to get to the root cause of a problem; able to creatively figure out a solution or propose changes to existing workflows as required
  • Adaptability and resilience to quick changes in priorities, technology, tools and workflow
  • Attention to detail; organization, problem-solving, analytical and multitasking skills
    • Do you have what it takes?

text: Sr Quality Assurance Engineer - Japan Certification Engineer
description: The Netflix Certification Team directly impacts the quality of consumer electronic products that millions of people use every day to enjoy Netflix. We are looking to add someone to the team that speaks Japanese to help us further develop our partnerships in Japan. To bring Netflix conveniently into the living rooms of our members across the globe, we are working with CE partners around the world to integrate Netflix into their Smart TVs, Set-Top Boxes, Streaming Sticks, Blu-Ray Players, Projectors, and more.  We are aiming to reach our current and future members around the world on devices they use most frequently to watch linear TV: cable, and satellite set-top boxes. The Netflix Certification Team is ensuring the quality of the consumer products carrying the Netflix logo, not only by developing and executing certification tests on devices, but also by coaching partners throughout the entire certification process.While Netflix Certification is working directly with all the major OEM brands in consumer electronics you will also get the chance to partner directly with chip manufacturers to integrate Netflix streaming application into their reference implementations for CE/MVPD devices. These reference implementations will subsequently be used by many of the major global brands.Netflix is looking for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer that will partner closely with our Japanese partners. A grey box tester, who has a strong quality assurance and development background with deep knowledge in testing audio/video consumer electronics devices, as well as demonstrated skill in partner communication. In this partner facing role, you will provide technical evaluation and feedback of certification test results to determine device eligibility to ship "Netflix-ready".  If you have the skill and a passion for audio/video consumer electronics devices such as Smart TVs, IPTV, cable and satellite set top boxes, then this job is for you!
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Partner Devices Sr Quality Assurance Engineer - Japan Certification Engineer


The Netflix Certification Team directly impacts the quality of consumer electronic products that millions of people use every day to enjoy Netflix. We are looking to add someone to the team that speaks Japanese to help us further develop our partnerships in Japan.


To bring Netflix conveniently into the living rooms of our members across the globe, we are working with CE partners around the world to integrate Netflix into their Smart TVs, Set-Top Boxes, Streaming Sticks, Blu-Ray Players, Projectors, and more.  We are aiming to reach our current and future members around the world on devices they use most frequently to watch linear TV: cable, and satellite set-top boxes.


The Netflix Certification Team is ensuring the quality of the consumer products carrying the Netflix logo, not only by developing and executing certification tests on devices, but also by coaching partners throughout the entire certification process.


While Netflix Certification is working directly with all the major OEM brands in consumer electronics you will also get the chance to partner directly with chip manufacturers to integrate Netflix streaming application into their reference implementations for CE/MVPD devices. These reference implementations will subsequently be used by many of the major global brands.


Netflix is looking for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer that will partner closely with our Japanese partners. A grey box tester, who has a strong quality assurance and development background with deep knowledge in testing audio/video consumer electronics devices, as well as demonstrated skill in partner communication. In this partner facing role, you will provide technical evaluation and feedback of certification test results to determine device eligibility to ship "Netflix-ready".  If you have the skill and a passion for audio/video consumer electronics devices such as Smart TVs, IPTV, cable and satellite set top boxes, then this job is for you!

  • Determine device certification program eligibility.
  • Communicate directly with partners as you coach them through the certification program.
  • Execute certification tests. Review partner results. Evaluate, troubleshoot, triage, and debug failures..
  • File detailed bug reports.
  • Build strong relationship with engineering teams on the partner side to effectively coach and support them in the certification process.
  • Take on special projects designed to drive the Netflix Certifications process forward.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams. Create solutions and remove roadblocks that enable us to scale the certification process across a wide range of device platforms.
    • Responsibilities:
  • Passionate about product quality.
  • Brilliant in your delivery of technical solutions.
  • Pragmatic about what is best both technically and for the business.
  • Energetic and versatile in a dynamic work environment.
  • Knowledgeable in consumer streaming media applications.
  • Clear, professional and diplomatic in communication.
  • Efficient when working independently.
  • Distinguishable when working on a team.
    • What you need to be:
  • B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
  • Proficient  in Japanese
  • 5+ years of experience in software development quality assurance or certifications process.
  • Extensive device testing experience.
  • Experience in direct interaction with partners or clients.
  • Industry experience working on TVs, IPTV, Cable and Satellite Set-Top Boxes.
  • Strong background in video streaming technology.
  • Knowledge of networking standards and protocols.
  • Working knowledge in Unix commands
  • Experience with at least one language (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, Groovy)
  • Ability and strong desire to operate in a highly cross-functional environment where you can leverage multiple teams to help our partners be successful.
    • What you need to have:

description: Netflix is revolutionizing the way entertainment is consumed by people all over the world. We are looking for a talented senior quantitative researcher who will identify how we can enhance engagement with Netflix Originals and delight our members.In 2018 Netflix will invest $8 billion in content creation and this role is at the heart of ensuring that we introduce members to Originals content they'll love, innovate the product experience to adapt to new content types (e.g. kids interactive content, unserialized, etc.) and grow engagement with Netflix Originals.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Design and Product Innovation Consumer Insights Senior Researcher - Originals Experience


Netflix is revolutionizing the way entertainment is consumed by people all over the world. We are looking for a talented senior quantitative researcher who will identify how we can enhance engagement with Netflix Originals and delight our members.


In 2018 Netflix will invest $8 billion in content creation and this role is at the heart of ensuring that we introduce members to Originals content they'll love, innovate the product experience to adapt to new content types (e.g. kids interactive content, unserialized, etc.) and grow engagement with Netflix Originals.

  • Reframe complex business problems into clear research questions.
  • Design, conduct and manage world-class quantitative primary research including questionnaire design, analysis, report/memo writing and recommendations. Synthesize secondary, qualitative, quantitative and behavioral data.
  • Partner with your product colleagues to influence business decisions across the organization including: algorithms, product and editorial creative, design and marketing.
  • Deliver insights that effectively solve business problems by combining objective context with an expert point of view.
  • Focus your energy on research initiatives that deliver maximum member and business impact.
    • Responsibilities:
  • At least 7+ years hands-on quantitative market research experience across a broad range of methodologies. Experience gained supplier side is favorable.
  • A very strong aptitude for data and statistics including fluency in Excel and SPSS and ability to confidently converse with our analytics partners.
  • Experienced in combining big/behavioral data with survey data, AB testing and/or quasi experiments is favorable.
  • Experienced in designing and executing studies across multiple countries, cultures and languages.
    • Qualifications and experience:

description: The Netflix global programmatic marketing team is responsible for architecting and activating programmatic media (RTB, paid social and paid search) in support of our campaigns throughout the world. The Manager, Programmatic Marketing EMEA will play a lead role in the planning, activation, testing and optimization of our programmatic efforts (RTB and paid social) across the EMEA region.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Programmatic Marketing EMEA


The Netflix global programmatic marketing team is responsible for architecting and activating programmatic media (RTB, paid social and paid search) in support of our campaigns throughout the world. The Manager, Programmatic Marketing EMEA will play a lead role in the planning, activation, testing and optimization of our programmatic efforts (RTB and paid social) across the EMEA region.

  • Serve as the strategic and tactical programmatic lead for a number of marketing campaigns with focus on launching Netflix Original Series and Features
  • Act as a project lead in coordinating cross-functional efforts linked to your campaigns, within EMEA regional marketing, marketing ops & social teams and also with our global programmatic team across multiple time zones
  • Support our ongoing efforts to improve our programmatic strategies and tactics across our key markets with market knowledge and collaboration with outside partners
  • Create hypotheses and execute rigorous test campaigns to understand the drivers of impact
  • Create thoughtful recommendations - backed by data - of new tactics and partners to elevate performance against multiple KPIs
  • In concert with other members of the programmatic team and overall Netflix marketing organization, take a "big picture" perspective and seek to maximize our total marketing return and EMEA business growth
    • THE ROLE
  • At least 3 years in a hands-on role planning & managing social and/or programmatic campaigns at an agency, marketer, PMD/Social Ads API platform, or DSP
  • At least 5 years of total marketing experience, with experience collaborating with complex sets of stakeholders across multiple time zones
  • High attention to detail, top-notch analytical skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions
  • Strong grasp of the overall digital marketing ecosystem and the role that paid social and programmatic play within it
  • A passion for the entertainment business and a strong understanding of popular culture
  • Excellent communication skills--you will be the go-to person for digital campaign strategy in region. Interpersonal skills are a prerequisite for success.
  • Able to demonstrate a proven track record in project management. The candidate will be an organized, strategic thinker with a strong bias to action.
  • A strong belief in our culture. We live by our values, so it's worth learning more about them at jobs.netflix.com
    • REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Production Integrated Producer, DACH


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Operations at Netflix brings creative concepts and strategy to life at global scale through technical innovation.


We are looking for an Integrated Producer to lead creative innovation, concepting and production of best-in-class marketing campaigns for the DACH (Germany, Austria, Switzerland) market. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the end-to-end production process of our market specific campaign initiatives across online and offline channels. This means that you thrive in environment that requires you to bridge creative and technical needs. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain.


The Role
Based in Amsterdam and reporting to the Manager, Marketing Production Northern Europe, you will join a team of Integrated and Digital Producers to ensure the translation of the creative strategy into outstanding, tailor-made campaign materials for any given context and format in the DACH market.

  • Driving local implementation of global campaigns, leveraging global creative materials to deploy marketing experiences and extensions with a high regional relevance.
  • Drive creative innovation and excellence in the DACH market, managing local creative agency relationships to maintain industry leading creative executions that help further our brand and connect new fans to Netflix Original titles.
  • Plan and manage regional integrated production workflows effectively and efficiently to forecast and meet timings and budgets.
  • Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams and to lead the exchange of campaign information and assets delivery effectively.
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines.
  • Manage localization, production process and creative approvals of advertising materials (including clearances, delivery, trafficking, etc.)
  • Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all tracking is implemented correctly, efficiently and executions are flawless.
  • Hands on experience working with Doubleclick and other 3rd party ad serving platforms, QA & trafficking processes and experience troubleshooting directly with local Publisher teams is not required but nice to have.
  • Fluency in English and German required.
  • At least 5 years of experience, preferably at an entertainment or lifestyle brand, creative or production agency with an emphasis on integrated production within the German-speaking markets including AV content, digital rich media, OOH, installation/stunts, events and paid social campaigns.
    • Responsibilities include:
  • You are passionate and curious about bringing campaign ideas to life by also constantly pushing creative boundaries.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong and effective judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!
    • Personality Attributes:

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to bring joy to users through entertainment, globally. In Japan, people are enjoying more of Netflix every day, in every way, as we continue to successfully grow our business. When we partner with other brands, we gain access to new investment, new audiences and increased reach. The role of partner marketing is to capture subscriber acquisition, create awareness of the Netflix brand, drive viewing and help build title brands through high quality creative partnerships and promotions. Our goal is to extract value by becoming an innovative creative resource that is considered an extension of our partners' marketing function. Working with the business development, consumer marketing and content teams, the Partner Marketing Manager is tasked with helping craft a strategy and tactical plan to help achieve the marketing and business objectives in Japan. To do this the successful candidate will be responsible for conceiving and executing creative marketing programs designed to extract value from other reputable brands that in turn will help deliver the Netflix service to new members in Japan.
search_text:
Tokyo, Japan Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Partner Marketing - Japan


It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to bring joy to users through entertainment, globally. In Japan, people are enjoying more of Netflix every day, in every way, as we continue to successfully grow our business.
 
When we partner with other brands, we gain access to new investment, new audiences and increased reach. The role of partner marketing is to capture subscriber acquisition, create awareness of the Netflix brand, drive viewing and help build title brands through high quality creative partnerships and promotions. Our goal is to extract value by becoming an innovative creative resource that is considered an extension of our partners' marketing function.
 
Working with the business development, consumer marketing and content teams, the Partner Marketing Manager is tasked with helping craft a strategy and tactical plan to help achieve the marketing and business objectives in Japan. To do this the successful candidate will be responsible for conceiving and executing creative marketing programs designed to extract value from other reputable brands that in turn will help deliver the Netflix service to new members in Japan.

  • Prioritize and drive partner marketing initiatives through excellent project management
  • Create and execute a partner marketing strategy that aligns with the business objectives for Japan
  • Drive and own the partner marketing relationships in sync with other business teams
  • Develop and launch partner marketing programs that compliment the consumer marketing efforts and help build our titles or the brand in a way that also benefits our partners
  • Represent Partner Marketing among internal constituents on the product and business development teams

    • Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  • Bachelor's degree required (Advanced Degree preferred)
  • 5-7 years experience in a consumer marketing role with a reputable brand or agency
  • Strong proven project management skills
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity
  • Organised and prepared to take initiative and work independently
  • Demonstrated creative thinking skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills (written/oral) in both English and Japanese
  • Natural partner engagement skills with the ability to develop trust and translate relationships into programs that impact the business
  • Ability to excel in a high context, low control environment

With over 120 Million subscribers enjoying great content throughout the globe, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix.  We are looking for a talented entertainment marketing attorney to provide legal support for our marketing, social and PR teams.  The successful candidate will advise on a host of entertainment marketing, social and PR initiatives, with particular focus on our original documentary and unscripted titles.  Among other things, this person will review and advise on marketing creative, with a particular focus on IP issues; track and review a large amount of studio and talent agreements to extract and synthesize applicable information to help guide marketing, social and PR campaigns and initiatives; and negotiate a variety of marketing-related agreements.  S/he will be comfortable evaluating risk with imperfect information and have the confidence to make quick decisions.


This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of digital media.  The legal team at Netflix is focused on collaborating with its business partners to help foster innovation. The ideal candidate will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization and thrive in new and developing areas of the law.

The successful candidate will have approximately 7-10 years of broad-based marketing, advertising, and contract drafting and negotiation experience. Expertise in the following areas is required: film and/or television content marketing; rights and clearances; IP issues, including fair use analysis; talent deals; guilds; credits; music; contests and sweepstakes; and production and agency agreements.  Film or television production experience is a plus. Experience at a law firm and in-house at an entertainment company or advertising agency, as well as familiarity with consumer protection issues, is strongly preferred. Must be excited about and thrive in our unique company culture.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Manager, Originals Slate Publicity


Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. With continued international expansion, and increased acquisition and production underway, it’s a great time to join Netflix. We are looking to fill a role on our publicity team for a manager of slate activations that specializes in strategic publicity campaigns and large scale publicity event execution. We are looking for a grown up with entertainment experience who wants to write a new and innovative playbook as a part of a fast growing and highly admired company.


The Role
The Manager, Originals Slate Publicity will work across several different disciplines bringing original films, series and documentaries together at large scale publicity events, like film festivals, conventions and junkets. The ideal candidate is both an event specialist as well as a strategic publicist. He/she will take the lead in pulling together all publicity leads and crossfuntional partners involved in multi-title
publicity events to ensure that Netflix goals are streamlined and executed well. They will be a key player (a quarterback per se) in strategizing, overseeing and facilitating multi-faceted events.


He/she is intellectually curious about both entertainment and technology and strives to utilize that knowledge at Netflix originals events. This position provides an opportunity to be a bold risk-taker looking for innovative ways to publicize Netflix originals, ways that have not been previously attempted. The ideal candidate takes initiative and uses sound judgment to make wise decisions on behalf of the
business, promoting Netflix Originals in the most effective ways possible.


Communication is key. They collaborate well with Netflix partners that range from content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. We are looking for a team member who is able to formulate and drive creative and executable ideas and communicates those
decisions to all stakeholders, suggesting better approaches when necessary. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work while articulating clear goals and helping to maintain alignment within all Netflix cross functional partners involved in the multi-faceted events. He/she will also be able to communicate with a wide array of outside parties including but not limited to journalists, filmmakers, talent representatives, agencies and vendors to streamline communications and ensure the best possible representation of Netflix.


They are an organized multi-tasker who works at a fast pace and are not afraid to get their hands dirty - handling tasks that range from developing an event strategy and hiring agencies to creating talent itineraries and updating guest lists. They can formulate, oversee and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because domestic and international travel is a requirement.


This job is based in Los Angeles and reports to the Manager, Originals Slate Publicity.


Qualifications
The successful candidate will have 6+ years of entertainment experience in an agency, studio or network setting. Extensive knowledge and understanding of publicity campaigns and experience organizing large scale publicity events. Excellent communication skills, team player and deadline-oriented with strong time management skills. BA/BS required.


To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


Creative
Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


Succinct Communicator
Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


A smart minimalist
Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex- and will resist and prevent that.


Has a Point of View
An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


Pace
Moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


Integrity
Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


An Adult
Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


Here at Netflix, we don't have rules and regulations. We hire adults who act responsibly on the
resources and freedom they are given to do their work, and we expect high performance in return.


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Delivery Senior Network Engineer - Open Connect


Netflix is responsible for more than a third of the traffic on Internet access networks at peak times, and we’re working collaboratively with Internet Service Providers to ensure that our great content is delivered in a manner that is both highly efficient and cost effective. Today, we deliver 100% of Netflix content from sites in 20 countries via Open Connect, our purpose-built content delivery network. We need great network professionals to help us manage the remarkable challenge and opportunity that this scale represents.

  • Work with your team members to operate, maintain and upgrade the Open Connect network infrastructure deployed in 80+ locations worldwide
  • Work with partners, carriers, data center providers and our hardware vendors to manage and troubleshoot the network (circuit, cross connect and TAC case management)
  • Collaborate with members of the network architecture team to implement and support complex network designs while providing constructive feedback
  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams and vendors to manage our continuous growth around the globe, with a strong focus on maintaining the high level of Quality of Experience (QoE) for Netflix’s users
  • Collaborate with the network tools team to develop a high level of automation for day-to-day activities
    • Job description
  • At least 7 years of relevant professional experience
  • Expert level at large scale multi-vendor networks (Arista, Cisco, Juniper)
  • Expert level at IP routing, more particularly BGP, ISIS
  • Familiar with transit and peering relationships, including a deep understanding of how networks interconnect
  • Comfortable with MPLS, QoS, DWDM technologies
  • Comfortable with automation; our scale requires lots of it, we use some CLI and work with both internal and open-source tools
    • Professional Qualifications:
  • Self organize, drive cross-functional projects with our data center, logistics, ops and provisioning teams
  • See a problem or opportunity, take ownership and act on it independently
  • Be a self-starter, curious and not afraid to ask when in doubt
  • Write technical documentation (diagrams / templates) and be rigorous about maintaining it
    • Organizational Qualifications:
  • On-call rotation
  • Limited travel (quarterly offsites / conferences)
    • Additional Requirements:


    Our culture is unique and is a key part of our approach to innovation. You'll be a contributor and leader in a high-performance organization that's really, truly changing how the world watches movies and TV.    


    For more information on Netflix CDN see https://openconnect.netflix.com

You’ll strengthen the critical link between our global Customer Service Operations teams as we continue to expand into new markets and grow as a brand. If you are a natural critical thinker, problem solver, have a passion for data analysis and can work with a large variety of cross-functional stakeholders, you are a great for this role.

Los Gatos, California Customer Service Customer Service Tier 3 Technical Escalation Specialist


It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment around the world.  We are enabling people to have more control over what they watch and when they watch it. Our efforts have helped to grow Netflix to over 117 million members globally, and we won’t stop there. That's where you come in.


As a Technical Escalations Specialist, you will monitor product health and work with Engineering and Product Management teams to resolve issues and drive the best possible customer experience. You will utilize a robust set of data analytics including: real-time product health metrics, member escalations, queryable data from database systems, CS and social media channels, and help center metrics. You are a constant advocate for the member experience who can pair data with sentiment to tell a compelling story to Product teams and drive continuous joy for our global membership.


In this exciting role, you’ll develop deep knowledge of the Netflix product, as well as work cross-functionally with a variety of internal Netflix stakeholders and external business partners. You’ll strengthen the critical link between our global Customer Service Operations teams as we continue to expand into new markets and grow as a brand. If you are a natural critical thinker, problem solver, have a passion for data analysis and can work with a large variety of cross-functional stakeholders, you are a great for this role.

  • Monitor key metrics related to product quality and drive initiatives to improve reliability of services and reduce user pain.
  • Collaborate with Engineering, Product Stakeholders, CS Operations, and other cross-functional teams on user-impacting issues and quality improvement initiatives to drive the best possible user experience.
  • We’re a run fast, fail well company where innovation culture leads the way. You’ll lead post mortems for identifying process gaps and take corrective actions to prevent recurrences of similar issues in the future.
  • Provide product and tool support for a variety of different internal CS verticals.
    • Responsibilities
  • Critical thinker with problem solving skills and a high attention to detail
  • Clear and effective communicator
  • Thrive in an innovative culture where autonomy is necessary
  • Highly analytical with an ability to make data-driven decisions and translate identified opportunities into actionable changes
  • Intellectually curious, you’re obsessed with knowing everything
  • Intermediate to advanced SQL/Presto Plus experience, analyzing/manipulating spreadsheet data, generating reports, and pulling data using database queries.

text: Senior Software Engineer - Player Automation and Test Engineer
description: At Netflix, we are always learning, innovating and discovering ways to make our video streaming experience better.  We’re also always looking for the next amazing colleague to join our ranks.  If you are looking for a role that has• colleagues to inspire and challenge you, • projects to redefine the television experience, • opportunities to directly impact the company’s success and a chance to bring the world’s stories to a global market,...then read on.WHAT SETS US APART..The Netflix app is installed on hundreds of millions of CE devices - everything from Smart TVs and streaming sticks to game consoles and cable boxes.  Hidden inside is a world-class streaming video player that despite running on so many different devices requires no Preferences or Options dialog.  Hence this team’s motto, “It Just Works.”The Device Video Player Team sits at the nexus of a diverse set of innovative activities, such as  new approaches to video encoding, optimizing our streaming algorithms through AB testing, and expanding our product with new interactive kids’ videos.  We regularly run joint projects with many other teams at Netflix including UI, Encoding, Edge, and Open Connect. The future holds many exciting frontiers.   We’re looking for an experienced engineer to support development of projects like these through contributions to our automated build and test infrastructure.IF YOU CAN…• Work with developers to create an automated test plan for new functionality, then execute it.• Systematically improve the stability and efficiency of build and test infrastructure.• Effectively collaborate and communicate with colleagues throughout the organization.IF YOU HAVE…• BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience• 5+ years of relevant software development experience• Experience programming in Javascript• Scripting experience, using build tools such as Jenkins, NPM or YARN• Exposure to Continuous Integration and Delivery systems, using pipelines like Spinnaker• Track record of creating and maintaining automated tests and test frameworks• Excellent verbal and written communication skillsIF YOU PRACTICE…• Attention to detail• Openness to constructive feedback• Eagerness to learn new skills and technologiesIntentness to continually improve the tools and platform that you useIF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN…• High performance JavaScript• Optimizing processes• Data Analysis• Continuous Integration • Software A/B testing …Then you have what it takes to tackle the challenge of bringing Netflix to millions more customers across the globe.Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more at jobs.netflix.com.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Streaming Client Senior Software Engineer - Player Automation and Test Engineer


At Netflix, we are always learning, innovating and discovering ways to make our video streaming experience better.  We’re also always looking for the next amazing colleague to join our ranks. If you are looking for a role that has
• colleagues to inspire and challenge you,
• projects to redefine the television experience,
• opportunities to directly impact the company’s success and a chance to bring the world’s stories to a global market,
...then read on.


WHAT SETS US APART..


The Netflix app is installed on hundreds of millions of CE devices - everything from Smart TVs and streaming sticks to game consoles and cable boxes.  Hidden inside is a world-class streaming video player that despite running on so many different devices requires no Preferences or Options dialog. Hence this team’s motto, “It Just Works.”


The Device Video Player Team sits at the nexus of a diverse set of innovative activities, such as  new approaches to video encoding, optimizing our streaming algorithms through AB testing, and expanding our product with new interactive kids’ videos.  We regularly run joint projects with many other teams at Netflix including UI, Encoding, Edge, and Open Connect. The future holds many exciting frontiers.   We’re looking for an experienced engineer to support development of projects like these through contributions to our automated build and test infrastructure.


IF YOU CAN…
• Work with developers to create an automated test plan for new functionality, then execute it.
• Systematically improve the stability and efficiency of build and test infrastructure.
• Effectively collaborate and communicate with colleagues throughout the organization.


IF YOU HAVE…
• BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience
• 5+ years of relevant software development experience
• Experience programming in Javascript
• Scripting experience, using build tools such as Jenkins, NPM or YARN
• Exposure to Continuous Integration and Delivery systems, using pipelines like Spinnaker
• Track record of creating and maintaining automated tests and test frameworks
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills


IF YOU PRACTICE…
• Attention to detail
• Openness to constructive feedback
• Eagerness to learn new skills and technologiesIntentness to continually improve the tools and platform that you use


IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN…
• High performance JavaScript
• Optimizing processes
• Data Analysis
• Continuous Integration
• Software A/B testing
…Then you have what it takes to tackle the challenge of bringing Netflix to millions more customers across the globe.


Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more at jobs.netflix.com.

description: ROLEAs a Manager of Global Tech Ops at Netflix, you will be responsible for managing the team who provides  world class technology to our productions worldwide. We want to empower the production landscape, utilizing never-before-seen streamlined, efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.  We’re looking for a leader who will pioneer the advancement of technology into Netflix productions. This requires extreme flexibility, unending creativity and a proactive approach to transforming the production culture.  Tech Ops Global Manager will report to the Manager of Production Technology. The Tech Ops team are the ambassadors of Netflix production technology, Prodicle. He/She will embody the passion for transformation and workflow advancements utilizing brand new creative technologies.  The Tech Ops team is one part production, one part cloud-based software, and one part hardware infrastructure.  He/She must have exceptional experience building and managing a global technical team.  He/She must be very proactive in nature and thrive in a lean and well managed environment of exceptional talent.  A passion for change and creativity is a must.  Must have the ability to navigate in Netflix’s “fast paced” environment.RESPONSIBILITIESAs a Tech Ops Global Manager, you will be responsible for mentoring, hiring and maintaining all operational aspects for our global team (Los Angeles: domestic and LATAM,, Amsterdam, Singapore, Japan). You will drive efficiencies and make great decisions. You will partner closely with all of Physical Production, Studio Technology team and senior leadership.  The Tech Ops Global Manager is a hands-on leader with a strong technical aptitude and possesses the ability to interact positively with our productions and have the ability to backfilling team members when needed.• Partner closely with Studio Technology team on in-house production software pilots and adoption• Manage IT Technician Team responsible for our production hardware offering and support• Continue to grow the global team responsible for providing cutting-edge technology to our global Netflix original productions• Ensure healthy and smart growth for proper scalability• Understand global regional, legal and localization needs• Global vendor relationships and management• Centralize and streamline workflows and Tech Ops operations globally
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Production Manager, Global Tech Ops


ROLE
As a Manager of Global Tech Ops at Netflix, you will be responsible for managing the team who provides  world class technology to our productions worldwide. We want to empower the production landscape, utilizing never-before-seen streamlined, efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.  We’re looking for a leader who will pioneer the advancement of technology into Netflix productions. This requires extreme flexibility, unending creativity and a proactive approach to transforming the production culture.  Tech Ops Global Manager will report to the Manager of Production Technology.


The Tech Ops team are the ambassadors of Netflix production technology, Prodicle. He/She will embody the passion for transformation and workflow advancements utilizing brand new creative technologies.  The Tech Ops team is one part production, one part cloud-based software, and one part hardware infrastructure. He/She must have exceptional experience building and managing a global technical team. He/She must be very proactive in nature and thrive in a lean and well managed environment of exceptional talent.  A passion for change and creativity is a must. Must have the ability to navigate in Netflix’s “fast paced” environment.


RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Tech Ops Global Manager, you will be responsible for mentoring, hiring and maintaining all operational aspects for our global team (Los Angeles: domestic and LATAM,, Amsterdam, Singapore, Japan). You will drive efficiencies and make great decisions. You will partner closely with all of Physical Production, Studio Technology team and senior leadership.  The Tech Ops Global Manager is a hands-on leader with a strong technical aptitude and possesses the ability to interact positively with our productions and have the ability to backfilling team members when needed.


• Partner closely with Studio Technology team on in-house production software pilots and adoption
• Manage IT Technician Team responsible for our production hardware offering and support
• Continue to grow the global team responsible for providing cutting-edge technology to our global Netflix original productions
• Ensure healthy and smart growth for proper scalability
• Understand global regional, legal and localization needs
• Global vendor relationships and management
• Centralize and streamline workflows and Tech Ops operations globally

  • 5-10+ years within entertainment production technology including experience with production office applications (Scenechronize, Final Draft, Office, etc.)
  • Keen understanding of current production, post, vfx, prod accounting workflows and how technology is used (and will be used in future) and a knowledge of production/post production infrastructure requirements
  • Ability to read the production environment and make great judgement calls
    • Entertainment Industry Experience
  • Experience managing a technology support team
  • Previous experience working in an end user tech support role
  • Experience in Cloud and hosted SaaS Applications and SSO, including Google Apps for the Enterprise (Gmail, Calendaring, Drive, Sites, Groups and Google +)
  • Strong fundamentals in networking protocols and troubleshooting
  • Familiarity in distributed computing environment concepts; local and network based user and group accounts and permissions
  • Knowledge of best practices around data security
  • In depth knowledge of and the ability to perform advanced troubleshooting on Mac OS, Chrome OS, Windows 7 & 8, Linux, and various applications including Office
  • Knowledge of imaging and sys mgmt software including Landesk and Jamf
  • Experience in procurement and asset management
  • Experience with partnering with external vendors to maintain office and enterprise technology
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly and with minimal guidance
  • Working knowledge of Google Apps Script or other scripting languages a big plus.
    • Technology Experience
  • Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision; must be a self-motivated self-starter that can initiate ideas and delegate projects
  • Ability to partner effectively with business leaders and cross functional teams
  • Strategic thinking both technically and business-wise
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Great problem solving ability and people management skills
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly and with minimal guidance.
  • Thrives on technical challenges and takes pride in solving them.
  • Strategic thinking both technically and business-wise.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Strong ability to dive into the unknown and create clarity amid chaos.
  • Flexible amid an ever-changing and growing environment.
    • Management and Leadership

text: Senior Software Engineer in Test - Studio Acquisition Engineering
description: Netflix is now producing hundreds of Original TV shows and movies which are enjoyed by millions of our members all over the world. We are disrupting the way content is produced by bringing technology expertise to the entertainment industry. By reimagining the way a script goes from "pitch to play", we plan to make an even bigger impact to movies and television by building the world’s most technologically advanced studio. Studio Acquisition Engineering builds applications used by content buyers to discover, evaluate and procure the next Netflix Original and we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer in Test to join our team.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Engineering Senior Software Engineer in Test - Studio Acquisition Engineering


Netflix is now producing hundreds of Original TV shows and movies which are enjoyed by millions of our members all over the world. We are disrupting the way content is produced by bringing technology expertise to the entertainment industry. By reimagining the way a script goes from "pitch to play", we plan to make an even bigger impact to movies and television by building the world’s most technologically advanced studio.


Studio Acquisition Engineering builds applications used by content buyers to discover, evaluate and procure the next Netflix Original and we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer in Test to join our team.

  • Develop and maintain a system for continuous automated testing.
  • QA every single feature release and ensure it works as expected and no regressions are introduced.
  • Automate the testing of common use cases by building both UI end-to-end testing and API integration testing.
  • Engage with the developers and PMs to come up with test strategies.
  • Be a strong advocate for quality and pitch best practices.
  • Help develop strategies for rolling out application updates without impacting user experience.
    • Responsibilities:
  • Experience in writing automated tests for both UI and backend.
  • Experience in performance and security testing.
  • Experience in working with database and writing SQL queries.
  • Experience in testing RESTful APIs.
  • Excel in cross team communication.

description: With over 117 Million subscribers enjoying great content throughout the world, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. In order to support our growth, our legal team is looking for an experienced lawyer to support our Product group located in Los Gatos, California.   You’ll work closely with the engineering teams to provide counseling and transactional support for all phases of product development as well as supporting all procurement needs for our corporate purchasing team.  As part of the Netflix team, you will help define the Netflix brand and shape the future of global digital entertainment in an environment where collaboration between legal and business thrives.  Learn more about life at Netflix here. The ideal candidate will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization and thrive in new and developing areas of the law.QUALIFICATIONSThe successful candidate will have 10-15 years of technology transactions, product counseling and/or intellectual property experience. In-house experience preferred. Expertise counseling in all aspects of software product development from buy v. build decisions to IP protections to distribution models as well as drafting and negotiating technology licensing deals, including outbound and inbound licensing agreements, distribution agreements., and marketing agreements.   Experience with consumer protection and e-commerce laws a plus.

With over 117 Million subscribers enjoying great content throughout the world, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. In order to support our growth, our legal team is looking for an experienced lawyer to support our Product group located in Los Gatos, California.   You’ll work closely with the engineering teams to provide counseling and transactional support for all phases of product development as well as supporting all procurement needs for our corporate purchasing team. description: THE OPPORTUNITYAt Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our international efforts have brought Netflix around the globe to virtually all countries and we’re excited to bring even more of our Originals programming to our viewers. With over 117 million subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. Netflix seeks a seasoned music licensing attorney as Senior Counsel, Music to help support thedistribution of the Netflix service all over the world. The successful candidate will join the Music Group, which is part of the Business & Legal Affairs Team based in West Hollywood, CA, USA. The Music Group itself is located in Los Angeles, London and Berlin and is responsible for all of Netflix’s global music business and licensing strategy. This encompasses the production and licensing of Netflix Originals; the administration of Netflix’s repertoire of music; business intelligence; and thedistribution of the Netflix service globally. This exciting and challenging role focuses on the distribution side of the business and will be responsible for structuring, negotiating and drafting agreements with collective management organisations (“CMOs”). Most of the CMOs that Netflix works with license music publishing rights, but some manage other types of authors’ or performers’ rights and therefore candidates with a broad range of commercial & IP experience in this respect will be preferred.A central part of the role requires the preparation of the commercial and legal strategy for negotiating licenses with CMOs. This involves working with internal stakeholders, reviewing technical and financial data, and taking ownership of the deal process from start to finish. Candidates must have experience of licensing copyright and related rights in multiple jurisdictions, together with a strong understanding of the issues facing technology companies operating in the content space. The role also involves advising the business on music issues as and when they affect discussions with either the licensors or the producers of film and TV content suppliers globally.He or she will handle music contract and copyright related matters as they arise, will likely need to dig into local law and practice in various international territories, and should be extremely comfortable working independently and counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. He or she should ideally have a curiosity for technology, reporting formats and music data. He or she will have an innate ability to maintain organization and focus that fuels his/her effectiveness in successfully juggling multiple projects. The successful candidate will also thrive in an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process, yet have the ability to work with organizations or institutions who may not hold the same beliefs. If you are this candidate, you love working in an environment where freedom and responsibility are a tenet, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates: https://jobs.netflix.com/culture. Curiosity is a plus if you seek a role which offers unique opportunities to expand and grow beyond your immediate area of expertise, and to collaborate with colleagues in our US and international offices who share your passion for music, copyright and the entertainment industry.This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of entertainment. There is some flexibility on the location of the role and will depend on the successful candidate’s circumstances. The role reports to the Head of the Music Group, part of the Business & Legal Affairs team at Netflix.REQUIREMENTSThe successful candidate will have: 8+ years of music licensing experience, including: immersion in structuring, negotiating and drafting music licensing agreements between technology companies and CMOs / owners of music rights; strong international experience; in-depth knowledge of music copyright and related rights; solid understanding of how copyright and related rights are licensed and managed in the entertainment industry; practical knowledge of the music and technology industries; and understanding of the evolving theatrical, SVOD, VOD, TV, syndication and home video landscapes. International market experience is strongly preferred. Experience providing in-house support in a technology or music company is highly preferred.The successful candidate will also possess the following:• Clear, concise communication skills.• Strong analytical capabilities and judgment, even when the rules are unclear andthe issues are of first impression.• Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in afast-paced production environment.• Ability to pivot quickly and fluidly, think practically and be solution-oriented.• Curiosity and willingness to tackle matters outside area of expertise.

Los Angeles, California Legal Legal Senior Counsel, Music


THE OPPORTUNITY
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our international efforts have brought Netflix around the globe to virtually all countries and we’re excited to bring even more of our Originals programming to our viewers. With over 117 million subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. Netflix seeks a seasoned music licensing attorney as Senior Counsel, Music to help support the
distribution of the Netflix service all over the world. The successful candidate will join the Music Group, which is part of the Business & Legal Affairs Team based in West Hollywood, CA, USA. The Music Group itself is located in Los Angeles, London and Berlin and is responsible for all of Netflix’s global music business and licensing strategy. This encompasses the production and licensing of Netflix Originals; the administration of Netflix’s repertoire of music; business intelligence; and the
distribution of the Netflix service globally. This exciting and challenging role focuses on the distribution side of the business and will be responsible for structuring, negotiating and drafting agreements with collective management organisations (“CMOs”). Most of the CMOs that Netflix works with license music publishing rights, but some manage other types of authors’ or performers’ rights and therefore candidates with a broad range of commercial & IP experience in this respect will be preferred.


A central part of the role requires the preparation of the commercial and legal strategy for negotiating licenses with CMOs. This involves working with internal stakeholders, reviewing technical and financial data, and taking ownership of the deal process from start to finish. Candidates must have experience of licensing copyright and related rights in multiple jurisdictions, together with a strong understanding of the issues facing technology companies operating in the content space. The role also involves advising the business on music issues as and when they affect discussions with either the licensors or the producers of film and TV content suppliers globally.


He or she will handle music contract and copyright related matters as they arise, will likely need to dig into local law and practice in various international territories, and should be extremely comfortable working independently and counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. He or she should ideally have a curiosity for technology, reporting formats and music data. He or she will have an innate ability to maintain organization and focus that fuels his/her effectiveness in successfully juggling multiple projects. The successful candidate will also thrive in an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process, yet have the ability to work with organizations or institutions who may not hold the same beliefs. If you are this candidate, you love working in an environment where freedom and responsibility are a tenet, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates: https://jobs.netflix.com/culture. Curiosity is a plus if you seek a role which offers unique opportunities to expand and grow beyond your immediate area of expertise, and to collaborate with colleagues in our US and international offices who share your passion for music, copyright and the entertainment industry.


This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of entertainment. There is some flexibility on the location of the role and will depend on the successful candidate’s circumstances. The role reports to the Head of the Music Group, part of the Business & Legal Affairs team at Netflix.


REQUIREMENTS
The successful candidate will have: 8+ years of music licensing experience, including: immersion in structuring, negotiating and drafting music licensing agreements between technology companies and CMOs / owners of music rights; strong international experience; in-depth knowledge of music copyright and related rights; solid understanding of how copyright and related rights are licensed and managed in the entertainment industry; practical knowledge of the music and technology industries; and understanding of the evolving theatrical, SVOD, VOD, TV, syndication and home video landscapes. International market experience is strongly preferred. Experience providing in-house support in a technology or music company is highly preferred.


The successful candidate will also possess the following:

the issues are of first impression.

fast-paced production environment.

Amsterdam, Netherlands Legal Legal Manager, Legal Operations Regulatory Compliance - Amsterdam


Do you want to work on interesting legal process and data disclosure issues in a fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative environment? Have you worked with Law Enforcement before? Netflix is seeking an experienced, highly-organized, candidate with strong judgment and a “hands-on” attitude to join our growing Global Regulatory Compliance Team in Amsterdam. The ideal candidate welcomes the opportunity to be part of an entrepreneurial organization that values high performance and is built around a culture of freedom and responsibility.

  • 3+ years operational experience responding to data disclosure requests from law enforcement agencies and consumers in EMEA, especially the Netherlands
  • Self-starter and fast learner that can work independently while using impeccable judgment
  • Excellent analytical skills, with a strong ability to review and organize numerous documents in complex legal matters.
  • Superior organizational skills, extraordinary attention to detail, and a mindset that processes can always be improved
  • Ability to maintain a positive, constructive attitude in ambiguous and high pressure situations and to manage complex issues in a productive manner
  • Excellent communication skills, including patience and an ability to explain legal requirements clearly and effectively, and a great sense of humor
  • Strong project management skills with a track record of consistently going above and beyond what is expected and delivering projects on schedule.
  • Fluency in English is a must, Dutch or German language skills preferred (please apply in English)

  • Serve as a law enforcement point of contact in EMEA and a resource for legal process inquiries
