text: Production Support Engineer, Production Technologies - EMEA (London)
description: Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, a lot of it original content: features, shorts, series, documentaries, comedy specials and unscripted content. Optimizing content quality and longevity without compromising efficiency and creative vision across all types of projects presents significant challenges, but that’s what the Studio Technologies team does by setting technical requirements and best practices, driving new industry standards, consulting on the studio’s technical infrastructure, providing direct support to Netflix Original Productions and staying up-to-date with the most advanced developments in professional and consumer technology. Our engineers are subject matter experts who offer varied yet overlapping backgrounds in motion picture production, post-production and distribution - image science, editorial, color correction, image capture, encoding, compression, storage, video, audio... Every day, we collaborate with the crews as well as our internal production, post-production, distribution, marketing, facilities and development teams.As Netflix creates more and more programming around the world leveraging new video and audio production technology, we are scaling to support the needs of diverse creative teams while continuing to foster industry-wide change.
search_text:
London, United Kingdom Content Post Production Production Support Engineer, Production Technologies - EMEA (London)


Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, a lot of it original content: features, shorts, series, documentaries, comedy specials and unscripted content. Optimizing content quality and longevity without compromising efficiency and creative vision across all types of projects presents significant challenges, but that’s what the Studio Technologies team does by setting technical requirements and best practices, driving new industry standards, consulting on the studio’s technical infrastructure, providing direct support to Netflix Original Productions and staying up-to-date with the most advanced developments in professional and consumer technology. Our engineers are subject matter experts who offer varied yet overlapping backgrounds in motion picture production, post-production and distribution - image science, editorial, color correction, image capture, encoding, compression, storage, video, audio... Every day, we collaborate with the crews as well as our internal production, post-production, distribution, marketing, facilities and development teams.


As Netflix creates more and more programming around the world leveraging new video and audio production technology, we are scaling to support the needs of diverse creative teams while continuing to foster industry-wide change.

  • Provide technical support to Netflix Originals productions.
  • Represent the Netflix Production Technologies group at industry functions, conferences, committee meetings, etc. in Europe.
  • Troubleshoot media assets for conformance to Netflix Originals specifications.
  • Educate various internal and external teams on Netflix Originals technical specifications and production best practices.
  • Explore, analyze and document local production practices, challenges and opportunities.
  • Devise and carry-out local strategies to achieve our global goals.
  • Work with internal engineering teams to inform design of Netflix systems to serve local needs.
  • Create blogs, documentation and other support resources to educate creative partners and vendors about our requirements and initiatives.
  • Evaluate local vendors for readiness to service Netflix Originals productions.
  • Maintain currency on Audio, Video and Streaming technology.
    • As part of the Production Technologies group, you will:
  • Strong customer orientation and helpful, collaborative demeanor.
  • An ability to translate technical jargon into layman terms.
  • Minimum of 5-years of film/TV production or post-production experience.
  • Extensive understanding of image capture, production and post-production workflows with an ability to quickly analyze and reconcile external operations against those of Netflix.
  • Understanding of common industry tools and local production practices across Europe.
  • Willingness and aptitude to educate both internal and external entities with varying degrees of knowledge in your area of expertise.
  • Ability to develop long-standing relationships with post-production operational teams.
  • Ability to communicate and interact on a Global level and frame projects with sensitivity to cultural diversity and industrial variation.
  • Knowledge of industry standards in and the bodies that ratify them.
  • Knowledge of and relationships with technology solutions, equipment and service vendors across post and production.
  • A passion for sound and the moving image.
    • Requirements:

description: Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, reaching over 100 million subscribers in more than 190 countries and territories around the world. Our subscribers consume over five billion hours of video a quarter and account for third of the downstream Internet traffic. Los Angeles, California Engineering Content Engineering Product Designer - Content Platform


Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, reaching over 100 million subscribers in more than 190 countries and territories around the world. Our subscribers consume over five billion hours of video a quarter and account for third of the downstream Internet traffic. At the center of every single title that launches on the service is a huge effort across multiple teams to curate and deliver the best representation of that title from the artwork to the synopsis.
 
The Content Engineering team builds a suite of tools to scale the operations behind taking a title live, while building the world’s deepest catalog of information about tv shows and movies. As part of the Content Engineering Design Team, you will be designing the future of our tools to manage and enhance our catalog of data, which is leveraged everywhere from production to the service.
 
About Us
In many ways we still act like a start up. You’ll work closely across engineering, product, and stakeholders to exchange ideas leading to rapid testing and iteration. We make decisions based on data, observing and reacting to how systems are impacted by our choices.
 
The organization is flat, process is minimal, individual responsibility is big, and there is an emphasis on keeping non-productive influences out of the everyday decision process.
 
About You
You are a natural leader.
You have exceptional communication skills.
You know how to bring multiple stakeholders to the table to understand and solve problems.
You have tremendous visual design skills and the ability to tell a story.
You know how to take complicated workflows and make them elegant.
You have the patience to build something magical.
You can juggle multiple top-priority tasks and efficiently focus on delivery.

  • Understanding of complex workflows designed to scale across diverse, global teams

Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Global Creative Marketing (Series - Drama II)


The Opportunity
It’s an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. With over 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries, our approach to Marketing is to defy convention, disrupt industry norms and break new ground through innovative, culturally relevant, breakthrough campaigns. We are actively promoting our original, exclusive content that is core to everything we do.


We are looking to fill the integral role of Manager, Global Creative Marketing working on Global Series. This is a great opportunity to join a team that leads the development and launch of innovative marketing campaigns across a diverse range of Original Series.


The Role
This role is unique. So is the right candidate.


In this role, you will lead the strategization, execution and management of 360 campaigns (AV, social, key art, and beyond) for a range of series -- primarily from our drama, sci-fi, and adult animation slates. You will be a member of a small, seasoned and nimble group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, reporting to the Global Creative Marketing Lead, Global Series - Drama.

  • Has a proven track record of building world-class creative and launching global campaigns for premium entertainment properties that foster passionate communities of fans. We are not only building campaigns--we are transforming our properties into culturally relevant franchises.
  • Has deep knowledge in running a 360-campaign, from strategy development to tactical execution (including AV/trailers, digital/social, print and out-of-home).
  • Has meaningful experience working directly with talent and talent representation.
  • Has a deep understanding of the social media landscape: community building and management, platform best practises and consumers (social) media behaviors.
  • Has experience in establishing strong and out of the box social media strategies that build, nurture and maintain strong fan communities and manifest themselves in unique tone of voices and cultural relevant and conversation driving creative.
  • Is passionate about the action and sci-fi space and is an active part of this very vocal and engaged community.
  • Is a cross-functional leader who is able to engage, listen and collaborate with internal departments/teams to align early on overall strategy and goals. This candidate should be able to see the cross-functional collaboration through launch.
  • Is able to effectively communicate different facets of their campaigns to executives, showrunners, talent and their representatives.
  • Has exposure to working on global campaigns, with reach domestically and internationally. Ideally, this person comes with a global IQ and/or is comfortable working with teams from different regional markets.
  • Has a good understanding of marketing, social and media analytics and can apply data to the testing and optimization of campaigns.
  • Has a native understanding of digital with an emphasis on mobile, social, video and display and is confident telling stories through great ideas regardless of medium.
  • Appreciates technology and can collaborate with our world class product team to integrate our campaigns into the member product experience.
  • Is an effective collaborator in a fast paced, multifaceted environment. We will typically have multiple campaigns launching at once.
    • We are looking for someone who:
  • Own day-to-day responsibilities for launching campaigns of upcoming global series -- from strategic development to creative execution, production and community management.
  • In partnership with the Global Creative Marketing Lead - Global Series - Drama, collaborate on creation and execution of title strategy.
  • Act as the central cross-functional liaison among internal teams (regional Marketing teams, Consumer PR, Publicity, Product and Social), with a focus on managing workflow; socialize, absorb, organize and implement feedback from cross-functional partners.
  • Act as the main point of contact with agencies - provide feedback and guidance to agencies partners.
  • Oversee and determine scope, budget, and overall campaign resources.
    • Core Responsibilities:
  • A minimum 6 years of experience at an entertainment marketing or social department, network/studio marketing/social team, or creative agency working on global campaigns and building communities (candidates with backgrounds in strategy, digital, print, AV and/or social creative are welcome).
  • Experience managing a high volume of campaigns; international experience (or experience in working with international teams) preferred.
  • Strong communication and analytical skills as well as the ability to think strategically
  • A formidable creative sensibility and a drive to take (thoughtful and well-informed) risks.
  • A passion for television and movies (this is a must).
    • The successful candidate possesses:
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.  
  • You are a proactive self-starter who does not need to be told what to do and when to do it. You will find solutions to any challenge and is not afraid to get your hands dirty.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of the business - especially when bridging the gap between our content and our brand. You have an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are a natural leader, with the ability to conceptualize and articulate creative strategy that all will rally around.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!
  • You are an avid user of both your left and right brain.
    • Personality Attributes:


    If you live and breathe global entertainment and geek out at the thought of breaking the advertising mold, then we want to talk to you.


    Compensation
    Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

text: Sr. Software Engineer, Compute Infrastructure for Personalization
description: Today, we think of the Netflix service less as a monolithic product and more as hundreds of millions of different products, serving uniquely personalized experiences to each of our member profiles. One of the teams powering this effort is the Personalization Infrastructure (PI) team, which builds scalable Machine Learning infrastructure for accelerating innovation for Netflix recommendations, content promotion, and search algorithms. The OpportunityWe are looking for a star Senior Software Engineer with experience scaling Apache Spark and other compute engines for large scale production use cases.  One of the focus areas for the team is scaling the compute infrastructure for critical stages of ML training pipelines for hundreds of simultaneous A/B Tests and production workflows.  This involves understanding how Spark execution plans are laid out when dealing with large data sets and optimizing them to achieve compute efficiency within acceptable latency limits.You will be writing production grade Spark applications, consulting with researchers to scale their applications, and contributing to our own in-house ML Infra libraries that are used by these applications. This aligns with the team’s charter to accelerate ML innovation by building infrastructure and tools that help ML Engineers and Researchers rapidly run offline experimentation and online A/B Tests.  You will also partner closely with the Data Platform team to identify, investigate and resolve Spark issues, including submitting pull requests for upstream open-source Spark.To be successful in this role, you must have a passion for performance tuning and discovering the low-level details of how subsystems work. You should also possess outstanding software development skills, ability to learn fast, and work cross-functionally with several teams. You will need to exhibit strong leadership and communication skills to successfully execute on the engineering and release priorities. We value work-life balance and believe that some of the best work happens in dynamic low-process environments.This is a great opportunity for someone with a solid compute infrastructure background to use and grow skills in the exciting ML Infra domain. This role will also allow you to gain intimate knowledge of Netflix Personalization, while working for a unique and pioneering company that is redefining how video content is consumed globally.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Sr. Software Engineer, Compute Infrastructure for Personalization


Today, we think of the Netflix service less as a monolithic product and more as hundreds of millions of different products, serving uniquely personalized experiences to each of our member profiles. One of the teams powering this effort is the Personalization Infrastructure (PI) team, which builds scalable Machine Learning infrastructure for accelerating innovation for Netflix recommendations, content promotion, and search algorithms.


The Opportunity
We are looking for a star Senior Software Engineer with experience scaling Apache Spark and other compute engines for large scale production use cases.  One of the focus areas for the team is scaling the compute infrastructure for critical stages of ML training pipelines for hundreds of simultaneous A/B Tests and production workflows.  This involves understanding how Spark execution plans are laid out when dealing with large data sets and optimizing them to achieve compute efficiency within acceptable latency limits.


You will be writing production grade Spark applications, consulting with researchers to scale their applications, and contributing to our own in-house ML Infra libraries that are used by these applications. This aligns with the team’s charter to accelerate ML innovation by building infrastructure and tools that help ML Engineers and Researchers rapidly run offline experimentation and online A/B Tests.  You will also partner closely with the Data Platform team to identify, investigate and resolve Spark issues, including submitting pull requests for upstream open-source Spark.


To be successful in this role, you must have a passion for performance tuning and discovering the low-level details of how subsystems work. You should also possess outstanding software development skills, ability to learn fast, and work cross-functionally with several teams. You will need to exhibit strong leadership and communication skills to successfully execute on the engineering and release priorities. We value work-life balance and believe that some of the best work happens in dynamic low-process environments.


This is a great opportunity for someone with a solid compute infrastructure background to use and grow skills in the exciting ML Infra domain. This role will also allow you to gain intimate knowledge of Netflix Personalization, while working for a unique and pioneering company that is redefining how video content is consumed globally.

  • Strong bias towards action and great curiosity
  • Experience building large-scale applications on Apache Spark with a good understanding of Spark internals
  • Experience working with large-scale distributed systems like Mesos, Zookeeper, and HDFS
  • 4+ years of relevant work experience post BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
  • Production experience with Scala
  • Excellent communication and people engagement skills
    • Minimum Qualifications
  • Experience building systems and solutions for ML Engineers/Researchers
  • Experience in Personalization/Recommendation domain
  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms like Amazon AWS
    • Preferred Qualifications
  • ML Orchestration for Netflix Recommendations
  • Scala DSL for ML Training Set Stratification
  • Meson Blog
  • Time Travel for Feature Generation
  • Netflix is going places  (A personal insight into our culture)
    • To learn more, here are some talks and blog posts from the PI Team:


    You can learn more about Netflix’s unique culture of Freedom and Responsibility, that presents an opportunity to work with some of the best and the brightest, allowing you to make a difference to the business in a meaningful way.

description: THE OPPORTUNITY With over 117 Million subscribers enjoying great content throughout the world, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. Netflix seeks an experienced film and television finance attorney to help support our original content efforts. We continue to grow our vast original content slate globally, and this role is imperative to the success of this massive initiative. This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of entertainment. The successful candidate will work as part of the company’s Corporate & Finance Team headquartered in Los Angeles to structure, negotiate and draft agreements with financiers, lenders,  completion guarantors, producers and distributors. He or she will work closely with our content team (both business and legal), handle related intellectual property matters as they arise (e.g., copyright, chain-of-title analysis), and should be extremely comfortable making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. REQUIREMENTSThe successful candidate will have at least 5+ years of broad-based film and television finance experience, including direct experience structuring, negotiating and drafting credit and security agreements (and all related documents), distribution agreements, licensing agreements, negative pick-ups, domestic and foreign tax incentives and co-production arrangements, and possess practical knowledge of the industry (including content windowing strategies, and the evolving theatrical, VOD, pay TV, syndication and home video landscapes). A combination of law firm experience and experience providing in-house support preferred.

description: Netflix seeks an experienced Paralegal for a role in the indie film division’s business and legal affairs group. This Paralegal will support the business & legal affairs team on a wide array of matters in connection with the development and production of indie films like The Fundamentals of Caring, Tallulah, Gerald’s Game, Private Life and To The Bone. The Paralegal will be primarily responsible for drafting and reviewing development and production-related agreements, preparing comments, negotiating agreements, coordinating among internal Netflix teams, creating and maintaining tracking systems, and establishing procedures that maximize the efficiency of the independent film business & legal affairs group. The candidate will also be responsible for guiding production through matters that arise throughout the production process.The candidate must have excellent drafting skills. In addition, the candidate must be comfortable challenging norms, counseling and collaborating with internal and external business partners, producers, production counsel and production partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impact.This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to grow within Netflix to help shape the future of entertainment. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Legal Legal Paralegal, Business & Legal Affairs, Independent Film


Netflix seeks an experienced Paralegal for a role in the indie film division’s business and legal affairs group. This Paralegal will support the business & legal affairs team on a wide array of matters in connection with the development and production of indie films like The Fundamentals of Caring, Tallulah, Gerald’s Game, Private Life and To The Bone. The Paralegal will be primarily responsible for drafting and reviewing development and production-related agreements, preparing comments, negotiating agreements, coordinating among internal Netflix teams, creating and maintaining tracking systems, and establishing procedures that maximize the efficiency of the independent film business & legal affairs group. The candidate will also be responsible for guiding production through matters that arise throughout the production process.


The candidate must have excellent drafting skills. In addition, the candidate must be comfortable challenging norms, counseling and collaborating with internal and external business partners, producers, production counsel and production partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impact.


This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to grow within Netflix to help shape the future of entertainment. The ideal candidate will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast‐paced, entrepreneurial organization.


REQUIREMENTS


The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:


• At least 7 years of experience as a paralegal for a production company, studio or law firm, with direct experience handling above-the-line agreements;
• High level understanding of guild and union agreements, working with minors and other production-related labor issues;
• The ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to stay calm under pressure;
• A high level of organization, detail orientation and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines;
• Fluency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and the Google Suite; and
• Paralegal certificate or JD.


In addition, the candidate will possess the following:


• Demonstrates good judgment, strong critical thinking skills and the desire and willingness to take ownership and control of complex projects;
• Curiosity and willingness to tackle matters outside their area of expertise;
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills (candor, honesty);
• Strong analytical (strategic and creative) capabilities and judgment;
• Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight time frames in a fast‐paced environment;
• Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross‐functionally, think pragmatically and be solution‐oriented;
• Adaptable negotiation style; and
• Passion for indie film and Netflix’s film strategy.

The LATAM Marketing Operations team is looking for a Digital Producer to lead digital media production for our core LATAM markets (Mexico, Brazil, Colombia, Argentina, Chile, and Peru).


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Operations at Netflix is focussed on establishing a global operational center-of-excellence for cross-functional project management, creative production and localization of our marketing campaigns.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Production Finance - Animation


The Opportunity
Our members love content. In 2017, Netflix spent billions of dollars on acquiring and producing content around the world in every window for every taste -- from brand new, never-before-seen Originals to timeless classics that are watched over and over again. In order to build the best service in the world, we look for the best and brightest to drive the analytics behind our strategic business decisions. Netflix operates a financially complex business and believes that it derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing the company.


The Role
The Manager of Production Finance for Feature Film Animation will be instrumental in creating and implementing the production finance goals of the Originals Animation team.  The goals include i) partnering with the senior creative, business and production team leaders to manage our investment into our Animation studio through operational and strategic solutions.Ii) providing accurate, timely and complete production budgets and estimated final costs iii) protecting company assets through cash management, policies and procedures and iv) providing shows with the production finance support to facilitate producing great content

  • Collaborate with Line Producers, Production Managers, Accounting Staff and the Netflix Originals team to deliver the highest quality original entertainment content.
  • Research, develop and test new technologies that provide the next generation of production finance tools and determine how and when to best incorporate into the production accounting workflow.
  • Hire the most talented production accounting teams with the skillset to provide the highest level of production accounting support on shows that are some of the most ambitious and complex to be ever produced.  Accounting teams must be self –motivated, resourceful, dedicated, hard-working, focused and strive for only the highest level of professional ethics, consistent mathematical accuracy and completeness, and embody the Netflix ethos.
  • Liaise with Netflix HR, Labor Relations, Content Accounting, Internal Audit, Payroll, Accounts Payable, Treasury, IT to ensure production finance policies and procedures are current and effectively implemented on our productions.
  • Prepare initial production budgets.
  • Manage production incentive workflow and ensure receipt of tax credits or cash.
  • Ensure that insurance claim costs are accurate and adequately supported by schedules, invoices and payroll documents.
  • Manage the cash flow and funding processes.
  • Review production budgets, cost reports, trial balances and petty cash reconciliations prepared by show accountants.
  • Work with show accountants on a day to day basis to drive accurate, complete and timely cost reporting,  protecting and managing show assets and supporting production.
  • Identify problem area as quickly as possible including breakdown in communication between department heads, upm’s, producers and accountants and minimal use of PO’s.
  • Develop relationships with Film Commissioners, CPA audit firms, Accountants, Producers and Payroll Companies to build resources and networks from which to poll industry information and help ensure all production finance processes are current, reasonable and timely.
  • Facilitate the training and mentoring of junior production accounting staff on Netflix shows with the goal of increasing the pool of loyal stellar accounting candidates for future Netflix productions.
  • Keep abreast of current and changing industry trends, evolving technologies, production incentives and changes in crew capacity and infrastructure support in the main worldwide production centers.
  • Travel to production locations where our shows are filming to audit, review workflows, organizational abilities and effectiveness of accounting staff.
    • The Responsibilities
  • Candidates must have 10+ years in feature film animation production finance and production accounting.
  • Broad understanding of production incentives.
  • Solid understanding of payroll process, union labor agreements and tax requirements.
  • Complete understanding of P2P process and tax requirements.
  • Expert skill level of Movie Magic Budgeting and either Vista or PSL production accounting systems.
  • College degree in accounting or finance from a well-known university is preferred.
  • Proven ability to lead and manage a team.
  • Solution focused.
  • Ability to understand and articulate issues using creative, production or financial context.
    • Experience

description: At Netflix, we are always learning, innovating and discovering ways to make our video streaming experience better.  We’re also always looking for the next amazing colleague to join our ranks.  If you are looking for a role that has• colleagues to inspire and challenge you• projects to redefine the television experience• opportunities to directly contribute to the company’s success a chance to bring the world’s stories to a global market...then read on.WHAT SETS US APART..The Netflix app is installed on hundreds of millions of CE devices - everything from Smart TVs and streaming sticks to game consoles and cable boxes.  Hidden inside is a world-class streaming video player that despite running on so many different devices requires no Preferences or Options dialog.  Hence this team’s motto, “It Just Works.”The Device Video Player Team sits at the nexus of a diverse set of innovative activities, such as  new approaches to video encoding, optimizing our streaming algorithms through AB testing, and expanding our product with new interactive kids’ videos.  We regularly run joint projects with many other teams at Netflix including UI, Encoding, Edge, and Open Connect. The future holds many exciting frontiers.   We’re looking for an experienced engineer to contribute to projects like these in the Netflix video player.  IF YOU CAN…• Address complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive design• Work at all phases of the software development lifecycle (planning, design, implementation, deployment and support)• Effectively drive technical collaboration and communication with multiple client and server engineering teamsIF YOU HAVE…• BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience• 7+ years of relevant software development experience• JavaScript, object oriented design and programming skills, multi-threaded app development experience• Background employing modular Javascript, asynchronous constructs, functional paradigms and unit testing• Agility in developing connected applications and advancing them in response to changing business needs• Excellent verbal and written communication skillsIF YOU PRACTICE…• End-to-end ownership of major features and component throughout their entire life cycle• Complex system redesigns to produce a simpler, more maintainable code base• Attention to detail and openness to critique through code and design reviews• Opportunistic code refactoring (you are comfortable changing tires on a moving vehicle)IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN…• High performance JavaScriptAPI design• Streaming video concepts• Test-driven development and continuous integration…then you have what it takes to tackle the challenge of bringing Netflix to millions more customers across the globe.Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more at jobs.netflix.com.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Streaming Client Senior Software Engineer - Player Developer


At Netflix, we are always learning, innovating and discovering ways to make our video streaming experience better.  We’re also always looking for the next amazing colleague to join our ranks. If you are looking for a role that has
• colleagues to inspire and challenge you
• projects to redefine the television experience
• opportunities to directly contribute to the company’s success a chance to bring the world’s stories to a global market
...then read on.


WHAT SETS US APART..


The Netflix app is installed on hundreds of millions of CE devices - everything from Smart TVs and streaming sticks to game consoles and cable boxes.  Hidden inside is a world-class streaming video player that despite running on so many different devices requires no Preferences or Options dialog. Hence this team’s motto, “It Just Works.”


The Device Video Player Team sits at the nexus of a diverse set of innovative activities, such as  new approaches to video encoding, optimizing our streaming algorithms through AB testing, and expanding our product with new interactive kids’ videos.  We regularly run joint projects with many other teams at Netflix including UI, Encoding, Edge, and Open Connect. The future holds many exciting frontiers.   We’re looking for an experienced engineer to contribute to projects like these in the Netflix video player.  


IF YOU CAN…
• Address complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive design
• Work at all phases of the software development lifecycle (planning, design, implementation, deployment and support)
• Effectively drive technical collaboration and communication with multiple client and server engineering teams


IF YOU HAVE…
• BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience
• 7+ years of relevant software development experience
• JavaScript, object oriented design and programming skills, multi-threaded app development experience
• Background employing modular Javascript, asynchronous constructs, functional paradigms and unit testing
• Agility in developing connected applications and advancing them in response to changing business needs
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills


IF YOU PRACTICE…
• End-to-end ownership of major features and component throughout their entire life cycle
• Complex system redesigns to produce a simpler, more maintainable code base
• Attention to detail and openness to critique through code and design reviews
• Opportunistic code refactoring (you are comfortable changing tires on a moving vehicle)


IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN…
• High performance JavaScriptAPI design
• Streaming video concepts
• Test-driven development and continuous integration
…then you have what it takes to tackle the challenge of bringing Netflix to millions more customers across the globe.


Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more at jobs.netflix.com.

Los Angeles, California Content Production Transportation Specialist


We are seeking an experienced Transportation Specialist to oversee our transportation compliance program. Responsibilities include supporting and monitoring individual productions to insure compliance, identifying gaps and weak points in the system to improve workflow, and providing instruction and feedback to productions when needed. This position will report to the Transportation Manager in Los Angeles and work in conjunction with Netflix physical production leads, risk management department, and production safety department. The Transportation team is responsible for supervising all aspects of production related transportation for our global original series, films, documentaries and comedy specials.


The Opportunity:
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 104 million members in over 190 countries. With continued international expansion and a move into original film acquisition and production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role:
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires a proactive and positive thinker who is able to exercise good judgment and initiative.


Specific responsibilities include:(Some of these responsibilities are coordinated with DOT Administrators on the ground and Third Party vendors)


Federal and State DOT number setup and maintenance :
Set up DOT numbers and Motor Carrier authority for domestic productions.
Set up California motor carrier authority for the California based Netflix Productions:
• Create a Motor Carrier Profile with CHP. Get a CA #
• Create an account with CA DMV EPN (Employer Pull Notice) Program
• Register and get a CA Motor Carrier Permit


USDOT Drug and Alcohol program administration
• Set up accounts with Third Party Administrator company and Drug and Alcohol collection sites and labs.
• Set up company with a consortium member agreement (CMA) with CSATF for Teamsters 399 studio driver.
• Act as the company’s representative and administrator for all Federal and State DOT safety audits.


Driver and Vehicle management and administration
• Oversee the production DOT administrator’s collection, auditing, and scanning of paperwork from drivers.
• Verify that drivers are qualified to operate a Commercial Motor Vehicle (CMV) per policy and government regulations.
• Insure that drivers aren’t exceeding the allowed on duty & drive time per the regulations, and that the productions are aware of the limitations.
• Make sure all vehicles rented by the company are compliant with federal and state DOT regulations, and that files are maintained per the regulations and company policy.
• Perform random onsite auditing of DOT compliance paperwork and Q&A/Training with drivers and transportation management.
• Oversee ELD (Electronic Logging Device) sourcing, implementation and training in coordination with the Transportation Manager.


Production Oversight and Innovation
• Provide insight/education to the studio and productions regarding how compliance limitations might affect the production.
• Dealing with wrapping of production company transportation dept. Overseeing data management and record retention as required by the law.
• Explore new technologies, test and pilot new programs to see how they will affect our industry in an effort to streamline film and television production transportation compliance.


Qualifications
• BA/BS Degree
• Ability to handle a fast paced environment simultaneously supervising multiple productions.
• Expertise in Federal and State motor carrier regulations (knowledge of International regulations is a plus).
• Knowledge of studio driver union rules, per each local union, from which the company is hiring drivers.
• Knowledge about production transportation equipment.
• Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters.
• Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting.
• Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information.
• Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly.
• Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current regulations both domestically and internationally.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task.

search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR PR Senior Manager Corporate and Technology Communications - Middle East, Turkey & Africa


Company profile
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 117 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 140 million hours of TV shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on nearly any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.


It's an amazing time to join the Netflix PR EMEA team as we continue to transform entertainment. Over the past few years, we have moved from being a distributor to a programmer; from being a US tech company to a global leader in the entertainment landscape; from a brand that was not known to one that creates excitement and joy for its subscribers. If you are a passionate, creative storyteller who is not afraid of a challenge, keep reading!


The Role
We are looking for a talented public relations expert with a strong understanding and relationship with business and news media across Middle East, Turkey and Africa (META). The CorpTech PR Manager, META, will be a member of a seasoned group of professionals helping to shape and tell the story of Netflix as a company and the technology that underpins our content. They will also bring to life how Netflix is investing in local original content, as well as being a significant exporter of content from different countries, providing creatives with a global platform to tell new and different stories. Additionally, this individual will help build and protect the Netflix reputation and brand throughout the region.


The role is strategically critical to building on the company’s success in a fast-changing, highly competitive global landscape. This is particularly the case as we expand our investments in the META regions, with the first Netflix Turkish and Arabic series underway as well as partnerships with local companies and an increased focus on our growth in these markets.


Reporting to the Director, Corporate Communications, EMEA, the role is based in Amsterdam and has strong cross-functional interaction with the broader team, with a high level of visibility and impact within the business. The Manager Consumer PR, Middle East and North Africa will be a key partner to CorpTech PR Manager, META, as will existing members of the Consumer PR team leading our activities in Turkey and South Africa. 


The CorpTech PR Manager, META, will likely possess at least 10 years of experience in media, corporate or agency settings. Of particular interest are candidates with backgrounds in the entertainment sector and those who are used to working in a fast-paced environment that requires agility, selflessness and the ability to manage multiple things at once.

  • Fluency in Arabic and English is a must.
  • Have a global mindset, with experience of working in multiple countries for a multinational brand in the Middle East region.
  • Have excellent news judgement as well as very strong writing and communications skills.
  • Have - or be capable of - quickly establishing trusted relationships with journalists and influencers throughout the region.
  • Be able to work cross-functionally and build relationships inside and outside the organisation.
  • Be capable and confident to serve as a company spokesperson in different cultural and media milieus and have strong business acumen.
  • Be deeply familiar with, and enthusiastically curious about, the entertainment sector, technology, innovation and media.
  • Be adept at corporate reputation and media issue management.
  • Be an entrepreneurial self-starter who comes up with new approaches and is eager to try those out.
  • Love entertainment and the prospect of delivering stories from all over the world to people all over the world.
    • The Manager must:
  • Ability to think innovatively and connect the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. 
  • Succinct communicator.
  • Great writer and talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Doesn't need to "check with the agency" on every issue or for every answer. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
  • Pragmatic, organized and detailed. Has a big capacity to both think and 'do'. Flourishes in a 'hands on' role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.
  • A smart minimalist. Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that. Does not need or desire big budgets for big results. Believes one great person on the team is more valuable than three to five ok people---and wants to be that great person.
  • Has a point of view - An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.
  • Enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done on short timeframes.
    • To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


    The Netflix culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion and curiosity. Read our blog and culture memo. If it resonates for you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team.

The Netflix Employee Apps team works with developers and designers to build applications that help our back-office business flow smoothly so we can find and deliver the best content in the world to our 100M+ subscribers around the world.  Our applications integrate with many internal Netflix systems and services to present the right information, to the right person at the right time.

Los Angeles, California Content Production Screening Assets Coordinator


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day. With continued international expansion and a move into original film acquisition and production, it's a great time to join Netflix. Our PR team exhibits screenings all over the world throughout the year to promote Netflix shows… the screening assets team partners with them to create these experiences.  


The Role
We are seeking an individual to support our screenings assets team while they manage our global screening requests. The coordinator role will be supporting the specialists who are responsible for the creation, approvals and delivery of screening assets for all of Netflix’s public facing screenings.  


We are looking for a team player who is eager to support and enable them to plan and execute great screening experiences for our creative staff, film & series creators, press, premieres, festivals and beyond.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Support specialists as needed to manage requests for the creation of screening assets including, but not limited to:  DCPs, BluRays, DVDs and various digital files
• Work alongside the Screening Assets Specialists, and internal PR, and Post Production teams to support the ordering, fulfilling and execution of screening assets
• Handle administrative work for the scheduling, tracking, and verification of screening assets
• Communicate effectively with the Screenings Asset Specialists and cross functional partners to ensure the proper planning, availability and delivery of assets are met


Experience and Qualifications
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving department that requires someone who is always ready to support the team as needed.


• 3+ years of experience within a medium to high budget studio post production dept and/or a medium to large post production facility
• Ability to handle a fast-paced environment and high volume of support
• A complete understanding of how to prioritize, while also remaining agile and able to pivot quickly; Excellent time management skills are a must
• Working knowledge of Google suite of applications & Air table required
• Knowledge of DCP, Blu-Ray, DVD and digital file creation
• Edit session requests and knowledge of DCI-Compliance standards
• Knowledge of color spaces, frame rates, resolutions, aspect ratios and audio configurations
• Knowledge of cloud hosted media sharing & collaboration tools
• Knowledge of Quality Control standards  & practices
• Knowledge of vendors including DCP & Post Production facilities
• Knowledge of data management


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

description: We are looking for a Director - HR Business Partner who will partner with several of our growing Corporate Legal teams across the globe. This position will be based out of Los Angeles, with regular travel to Northern California and occasional travel to international locations.Our Corporate Legal teams play a critical role in supporting the business through growth and innovation. The team currently has over 100 employees around the world and is growing quickly. This role will support a diverse set of Corporate Legal teams, including but not limited to: Real Estate, Privacy, Litigation, Employment, and Marketing Legal.  The focus of the HR Business Partner role is to coach leaders and their teams, foster effective working relationships and partner alignment across the organization, and ensure our talent is able and prepared to accomplish amazing things. At Netflix, our culture shapes how we work together and how we get great work done.  We need someone who is passionate about the values and aspects of our culture, and able to guide partners in working effectively in our environment.The ideal candidate:You understand the business and the culture.  You will be an example of what it means to be a stunning colleague - living our values, understanding how our culture comes to life, and possessing a deep knowledge of the business.  This role is unique in the sense that you’ll be responsible for driving decisions on organization design, compensation, employee development, talent density, and much more.  You’ll learn the business and culture inside and out so that you are able to provide strategic HR partnership to the business leaders and the teams you support to enhance the growth and impact of those teams to the business. The ideal candidate will be a dynamic and thoughtful leader with a collaborative and influential leadership style, the ability to inspire others into action and to think creatively about solutions. The right person for this role must have comfort with ambiguity, and able to make quick, well-informed decisions. She/he will embody our culture of Freedom and Responsibility through daily behaviors and interactions and be willing to invite, receive and promote constructive feedback. She/he will exude curiosity about our business and have a proven track record of rapid self-learning.  She/he will value inclusion, diversity of opinions and people, and every member of the team, regardless of their role and background.Experience:This position requires a minimum of 10 years of progressive HR/OD/OE experience. Experience in more than one industry or business sector is highly desired, with particular emphasis on entertainment/media and technology.  Previous experience working with business and legal affairs teams is highly desired.

  • You will make a make a huge impact at an established company.  Your opinion matters and your work adds value to the company. We are a small and nimble team solely responsible for finding the most capable candidates so that Netflix can continue to innovate and be successful.

text: Senior Software Engineer in Test - Messaging
description: Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with more than 110 million members worldwide enjoying billions of hours of TV shows and movies per month.Netflix Messaging Engineering builds the platform, applications and messages to communicate with Netflix members across their entire lifecycle, starting with acquisition, and then moving into account, on boarding and personalized content recommendation messaging. Messaging is considered part of the core Netflix product and is critical in driving growth and engagement of our member base as we work to take Netflix to the next 100 million subscribers.The Netflix Messaging Platform team is responsible for communicating with Netflix users across a wide array of devices including computers, tablets, phones, smart TVs and gaming stations such as Wii, Playstation etc. Communication channels include emails, push notifications on mobile phones and tablets, and in-app messages. Messaging plays an important role in enabling critical transactions as well as increasing user engagement, retention and acquisition. If you enjoy analyzing data, problem solving and testing across a spectrum of interconnected systems and applications using leading technologies, this role with the Netflix Messaging Platform team might be perfect for you.What you will do…As a Senior Software Engineer in Test on the Messaging Platform team, you’ll own the end-to-end QA of our platform that sends billions of messages a year to over 110 million subscribers. As part of that you’ll own building and innovating our test automation framework as well as the automation test plans needed to maintain a high bar of quality of our systems. You’ll develop test plans as we build new features on our platform and A/B tests in our message personalization system. You’ll partner closely with the rest of Messaging engineering as well as other product and engineering teams to ensure we have solid test coverage as we continue to innovate. You and the team will ensure our highly-performant system evolves with maintainability and scalability in mind, solve complex problems in a distributed environment, and continually innovate the platform as we become more personalized and predictive in the frequency of messages and types of content we recommend to our members.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Senior Software Engineer in Test - Messaging


Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with more than 110 million members worldwide enjoying billions of hours of TV shows and movies per month.


Netflix Messaging Engineering builds the platform, applications and messages to communicate with Netflix members across their entire lifecycle, starting with acquisition, and then moving into account, on boarding and personalized content recommendation messaging. Messaging is considered part of the core Netflix product and is critical in driving growth and engagement of our member base as we work to take Netflix to the next 100 million subscribers.


The Netflix Messaging Platform team is responsible for communicating with Netflix users across a wide array of devices including computers, tablets, phones, smart TVs and gaming stations such as Wii, Playstation etc. Communication channels include emails, push notifications on mobile phones and tablets, and in-app messages. Messaging plays an important role in enabling critical transactions as well as increasing user engagement, retention and acquisition. If you enjoy analyzing data, problem solving and testing across a spectrum of interconnected systems and applications using leading technologies, this role with the Netflix Messaging Platform team might be perfect for you.


What you will do…


As a Senior Software Engineer in Test on the Messaging Platform team, you’ll own the end-to-end QA of our platform that sends billions of messages a year to over 110 million subscribers. As part of that you’ll own building and innovating our test automation framework as well as the automation test plans needed to maintain a high bar of quality of our systems. You’ll develop test plans as we build new features on our platform and A/B tests in our message personalization system. You’ll partner closely with the rest of Messaging engineering as well as other product and engineering teams to ensure we have solid test coverage as we continue to innovate. You and the team will ensure our highly-performant system evolves with maintainability and scalability in mind, solve complex problems in a distributed environment, and continually innovate the platform as we become more personalized and predictive in the frequency of messages and types of content we recommend to our members.

  • Our Journey so Far: Messaging Engineering at Netflix
  • Overview of Messaging, Architecture and how we use Elasticsearch for triage
  • SMS integration into the Netflix Messaging platform

  • Experience working with large data sets to answer questions and extract patterns
  • Experience implementing in Java or other object oriented languages for a distributed environment
  • Thrive in an environment that requires you to work cross-functionally across engineering and product teams
  • Great at making data driven decisions
  • Great oral and written communication skills

  • Groovy, Scala or other JVM languages
  • Testing messaging platforms on a global scale
  • Testing personalization systems

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Production Manager, Post Production - Unscripted


We are seeking an experienced Post Production Manager to help manage both internal and third party co-production unscripted & talk series from a post perspective, establish and curate vendor & editorial crew relations, review budgets and support/suggest best practices for post from the moment content is collected through delivery. This position will report into Physical Production in Los Angeles. Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of production on our global original films, series, documentaries, comedy specials, and unscripted series.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. With continued international expansion and a move into original film acquisition and production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Technical Setup of Show
• Work with Production Technologies, Distribution and Localization teams, and external production & post team on defining key post workflows such as camera capture, master delivery, final archive - high emphasis in 4K
• Set up and manage dailies and cut viewing access for showsManage communication of cut schedule


Budgeting
• Work with the EIC, Line Producer, and/or Post Supervisors to prepare and vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback internally and externally on viability and risks
• Review creative and define post budget and strategy
• Collaborate with internal/external teams to lock budget
• Track & manage all post related costs, keeping stakeholders apprised of status
• Deal with the Bond company on delivery dates & budget concerns when applicable


Post Scheduling
• Create/inform and draft post schedule
• Collaborate with internal teams (including Content Ops) & external production team to lock and manage schedule
• Troubleshoot and communicate all changes to schedule to internal/external teams


Staffing/Vendors
• Review & approve facilities for graphics, VFX, animation, color, and sound
• Search and approve and key post hires (post producer, post supervisor, editors, assistant editors)
• Determine key post vendors to accommodate creative vision and relationships, tax incentives, budget needs, location issues
• Help maintain/curate preferred vendor list
• Help maintain/curate preferred staff list


Content Management
• Set up and attend key creative approval sessions such as final mix playbacks, color correction reviews
• Schedule and attend Netflix screenings, previews, premieres, etc.  Collaborate with show post on setting up theater, arranging engineering when necessary, and rehearsing the content when applicable


Qualifications:
• BA/BS Degree
• 10+ Years as Head of Post, Post Production Supervisor or Producer working in unscripted content.
• 10+ years of experience within a medium to high budget studio, network or high volume production company
• Ability to handle a fast paced environment supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery)
• Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K and HDR
• Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
• Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting
• Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
• Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
• Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process
• Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task
• Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Movie Magic Budgeting, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail
• Working knowledge of UHD/4K cameras, UHD/4K workflows, Avid, Final Cut Pro, Premiere, Resolve, Baselight, Nucoda, Pablo Rio, After Effects, ProTools, IMF, DCP


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

description: Netflix runs its applications across a diverse range of devices including: smartphones, tablets, game consoles, Smart TVs and a variety of consumer electronic products. As a result, Netflix works closely with a variety of partners to integrate and launch Netflix applications on these devices, and ensure our subscribers have a great experience watching all the movies and shows. Imagine the complexity and cost of managing all the aspects of the relationship with these partners on both the business and technical side. Here at Netflix, we live to push the bar higher and solve problems like these.All these devices (think Smart TVs, Set Top boxes, and even upcoming devices not yet in the market!) are managed through our Partner Platform which is providing highly visible, partner-facing services such as device management, certification tracking, workflow support and many others. Our users are not only a variety of internal teams, but partners as well like Samsung, LG, Sony, and Google.  Our solution is built on the Netflix platform which gives us access to some amazing tools, such as Spinnaker, Security Monkey, and many other popular tools and services. We are leveraging the same server ecosystem that is used to deliver Netflix to millions of users and actually work alongside it.

text: Senior Research Scientist - Computer Vision for Personalization
description: Want to help each of our 100+ million members worldwide find great content by giving each show its best opportunity to appeal to each member? Are you passionate about researching and applying computer vision where it intersects with personalization? The Page Algorithms Engineering team is looking for a talented applied computer vision and machine learning expert to join the team. You will lead the way by researching and developing the next generation of algorithms used to generate and select artwork, trailers, and evidence shown on Netflix. For more details about what we are working on, take a look at these blog posts: Artwork Personalization at NetflixLearning a Personalized HomepageThe Power of a PictureSelecting the Best Artwork for Videos Through A/B Testing As a Research Scientist at Netflix, you will conduct applied research by conceptualizing, designing, implementing, and validating potential algorithmic improvements for the homepage. This includes running offline experiments and building online A/B tests to run in production systems. To be successful in this role, you have a strong computer vision and machine learning background, are a quick learner, have proven software development skills, and work well in large cross-functional teams. You will need to exhibit strong communication and leadership skills, an ability to set priorities, and an execution focus in a dynamic environment.

Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Senior Research Scientist - Computer Vision for Personalization


Want to help each of our 100+ million members worldwide find great content by giving each show its best opportunity to appeal to each member? Are you passionate about researching and applying computer vision where it intersects with personalization? The Page Algorithms Engineering team is looking for a talented applied computer vision and machine learning expert to join the team. Artwork Personalization at Netflix

As a Research Scientist at Netflix, you will conduct applied research by conceptualizing, designing, implementing, and validating potential algorithmic improvements for the homepage. To be successful in this role, you have a strong computer vision and machine learning background, are a quick learner, have proven software development skills, and work well in large cross-functional teams.   • Great interpersonal skills
  • MS (PhD preferred) in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field

text: Manager, Global Publicity and Content Communications
description: Do you want to help tell the story of Netflix? Do you enjoy shaping communications strategy and messaging? I mean, really enjoy thinking about them and putting new ideas forward. Do you live and breathe entertainment? Do you read or watch media coverage on a network, executive or television series and get curious about how it came to be and wonder how it could be improved? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? If so, we may have just the opportunity for the right person on the originals publicity team. The OpportunityFueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to more than 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is the total package -- a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading and handling communications and publicity campaigns for a fast-growing and highly admired company, across overall strategy and messaging, series publicity, executive communications, appearances and crisis management.  And you’ll get to work with some of the most exciting and creative people in the business. The RoleThe Manager of Global Publicity and Content Communications will work in conjunction with the LA publicity leadership team to primarily help set and implement communications strategy and craft messaging for content teams and executives, while also managing executive appearances and crisis communications. She or he also will be responsible for series publicity initiatives, as well as trade/consumer press announcements.The Manager will have past experience in helping create, shape, execute and manage entertainment trade/consumer communications strategy, both on the corporate/executive side and the series campaign side. They will have experience in communicating with executives, filmmakers, talent and production company partners. She or he will have exemplary media relations, particularly with trade/industry press in both Los Angeles and New York.  They can skillfully and thoughtfully craft narratives, boil down complex concepts into succinct pitches and secure and work with media across broadcast, print, online and radio in both the trade and consumer space. International experience or knowledge of international media is a bonus. They have also worked alongside agencies, or have managed agencies or consultants on projects. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. The ideal candidate is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity, and thinks strategically at all times. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Manager, Global Publicity and Content Communications


Do you want to help tell the story of Netflix? Do you enjoy shaping communications strategy and messaging? I mean, really enjoy thinking about them and putting new ideas forward. Do you live and breathe entertainment? Do you read or watch media coverage on a network, executive or television series and get curious about how it came to be and wonder how it could be improved? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? If so, we may have just the opportunity for the right person on the originals publicity team. The


Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to more than 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is the total package -- a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading and handling communications and publicity campaigns for a fast-growing and highly admired company, across overall strategy and messaging, series publicity, executive communications, appearances and crisis management.  And you’ll get to work with some of the most exciting and creative people in the business.


The Role
The Manager of Global Publicity and Content Communications will work in conjunction with the LA publicity leadership team to primarily help set and implement communications strategy and craft messaging for content teams and executives, while also managing executive appearances and crisis communications. She or he also will be responsible for series publicity initiatives, as well as trade/consumer press announcements.


The Manager will have past experience in helping create, shape, execute and manage entertainment trade/consumer communications strategy, both on the corporate/executive side and the series campaign side. They will have experience in communicating with executives, filmmakers, talent and production company partners. She or he will have exemplary media relations, particularly with trade/industry press in both Los Angeles and New York.  They can skillfully and thoughtfully craft narratives, boil down complex concepts into succinct pitches and secure and work with media across broadcast, print, online and radio in both the trade and consumer space. International experience or knowledge of international media is a bonus. They have also worked alongside agencies, or have managed agencies or consultants on projects. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully.


The ideal candidate is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity, and thinks strategically at all times. He/she is not defined by past experiences and is eager to put a new spin on what publicity can be. They can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer, and is able to multitask and work at a clip pace. They are not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that could mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from writing a strategy, writing a series announcement, or helping cover a set visit, if necessary. We are a small team, so the responsibility really is wide-ranging. They collaborate well with partners that range from content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and questions values inconsistent with our values and Netflix culture. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues.


Qualifications
The successful candidate for Manager, Global Publicity and Content Communications will have at least 7+ years of entertainment experience in a studio, network, agency or journalism setting.Background in Communications/Corporate Communications preferred.  They have relationships with key media as well as the ability to build and maintain connections with key journalists and social media influencers.  BA/BS required.


COMPENSATION
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.


REPORTING RELATIONSHIP
The Manager, Global Publicity and Content Communications reports to the Director of Global Publicity and Content Communications.

text: Manager, Global Creative Marketing, Anime - Japan
description: With 117 million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.  Originals anime content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of anime originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world.We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our Japan originals marketing campaigns for anime content. This team is based in our Tokyo office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, Tokyo, Mumbai, Amsterdam and Singapore, frequent international travel is a must.
