Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Global Creative Marketing, Anime - Japan


With 117 million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.  
Originals anime content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of anime originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world.
We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our Japan originals marketing campaigns for anime content. This team is based in our Tokyo office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, Tokyo, Mumbai, Amsterdam and Singapore, frequent international travel is a must.

  • You have a proven track record of building impactful, world-class 360 creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. 
  • You are a natural leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate creative ideas that people rally around.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, possess a high level of emotional IQ and intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and decision making skills in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing + innovation, and  strive to create impactful and effective visual storytelling on mobile, paid social, and all other mediums/platforms.
  • You love TV and film content and have deep knowledge of the anime industry and media trends both in Japan and globally. 
  • You are a connoisseur of trailers, key art and digital/social media and have solid experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 creative marketing campaigns. 
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are).

    • Who are you?
  • Play a key role in building strategy and creative campaigns (e.g. positioning, key art visuals, trailers & other AV assets, digital creative) for the launch of anime originals.
  • Partner closely with regional marketing teams to develop authentic campaigns that are built on regional insights and connect with local audiences. 
  • Write creative briefs to guide the global creative process and align internal marketing teams on goals and overall strategies. 
  • Project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning internal task force meetings and brainstorm sessions and external filmmaker kickoffs/presentations.
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external stakeholders/partners.
  • Participate in and/or lead lively debates and discussions as you communicate different facets of the campaign to filmmakers, talent and colleagues across the company. 
  • Collaborate with our world class product/engineering team to integrate our originals marketing campaigns within the member product experience. 

    • What will you do?
  • 5+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in entertainment (TV, film, gaming), global lifestyle brand or creative/advertising agency. 
  • Marketing experience in the anime industry or with anime content is preferred.
  • A history of team leadership and cross-functional collaboration with both internal and external partners. 
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp of marketing / media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • Fluency in English and Japanese is mandatory. 
  • Strong interpersonal, creative, presentation, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills

    • Qualifications:

description: It’s not often there’s an opportunity to join a company that is changing consumer habits all over the world, and challenging an entire industry at the same time. The Social Media Manager role at Netflix is a blend of strategy and creative, responsible for launching social campaigns that get people so excited for the Netflix brand and original titles that they sign up.Korea is an important market for us and this is an exciting time to be part of driving our growth with a handful of stunning colleagues who are responsible for driving our success in Korea.From a strategy standpoint, the manager will need to understand the Korean market, our broad Netflix business goals, and local social behavior to lay out what it will take to win the word of mouth game in one of our growth markets. The successful candidate will display the curiosity to learn the Netflix business, analyze high volumes of information quickly, and make smart choices. You will have a great opportunity to represent the Korean local context and help many colleagues from content, product and marketing approach the market with confidence. Creatively, our goal on the marketing team is to build campaigns that prioritize earned media and social conversation. With our original titles and a strong brand, we try to earn as many impressions as we can get before buying them. The social leader will manage agencies, develop creative, and even work with talent from time to time. He or she will need to have impeccable taste, vision for how to stand out from the competition, and a strong instinct for ideas that will get consumers talking. In addition to shaping the Netflix brand in Korea, you will work closely with the originals team to make our shows relevant for Korean viewers.The right hire will bring a deep knowledge of the social media landscape, including a strong understanding not only of their features and technology, but of the new consumer behaviors emerging everyday. We work in a fast-moving environment like a newsroom, constantly mining conversation for insights and ideas, and shaping how consumers and media think about us.

Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR Marketing Social Media Manager - Korea


It’s not often there’s an opportunity to join a company that is changing consumer habits all over the world, and challenging an entire industry at the same time. The Social Media Manager role at Netflix is a blend of strategy and creative, responsible for launching social campaigns that get people so excited for the Netflix brand and original titles that they sign up.


Korea is an important market for us and this is an exciting time to be part of driving our growth with a handful of stunning colleagues who are responsible for driving our success in Korea.From a strategy standpoint, the manager will need to understand the Korean market, our broad Netflix business goals, and local social behavior to lay out what it will take to win the word of mouth game in one of our growth markets. The successful candidate will display the curiosity to learn the Netflix business, analyze high volumes of information quickly, and make smart choices. You will have a great opportunity to represent the Korean local context and help many colleagues from content, product and marketing approach the market with confidence.
 
Creatively, our goal on the marketing team is to build campaigns that prioritize earned media and social conversation. With our original titles and a strong brand, we try to earn as many impressions as we can get before buying them. The social leader will manage agencies, develop creative, and even work with talent from time to time. He or she will need to have impeccable taste, vision for how to stand out from the competition, and a strong instinct for ideas that will get consumers talking. In addition to shaping the Netflix brand in Korea, you will work closely with the originals team to make our shows relevant for Korean viewers.


The right hire will bring a deep knowledge of the social media landscape, including a strong understanding not only of their features and technology, but of the new consumer behaviors emerging everyday. We work in a fast-moving environment like a newsroom, constantly mining conversation for insights and ideas, and shaping how consumers and media think about us.

  • With social managers from nearly every major country around the world, we’re a bit like the UN of social media
  • We love a good pun
  • We aren’t afraid to get our hands dirty and don’t think community management is a dirty word
  • We have a head for business. We understand working in a corporate context even though we find ways to bring our personality to work
  • We love movies and TV and could talk about it for hours. We keep a running spreadsheet on Making a Murderer theories, share lists of our favorite TV episodes of the year, and sometimes go to the movies together

    • A little bit about the team:


    The manager will have 7+ years of experience with some combination of consumer brand, media, entertainment, and agency work in marketing and communications. Our culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read the culture memo. If it resonates for you, maybe you’re the right person to join the Netflix team. Fluency in English and Korean is a must.

description: We call our IT team at Netflix Nerds.  Nerd - an expert in a technical field.  Being a Nerd at Netflix means more than an expert in a technical field.  It also means being passionate about the job of a Nerd and the technology we use.  Read below to find out what being a Nerd at Netflix means and see if you are what we’re looking for.  Netflix is on the hunt for a smart, motivated and customer service centric individual to take on the role of a Nerd who will provide exceptional technology support to our employee base. This position will be based out of our Amsterdam office.  The Nerds team is responsible for over five thousand systems globally. With corporate offices located in Los Gatos, Los Angeles, New York, London, Amsterdam, Singapore, Taiwan, Tokyo, and Sao Paulo, the team is constantly challenged. While responsible for all employee technology platforms and services throughout the company, the team is also highly encouraged to constantly review and refresh the technology, with great opportunity to innovate in Netflix's unique “fast paced environment.”As a Nerd based out of our Amsterdam office you are responsible for the employee experience, providing world class support and resolving every technology issue that comes your way. You are an expert in all of our internal technologies and must ensure Netflix employees stay highly productive in the most secure environment possible. These requests can come in via tickets, email, walkups, chat, phone calls and automated alerts. This position will involve tasks such as supporting cloud and desktop software, troubleshooting conference and screening room AV, access requests, provisioning/deprovisioning accounts and hardware, deploying and upgrading mobile devices, inventory management, supporting off site events, resolving printer issues, along with projects, training on applications and security practices, and documentation. Daily duties can consist of prioritizing, resolving, routing and scheduling all incoming internal technology support requests. The Nerd must also set expectations with the ticket requester, and ensure all ticket information is logged correctly.

description: As Netflix continues to drive global growth, the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) team is looking for a talented Manager to drive marketing, planning and analysis for our US, Canada, Australia & New Zealand marketing efforts. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Senior Manager, Marketing Planning & Analysis - UCAN


As Netflix continues to drive global growth, the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) team is looking for a talented Manager to drive marketing, planning and analysis for our US, Canada, Australia & New Zealand marketing efforts. Netflix derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing all aspects of the business, and this is equally applicable to Marketing Strategy. This position will partner closely with regional Marketing and Communications leadership to inform and prioritize strategic business decisions with data-driven insights.


In this role, you will need to be a big picture thinker, self-starter, and analytical thought partner with a killer eye for detail, and bring tremendous skills and experiences as a cross-functional partner and communicator.   You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and embrace ambiguity and change. You must be a solutions oriented problem solver with a focus on generating impact and results, and be able to communicate complex ideas using both qualitative and quantitative means to communicate to a broad spectrum of stakeholders. The position is based in our Los Angeles office and reports to the Marketing Planning & Analysis lead for UCAN (United States, Canada, Australia & New Zealand).

  • Monitoring and analyzing subscriber lifecycle and viewing behaviors to identify trends and uncover insights that help drive subscriber growth, shape market strategy and drive tactical execution within the region
  • Performing analyses to inform strategic prioritization, optimization,  and learnings for earned and paid marketing campaigns. Projects may include media partnership planning and evaluation, campaign measurement, and resourcing prioritization
  • Supporting marketing experimentation and testing strategy development and execution in collaboration with cross-functional teams (MP&A, Data Science & Algorithms, etc.)
  • Conducting market research, compiling industry trends and competitive analyses to inform strategic planning for new areas of growth, developing business plans or go-to-market strategies
  • Partnering with marketing and communications stakeholders to create transparency and measurement of  the business, developing business processes, dashboards, and reporting tools
  • Supporting organizational planning efforts to drive scale and efficiency across the company
    • RESPONSIBILITIES (include, but are not limited to):
  • A successful candidate will have a strong track record of identifying key questions, connecting the dots, performing analyses independently, and communicating findings in a clear and concise way. He/she must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of business managers.
  • Must have previous top-tier experience in a highly analytical environment, e.g. corporate strategy,  top management consulting firm, investment bank or similarly demanding environment in which modeling and strategic analysis were regularly performed, scoped and managed
  • Additional 5+ years of operational or client-side experience in a marketing, planning and/or analytical function with cross-functional, executive level stakeholder management
  • High aptitude and enthusiasm for problem solving, research, and financial modeling and analysis used in support of analysis and prescribed recommendations for executive management and cross-functional stakeholders
  • Excellent in crafting, presenting and socializing complex ideas, recommendations and insights with an adaptable communication approach necessary to partner with broad stakeholder sets
  • Detail oriented, high quality work output oversight,  with a keen eye for process and business improvement opportunities
  • Demonstrated leadership, team-building and people management experience
  • Prior digital, media/entertainment (TV, film), advertising, consumer products and/or services marketing each a plus
  • Demonstrated cross-cultural understanding and global expertise or prior marketing experience in AUS/NZ or Canada a plus
  • MBA preferred, not required
    • QUALIFICATIONS

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Manager, Consumer PR - Mexico


The Opportunity
We are looking for a talented Public Relations professional who is an expert in understanding the different cultures & idiosyncrasies of Mexico. Passion for entertainment and a desire to connect people to amazing content is a must.


It’s not often there’s an opportunity to help define media strategy through one of the most important markets in the world for a fast growing and highly admired company. Fueled by consumer delight in being able to watch instantly unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix subscriber growth has been enormous in recent years with the company now offering its service to over 117 million members in over 190 countries .


Our upside potential has never been greater – both domestically and internationally – and there’s never been a more promising time to join Netflix.


The Role
The PR Media Relations Manager will help build the Netflix brand and its service in Mexico, making use of multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print, and online. He/She will be a critical link between agencies in specific countries and Netflix in promoting Netflix as a Brand including how we fit into people’s lives through our content, our technology and our unique service.

  • Manage, ensure effective and efficient implementation and analyzes the impact of PR programs in Mexico including Consumer, Entertainment & Technology initiatives.
  • Excellence in Project Management. – understands what does it take to build a project, campaign or initiative starting with strategy, through execution and overseeing the recording of results
  • Understand how to build and maintain relationships with key journalists and different kind of influencers on behalf of Netflix
  • Acknowledges the importance of partnering with agencies in the region and manages teams in several countries simultaneously
  • Be deeply familiar with, and enthusiastically curious about, technology, intellectual property, privacy and other Web issues.
  • Is familiar with Social Media, Marketing and Development of Materials and provides insight to different internal local teams on potential PR opportunities around Content & Marketing initiatives.
  • Understands the importance of accurate budgeting and reporting
  • US Hispanic media relations is a plus
    • In addition, the Manager must:


    Qualifications


    The successful candidate for the Media Relations role will likely possess 8+ years in corporate or agency settings. Of particular interest are candidates with Broad knowledge of TV, entertainment, pop culture & lifestyle trends, etc. in general and Latin America.


    To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


    Creative
    Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


    Succinct Communicator
    Great writer and talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Doesn’t need to “check with the agency” on every issue or for every
    answer. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


    Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
    Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


    A smart minimalist
    Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex- and will resist and prevent that. Does not need or desire big budgets for big results. Believes one great person on the team is more valuable than 3 to 5 OK people- and wants to be that great person.


    Has a Point of View
    An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


    Pace
    Moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done on short timeframes.


    Languages
    Ability to speak/write in Spanish & English is essential; Portuguese is a plus.


    An Adult
    Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


    COMPENSATION
    Realizing the importance of the position, Netflix will offer an attractive compensation package.


    REPORTING RELATIONSHIP
    The Manager reports to the Director – Latin America Media Relations.

text: Senior Data Scientist - Payments and Partnerships
description: Netflix is a global leader in entertainment with over 117 million members in 190 countries, and a slate of over 700 original series and movies in 2018. Our payments teams across the globe strive to make it convenient for consumers to pay their subscriptions on time and enjoy Netflix without interruption. We support and continuously optimize the portfolio of different payment methods in each country. To complement and increase our worldwide reach, our partnerships and business development teams work with a range of partner companies spanning cable, telecom, CE manufacturers, TV makers, streaming devices, and app platforms. Our partners not just allow consumers to enjoy Netflix on a wide variety of devices, but also lend us their brand names and marketing budgets.At the heart of all our initiatives lies data. We maintain a relentless focus on data and hypothesis driven decision making that allows us to create the best experiences for our members. We are at the forefront of using advanced mathematical models and algorithms on big data to provide a personally optimized experience for each of our members, and our scientists and engineers are constantly looking for new ways to improve the state of the art. Netflix data science is a unique combination of big data, algorithms, and entertainment: where else do you get to work on big data and win forty three primetime Emmys, four technical achievement Emmys, four Golden Globes, and earn seven Oscar nominations (one win and counting)!We are seeking a talented and passionate data scientist to help drive innovation in the payments space, and across all our partnerships and business development initiatives. This is a high-impact position where your analysis and interpretation of test results will have a direct and high impact on product and business decisions.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Science and Analytics Senior Data Scientist - Payments and Partnerships


Netflix is a global leader in entertainment with over 117 million members in 190 countries, and a slate of over 700 original series and movies in 2018. Our payments teams across the globe strive to make it convenient for consumers to pay their subscriptions on time and enjoy Netflix without interruption. We support and continuously optimize the portfolio of different payment methods in each country. To complement and increase our worldwide reach, our partnerships and business development teams work with a range of partner companies spanning cable, telecom, CE manufacturers, TV makers, streaming devices, and app platforms. Our partners not just allow consumers to enjoy Netflix on a wide variety of devices, but also lend us their brand names and marketing budgets.


At the heart of all our initiatives lies data. We maintain a relentless focus on data and hypothesis driven decision making that allows us to create the best experiences for our members. We are at the forefront of using advanced mathematical models and algorithms on big data to provide a personally optimized experience for each of our members, and our scientists and engineers are constantly looking for new ways to improve the state of the art. Netflix data science is a unique combination of big data, algorithms, and entertainment: where else do you get to work on big data and win forty three primetime Emmys, four technical achievement Emmys, four Golden Globes, and earn seven Oscar nominations (one win and counting)!


We are seeking a talented and passionate data scientist to help drive innovation in the payments space, and across all our partnerships and business development initiatives. This is a high-impact position where your analysis and interpretation of test results will have a direct and high impact on product and business decisions.

  • Partner closely with leadership on our payments, partnerships, business development, and product management teams to design and analyze experiments (and quasi-experiments) that drive key decisions globally.
  • Develop statistical/machine learning models and related analysis that explain user acquisition, retention, and engagement on our various partner initiatives and devices.
  • Examples of past projects include payment method fraud prediction, estimating the value of a dedicated Netflix button on remotes, optimizing the set of payment methods offered by country, understanding adoption of Netflix on Oculus VR.
  • Research and develop key metrics and performance indicators. How do we measure the impact of marketing dollars that a partner company spends to promote Netflix? What is the value of implementing Dolby Atmos audio?
  • Translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business or product improvement, and communicate these findings.
  • Build dashboards and visualizations that enable stakeholders to self-serve metrics and trends effectively. Assist and educate on interpretation.
    • Responsibilities:
  • PhD degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research, Econometrics or related field
  • 3+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging massive amounts of data to drive product innovation
  • Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in A/B testing or other experimentation setting
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Strong Programming skills in Python or R
  • Experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (Hive, Pig, Presto, Spark)
  • Data visualization skills to convey information and results clearly
  • Deep product sense
  • Ability to work independently and drive your own projects
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
  • A fan of Netflix is a strong plus
    • Qualifications:

text: Senior UI Engineer - Identity and Access Engineering
description: Netflix is an incredible place to work filled with dynamic, talented, and creative people. Our culture values a large degree of freedom to innovate, relying on responsibility to avoid chaos. This thoughtful culture pushes the boundaries of traditional security approaches, but allows for creative freedom, low friction, and polished user experience. As a result, we often develop innovative ways to keep our customers and company safe.Come join a collaborative, engineering focused security team passionate about pioneering cutting edge identity tools and services. We are looking for skilled software engineers with a passion for building innovative products that work reliably, repeatedly, and with little guidance; automation and a strong user-experience should always do the work. You will be responsible for building and contributing to a identity platform that drives user authentication, access, lifecycle, and consumption of identity related data across the entire Netflix ecosystem.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Senior UI Engineer - Identity and Access Engineering


Netflix is an incredible place to work filled with dynamic, talented, and creative people. Our culture values a large degree of freedom to innovate, relying on responsibility to avoid chaos. This thoughtful culture pushes the boundaries of traditional security approaches, but allows for creative freedom, low friction, and polished user experience. As a result, we often develop innovative ways to keep our customers and company safe.


Come join a collaborative, engineering focused security team passionate about pioneering cutting edge identity tools and services. We are looking for skilled software engineers with a passion for building innovative products that work reliably, repeatedly, and with little guidance; automation and a strong user-experience should always do the work. You will be responsible for building and contributing to a identity platform that drives user authentication, access, lifecycle, and consumption of identity related data across the entire Netflix ecosystem.

  • How can we securely authenticate users with a rich login experience that is tailored for each individual brand at Netflix, fully customizable and for which doesn't impede user productivity?
  • How can we fully automate user-lifecycle but give decision makers the right amount of freedom to customize their own workflows of how and when a user is on-boarded or off-boarded?
  • Can we use our user behavior analytics to better inform managers in a self-service means what access their current employees use and why, and what new employees need on day one?
  • Can we present a single interface for all of our workforce, customer service, partner, and studio users that allows them to view and edit all of their own Identity related information as well their peers. (Employee Info, Application Access, Org Hierarchy, MFA & Personal Devices, etc)
  • Can we make it frictionless for developers to integrate authentication into progressive microservice architectures by providing intuitive user friendly libraries.
    • Some of the problems we’re solving:
  • You have a strong background in front-end JS frameworks like Polymer/ReactJS as well as some experience in full-stack development environments such as Node or Java.
  • You have solid understanding of core JavaScript and its fundamentals.
  • You want to build a stunning front-end experiences and desire to dive deep and contribute within our backend platforms.
  • You love to learn new technologies quickly and to pivot as our team and projects evolve.
  • You are proactive, self-driven and enjoy solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.
  • You have the ability to effectively collaborate and gather requirements from various teams and/or partners around the business and successfully translate the requirements into working tools or applications.
    • As our ideal teammate:
  • Native mobile application development on iOS or Android
  • AuthN and AuthZ protocols/frameworks. Specifically OpenID Connect, OAuth, SAML.
  • Background in web application security and the OWASP top 10.
    • Even better if you have experience with..


    We are looking for thoughtful security professionals who enable our mission and support our culture of freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more about life at Netflix by watching our security talks or exploring our open source work.

text: Senior Software Engineer - Fullstack, Edge Developer Productivity
description: Netflix is the world’s leading Internet video streaming service. Our members enjoy billions of hours of TV shows and movies per month on over 1000 different types of devices. How do we ensure that we are providing our members the best possible experience without compromising availability, scalability and cost? Large scale, highly available Netflix API services are at the core of that challenge. The Edge Developer Productivity team focuses on both service side as well as client side developers, crafting tools and solutions to optimize across their entire development and operations lifecycle. Thus, our mission is to amplify the innovation velocity at the API tier.We are looking for highly motivated engineers who can apply their technical skills towards solving productivity challenges for other engineers. For the curious learner, this is an opportunity to apply cutting edge technology such as containers, functional reactive programming and modern UI frameworks to challenging problems, and cross leverage them in impactful ways. In this role, you will be interacting with a wide set of users and partners. The ability to communicate well with partners and understand their requirements is a key to success.

•Keeping timelines of debuts and releases
•Organizing & executing Media Center approvals
•Creating usernames and managing user databases
•Assigning screeners and managing press lists
•Assisting in the upkeep of department documents and trackers


This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and who is able to exercise good judgment and initiative. Here at Netflix, we don't have rules and regulations. We hire adults who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work, and we expect high performance in return.


The successful candidate is:
•Confident and able to express ideas thoughtfully and with passion.
•Meticulous about the details. Every single one of them.
•Thorough, completes tasks and follows up.
•Passionate about entertainment. A rabid fan of television, film and pop culture. 
•Scrappy, resourceful and relentless in trying to find a solution before escalating issues. 
•Able to anticipate potential problems and knows when to ask for help. 
•Aware that the world of publicity is not a 9-5 job. 
•Organized, organized, organized 
•Poised, not scared to speak up with the team, and mature.
•Able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadlines and pressure.
•Able to pivot and adapt to shifting priorities without missing a beat.
•A proactive and positive thinker and a contributor to the team.
•Knows Google Drive like the back of their hand.
•Able to function effectively as a part of a loosely coupled but highly aligned team. 
•Effective in dealing with global PR agencies, talent reps and internal executives. 
•A great communicator - via email, by phone, in person-and simultaneously.


Qualifications
The successful candidate for Coordinator, EMEA Originals Publicity will have at least two to three years of entertainment experience either in a studio or agency setting.  They will be a clear and concise communicator in a variety of media.  The role is global so some international experience is a bonus but not a deal breaker.


To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:
Creative
Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.
Succinct Communicator
Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.
A smart minimalist
Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.
Has a Point of View
An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.
Pace
Moves quickly and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short time frames.
Integrity
Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.
An Adult
Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


COMPENSATION
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, comprehensive benefits and relocation.

With over 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries, our approach to Marketing is to defy convention, disrupt industry norms and break new ground through innovative, culturally relevant, breakthrough campaigns. We are actively promoting our original, exclusive content that is core to everything we do.We are looking to fill an integral role on the global creative marketing team for a Manager of Global Creative Marketing, Global Series. This is a great opportunity to join a team that leads the development and launch of innovative marketing campaigns across a diverse range of Original Series.The RoleThis role is unique. So is the right candidate. In this role, you will be a key contributor and leader in strategizing, executing and managing marketing/social launch campaigns for different series -- including drama and action series. This role focuses especially on fandom space around our unique Marvel and Millar properties. Experience with talent relations is a must. You will be a member of a small, seasoned and nimble group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, reporting to the Global Creative Marketing Lead - Global Series - Marvel and Millar.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Global Creative Marketing (Global Series - Marvel Millar)


The Opportunity
It’s an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. With over 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries, our approach to Marketing is to defy convention, disrupt industry norms and break new ground through innovative, culturally relevant, breakthrough campaigns. We are actively promoting our original, exclusive content that is core to everything we do.


We are looking to fill an integral role on the global creative marketing team for a Manager of Global Creative Marketing, Global Series. This is a great opportunity to join a team that leads the development and launch of innovative marketing campaigns across a diverse range of Original Series.


The Role
This role is unique. So is the right candidate.


In this role, you will be a key contributor and leader in strategizing, executing and managing marketing/social launch campaigns for different series -- including drama and action series. This role focuses especially on fandom space around our unique Marvel and Millar properties. Experience with talent relations is a must. You will be a member of a small, seasoned and nimble group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, reporting to the Global Creative Marketing Lead - Global Series - Marvel and Millar.

  • Has a proven track record of building world-class creative and launching global campaigns for premium entertainment properties that connect consumers to entertainment brands and create a passionate following. We are not only building campaigns, we are transforming our properties into culturally relevant brands.
  • Has deep knowledge in running a 360-campaign, from strategy development to tactical execution (including AV/trailers, digital/social, print and out-of-home).
  • Has a deep understanding of the social media landscape, platform best practices and consumers (social) media behaviors.
  • Has experience in establishing strong and out of the box social media strategies that build, nurture and maintain strong fan communities and manifest themselves in unique tone of voices and cultural relevant and conversation driving creative.
  • Is passionate about the comic book space and part of this very vocal and engaged community.
  • Is a cross-functional leader who is able to engage, listen and collaborate with internal departments/teams to align early on in terms of overall strategy and goals, and to see the cross-functional collaboration through launch.
  • Is able to effectively communicate different facets of their campaigns to executives, showrunners (or filmmakers), talent and talent representatives (as needed).
  • Has exposure to working on global campaigns, with reach domestically and internationally. Ideally, this person would have a global IQ and/or are familiar with working with teams from different regional markets.
  • Has a good understanding of marketing, social and media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • Has a native understanding of digital with an emphasis on mobile, social, video and display and an ability to tell stories through great ideas regardless of medium.
  • Appreciates technology and can collaborate with our world class product team to integrate our multi-title campaigns within the member product experience.
  • Is an effective collaborator in a fast paced, multifaceted environment. We will typically have multiple launch campaigns happening at once.
    • We are looking for someone who:
  • Lead day-to-day on upcoming global series launch campaigns -- from strategy development to creative execution, production and community management.
  • In conjunction with the Global Creative Marketing Lead - Global Series - Marvel and Millar, collaborate on strategy around entertainment properties and execute based on the strategy.
  • Act as the central cross-functional liaison amongst internal teams (across region-based Marketing teams, Consumer PR, Publicity, Product and Social), with a focus on managing workflow and being able to socialize, absorb, organize and address cross-functional feedback (where possible)
  • Act as the main point of contact with agencies - giving feedback to agencies based on internal conversations (being willing to experiment when warranted).
  • Shepherd scope, budget, and overall campaign resources.
    • Core Responsibilities:
  • A minimum 6 years of experience at an entertainment marketing or social department, network/studio marketing/social team, or creative agency working on global campaigns and building communities (in strategy, Digital, Print and AV creative).
  • Experience managing a high volume of campaign types in parallel, while collaborating with diverse, geographically-dispersed teams.
  • Strong communication and analytical skills along with the ability to think strategically and creatively and a reasonable appreciation for the unknown.
  • International experience (or experience in working with international teams) preferred.
  • University Degree, Post Graduate qualifications in related field preferred.
  • Passion for television and movies is a must.
    • Qualifications (The successful candidate possesses):
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.  
  • You are a proactive self-starter, who does not need to be told what to do and will be resourceful in order to find solutions to any challenge. You are not afraid to get your hands dirty.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of the business - especially when bridging the gap between our content and our brand - and have an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are a natural team leader, with the ability to conceptualize and articulate creative strategy and production that all will rally around.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!
  • You are able to make wise and informed decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically.
  • You are an avid user of both your left and right brain. If you live and breathe global entertainment and geek out at the thought of breaking the advertising mold, then we want to talk to you.
    • Personality Attributes:


    Compensation
    Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

Tokyo, Japan Content Production Coordinator, Physical Production - Anime


We are seeking an experienced Coordinator, Physical Production to help manage both internal and third party co-productions Netflix Originals Anime titles from a physical production perspective. Responsibilities include establishing and curating vendor & staff/crew relations, ensuring all Physical Production deadlines are established and met, assist the Manager of Physical Production, Anime with administration, reviewing budgets and supporting/suggesting best practices from pre production through delivery. This position will report in to the Manager of Physical Production, Anime based in Tokyo. Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of the physical production processes across the Netflix Originals Anime slate.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members worldwide. With continued international expansion and a move into original production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative while working with a high volume production slate.

  • Set up, schedule and coordinate initial kick off and ongoing production meetings for internal and partner produced co-productions
  • Assist with identification and curation of experienced, high quality production staff and crew
  • Coordinate the onboarding process for production companies and freelance producers to the Netflix ecosystem, tools and resources
  • Update and maintain inward and outward-facing production resources and documents
  • Research, curate, and develop relationships with vendors, while continually analyzing cost efficiencies
  • Assist productions and executives in planning and coordinating travel
  • Research and outreach to potential location for look development reference and studios
  • Production budget review and analysis
  • Any other duties as necessary to support the productions and the department

    • Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Fluent bilingual ability in both English and Japanese
  • 5 Years + experience with long form production management both in the Anime production ecosystem. Candidates will likely be at the Manager or equivalent outside of Netflix
  • Experience in anime production
  • Ability to handle a fast paced environment, simultaneously supporting several projects in various phases of production (from evaluation to production through delivery)
  • Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both 2D and 3D Anime productions along with delivery of HD and 4K workflows
  • Access to long roster of high quality vendors and crew/creative talent worldwide in the anime industry
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
  • Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting
  • Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
  • Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly while being an effective communicator
  • Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current production process and gear
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-tasks
  • Proficiency in Google Ecosystem (including Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, Mail and Drive) and familiarity with post production/editorial systems and finishing processes
  • Willingness to take educated risks and think out of the box

description: Netflix announced the creation of the first global Internet TV network two years ago and operates in 190 countries. But our journey has just begun. Our marketing department is tasked with making people so passionate about our content that they signup and watch.  As part of this mission, our marketing team optimizes a billion dollar budget, executes thousands of programmatic campaigns via online ad platforms (Facebook, AdWords/YouTube, DoubleClick) and offline channels (TV, OOH, etc.) in order to drive member engagement and incremental sign ups globally. To help marketing achieve this huge scale, the Ads Engineering team develops ways to simplify and automate most aspects of the sophisticated marketing campaigns and experiments that advances our learning.  We do that in the following ways...• build a unified interface for campaign and marketing experimentation management• support algorithmic innovation to optimize selection of audience, budget, title, etc.• build a unified reporting and monitoring infrastructure across all ad platforms.The RoleWe’re looking for an experienced engineering leader to help us build out our engineering foundations for marketing global scale vehicles.  You will craft partnerships with product managers, programmatic marketing, scientists and machine learning researchers, and other engineering teams.  You will hire star performers to the team while inspiring and motivating the seasoned engineers on the team.  You will ensure we can continue to scale with our growing marketing campaigns across both earned and paid media.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Engineering Leader - Ads Engineering


Netflix announced the creation of the first global Internet TV network two years ago and operates in 190 countries. But our journey has just begun. Our marketing department is tasked with making people so passionate about our content that they signup and watch.  As part of this mission, our marketing team optimizes a billion dollar budget, executes thousands of programmatic campaigns via online ad platforms (Facebook, AdWords/YouTube, DoubleClick) and offline channels (TV, OOH, etc.) in order to drive member engagement and incremental sign ups globally.


To help marketing achieve this huge scale, the Ads Engineering team develops ways to simplify and automate most aspects of the sophisticated marketing campaigns and experiments that advances our learning.  We do that in the following ways...
• build a unified interface for campaign and marketing experimentation management
• support algorithmic innovation to optimize selection of audience, budget, title, etc.
• build a unified reporting and monitoring infrastructure across all ad platforms.


The Role
We’re looking for an experienced engineering leader to help us build out our engineering foundations for marketing global scale vehicles.  You will craft partnerships with product managers, programmatic marketing, scientists and machine learning researchers, and other engineering teams.  You will hire star performers to the team while inspiring and motivating the seasoned engineers on the team.  You will ensure we can continue to scale with our growing marketing campaigns across both earned and paid media.

  • You have several years of experience building and leading software engineering teams working on high traffic distributed systems
  • You are a great partner for your engineering and product colleagues. Your team consistently delivers and delights; partners want to work with you.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You have a bias towards action and results.
  • You provide services to many other teams. You are a pro at handling the coordination and technical challenges of wide-scale integration of dependencies.
  • You recruit and lead stars. This is a small team with a huge mandate. Only superstars can get it done, and you can lead them.
  • You have working knowledge of programmatic advertising
    • Job Qualifications


    Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more via the Netflix culture memo and jobs site.  


    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Manager, Film Events - Originals Publicity


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading promotional campaigns for such a fast growing and highly admired company, with a chance to strategize, plan and execute events alongside a team that is working on films and series that feature high production value from the brightest filmmakers and actors in the industry, using the latest technology.


The Role
The Manager for Film Events will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing events for the rapidly growing slate of Netflix films.


The Manager will work alongside the team that is helping to create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for feature films, meaning that he/she will have to be in sync and show a curiosity about promotional efforts and contribute to improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas. The ideal candidate has worked handling events for film studios, brands or agencies that are experts in film. He/she will be able to communicate with filmmakers, talent representatives, agencies, executives and production partners on efforts. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because both domestic and international travel is a requirement.


She/he is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. He/she can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and questions values inconsistent with our values.


Qualifications

He/she understands the industry and the strategy behind developing a successful publicity campaign for a film release. This person will ideally have deep relationships within the film event industry, be familiar with the key theaters and venues in both NY and LA and have past experience working at the major film festivals. He/she will have experience in creating and managing film premieres and events including red carpet arrivals, managing influencer invite lists, build out and management of the theater as well as creating exceptional party environments and launch stunts.


The right candidate will have experience leading a team of event pros, collaborating with cross functional teams and bringing new ideas to the table that reach beyond traditional film premiere events.

This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.

description: The Netflix marketing legal team is hiring a seasoned manager of music to manage music clearance for Netflix’s Marketing and PR teams.Our Marketing and PR campaigns are a key part of Netflix’s ongoing success, and music is core to those campaigns.  Working closely with the existing marketing music team, the company’s Music Group and stakeholders in the Marketing and PR organizations, the successful candidate will be comfortable working through a wide range of music clearance matters.  Keeping in mind the strategic goals of the company and understanding the broader legal implications of each music deal is paramount. This includes working  across various types of media in all kinds of integrations, having great relationships within the music industry and knowing how to keep forward momentum in the fast-moving world of marketing and PR.  Helping find song owners (no matter how obscure), digging into challenging negotiations, and facilitating the marketing and PR teams music use. The successful candidate loves everything music.  S/he spends his/her free time going to venues,  searching the Internet for the next great artists, and studying musicology.  Because the role deals with so many people across all sizes of companies s/he knows everyone in the industry - the record labels, the publishers, artists, managers, studios, networks, agencies, marketing teams, producers, post producers, editors, and directors.  S/he thinks having several different licenses (synch, master, mechanical, etc.) for the same work makes complete sense and doesn’t think twice about a 7-way split ownership for “a side” of a song.  S/he thinks about negotiation from a broad perspective and geeks out about the business side of music even more than the creative side.The successful candidate will be someone who loves working in an environment where freedom and responsibility are tenets, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates.  S/he will have incredible soft skills to compliment his/her diligent work ethic.  S/he seeks an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process yet s/he knows how to work with organizations or institutions that may not hold the same beliefs.  This page outlines how s/he always thought a company should be run.This role is based in Los Angeles, and reports into the Marketing Legal Group, and will be part of the larger music group at Netflix.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Legal Legal Manager, Marketing Music


The Netflix marketing legal team is hiring a seasoned manager of music to manage music clearance for Netflix’s Marketing and PR teams.


Our Marketing and PR campaigns are a key part of Netflix’s ongoing success, and music is core to those campaigns.  Working closely with the existing marketing music team, the company’s Music Group and stakeholders in the Marketing and PR organizations, the successful candidate will be comfortable working through a wide range of music clearance matters.  Keeping in mind the strategic goals of the company and understanding the broader legal implications of each music deal is paramount. This includes working  across various types of media in all kinds of integrations, having great relationships within the music industry and knowing how to keep forward momentum in the fast-moving world of marketing and PR.  Helping find song owners (no matter how obscure), digging into challenging negotiations, and facilitating the marketing and PR teams music use.


The successful candidate loves everything music.  S/he spends his/her free time going to venues,  searching the Internet for the next great artists, and studying musicology.  Because the role deals with so many people across all sizes of companies s/he knows everyone in the industry - the record labels, the publishers, artists, managers, studios, networks, agencies, marketing teams, producers, post producers, editors, and directors.  S/he thinks having several different licenses (synch, master, mechanical, etc.) for the same work makes complete sense and doesn’t think twice about a 7-way split ownership for “a side” of a song.  S/he thinks about negotiation from a broad perspective and geeks out about the business side of music even more than the creative side.


The successful candidate will be someone who loves working in an environment where freedom and responsibility are tenets, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates.  S/he will have incredible soft skills to compliment his/her diligent work ethic.  S/he seeks an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process yet s/he knows how to work with organizations or institutions that may not hold the same beliefs.  This page outlines how s/he always thought a company should be run.


This role is based in Los Angeles, and reports into the Marketing Legal Group, and will be part of the larger music group at Netflix.

  • Coordinating with Netflix’s internal cross-functional stakeholders as well as outside parties including labels, publishers, copyright owners, composers, their managers and/or attorneys, regarding clearance, ownership, and financial procedures and license fees.
  • Researching music ownership and seeking/obtaining quotes from labels and publishers.
  • Managing, negotiating, and preparing/reviewing licenses (master and synch, etc.).
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with third-party companies, labels, artists, studios, publishers, producers, various guilds and music/performance associations (e.g., SAG-AFTRA, AFM).
  • Meeting with current and new music production houses, libraries, songwriters and producers and making recommendations for future opportunities.
  • Managing Netflix marketing and PR’s music clearance needs and rights management, including tracking territory, media and terms and maintaining all cue sheets.
  • Obtaining media buy schedules in order to pay talent fees, if necessary, for all spots and to provide to publisher’s/labels as required by licenses.
  • Providing creative input for use of songs when requested by the marketing creative teams.
  • Following industry trends for new business/content opportunities.
  • Participating in other projects specific to Netflix’s marketing music needs.
    • List of Responsibilities:
  • The successful candidate will have at least 7+ years of direct music clearance experience at a major production, film/television studio, television network, agency, publisher, label, or law firm in the music department.
  • Clear, concise communication skills.
  • Ability to distill salient points and frame and present issues succinctly.
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably on multiple projects under tight time-frames in a fast-paced production environment.
  • Ability to pivot quickly, think practically, and be solution-oriented.
  • Attention to detail and understanding of the critical nature of clean data as it pertains to music rights.
    • Requirements:

text: Manager Creative Marketing International Originals - Spain
description: With 100+ million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.Originals content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of international originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world. We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our EMEA international originals marketing campaigns. This team is based in our Amsterdam office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, London and Amsterdam, frequent international travel is a must.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Manager Creative Marketing International Originals - Spain


With 100+ million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.


Originals content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of international originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world. 


We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our EMEA international originals marketing campaigns. This team is based in our Amsterdam office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, London and Amsterdam, frequent international travel is a must.


  • You have a proven track record of building impactful, world-class 360 creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist.
  • You are a natural team leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate creative ideas that people rally around.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, possess a high level of emotional IQ and intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and decision making skills in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing + innovation, and  strive to create impactful and effective visual storytelling on mobile, paid social all other mediums/platforms.
  • You love international TV and film content and have deep knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends both in Europe and globally.
  • You are a connoisseur of trailers, key art and digital/social media and have solid experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 creative marketing campaigns.
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are).
    • Who are you?
  • Play a key role in building strategy and creative campaigns (e.g. marketing shoots, AV and key visuals, paid assets) for the launch of EMEA international originals.
  • Partner closely with EMEA regional marketing teams to develop authentic campaigns that are built on regional insights and connect with local audiences.
  • Write creative briefs to guide the global creative process and align internal marketing teams on goals and overall strategies.
  • Project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning internal task force meetings and brainstorm sessions and external filmmaker kickoffs/presentations.
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external stakeholders/partners.
  • Participate in and/or lead lively debates and discussions as you communicate different facets of the campaign to filmmakers, talent and colleagues across the company.
  • Collaborate with our world class product/engineering team to integrate our originals marketing campaigns within the member product experience.
    • What will you do?
  • Fluency in English and Spanish is mandatory.
  • 8+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in entertainment (TV, film, gaming), global lifestyle brand (Nike, Coca-Cola, Apple, etc.) or creative/advertising agency.
  • A history of team leadership and cross-functional collaboration with both internal and external partners.
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp of marketing / media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • You have international experience, preferably have spent time living and working in Europe.
  • Strong interpersonal, creative, presentation, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills.
    • Qualifications:

description: Netflix: Over one-third of the Internet’s downstream traffic during peak hours.As a Traffic Engineer, you will work on the application control plane. You will analyze and understand the way user requests are routed to our multi-regional cloud deployment. You will design, develop, and deploy new solutions to route traffic more intelligently. Your solutions will take into account perceived latency, granularity of fault domains, time to remediate, and capacity costs.The Traffic Team has a mission to fortify availability in the face of failures. In mere minutes, Traffic moves massive amounts of in-flight data from one fault domain to another during service disruptions. This helps maintain a healthy and agile system, capable of responding to devastating outages in stride while preserving the quality of service for our customers.

As a Traffic Engineer, you will work on the application control plane. You will analyze and understand the way user requests are routed to our multi-regional cloud deployment. Your solutions will take into account perceived latency, granularity of fault domains, time to remediate, and capacity costs.


The Traffic Team has a mission to fortify availability in the face of failures. This helps maintain a healthy and agile system, capable of responding to devastating outages in stride while preserving the quality of service for our customers.

text: Senior UI Engineer, Geo Experimentation Platform
description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over 140 million hours of TV shows and movies per day to 117 million members in over 190 countries. We do this in a data-driven culture which allows us to gain the insights needed to successfully disrupt the cable and linear TV industry. Data scientists, engineering teams, and product managers throughout Netflix perform rigorous testing to ensure that all our changes are ones that customers love. The Quasi-Testing Platform team (under the Data Engineering and Infrastructure org) is in the thick of enabling quasi experimentation across a variety of teams at Netflix. These range from geo based pricing experiments to Marketing tests that impact new customer acquisition as well as the viewing of specific titles. Marketing, in particular, with a budget of $2B for 2018, is a key driver of our global subscriber growth and is increasingly being used to improve the amount of viewing of titles via innovative techniques such as city and country level quasi-experiments.We are looking for a UI engineer to help us build a fantastic UI experience to design, launch, monitor and analyze quasi tests in a simple and intuitive way. As a member of the core quasi-testing platform team, you will partner with various stakeholders to understand their use cases and help ensure that we deliver UI features which are easy to use, update and maintain. You will also get opportunities to collaborate with other teams within Netflix to leverage as well as influence the best practices for UI development.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure Senior UI Engineer, Geo Experimentation Platform


Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over 140 million hours of TV shows and movies per day to 117 million members in over 190 countries. We do this in a data-driven culture which allows us to gain the insights needed to successfully disrupt the cable and linear TV industry. Data scientists, engineering teams, and product managers throughout Netflix perform rigorous testing to ensure that all our changes are ones that customers love.
 
The Quasi-Testing Platform team (under the Data Engineering and Infrastructure org) is in the thick of enabling quasi experimentation across a variety of teams at Netflix. These range from geo based pricing experiments to Marketing tests that impact new customer acquisition as well as the viewing of specific titles. Marketing, in particular, with a budget of $2B for 2018, is a key driver of our global subscriber growth and is increasingly being used to improve the amount of viewing of titles via innovative techniques such as city and country level quasi-experiments.


We are looking for a UI engineer to help us build a fantastic UI experience to design, launch, monitor and analyze quasi tests in a simple and intuitive way. As a member of the core quasi-testing platform team, you will partner with various stakeholders to understand their use cases and help ensure that we deliver UI features which are easy to use, update and maintain. You will also get opportunities to collaborate with other teams within Netflix to leverage as well as influence the best practices for UI development.

  • You are an experienced UI engineer with knowledge of modern web applications (concepts like MVC and frameworks like React/Node.js) and front-end development (HTML/CSS/Javascript)

  • You have a strong software engineering mindset and are passionate about code quality, continuous integration, documentation and end-to-end testing of your applications

  • Communication is one of your key strengths - both written and verbal

    Come join the Quasi-Testing Platform team and help Netflix push the boundaries in this exciting new space.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Manager, Talent Relations - Events


Netflix is looking for a Manager of Talent Relations to join our expanding department and build the ultimate talent experience for our actor, directors, and producers. From David Fincher’s MINDHUNTER to stand-up icon Dave Chappelle, to David Ayer and Will Smith’s Bright to Bryan Fogel’s Icarus, we are looking for someone who has experience working with talent, rapidly consumes entertainment, and is passionate and curious about the growing global entertainment landscape. This person should be excited to grow Netflix into the best place for talent to work in our industry.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is a great opportunity to join a team that is building the largest Internet entertainment service  in the world, with a chance to work with the brightest filmmakers and actors around the world, using the latest technology.  


The Role
As a member of a seasoned group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, the Manager of Talent Relations will be responsible for creating invite lists for our talent driven premieres, driving talent strategy around executive honors and tributes, and organizing/facilitating ticketing for awards ceremonies for nominees and internal executives.  We want to be the premier entertainment industry destination for talent and as such, will work closely with our colleagues across content, marketing and communications, across all content programming genres, to establish best practices and innovate how we organize, prioritize and work with talent and their representatives.  As one of the first points of contact for talent and their reps within Netflix, this role will act as a brand and business ambassador, helping to ensure our talent become part of the fabric of their shows, films, and promotional efforts.  


The ideal candidate exhibits consistent sound judgement and maturity in business communications and decision making, even when faced with ambiguity.   He or she is polished, personable, a heightened listener, a real doer, adept at reading a room, and is able to multi-task and work efficiently, independently and with speed. They are not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that could mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from writing a strategy, creating lists, coordinating gifts, booking travel, or negotiating hair and make-up. They collaborate well with partners that range from content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. They aren’t timid about assessing their work when they are done to explore what they could have done differently or better.  A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style. They are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and question values inconsistent with our values and Netflix culture. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues.  Talent relations is not a 9 to 5 job and will require willingness to work evenings and on weekend.  International travel also required.


Qualifications
The successful candidate will have at 5-7 years of entertainment experience in an agency, studio, network, production or journalism setting. They have worked directly and successfully with talent have relationships with talent representatives.  The ideal candidate is high energy, motivated with strong relationship-building capabilities and a capacity to work in a very fast-paced environment.  BA/BS required.


To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


Creative
Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


Succinct Communicator
Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


A smart minimalist
Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.


Has a Point of View
An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


Pace
Moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


Integrity
Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


An Adult
Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


COMPENSATION
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.


REPORTING RELATIONSHIP
The Manager, Talent Relations reports to the Director of Talent Relations.
