text: Payments Coordinator - Original Film, Business & Legal Affairs
description: With over 100 Million subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. Netflix is in search of an experienced contracts coordinator to handle a wide array of responsibilities related to Netflix's original film initiative. The Original Film team is behind a range of exciting motion pictures including Okja directed by Bong Joon-Ho and starring Tilda Swinton, Jake Gyllenhaal, Paul Dano, Lily Collins and Bright, directed by David Ayer and starring Will Smith and Joel Edgerton.  This is a unique opportunity to be an important part of a growing Netflix initiative, and to help Netflix shape the future of film production and distribution, much the way it is doing for television. The Role: ​The Payments Coordinator will have a strong emphasis on organization and a high level of attention to detail.  You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills, you are quick-thinking, adaptable to change, able to juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time and are self-motivated. You must have the ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight time-frames in a fast-paced environment.  You will work closely with the Netflix Production Finance team, in addition to Labor Relations, Content Acquisition, and the show accountants.

At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment bringing moments of joy to 100+ million customers.  Our members need help from time to time and Netflix Customer Service (CS) Organization is here to help fix the problem and get our customers back to enjoying Netflix.


At Netflix CS, our goal is to create customer centric products that are simple, intuitive and create amazing experiences. We build products that are used by agents and end users, our customers. The UX designer will be part of CS Technology team and work closely with cross functional partners in customer service to understand their challenges and create solutions that address their needs.


About the Role:
As a UX designer for customer service, you will work on agent and customer facing products. You are versatile at creating web and mobile designs. You are creative, customer focused, passionate about solving customer problems and have disruptive ideas that push the boundaries in creating amazing customer experiences. In this role, you will work closely with a team of product managers, engineers and business stakeholders to build the next generation of customer service products.


About You:
You are curious, creative and have experience creating consumer-oriented UI designs.  You have a keen eye for visual design and are a great storyteller. You are highly adaptable and when faced with challenges, you become more creative, not less. You are execution oriented and bring projects from concept to completion, doing everything possible to ensure successful launches.


You have a can do attitude. You’re smart, confident and a skilled communicator who welcomes honest and candid feedback. You use data and AB tests to select the best design for our customers. You partner with PMs, engineers, content creators and CS stakeholders to deliver projects from concept to launch.

  • BA/BS in fine arts, graphic arts, human factors or equivalent experience.

  • A great portfolio that showcases deep visual and interaction design skills with an emphasis on simple and intuitive designs.
  • Ability to rapidly produce multiple UX/UI concepts.   
  • Strong communication skills to clearly articulate your concepts with rationale—and evangelize on their behalf.

  • A good sense of humor.

You will have the opportunity to influence what we build and how we build. We are looking for a top notch Javascript engineer, with well rounded experience using the latest technology stacks, like React and Node.js.

text: Senior Analytics Engineer, Growth and Marketing
description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over a billion hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 110 million members globally. Our data-driven culture allows us to continuously innovate and provide the best experience for our members. We are at the forefront of using advanced mathematical models and algorithms at scale to personalize the experience that every member has, and our scientists and engineers are constantly looking for new ways to improve the state of the art. Netflix data science is a unique combination of big data, algorithms, and entertainment: where else do you get to work on big data and win fourteen Emmys (four for technical achievement), two Golden Globes, and back-to-back Oscar nominations!The Growth and Marketing Science team, within the central Science & Analytics org, leads experimentation, analysis, and analytic tooling around the company’s biggest acquisition decisions in marketing.  In partnership with marketing and finance organizations, and engineering, the team has revolutionized how Netflix plans and optimizes for growth and engagement.  At the core, the team maintains a relentless focus rigor and causal / incrementality to test and learn into improved strategies and tactics.  The team is small and needs to expand to further innovate in data transparency, statistical context, and accelerate our industry-leading work on experimentation at scale in acquisition. In this role, you will have the opportunity to impact Netflix subscriber growth by leading and operationalizing a roadmap for data access, statistical rigor, and tooling.  You will help Netflix further revolutionize growth marketing.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Science and Analytics Senior Analytics Engineer, Growth and Marketing


Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over a billion hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 110 million members globally. Our data-driven culture allows us to continuously innovate and provide the best experience for our members. We are at the forefront of using advanced mathematical models and algorithms at scale to personalize the experience that every member has, and our scientists and engineers are constantly looking for new ways to improve the state of the art. Netflix data science is a unique combination of big data, algorithms, and entertainment: where else do you get to work on big data and win fourteen Emmys (four for technical achievement), two Golden Globes, and back-to-back Oscar nominations!


The Growth and Marketing Science team, within the central Science & Analytics org, leads experimentation, analysis, and analytic tooling around the company’s biggest acquisition decisions in marketing.  In partnership with marketing and finance organizations, and engineering, the team has revolutionized how Netflix plans and optimizes for growth and engagement.  At the core, the team maintains a relentless focus rigor and causal / incrementality to test and learn into improved strategies and tactics.  The team is small and needs to expand to further innovate in data transparency, statistical context, and accelerate our industry-leading work on experimentation at scale in acquisition.


In this role, you will have the opportunity to impact Netflix subscriber growth by leading and operationalizing a roadmap for data access, statistical rigor, and tooling.  You will help Netflix further revolutionize growth marketing.

  • Be a strategic partner to regional leaders to define high impact analytical problems, and to push against low impact descriptive summaries
  • Deliver insights from ad hoc analytic inquiries and models, and lead automation efforts to scale team impact
  • Drive innovation in high-visibility reports and dashboards that accelerate data transparency with innovative statistical context to ensure actionability
  • Build and innovate analytic tools to accelerate development and execution of causal research and experiments in partnership with other team members
  • Assess opportunities and seek impact through new data products
    • What you will do:
  • Possess and apply exceptional coding proficiency.  Expert in distributed database and query languages (SQL, Hive).  Proficient with R or Python (scientific libraries).  Other computing languages (Java/Scala/Spark) a plus.
  • Extensive statistical experience and training from an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline, and at least 5 years experience as an engineer operating in analytic settings, producing analyses and tools to guide business leaders
  • Passion for applying and innovating advanced methods to data access, data communication, and analytic modeling
  • High-energy self-starter with attention to detail and a passion for data
  • Strong communication skills coupled with business acumen. Must be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses, and analytic results into business and product recommendations.
  • Experience and interest in TV, entertainment, growth marketing, and machine learning a plus!
    • Who you are:


    You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way, working through interesting problems in an environment that encourages freedom, innovation, and risk taking.  Your co-workers will be driven to find and solve hard problems and will work with you to foster ever-higher performance. Our success is reinforced by our culture; check it out.

text: Manager, Global Creative Marketing, Anime - Japan
description: With 117 million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.  Originals anime content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of anime originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world.We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our Japan originals marketing campaigns for anime content. This team is based in our Tokyo office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, Tokyo, Mumbai, Amsterdam and Singapore, frequent international travel is a must.
search_text:
Tokyo, Japan Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Global Creative Marketing, Anime - Japan


With 117 million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.  


Originals anime content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of anime originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world.


We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our Japan originals marketing campaigns for anime content. This team is based in our Tokyo office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, Tokyo, Mumbai, Amsterdam and Singapore, frequent international travel is a must. 

  • You have a proven track record of building impactful, world-class 360 creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. 
  • You are a natural leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate creative ideas that people rally around.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, possess a high level of emotional IQ and intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and decision making skills in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing + innovation, and  strive to create impactful and effective visual storytelling on mobile, paid social, and all other mediums/platforms.
  • You love TV and film content and have deep knowledge of the anime industry and media trends both in Japan and globally. 
  • You are a connoisseur of trailers, key art and digital/social media and have solid experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 creative marketing campaigns. 
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are).
    • Who are you?
  • Play a key role in building strategy and creative campaigns (e.g. positioning, key art visuals, trailers & other AV assets, digital creative) for the launch of anime originals.
  • Partner closely with regional marketing teams to develop authentic campaigns that are built on regional insights and connect with local audiences. 
  • Write creative briefs to guide the global creative process and align internal marketing teams on goals and overall strategies. 
  • Project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning internal task force meetings and brainstorm sessions and external filmmaker kickoffs/presentations.
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external stakeholders/partners.
  • Participate in and/or lead lively debates and discussions as you communicate different facets of the campaign to filmmakers, talent and colleagues across the company. 
  • Collaborate with our world class product/engineering team to integrate our originals marketing campaigns within the member product experience. 

    • What will you do?
  • 5+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in entertainment (TV, film, gaming), global lifestyle brand or creative/advertising agency. 
  • Marketing experience in the anime industry or with anime content is preferred.
  • A history of team leadership and cross-functional collaboration with both internal and external partners. 
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp of marketing / media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • Fluency in English and Japanese is mandatory. 
  • Strong interpersonal, creative, presentation, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills

    • Qualifications:

search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure Senior Data Engineer, Marketing


Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We deliver over 140 million hours of TV shows and movies per day to 117 million members in over 190 countries. Marketing, with a budget of $2B for 2018, is a key driver of our global subscriber growth and is increasingly being used to improve the amount of viewing of various titles via innovative techniques such as city and country level experiments.


The Marketing Data Engineering team is in the middle of powering this data-driven transformation and is responsible for identifying, ingesting and integrating disparate data from internal and external sources. This data is used as features in ML models, for validation of AB and Quasi experiments, and for powering a variety of analytical dashboards to allow our Marketing and PR stakeholders to take decisions quickly and confidently.


As part of the Marketing DEI team you will play a critical role in creating reliable distributed data pipelines that power internal Marketing systems and also help measure the impact of those campaigns across a variety of advertising and social platforms. You will be working closely with product managers, analysts, data scientists and platform engineers to source, architect, design, develop and implement systems to process data.

  • You have a strong background in distributed data processing as well as software engineering design and data modeling concepts
  • You enjoy working with all sorts of data, big and small, and helping partners leverage it for business decision making
  • You are a well-rounded, top performer with strong communication skills who loves working with engineering and science partners
  • You are proficient in at least one major language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python). You strive to write beautiful code and you're comfortable working with and picking up new technologies
  • You are passionate about data quality, automation and documentation to empower your partners to make decisions by themselves
  • You can relate to many of the aspects of the Netflix Culture and love to operate independently while collaborating and giving/receiving strong, candid feedback to your team members.
    • Who are you:


    This position offers a unique opportunity to get exposure to multiple data platforms (GCP/AWS) and external systems for Marketing and Social data (e.g. DCM/FB/ADH/AA/Twitter). Some of the technologies used in our group include Spark/Hadoop, Scala, Python, Pig, SQL, SparkSQL, Hive, MySql and ElasticSearch.


    Come join the Marketing DEI team and be a part of this amazing industry leading transformation in Marketing.

Los Gatos, California Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Senior UI Engineer, Insight Engineering


Netflix is the world's leading Internet TV network.  We have more than 100 million members in virtually every country watching billions of hours of content a month; and we're just getting started!  


We don't just deal with huge scale, we deal with a huge diversity of scale.  We run thousands of applications on tens of thousands of servers.  We serve hundreds of thousands of TV shows and movies to millions of customers on thousands of device families, all of which are evolving daily.


The Insight Engineering group at Netflix builds systems providing real-time operational insight to hundreds of engineers, and everyone else who cares about our service, at Netflix.  Our UI engineers work directly with their customers and partners to understand their needs and collaboratively build great ways to look at our data and manage our systems.


As we continue to grow our product portfolio, we look to increase our ability to push the state of the art in useful, effective, user interfaces and cognitively obvious visualizations, and are looking to hire a UI engineer to join an already-formed, cohesive UI team. We're looking for someone who'll help us accelerate towards building a product that engineers love vs. another functional UI. This isn't just about more bandwidth -- rather, we want to hire someone who brings diversity of thought and approach that the team can learn and leverage from.

  • Have a strong background in front-end technologies, specifically HTML5, CSS, Javascript and at least one reasonably popular JavaScript framework (e.g. React, Polymer, Angular)
  • Have experience leading multiple initiatives for complex applications
  • Have a good understanding of effective UX
  • Be deeply interested in a long-term view and customer centric solutions
  • Have great verbal and written communication skills
  • Be self-led but highly aligned with your customers and teammates
    • We need you to ...
  • Be passionate about observability and monitoring or working with developer community in general.
  • Have some experience with data visualization and related tools like D3
  • Be knowledgeable about cloud computing platforms, such as Amazon Web Services
  • Be knowledgeable about Java and JVM-based languages.
    • We’d love you to ...


    Sharing Is Caring
    In this group, you'll have an opportunity to build UIs and UI frameworks that are cutting edge, highly usable, and foundational.  Because of Netflix's strong desire to contribute to open source technology and share technology and concepts, you'll be in the rare position of both working on this and speaking about it publicly, sharing this knowledge with your peers outside Netflix.  We think this is unique to Netflix, and if it sounds amazing to you … we should talk.

Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Production Digital Producer, Italy/Greece


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Operations at Netflix brings creative concepts and strategy to life at global scale through technical innovation.


We are looking for a Digital Producer to support centralized digital production of best-in-class marketing campaigns for the EMEA market. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the end-to-end digital production process of our EMEA campaign initiatives with a digital and social focus. This means that you thrive in environment that requires you to bridge project management and technical needs. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain. You have a keen ability to balance focus on delivery, excellent creative taste, operational challenges at scale and understanding how production plays into the broader strategic media context.


The Role
To support our continued global expansion and ongoing shift towards a greater digital marketing focus, we are looking for a Digital Producer to join our team. Based in Amsterdam and reporting to the Manager, Integrated Production Southern Europe & Middle-East, Turkey and Africa, this producer will join a team of integrated producers, digital producers, ad operations and campaign operations to run point on end to end digital production for our Originals campaigns.

  • Manage digital production and oversee delivery of assets, primary focus on dynamic display, rich media, online video, mobile and social creative types for Italy and Greece.
  • Lead communications during the production lifecycle to ensure that external agencies and internal stakeholders from Creative, Media, Production and EMEA/Global Marketing are aligned.
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines.
  • Integrate closely with internal Italy and Greece country teams and external trafficking teams to ensure that all tracking is implemented correctly, delivery deadlines are met, and executions are flawless.
  • Manage localization, production process and creative approvals of advertising materials in multiple languages (including clearances, delivery, trafficking, etc.)
  • Drive workflow efficiencies by identifying bottlenecks and instituting project management best practices to decrease operational lag.
    • Responsibilities include:
  • At least 5 years of experience, preferably at an entertainment brand, advertising or media agency with an emphasis on digital production including online and offline video, high impact display takeovers, rich media and paid social campaigns.
  • Knowledge of project management for marketing campaign and localization workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for both Video and Digital materials.
  • Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams.
  • Hands on experience working with Doubleclick and other 3rd party ad serving platforms, QA & trafficking processes and experience troubleshooting directly with local teams is a plus.
  • Knowledgeable of and familiar with leading digital production agencies in Italy and Greece.
  • Fluency in English and Italian (Greek is a plus.)

text: Head of Partner Marketing Creative - APAC
description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key to growth is our ability to work well with global partners across verticals. As we move beyond 100M members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, we are looking for talented individuals to drive better creative outcomes for our partnerships.Our partners range from MVPDs and Telcos to retailers, device and OS partners and include brands like Globe, LG, Samsung, Apple, Google, and more.  Working closely with the partner marketing team, and cross-functional creative and marketing leaders at Netflix, we are seeking a creative professional who can lead a team of individual contributors owning end to end creative strategy and service for these partners. The successful candidate will have deep experience building and implementing a strategic approach with clients and/or partners, and owning creative strategy. As partner facing creative strategists and gatekeepers for the brand, the person in this role and their team will ultimately be responsible for setting the creative strategy, ensuring business objectives are met and the narrative throughout the work reflects strategic intent.
search_text:
Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR Marketing Head of Partner Marketing Creative - APAC


It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key to growth is our ability to work well with global partners across verticals. As we move beyond 100M members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, we are looking for talented individuals to drive better creative outcomes for our partnerships.


Our partners range from MVPDs and Telcos to retailers, device and OS partners and include brands like Globe, LG, Samsung, Apple, Google, and more.  Working closely with the partner marketing team, and cross-functional creative and marketing leaders at Netflix, we are seeking a creative professional who can lead a team of individual contributors owning end to end creative strategy and service for these partners. The successful candidate will have deep experience building and implementing a strategic approach with clients and/or partners, and owning creative strategy. 


As partner facing creative strategists and gatekeepers for the brand, the person in this role and their team will ultimately be responsible for setting the creative strategy, ensuring business objectives are met and the narrative throughout the work reflects strategic intent.

  • Motivating partners to strive for inventive storytelling across their campaigns
  • Leading a team of strategic individual contributors working across numerous high priority partner campaigns while acting autonomously
  • Translating our brand/marketing requirements into ideas the partner and ultimately consumer easily understands
  • Introducing new partners and their agencies to the Netflix brand, creative guidelines and workflow
  • Extracting creative brief from partners and developing all creative briefs and campaign proposals 
  • Owning responsibility for Netflix brand positioning and representation / usage of Netflix and studio content in partner campaigns
  • Developing partner creative workshops that result in compelling campaigns that build title brands
  • Attending partner meetings with Partner Marketing leads to represent creative team to partners

  • Owning partner creative feedback loop and output
  • Owning and directing design, curation and delivery of Netflix-produced partner assets
  • Close collaboration with cross-functional teams including: Marketing Operations, Global Creative Marketing, Content Services, Public Relations & Social
  • Drive successful integration of broader creative content and brand initiatives at Netflix and our strategic partners

  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and drive results

  • High level of intellectual curiosity with the ability to demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity

  • A natural and deep affection for movies and television

description: At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment. We are the first truly global internet TV network and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want.  Our catalog is continually growing and this requires that our quality checks on the video, audio and text assets are able to scale up to meet these. The Opportunity:The Content Quality team’s charter is to build highly efficient workflow systems to manage all aspects of managing content quality. We work on applications and automation tools to ensure best in class quality for all video, audio and subtitle assets that go live on Netflix. We will be using both predictive models as well as computer aided models to identify potential issues in assets. Using these signals we will be leveraging human QC efforts to be more effective in identifying issues faster.You will have the opportunity to influence what we build and how we build. We are looking for an engineer who has a passion for building elegant scalable distributed applications to handle complex business scenarios.

Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Engineering Senior Software Engineer - Content Quality


At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment. We are the first truly global internet TV network and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want.  Our catalog is continually growing and this requires that our quality checks on the video, audio and text assets are able to scale up to meet these.


The Opportunity:
The Content Quality team’s charter is to build highly efficient workflow systems to manage all aspects of managing content quality. We work on applications and automation tools to ensure best in class quality for all video, audio and subtitle assets that go live on Netflix. We will be using both predictive models as well as computer aided models to identify potential issues in assets. Using these signals we will be leveraging human QC efforts to be more effective in identifying issues faster.


You will have the opportunity to influence what we build and how we build. We are looking for an engineer who has a passion for building elegant scalable distributed applications to handle complex business scenarios.

text: Senior Data Engineer, Content Data Engineering
description: Who are we?Netflix is the world's leading internet streaming service with over 100 million members in 190 countries.  Our members enjoy more than 125 million hours of streamed video per day, using over 1000 different types of devices, generating more than a third of downstream Internet traffic in North America.  The Content Data Engineering team is based in the entertainment capital of the world, focused on providing our colleagues rich data so that we can make decisions on what series and films will bring the most joy to our subscribers.  We are part of a larger team that supports Netflix’s data-driven culture across marketing, streaming, product, and finance functions.  As Netflix deepens its global reach and develops more and more amazing Originals content, the scope and impact of our team’s work in the content space is exploding.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure Senior Data Engineer, Content Data Engineering


Who are we?
Netflix is the world's leading internet streaming service with over 100 million members in 190 countries.  Our members enjoy more than 125 million hours of streamed video per day, using over 1000 different types of devices, generating more than a third of downstream Internet traffic in North America.  The Content Data Engineering team is based in the entertainment capital of the world, focused on providing our colleagues rich data so that we can make decisions on what series and films will bring the most joy to our subscribers.  We are part of a larger team that supports Netflix’s data-driven culture across marketing, streaming, product, and finance functions.  As Netflix deepens its global reach and develops more and more amazing Originals content, the scope and impact of our team’s work in the content space is exploding.

  • You are lazy in a productive way (find tedious work boring and would rather automate it).
  • You are charismatic, tenacious, curious, and industrious, and not just talented.
  • You thrive in a fast paced environment, and see yourself as a partner with the business with the shared goal of moving the business forward.
  • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it.
  • You create code that is understandable, simple, and clean, and take pride in its beauty.
  • You love freedom and hate being micromanaged. Given context, you're capable of self-direction.
  • You have a high tolerance for ambiguity and fast-changing contexts.
  • You are motivated to explore new technologies and learn, and can do so without taking formal education.
    • Who are you?
  • Fully own critical portions of Netflix' Content data model.  Collaborate with stakeholders to understand needs, model tables using data warehouse best practices, and develop data pipelines to ensure the timely delivery of high quality data.
  • Continually acquire new data sources to develop an increasingly rich dataset that characterizes content.  This dataset will be the foundation for many strategic uses cases from multiple teams.
  • Creatively explore how to use data to continually add value to Netflix.  Translate data questions into flexible methodologies that scale to answer broad problems across the organization.
  • Be a bridge between data engineering and the business, enabling insight that can empower better decision-making.
  • Be comfortable outside of your comfort zone - explore new tech, make your own tool, or find a new way to address an old problem.
    • What will you do?
  • Data warehouse data modeling and data transformation.
  • How to write complex SQL in your sleep.
  • "Big Data" tech - Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, etc.  Significant experience with other ETL tech (Informatica, SSIS, etc) is very valuable, but expect to work in a "Big Data" environment.
  • MPP data warehouse solutions (Redshift, Vertica, Teradata, Greenplum, etc).
  • Python for scripting and automation.
  • Education: Surprise us.
    • What do you know? (not a rigid litmus test)


    A few more things to know:
    Netflix offers amazing co-workers, new technology, fascinating analytical and technical challenges, and a Freedom & Responsibility Culture that's truly unique. It’s worth learning more: http://jobs.netflix.com/culture

description: With over 117 million members worldwide, growing our teams to meet the demands of our expanding business is critical to Netflix’s success and goal of changing the way global audiences consume entertainment. The Talent Acquisition (TA) team plays a key partnership role to our business partners, as they continue to seek world-class professionals for each and every open position. Netflix is looking for a Sourcer to partner with TA team members in support of hiring needs within our Engineering organizations.  The ideal candidate comes to us with mid-level experience in TA and/or HR, along with a passion for finding, engaging and evaluating great talent across a number of functional disciplines.  In this role, you’ll review and evaluate external applicants and referrals to assess potential role and culture fit. To do this effectively, you’ll partner with TA team colleagues to gain a deep, holistic understanding of our business and assigned role(s). Building strong and lasting relationships with colleagues and candidates is key, so you’ll possess a natural ability to communicate and collaborate effectively. Over time, as you get up to speed, we expect you’ll use your knowledge of various roles and teams to identify potential candidates across multiple Engineering disciplines, creating a robust pipeline of talent for both current and future openings.

Netflix is looking for a Sourcer to partner with TA team members in support of hiring needs within our Engineering organizations.  The ideal candidate comes to us with mid-level experience in TA and/or HR, along with a passion for finding, engaging and evaluating great talent across a number of functional disciplines.  


In this role, you’ll review and evaluate external applicants and referrals to assess potential role and culture fit. To do this effectively, you’ll partner with TA team colleagues to gain a deep, holistic understanding of our business and assigned role(s). Building strong and lasting relationships with colleagues and candidates is key, so you’ll possess a natural ability to communicate and collaborate effectively. Over time, as you get up to speed, we expect you’ll use your knowledge of various roles and teams to identify potential candidates across multiple Engineering disciplines, creating a robust pipeline of talent for both current and future openings.  

  • 5+ years’ experience in TA/recruiting, HR, or related field
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
  • Experience in-house or staffing agency environment
  • Prior experience evaluating Software Engineering roles and functions
  • Prior candidate sourcing/screening/interview experience

  • Strong intellectual curiosity and a desire to deeply understand the business and assigned roles
  • Strong organizational skills and keen attention to detail
  • Flexible, resourceful, with a bias to action and willingness to do what is needed to get great work done
  • Ability to identify commonalities in desired profiles among disparate roles and/or teams, to optimize candidate pipelines
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
  • A natural inclination to work within a culture that is fast-paced, dynamic, and especially, autonomous
  • Prior work experience with Google (G Suite) enterprise applications; prior ATS and/or HRIS experience is a strong plus

description: The Creative Marketing Infrastructure (CMI) team's mission is to bring promotional concepts to life at global scale through technological innovation. We are looking for a Manager of Infrastructure to work within our Marketing Operations team to build best-in-class applications. This role is unique as it merges operations expertise with technology development. In this position, you will drive ideation of multiple marketing technology initiatives and work with the product and engineering teams to build innovative in-house tools.The ideal candidate will have a passion for operations and strong analytical abilities. If you love solving complex problems and have a proven track record of building and implementing tools for scale, this is the job for you.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Manager Of Infrastructure


The Creative Marketing Infrastructure (CMI) team's mission is to bring promotional concepts to life at global scale through technological innovation. We are looking for a Manager of Infrastructure to work within our Marketing Operations team to build best-in-class applications. This role is unique as it merges operations expertise with technology development. In this position, you will drive ideation of multiple marketing technology initiatives and work with the product and engineering teams to build innovative in-house tools.
The ideal candidate will have a passion for operations and strong analytical abilities. If you love solving complex problems and have a proven track record of building and implementing tools for scale, this is the job for you.

  • Research and define current production and operational workflows and translate those workflows into market requirements.
  • Analyze, define, and prioritize business needs by partnering with end users and Marketing leadership
  • Partner with our engineering teams to review wire frames, test software, give feedback, and launch products
  • Drive tactical adoption and evaluation of applications. Drive awareness and adoption of new tools with the global operations team.
  • Provide regular updates to marketing leadership regarding program progress and major milestones.
    • RESPONSIBILITIES
  • 7+ years of advertising operations or post-production experience.
  • Experiencing working with engineering teams to build and implement technology products.
  • You have experience building tools for scale.
  • You have a strong analytical mind and can translate needs of creatives to engineers and product managers.
  • You understand the technologies, systems and tasks involved in advertising and marketing campaign execution.
  • Experience and passion for software implementation, change management and developing automation technologies.
  • Strong ability to dive into the unknown and create clarity amid ambiguity.
  • Sharp assessment skills with an ability to vet wants vs. needs.
  • Flexible amid an ever-changing and growing environment.
    • REQUIREMENTS

description: As Netflix continues to grow, the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) team is looking for a talented Manager to be the data and strategy partner to our creative marketing team.  Netflix derives a significant competitive advantage from the analytical approach it takes to managing all aspects of the business, and this is equally applicable to global marketing efforts. This position will partner closely with marketing leadership to determine how to best combine data-driven strategy with creative expertise to drive strong results for our shows and our brand.In this role, you will need to be a self-starter with tremendous skill in communicating with cross-functional partners who have different backgrounds, levels, and experiences.  A successful candidate will be able to manage complex workstreams that involve multiple stakeholders and build strong relationships across teams.The position is based in our Los Angeles office and reports into the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) group.  The key stakeholders for this role outside of MP&A are the Global Creative Marketing team and our Marketing Operations team.  Jointly, these teams develop all marketing assets used to advertise Netflix shows globally (e.g. trailers, billboards, tv spots, digital ads, etc).
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Marketing Planning & Analysis


As Netflix continues to grow, the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) team is looking for a talented Manager to be the data and strategy partner to our creative marketing team.  Netflix derives a significant competitive advantage from the analytical approach it takes to managing all aspects of the business, and this is equally applicable to global marketing efforts. This position will partner closely with marketing leadership to determine how to best combine data-driven strategy with creative expertise to drive strong results for our shows and our brand.


In this role, you will need to be a self-starter with tremendous skill in communicating with cross-functional partners who have different backgrounds, levels, and experiences.  A successful candidate will be able to manage complex workstreams that involve multiple stakeholders and build strong relationships across teams.


The position is based in our Los Angeles office and reports into the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) group.  The key stakeholders for this role outside of MP&A are the Global Creative Marketing team and our Marketing Operations team.  Jointly, these teams develop all marketing assets used to advertise Netflix shows globally (e.g. trailers, billboards, tv spots, digital ads, etc).

  • Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Translating complicated analyses into actionable insights for non-technical business partners; developing trusted relationships with Netflix marketing leaders.
  • Facilitating our efforts to test which types of marketing messages, formats (e.g. video ad vs. display ad), ad types, and earned media formats work best to drive growth through customer acquisition and engagement.
  • Identifying potential opportunities to improve marketing outcomes and efficiency and developing the analysis needed to review and discuss those opportunities with leadership teams.
  • Developing key metrics.  How should we measure the value of our marketing assets in comparison to what it costs to produce them?  How can we ensure more efficient and effective campaigns going forward?
  • Defining the data and information that needs to be captured to measure efficiency and effectiveness, and working with our technical teams to guide the development of internal tools that capture that data.
  • Operating as the marketing stakeholder to our data science team, helping to guide our efforts to predict show performance and use those predictions to set marketing budgets and priorities.
  • Creating thoughtful recommendations based on both data and input from the creative marketing teams and guiding the implementation of those recommendations.
    • RESPONSIBILITIES
  • A successful candidate will have a strong track record of identifying key questions, defining analysis needs, performing and coordinating analysis, and communicating findings in a clear and concise way.
  • Must have 5-7 years of experience in a highly analytical environment.  E.g. corporate strategy, planning and/or analysis, management consulting, investment banking or similarly analytical environment.  Analytical experience combined with entertainment, marketing, or product management experience is a plus.
  • Excellent Excel skills and a proven track record with complex problem solving.
  • Demonstrated history managing projects involving a large number of partners and experience working in cross-functional teams.  Comfortable with ambiguity and able to frame up key questions and the analyses needed to answer them.
  • Strong talent for crafting and presenting data driven analyses and insights to stakeholders of all levels and backgrounds.  Ability to translate data analysis into a coherent story and actionable recommendation.
  • MBA preferred, though not required.
    • QUALIFICATIONS

text: Senior Marketing Manager - Spain and Portugal
description: It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. Netflix has grown to over 117 million members globally. That's where you come in.We are looking for a Senior Marketing Manager to help us grow our business in Portugal and Spain. Someone who has experience building engaging and efficient marketing campaigns and driving WoM and love for a passion brand. We’re also looking for a professional who values entrepreneurial work environments and a ‘freedom and responsibility' culture.The Senior Marketing Manager will report to the Director of Marketing, Spain & Portugal and will oversee Netflix Originals campaign activations across the two countries. Working closely with counterparts in PR and social and other international marketing peers, you will be a strong consumer voice for the Netflix content in Portugal and Spain and the local culture expert for the cross-functional team.If you're a passionate entertainment or brand marketer with demonstrated experience in launching amazing marketing campaigns in Portugal and Spain, we'd like to hear from you.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Senior Marketing Manager - Spain and Portugal


It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. Netflix has grown to over 117 million members globally. That's where you come in.


We are looking for a Senior Marketing Manager to help us grow our business in Portugal and Spain. Someone who has experience building engaging and efficient marketing campaigns and driving WoM and love for a passion brand. We’re also looking for a professional who values entrepreneurial work environments and a ‘freedom and responsibility' culture.


The Senior Marketing Manager will report to the Director of Marketing, Spain & Portugal and will oversee Netflix Originals campaign activations across the two countries. Working closely with counterparts in PR and social and other international marketing peers, you will be a strong consumer voice for the Netflix content in Portugal and Spain and the local culture expert for the cross-functional team.


If you're a passionate entertainment or brand marketer with demonstrated experience in launching amazing marketing campaigns in Portugal and Spain, we'd like to hear from you.

  • Marketing strategy. You will work on the launch strategy for key title launches in Portugal and Spain together with the Marketing and Social team.
  • Campaign management. You will launch unique campaigns for our Netflix Originals that set new standards for entertainment marketing and drive significant word of mouth and engagement from our users. For that matter, you will work close with creative and media agencies and advertising partners in Portugal in order to find the right media, placements and ad formats for our campaigns.
  • Campaign analysis. You will be responsible for the analysis of our campaigns and will work with our partners to optimize them. Your findings and learnings will be key to improve Netflix’s performance as an entertainment brand in Spain and Portugal.
  • Cultural ambassador. You will be critical to help Netflix understand the Portuguese consumers while also living and embracing the Netflix culture.
    • Key responsibilities:
  • Digital expertise. We are looking for someone that understands digital marketing (display, rich media, VOD, direct video, mobile, paid social…) and has demonstrated experience launching and managing unique digital campaigns for entertainment, from ideation and media planning to  optimization and performance analysis.
  • Marketing know-how. We are looking for someone that understands consumer marketing –preferably in the entertainment space– and how not only build strategy but also execute flawlessly.
  • Bias for action. With the right context, we expect you to act autonomously and take decisions on the different marketing activations in the market.
  • Depth of knowledge. At least 5-7 years of marketing experience in the entertainment industry. Creative agency management and media development experience is a plus.
  • Concise and clear communication. We are looking for a native Portuguese and fluent English speaker with excellent communication skills, who is also confident working with senior leadership teams. Spanish is a plus.
    • Experience/Skills:

description: The Globalization team is responsible for translation and cultural adaptation of most things Netflix creates, from beautiful user interfaces to cinematic original programming. We treat each country we enter differently, since it is not just about translation, it is about providing our audience with an experience that feels local, and we do it at scale. Our team is looking for an experienced Regional Language Manager to manage the localization strategy and resources for several Eastern European languages, from our hub in Amsterdam. This highly motivated individual will report into the leadership team based in California and work closely with the rest of the Globalization team in the US, Europe and Asia.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Global Product Creative Globalization Regional Language Manager


The Globalization team is responsible for translation and cultural adaptation of most things Netflix creates, from beautiful user interfaces to cinematic original programming. We treat each country we enter differently, since it is not just about translation, it is about providing our audience with an experience that feels local, and we do it at scale.


Our team is looking for an experienced Regional Language Manager to manage the localization strategy and resources for several Eastern European languages, from our hub in Amsterdam. This highly motivated individual will report into the leadership team based in California and work closely with the rest of the Globalization team in the US, Europe and Asia.

  • Provide cultural & linguistic consultancy, localization advocacy, and influence other teams at Netflix (in the US and in region) in order to deliver the best possible user experience to our EE members.
  • Gain deep product knowledge and awareness of product data for the EE region and define quality expectations through research and A/B testing.
  • Work closely with our vendors’ Language Leads to define and monitor quality standards for each language in your region.
  • Develop a language strategy, using localization vendors and freelance resources, by building, training and maintaining translation and review teams for each of the languages/markets supported.
  • Define linguistic standards across the whole localized user experience, including supporting the development of style guides, glossaries, tone and voice of Netflix product in the region.
  • Work closely with the cross functional Globalization teams to anticipate, identify and fix linguistic and product issues related to your region.
  • Provide creative input in adapting content linked to high priority Netflix titles, in close partnership with the regional Marketing teams.
  • Focus on regional product initiatives and customizations, increasing the level of engagement with internal and regional stakeholders to create an optimized and consistent local user experience and ecosystem for our international members.
  • Facilitate collaboration between internal stakeholders and Vendor Leads and teams, making sure the necessary resources have access to the relevant information, and advising on best course of action regarding localization processes.
    • RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Experience in language or localization resource management.
  • Native knowledge of one of the languages they manage is a plus, but not a hard requirement.
  • Linguist by training or the ability/experience to identify language patterns and address linguistic issues beyond one language.
  • Strong business acumen and proven stakeholder management skills.
  • Marketing and PR translation experience, with the right mix of linguistic skills in one of the following languages:  Russian (preferred), Polish (preferred), Czech or Hungarian.
  • Experience in creative writing and media/journalism a plus.
  • Deep understanding of localization specificities and pitfalls.
  • Knowledge of the movie/entertainment industry in the Eastern European region, and more specifically in Poland, the Czech Republic or Hungary.
  • Knowledge of industry CAT tools, as well as translation and terminology tools.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Excellent presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to show initiative and work independently.
    • SKILLS REQUIRED

text: Senior Software Engineer - Content Discovery and Personalization
description: The Content Discovery and Personalization team enables Netflix’s discovery experience across all device platforms, supports innovation via A/B testing and helps boost member engagement with titles by personalizing assets like images and title metadata.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Senior Software Engineer - Content Discovery and Personalization


The Content Discovery and Personalization team enables Netflix’s discovery experience across all device platforms, supports innovation via A/B testing and helps boost member engagement with titles by personalizing assets like images and title metadata.

  • Systems that support the browse experience on Netflix - ex, assemble and deliver personalized content in real time for the home page and categories, and enable a responsive app experience via caching. You will have the opportunity to work directly on member facing features and A/B tests(“I made your Continue Watching row update in real time!”)
  • Systems that leverage explore/exploit strategies to personalize and find the best assets and metadata - images, video trailers, synopses, episode ordering, badging - to help members evaluate and engage with titles. Architecting a system that enables exploring over many different asset types is our next challenge!
  • Systems that detect changes in recommendations and notify devices in real time allowing devices to perform updates and maintain freshness of data
  • High throughput, highly resilient systems that are constantly evolving to support the next set of A/B tests
    • As a member of this team, you will design, implement and support:
  • A culture that is unique and built on the idea of Freedom and Responsibility. Our culture is all about context over control, minimal process and loosely coupled but highly aligned teams. Read more about our values here.
  • We foster an environment where your work and passion for the product can move the business in a meaningful way.
  • As a company, we continue to thrill more than 100 million subscribers across the globe, on 1900 device types whose streaming accounts for more than a third of the internet’s downstream traffic during peak hours in North America!
    • Why Netflix?
  • 5+ years experience in Java
  • Experience with large scale distributed systems
  • Passion for quality and reliability
  • Strong communication skills
  • A drive for excellence in highly cross-functional environment
  • Ability to work in all phases of the development lifecycle (design, implementation, deployment and support)
    • What we are looking from in you:
  • Experience operating services in AWS or other cloud providers
  • Experience with explore/exploit or personalization systems

search_text:
New York, New York Content Production Tech Ops Specialist, Production Operations (NY)


As a Tech Ops Specialist at Netflix, you will be responsible for providing exceptional support to our production accountants and growing productions in our New York based studio. We want to empower the production landscape, utilizing never-before-seen streamlined, efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.  We’re looking for TECH OPS SPECIALISTS willing to pioneer the advancement of technology into Netflix productions. This requires extreme flexibility, unending creativity and a proactive approach to transforming the production culture.  You will serve as a liaison between Netflix teams and the productions to assist in infusing technology and gaining proper adoption of our in-house technology solutions.  This role operates within the system deployment side of Production Operations, part of the Netflix Production team. Tech Ops Specialists will report to the Manager of Production Technology.


The Tech Ops Specialist will be an ambassador of Netflix production technology. He/She will embody the passion for transformation and workflow advancements utilizing brand new creative technologies. This role will be a point of contact for technology support for our productions with expertise in how productions utilize software now and in the future. The Tech Ops Specialist is one part production, one part cloud-based software, and one part hardware infrastructure. He/She must have a working knowledge of current web-based software trends, both within entertainment and outside of entertainment. He/She will assess technical infrastructure needs for production build-outs (stages and offices) and provide hardware via internal resources and external vendors. Passion for change and creative thinking is a must.




Responsibilities


Production Technology POC
• Act as the primary technical point of contact and develop personal relationships related to the advancement of technology with our productions.
• Work within production security guidelines to encourage safe collaboration of Netflix production data.
Product
• Create a feedback loop for production tools in order to develop a mastery of production software and the workflows.
Training
• Production specific G-Suite training.
• Build training material: devise creative, unique, and scalable training solutions and support techniques for our production personnel.
Support
• Single POC for production technology needs: support requests will come in via tickets, emails, phone calls and automated alerts.
• As technology develops, operationalize support models and generate run-book plans for remote support.
• Work hand-in-hand with NERDS remote support and DevOps engineering support via support escalation models.
IT
• IT support for the production accountants
• Own the automation of the on-premise hardware requests (i.e. vending machines)
• Build out IT technology needs for new stages
• Administration for G-Suite and internal technology solutions on top of the Google platform.
• IT equipment procurement and delivery: Imaging machines, maintaining stock, configuring and troubleshooting printers and scanners and equipment deliveries.
• Refine all methods of hardware selection, inventory management and IT vendor relations by partnering with NERDS and Purchasing.
Production Office Build-Outs
• Partner with productions, Systems Management, Network Infrastructure, and A/V on assessing and delivering on technical infrastructure needs.
• Deploy production office technology (computers, printers, AV, applications, wireless) to our productions.
• Partner with third party sources vendors when applicable.


Requirements


Entertainment Industry Experience
• 5-10+ years within entertainment production technology including experience with production office applications (Scenechronize, Final Draft, Office, etc.)
• Keen understanding of current production, post, vfx, prod accounting workflows and how technology is used (and will be used in future) and a knowledge of production/post production infrastructure requirements.
IT
• A minimum of 3 years of IT or Desktop Support/System Administration
• Familiarity with fundamental networking/distributed computing environment concepts; local and network based user and group accounts and permissions
• Knowledge of imaging and sys mgmt software including Landesk and Jamf
• Experience supporting Cloud and SaaS Applications and SSO: G-Suite including Gmail, Calendaring, Drive, Sites, and Groups and AWS.
• In depth knowledge of and the ability to perform advanced troubleshooting on Mac OS, Windows 7,8 & 10, and various applications including Office and Adobe software
• Solid working knowledge of Mac and Lenovo hardware including laptops & desktops
• Mobile device support including iPhone, Android, Windows


Nice to Have
• Ability to learn new technologies quickly and with minimal guidance.
• Thrives on technical challenges and takes pride in solving them.
• Strategic thinking both technically and business-wise.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision; must be a self-motivated self-starter that can initiate ideas.
• Strong ability to dive into the unknown and create clarity amid chaos.
• Experience with supporting people remotely.
• Flexible amid an ever-changing and growing environment.
• Working knowledge of Google Apps Script or other scripting languages a big plus.

description: Netflix seeks an experienced paralegal or lawyer for a BA/Legal coordinator role with responsibility for a wide array of matters related to Netflix's original and licensed ”unscripted” and “reality” series and specials. The successful candidate will work with the company's Unscripted team in many facets of business and legal affairs support, including coordination among internal Netflix teams; creating and maintaining season option tracking systems and procedures; drafting and reviewing production-related agreements necessary to develop and produce the company's slate of original titles; and helping to prepare agreements related to the licensing of content. This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to grow within Netflix to help shape the future of entertainment. The Unscripted team at Netflix is small but growing and focused on building a slate of unique and high-quality titles.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Legal Content Legal and Business Affairs Unscripted Production Paralegal/Coordinator


Netflix seeks an experienced paralegal or lawyer for a BA/Legal coordinator role with responsibility for a wide array of matters related to Netflix's original and licensed ”unscripted” and “reality” series and specials. The successful candidate will work with the company's Unscripted team in many facets of business and legal affairs support, including coordination among internal Netflix teams; creating and maintaining season option tracking systems and procedures; drafting and reviewing production-related agreements necessary to develop and produce the company's slate of original titles; and helping to prepare agreements related to the licensing of content. This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to grow within Netflix to help shape the future of entertainment. The Unscripted team at Netflix is small but growing and focused on building a slate of unique and high-quality titles.

  • At least 3+ years of experience in a business and/or legal affairs setting, managing legal agreements in television or film, including some drafting and reviewing of those agreements (or if an attorney, 2+ years transactional experience in a law firm or a production company, studio or network);
  • Maintaining flexibility and openness to take on additional projects as necessary or assigned;
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment;
  • High level of organization, detail orientation and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines;
  • Fluency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and the Google Suite;
  • Highly collaborative, resourceful, quick thinking, and curious; staying calm under pressure;
  • Positive attitude curious and ability to respond positively to change and be respectful of new ideas;
  • Demonstrates good judgment, strong critical thinking skills and the desire and willingness to take ownership and control of complex projects;
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally, think practically and be solution-oriented; and
  • JD and knowledge of the evolving and international media landscape is a plus but not required.
    • Requirements:
  • Handling and coordinating signatures (both externally and internally) and entering signed agreements into digital document tracking system;
  • Creating, updating and tracking deal terms;
  • Creating and maintaining option tracking systems; drafting and issuing option pick up notices;
  • Managing and updating all form agreements and deal summaries, as well as various dashboards, and document management systems;
  • Coordinating with the Unscripted team on projects, priorities, and production schedules;
  • Capturing and condensing notes from meetings with various business and legal affairs partners;
  • Coordination among internal Netflix teams with respect to various issues including chain of title, rights management, legal deliverables, marketing restrictions, talent approvals and payment and finance;
  • Drafting, reviewing and redlining various 3rd party agreements as needed under the supervision of counsel (e.g. license agreements, co-production agreements, production services agreements, and above the line and below the line agreements);
  • Review third-party production packets and agreements (including participant releases, location agreements, access agreements, materials releases, casting notices);
  • Negotiate production agreements (with attorney supervision); and
  • Providing internal support for various dashboards and production and management systems and providing training to new team hires.
    • Duties include:

description: At Netflix, we focus on tailoring our service to the local tastes and preferences of our members throughout the world. In 2017, Netflix spent billions of dollars on acquiring and programming TV shows and movies in every window for every taste -- from brand new, never-before-seen Originals to timeless classics that are watched over and over again. In order to build the best entertainment service in the world, we look for the best and brightest to drive the analytics for strategic business decisions. Netflix operates a financially complex business and believes that it derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing the company.The Content Strategy & Analysis team is looking for a Manager to lead Strategic and Financial Analysis for content across our EMEA footprint. Working closely with the Business Affairs and Creative teams, the team is primarily responsible for deal valuation, greenlight models, programming strategy and analytics, competitive analysis and user behavioral analysis. This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior management within the organization. Senior leadership depends heavily on the Content Strategy & Analysis group to accurately model and forecast the business as well as lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform important business decisions.This role will reside in Netflix's Amsterdam office.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Content Strategy & Analysis - EMEA


At Netflix, we focus on tailoring our service to the local tastes and preferences of our members throughout the world. In 2017, Netflix spent billions of dollars on acquiring and programming TV shows and movies in every window for every taste -- from brand new, never-before-seen Originals to timeless classics that are watched over and over again. In order to build the best entertainment service in the world, we look for the best and brightest to drive the analytics for strategic business decisions. Netflix operates a financially complex business and believes that it derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing the company.


The Content Strategy & Analysis team is looking for a Manager to lead Strategic and Financial Analysis for content across our EMEA footprint. Working closely with the Business Affairs and Creative teams, the team is primarily responsible for deal valuation, greenlight models, programming strategy and analytics, competitive analysis and user behavioral analysis. 


This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior management within the organization. Senior leadership depends heavily on the Content Strategy & Analysis group to accurately model and forecast the business as well as lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform important business decisions.


This role will reside in Netflix's Amsterdam office.

  • Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects (i.e., greenlight models) in partnership with the EMEA Creative, Business Affairs and Content Acquisition teams.
  • Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators.
  • Develop deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities.
  • Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders.
  • Develop and manage associate(s) on the team: establish priorities, set objectives, and provide guidance and feedback.
    • RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • 6-9 years of experience in finance, strategy, and/or consulting roles. For candidates with MBAs, typically we would look at candidates with 1-3 years post-MBA experience.
  • Expertise in the EMEA content industry (preferably UK, having worked in a studio, production company, agency, distributor) is a plus though not required.
  • Strong communication/presentation skills with track record of presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management clearly and concisely.
  • Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis.
  • The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. He or she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. The ideal candidate would be prepared to regularly "roll up their sleeves" to perform more routine tasks in the same day that they are asked to prepare analysis and a presentation to the executives of the company. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, and be able to work effectively autonomously.
  • Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages.
  • Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. MBA a plus but not required.
    • QUALIFICATIONS:
