description: The OpportunityFueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries.This is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading promotional campaigns for such a fast growing and highly admired company, with a chance to strategize, plan and execute events alongside a team that is working on series that feature high production value from the brightest filmmakers and actors in the industry, using the latest technology. The opportunity also extends into support of television and film award campaigns.The RoleThe Manager for Events - Korea will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing events for series and films teams. They are a member of a small, seasoned group of professionals, who will be based in our Singapore office & managing the Korean Market for Netflix Events.The Manager will work alongside the team that is helping to create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for series, meaning that he/she will have to be in sync and show a curiosity about promotional efforts and contribute to improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas. The ideal candidate has worked handling events for film, TV or entertainment brands within Korea. If they also have experience working in film or television awards campaigns, that’s a bonus and if they don’t, they are quick studies and are ready to hit the ground running to contribute to this important facet of our business. He/she will be able to communicate with local filmmakers, talent representatives, agencies, executives and production partners on efforts. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because domestic and international travel is a requirement.  They are also open to working in other APAC markets as needed.She/he is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. He/she can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer. They are organized, thorough and not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that will mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from hiring an agency to plan an event, to maintaining and updating guest lists, to booking a venue themselves for an event or to working a check-in table. We are a small team, so the responsibility is wide-ranging. They collaborate well with partners that range from the publicists overseeing global strategy to content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and questions values inconsistent with our values.  Experience working in the Korean Market at an agency, studio, network, venue or with a brand is preferred.  QualificationsThe successful candidate for Manager, Korea Events will have at least 6+ years of event experience organizing, planning, executing and staffing events.  All candidates must be fluent in English and Korean.Reporting RelationshipThe Manager, Korea Events reports will report to the Director, Events APAC.
search_text:
Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR PR Manager, Events - Korea


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries.


This is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading promotional campaigns for such a fast growing and highly admired company, with a chance to strategize, plan and execute events alongside a team that is working on series that feature high production value from the brightest filmmakers and actors in the industry, using the latest technology. The opportunity also extends into support of television and film award campaigns.


The Role
The Manager for Events - Korea will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing events for series and films teams. They are a member of a small, seasoned group of professionals, who will be based in our Singapore office & managing the Korean Market for Netflix Events.


The Manager will work alongside the team that is helping to create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for series, meaning that he/she will have to be in sync and show a curiosity about promotional efforts and contribute to improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas. The ideal candidate has worked handling events for film, TV or entertainment brands within Korea. If they also have experience working in film or television awards campaigns, that’s a bonus and if they don’t, they are quick studies and are ready to hit the ground running to contribute to this important facet of our business. He/she will be able to communicate with local filmmakers, talent representatives, agencies, executives and production partners on efforts. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because domestic and international travel is a requirement.  They are also open to working in other APAC markets as needed.


She/he is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. He/she can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer. They are organized, thorough and not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that will mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from hiring an agency to plan an event, to maintaining and updating guest lists, to booking a venue themselves for an event or to working a check-in table. We are a small team, so the responsibility is wide-ranging. They collaborate well with partners that range from the publicists overseeing global strategy to content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and questions values inconsistent with our values.  


Experience working in the Korean Market at an agency, studio, network, venue or with a brand is preferred.  


Qualifications
The successful candidate for Manager, Korea Events will have at least 6+ years of event experience organizing, planning, executing and staffing events.  All candidates must be fluent in English and Korean.


Reporting Relationship
The Manager, Korea Events reports will report to the Director, Events APAC.

text: Business Development Manager - North Asia (Korean Speaker)
description: About NetflixNetflix is a global Internet TV network that offers movies and TV series, commercial-free, to users who pay a monthly subscription, and choose how, when and where to watch. We produce award-winning original content and build cutting-edge streaming technology, allowing global stories to travel to users across the world. Over 117 million users in over 190 countries, stream 140 million hours of content - every day - on Netflix. In 2017, Netflix invested $6 billion in content globally. Since launching globally in 2016, our content library has doubled to include the best of Western entertainment, as well as high-quality Asian content. We have also added features that consumers love, such as mobile downloads. More than anything else, Netflix’s culture is about getting to work with extraordinarily talented people, in an impactful environment.About this roleNetflix has built a number of partnerships with companies, from mobile and fixed line network operators to CE device manufacturers and distributors, that help us deliver this service around the world. These partnerships have been instrumental in accelerating Netflix’s global growth story. The Business Development team is responsible for leading these partnerships, working closely with colleagues across Netflix to deliver efficient and effective outcomes for Netflix and our partners.As Netflix continues to grow we are looking to hire a new Business Development Manager who will be responsible for developing partnerships so that customers can sign up for and watch Netflix through many different screens and services. Many of these relationships are in place and the role will have a focus on strengthening and developing these partnerships for the longer term, as well as seeking new partnership opportunities. We are looking for a stand out Business Development professional with 5+ years of experience, who is passionate about Internet TV and has a fantastic track record in building high value, long lasting, international partnerships The role will focus on (i) partnerships with ISPs, MNOs and MVPDs in North Asia (S.Korea, Hong Kong, and Taiwan) and (ii) regional relationships with Consumer Electronic and Mobile OEM partners. The role will drive partnerships from a commercial basis, and will work closely with colleagues in Product and Marketing both in Asia and the US to find the optimal ways of working with partners balancing between global, regional and country level.The role will report into the Director, Business Development, North Asia.
search_text:
Singapore, Singapore Business Development Business Development Business Development Manager - North Asia (Korean Speaker)


About Netflix
Netflix is a global Internet TV network that offers movies and TV series, commercial-free, to users who pay a monthly subscription, and choose how, when and where to watch. We produce award-winning original content and build cutting-edge streaming technology, allowing global stories to travel to users across the world. Over 117 million users in over 190 countries, stream 140 million hours of content - every day - on Netflix.


In 2017, Netflix invested $6 billion in content globally. Since launching globally in 2016, our content library has doubled to include the best of Western entertainment, as well as high-quality Asian content. We have also added features that consumers love, such as mobile downloads. More than anything else, Netflix’s culture is about getting to work with extraordinarily talented people, in an impactful environment.




About this role
Netflix has built a number of partnerships with companies, from mobile and fixed line network operators to CE device manufacturers and distributors, that help us deliver this service around the world. These partnerships have been instrumental in accelerating Netflix’s global growth story. The Business Development team is responsible for leading these partnerships, working closely with colleagues across Netflix to deliver efficient and effective outcomes for Netflix and our partners.


As Netflix continues to grow we are looking to hire a new Business Development Manager who will be responsible for developing partnerships so that customers can sign up for and watch Netflix through many different screens and services. Many of these relationships are in place and the role will have a focus on strengthening and developing these partnerships for the longer term, as well as seeking new partnership opportunities. We are looking for a stand out Business Development professional with 5+ years of experience, who is passionate about Internet TV and has a fantastic track record in building high value, long lasting, international partnerships


The role will focus on (i) partnerships with ISPs, MNOs and MVPDs in North Asia (S.Korea, Hong Kong, and Taiwan) and (ii) regional relationships with Consumer Electronic and Mobile OEM partners. The role will drive partnerships from a commercial basis, and will work closely with colleagues in Product and Marketing both in Asia and the US to find the optimal ways of working with partners balancing between global, regional and country level.


The role will report into the Director, Business Development, North Asia.

  • You will primarily manage our partnerships with ISPs, PayTV operators, MNOs, and CE/Mobile OEMs in S. Korea, building out the partnerships and working with colleagues in Product and Marketing to find new ways to drive Netflix membership and viewing in an efficient manner.
  • You will also look to develop these relationships into new territories where the partners operate, using Netflix’s global scale to create growth efficiently.
  • You will explore new relationships in these territories and in new territories that can help drive membership and viewing in an efficient manner, and that can be scaled across multiple territories.
  • You will also provide partnership support with CE/Mobile manufacturers across APAC to ensure we get the most out of these partnerships in terms of maximising viewing for our members and winning new members in an efficient manner. You will work with BD team members along with Product and Marketing colleagues in the US on global relationships with these partners, and with partner-marketing teams at country/cluster level.
    • Responsibilities:
  • Strong Netflix culture fit.
  • 5 years minimum experience in Business Development in the MVPD, ISP, CE, Payment or adjacent industries, with stand out performance.
  • Experience of/deep understanding of retail environment for CE and MVPD/MNO desirable.
  • Technical and/or content background desirable.
  • Deep understanding of VOD landscape Understanding of, and ability to work closely with, marketing and product colleagues.
  • Passion for managing international partnerships.
  • Strong performer with high level of self-organization and prioritization abilities.
  • Prepared for significant travel.
  • Fluent Korean speaker required, additional language a plus (Mandarin preferred).
    • The Ideal candidate:

text: Manager, Licensing, Merchandising, and Partner Marketing
description: Netflix is changing the way more than 117 million subscribers around the world enjoy entertainment.  With continued international expansion and ongoing production across the globe, it’s a great time to join Netflix.Reporting to the Senior Counsel, Marketing and Merchandising, this role will have broad responsibility supporting the global Licensing + Merchandising team and the Partner Marketing teams for the Americas.  The successful candidate will review studio and talent agreements to extract and synthesize information necessary to guide the Licensing + Merchandising team as they develop their products and programs.  S/he will also assist the Partner Marketing and Licensing + Merchandising teams in negotiating and finalizing basic agreements (e.g., IP license agreements, licensee/vendor agreements, releases, agency/vendor agreements), and will provide guidance on contractual and talent obligations for consumer products and partner marketing.   S/he will be responsible for managing the tracking and/or organization of licensing and merchandising and partner marketing agreements, as well as other rights and restrictions on content. In addition, s/he will partner with our business teams  in evaluating and implementing new technologies that provide the next generation of ​contract administration and rights management tools.The successful candidate will have a BA/BS degree and 6+ years of licensing and merchandising and/or entertainment marketing experience. Great flexibility, and the ability to manage a large number of agreements and to work cross-functionally with minimal supervision are essential.  Strong in-house experience in an entertainment company or entertainment-focused consumer products company is strongly preferred.  Experience with kids consumer products is preferred.  S/he will always seek to innovate, and will thrive in a culture that places thoughtful efficiency over process, yet will have the ability to work with organizations or institutions that may not hold the same beliefs.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Legal Legal Manager, Licensing, Merchandising, and Partner Marketing


Netflix is changing the way more than 117 million subscribers around the world enjoy entertainment.  With continued international expansion and ongoing production across the globe, it’s a great time to join Netflix.


Reporting to the Senior Counsel, Marketing and Merchandising, this role will have broad responsibility supporting the global Licensing + Merchandising team and the Partner Marketing teams for the Americas.  The successful candidate will review studio and talent agreements to extract and synthesize information necessary to guide the Licensing + Merchandising team as they develop their products and programs.  S/he will also assist the Partner Marketing and Licensing + Merchandising teams in negotiating and finalizing basic agreements (e.g., IP license agreements, licensee/vendor agreements, releases, agency/vendor agreements), and will provide guidance on contractual and talent obligations for consumer products and partner marketing.   S/he will be responsible for managing the tracking and/or organization of licensing and merchandising and partner marketing agreements, as well as other rights and restrictions on content. In addition, s/he will partner with our business teams  in evaluating and implementing new technologies that provide the next generation of ​contract administration and rights management tools.


The successful candidate will have a BA/BS degree and 6+ years of licensing and merchandising and/or entertainment marketing experience. Great flexibility, and the ability to manage a large number of agreements and to work cross-functionally with minimal supervision are essential.  Strong in-house experience in an entertainment company or entertainment-focused consumer products company is strongly preferred.  Experience with kids consumer products is preferred.  S/he will always seek to innovate, and will thrive in a culture that places thoughtful efficiency over process, yet will have the ability to work with organizations or institutions that may not hold the same beliefs.  

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.  Capable of asking questions and seeking information cross-functionally and at all levels of the business.
  • Proactive and curious.  Able to move quickly to action.
  • Strong analytical capabilities and judgment.  You are comfortable evaluating risk and have the confidence to make quick decisions.
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to pivot quickly and fluidly, think practically and be solution-oriented.
  • Strong organizational and project management skills. A track record of consistently going above and beyond what is expected and delivering projects on schedule.
  • Experience working in a global company and doing international (not simply global) deals.
  • Skill at identifying priorities.  
  • Willingness to tackle matters outside area of expertise.
  • Spanish or Portuguese a plus.
    • What we want from you:

description: THE OPPORTUNITY Netflix seeks an experienced attorney to handle a wide array of responsibilities related to the acquisition, development, and production of Netflix’s original documentaries and docuseries, e.g. White Helmets, 13th, Making a Murderer, Dirty Money.  The successful candidate will be an integral part of the original documentaries team, and will oversee all facets of multiple third-party productions.  REQUIREMENTS You should have at least eight (8) years of development and production experience in unscripted television and/or documentary film, with direct experience negotiating and drafting all forms of production agreements, including talent agreements, production services agreements, and production forms. You should be extremely comfortable dealing directly with productions as well as communicating across myriad departments within the company.  You need to be ready, willing, and able to completely own all business and legal facets of making a documentary film or series: you will be doing the deal for a project, papering it, and then overseeing production-legal and clearance issues.  Experience providing in-house support and managing outside counsel OR experience serving as outside production counsel is required.  You should have knowledge of substantive areas of the law relevant to documentary filmmaking, such as defamation, copyright, and privacy rights; you should also be familiar with journalistic standards and practices.  Our projects are produced both domestically and internationally, so experience working on productions outside of the US would be awesome, but not mandatory.  And, generally, we’re looking for someone who’s curious about the world and the people in it.  A successful candidate will also possess the following: • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.• Strong analytical capabilities and judgment.• Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment.• Ability to work effectively and collaboratively, think practically and be solution-oriented.• Willingness to tackle matters outside your area of expertise. If you’re confronted with something new, you should be able to admit when you don’t know how to do it, and then dive right in to figuring it all out.  And, importantly:  Be honest, be bold, be creative, and be kind.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Legal Content Legal and Business Affairs Counsel, Original Documentaries


THE OPPORTUNITY
Netflix seeks an experienced attorney to handle a wide array of responsibilities related to the acquisition, development, and production of Netflix’s original documentaries and docuseries, e.g. White Helmets, 13th, Making a Murderer, Dirty Money.  The successful candidate will be an integral part of the original documentaries team, and will oversee all facets of multiple third-party productions.  


REQUIREMENTS
You should have at least eight (8) years of development and production experience in unscripted television and/or documentary film, with direct experience negotiating and drafting all forms of production agreements, including talent agreements, production services agreements, and production forms. You should be extremely comfortable dealing directly with productions as well as communicating across myriad departments within the company.  


You need to be ready, willing, and able to completely own all business and legal facets of making a documentary film or series: you will be doing the deal for a project, papering it, and then overseeing production-legal and clearance issues.  Experience providing in-house support and managing outside counsel OR experience serving as outside production counsel is required.  You should have knowledge of substantive areas of the law relevant to documentary filmmaking, such as defamation, copyright, and privacy rights; you should also be familiar with journalistic standards and practices.  Our projects are produced both domestically and internationally, so experience working on productions outside of the US would be awesome, but not mandatory.  And, generally, we’re looking for someone who’s curious about the world and the people in it.  


A successful candidate will also possess the following:


• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Strong analytical capabilities and judgment.
• Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment.
• Ability to work effectively and collaboratively, think practically and be solution-oriented.
• Willingness to tackle matters outside your area of expertise. If you’re confronted with something new, you should be able to admit when you don’t know how to do it, and then dive right in to figuring it all out.  


And, importantly:  Be honest, be bold, be creative, and be kind.

description: It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment around the world.  We are enabling people to have more control over what they watch and when they watch it.  Our efforts have helped to grow Netflix to over 117 million members globally, and we won’t stop there. That's where you come in. We are looking for an operations specialist to lead our day-to-day efforts to stay on top of payment operational needs as well as to improve our operational flows and processes.  This person would be our liaison to ensure payments run smoothly at Netflix.  Just as Netflix works to provide the best entertainment experience possible, our team ensures that the customer’s payment experience is best in class. This role will reside in Los Gatos, CA and will be an integral part of the team that is responsible for developing and implementing the company’s global consumer payments strategy.

Los Gatos, California Finance Finance Manager, Global Payments Operations


It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment around the world.  We are enabling people to have more control over what they watch and when they watch it.  Our efforts have helped to grow Netflix to over 117 million members globally, and we won’t stop there. That's where you come in.


We are looking for an operations specialist to lead our day-to-day efforts to stay on top of payment operational needs as well as to improve our operational flows and processes.  This person would be our liaison to ensure payments run smoothly at Netflix.  Just as Netflix works to provide the best entertainment experience possible, our team ensures that the customer’s payment experience is best in class.


This role will reside in Los Gatos, CA and will be an integral part of the team that is responsible for developing and implementing the company’s global consumer payments strategy.  

  • Coordinating with internal teams and external partners to fine-tune existing payment processes, investigate issues as they arise, identify any bugs that need addressing, and track issues to resolution
  • Identifying new opportunities, with respect to operational components, for performance improvement, cost savings and risk mitigation with key vendors and strategic payment partners
  • Working with the payments data and analysis teams to monitor, create, and maintain payment operational metrics
  • Providing operations support during the launches of new payment providers, methods of payment, etc.
  • Working cross-functionally throughout the organization (engineering, data science, finance, CS, legal, etc.) to build a best-in-class payment program
    • Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Critical thinker with mad problem solving skills and a high attention to detail
  • Clear, effective communicator
  • Familiar with global payment systems and methods of payments (ideal but not required)
  • Able to take on complex situations as well as understand key metrics and how they impact the business
  • Able to remain highly organized in a loosely structured, fast-paced environment
  • Excited and curious about being involved in global payments and the prospect of delivering high-quality entertainment throughout the world
  • Highly analytical with an ability to make data-driven decisions and translate identified opportunities into actionable changes
  • Possessing a high level of intellectual curiosity, is focused on generating results, and exhibits the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics
  • Motivated, disciplined, and able to work autonomously

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Technical Operations Manager, International Dubbing


The Opportunity
Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with over 86 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on nearly any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.


We need a courageous and patience technical operations leader who is committed to pushing the industry forward with greater commitments to quality and to innovating long-standing workflows to better scale the volume and complexity of Netflix content. This is your chance to be part of a team that is transforming entertainment through original content and changing the perception of  how more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films can be viewed and enjoyed, worldwide.


The Role
In the International Dubbing Technical Operations Manager role, you will push to break old industry standards and practices in order to efficiently and effectively create high-quality dub audio assets for the Netflix catalog in 22 languages (and growing). You will build a strong team of impactful individuals, work independently in a fast-paced environment, and own multiple initiatives while shifting nimbly as our business strategies change and grow. You must be an impressive communicator and make smart decisions despite ambiguity.

  • Oversee Netflix’s International Dubbing Technical Operations area for the dubbing of all Netflix Originals, International Originals, Series and Documentaries
  • Innovate and optimize localization workflows to support accelerated timelines  without compromising quality of content
  • Ensure Netflix provides clear guidelines, specifications and creative direction to dubbing partners to enable the highest quality and effectual delivery of localization assets
  • Help build a strong network with the dubbing studios, with experienced and profiled dubbing supervisors and dubbing directors
  • Help build and create workflows for various centralized dubbing services, worldwide.
  • Create ongoing educational programs with regard to the technical aspects of international recording and mixing for all current and new dubbing staff.
  • Work with various technical teams to create and support a robust and ever-increasing international post production workflow.
  • Support Netflix’s accessibility initiative through innovating quality standards and creation of workflows for dubbing and Audio Description
  • Partner with the internal engineering and QC teams to provide clear quality standards on all content language assets and identify and address gaps in the localization processes
  • Advocate, understand and communicate the company's values
    • The Responsibilities
  • Broad technical and audio experience in content localization or international versioning for theatrical and premium TV services especially dub creation
  • Established strong relationships within the content localization industry including studios, international directors, international mixers/audio engineers and dubbing supervisors
  • Solid understanding of international consumer expectations regarding audio and video assets, captioning and dubbing in the markets Netflix serves
  • A deep passion for quality dubbing and international creative intent, worldwide
    • The Right Stuff

description: Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, a lot of it original content: features, shorts, series, documentaries, comedy specials and unscripted content. Optimizing content quality and longevity without compromising efficiency across all types of projects presents significant challenges, but that’s what the Production Technologies team does by setting technical requirements and best practices, driving new industry standards, consulting on the studio’s technical infrastructure, providing direct support to Netflix Original Productions and staying up-to-date with the most advanced developments in professional and consumer technology.  As Netflix creates more and more programming around the world, leveraging new video and audio production technology, the studio’s internal production infrastructure needs are rapidly expanding and evolving to support creative development and production execution.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Projectionist, Exhibition Technology


Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, a lot of it original content: features, shorts, series, documentaries, comedy specials and unscripted content. Optimizing content quality and longevity without compromising efficiency across all types of projects presents significant challenges, but that’s what the Production Technologies team does by setting technical requirements and best practices, driving new industry standards, consulting on the studio’s technical infrastructure, providing direct support to Netflix Original Productions and staying up-to-date with the most advanced developments in professional and consumer technology.  As Netflix creates more and more programming around the world, leveraging new video and audio production technology, the studio’s internal production infrastructure needs are rapidly expanding and evolving to support creative development and production execution.

  • Provide excellent client support in the Screening Rooms and Lounges, while performing all daily functions therein.
  • Liaise with the Post Production groups, Publicity, and Productions to assist with content management in Screening Rooms, run-throughs, tests, and playbacks.
  • Perform routine calibration and maintenance procedures on display devices, to ensure a confident and correct playback experience.
  • Ingest, prepare, and organize all content on local servers or storage, including, but not limited to DCP’s and their respective KDM’s, AVID media sessions, ProRes sessions, DPX or EXR review sessions
  • Setup screening room for Events, Q&A Sessions, Meetings, and Presentations.
  • Provide QC and Continuity checks, where applicable, on incoming media and screening material.
  • Coordinate and support remote review playback sessions.
  • Provide monitoring and feedback on screening room equipment and screening room status.
    • As part of the Production Technologies group, you will:
  • Excellent communication and client relationship skills, ideally with experience within the motion picture industry, and/or other creative environments.
  • 2+ years of projection and motion picture exhibition, including experience with DCI compliant projection equipment
  • Experience with, but not limited to, AVID Media Composer, AVID ProTools, Final Cut Pro, Quicktime Pro, Resolve, Keynote, Powerpoint.
  • Light network management skills.
  • Working knowledge of color, light, and sound calibration equipment
    • Qualifications:


    About You
    You enjoy interfacing with a wide variety of clientele (creatives, executives, talent) throughout your day, and have a disposition geared toward client relations and support services. You have an interest and an understanding of the motion picture industry, with an emphasis on Post Production.  You have a strong working knowledge of computers, computer-based workstations, networks, and servers.  In addition to experience with picture and sound equipment, you understand the basic principles of digital imaging and sound.  You have the desire and capacity to learn and understand future technologies.

text: Senior UI Engineer - Edge Insights Engineering
description: Netflix is the world's leading internet streaming service with over 100 million members in 190 countries. Our members enjoy more than 125 million hours of streamed video per day, on over 1000 different types of devices. The product experience is delivered by calling into a complex distributed system of services running in the cloud. With all the usage, our telemetry data volumes continue to rise. Operating at this scale requires extremely high levels of observability and automation. The Edge Insights team develops and operates the infrastructure that processes this data in realtime and provides insights that engineers depend on to measure, visualize, investigate, and optimize how customers experience their services.More About the TeamThe team is part of the Edge Engineering organization where most of the tier-1 critical services reside within Netflix. We combine deep domain knowledge of Edge and Playback systems, insights from real time data streams and dynamic visualization to build the best in class observability suite. Here is a link to a talk from an engineer on the team: https://youtu.be/uODxUJ5JwisRole:We’re looking for a passionate, experienced UI/Data Visualization Engineer who will own and build new, high-­impact  web application to make “large” data both understandable and actionable.

Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Senior UI Engineer - Edge Insights Engineering


Netflix is the world's leading internet streaming service with over 100 million members in 190 countries. Our members enjoy more than 125 million hours of streamed video per day, on over 1000 different types of devices. The product experience is delivered by calling into a complex distributed system of services running in the cloud. With all the usage, our telemetry data volumes continue to rise. Operating at this scale requires extremely high levels of observability and automation. The Edge Insights team develops and operates the infrastructure that processes this data in realtime and provides insights that engineers depend on to measure, visualize, investigate, and optimize how customers experience their services.


More About the Team
The team is part of the Edge Engineering organization where most of the tier-1 critical services reside within Netflix. We combine deep domain knowledge of Edge and Playback systems, insights from real time data streams and dynamic visualization to build the best in class observability suite. Here is a link to a talk from an engineer on the team: https://youtu.be/uODxUJ5Jwis


Role:
We’re looking for a passionate, experienced UI/Data Visualization Engineer who will own and build new, high-­impact  web application to make “large” data both understandable and actionable.  

  • Be product-focused, driving the design, development, and implementation in order to turn a user’s pain-points into simple and elegant solutions that are loved.
  • Be an expert at building web applications using HTML, CSS, and at least one JavaScript framework like React.js, AngularJS or Backbone.js
  • Build data visualizations using libraries like D3.js
  • Develop visualizations that enable Netflix engineers and leaders to explore and understand data
  • Be driven and bias toward autonomy.  Take full ownership of a product or feature from concept to launch.
  • Understand usability issues in a web application
    • More on the role:
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience
  • 7+ years of relevant software development experience
  • Proficiency with HTML5, CSS, and at least one reasonably popular JavaScript framework (e.g. React, Angular, Polymer, Backbone, Ember)
    • Required Skills & Experience:
  • Exposure to and/or experience in the following :
  • Understanding of how to present and visualize complex data
  • Understanding of visualizing streaming data
  • Commercial and/or open source technologies in the log management, distributed tracing and analytics domains  e.g. LogStash, Splunk, Zipkin, New Relic etc.
    • Bonus:


    At Netflix, we like to move fast, bias towards action, and rely on great people to make good judgment calls.  You should also love solving real problems and making an impact for the company, your partners, and your teammates.  Things also change fast and often, so you need to be able to function well with ambiguity and be comfortable making decisions under uncertainty.  For more on the Netflix culture, read our culture document.


    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Coordinator, Master QC


The Opportunity
The Netflix Master QC team is charged with defining, driving, and executing the quality standards for our Original content through a QC process designed with pixel perfection in mind.  Coordinator, Master QC will partner with the team to ensure QC quality and also innovate on existing QC workflows.  You will have direct impact on award-winning content that will be viewed by over 104 million members in over 190 countries; 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day.


The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, effective communicator and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.

  • Responsible for the creation of QC requests and selection of QC Vendors
  • Monitoring vendor workload to ensure that they are within capacity
  • Follow up on QC tickets and/or assign the appropriate team member
  • Maintain QC dashboard and queue to ensure all data is accurate and up to date
  • Develop innovative ways to streamline QC workflows
  • Track progress of strategic initiatives
  • Assist Specialist with projects logistics and business travel planning
    • The Responsibilities:
  • 2+ years of industry experience within a post-production company, QC service provider or home entertainment division of a studio or equivalent organization
  • Have a thorough working knowledge of common technical issues found in digital video and audio
  • Adaptability and resilience to quick changes in priorities, technology, tools and workflow
  • Attention to detail, organization, problem-solving, analytical and multitasking skills
  • Understanding of how to prioritize, while also remaining agile and able to pivot quickly
  • Ability to handle high volume of tasks for multiple people simultaneously and manage competing priorities
  • Strong desire to be part of a team that thrives on collaboration and shared learning
  • Confident decision maker
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR PR Originals Publicity Manager - Turkey, Israel & South Africa


 Do you live and breathe entertainment?
Are you an entertainment publicity expert in Turkey with an international curiosity & mind-set?
Do you enjoy strategizing publicity and promotional campaigns?
Do you re-evaluate publicity campaigns that you have worked on to appraise what you could have done different or better?
 
If so, we may have just the opportunity for you:
 
The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members across the globe. With continued international expansion and a move into original series acquisition and production underway, it’s a great time to join Netflix.
 
The Originals Publicity Manager - Turkey, Israel & South Africa will be based in Amsterdam and will work as part of the Originals Publicity team to formulate and implement strategy in Turkey for the growing slate of Netflix Original content. The position will provide a critical link between local agencies and Netflix in promoting Original series content on the service. It’s the chance to be part of changing the entertainment landscape across the globe and to seize the opportunity to take different approaches in managing and executing promotional and publicity campaigns.
 
The Role
The Manager will work across several different disciplines that bring Original series, films & docs to fruition here at Netflix. They will drive innovative Turkish publicity campaigns for our Turkish originals, whilst drawing on our incredible slate of originals to drive our business in Turkey. In addition, they will independently formulate, and drive creative and executable ideas for South Africa & Israel, communicating priorities and presenting clear goals to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their team members to do the same. They role will report into the Originals Publicity Manager - Middle East & North Africa.
 
The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic and understand the market. They will also not be afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches; they will make tough decisions without agonizing and will be candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial. They are scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks at all levels and they thrive in an environment void of bureaucracy and layers.
 
The day to day responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, formulating and implementing local strategy, managing and leading local PR agencies, writing press releases, managing set visit nominations, scheduling local & international junkets, liaising with journalists, talent representatives and talent, implementing screening strategy.


Qualifications
The successful candidate for the Originals Publicity Manager - Turkey, Israel & South Africa role will likely:
•Have 7-10 years of experience in a Turkish entertainment PR setting - either agency or TV network.
•Possess a keen understanding of new and traditional media.
•Be able & willing to think on a pan-European level
•Be able to understand and comfortably interpret business and technology issues.
•Be a clear and concise communicator
•Have excellent media relationships and experience executing a PR strategy and work well across disciplines to execute campaigns.
•Be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadline and thrive in a high energy, fast-paced environment.
•Have experience managing agencies, be effective in dealing with talent, talent reps, journalists and other media influencers.
•Pack your bags because domestic and international travel is a requirement.
 
To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:
•The ability to think innovatively - connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.
•Succinct Communicator. Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. 
•Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
•Pragmatic, organized and detailed. Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.
•A smart minimalist. Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.
•Has a Point of View. An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.
•Pace moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. 
•Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes. 
•Integrity. Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.
•An Adult. Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


Compensation Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

With continued international expansion and a move into original series acquisition and production underway, it’s a great time to join Netflix.


The Originals Publicity Manager - Middle East & North Africa will be based in Amsterdam and will work as part of the Originals Publicity team to formulate and implement strategy in MENA for the growing slate of Netflix global and local Original series. The position will provide a critical link between agencies in the region, their counterparts in other teams such as Marketing, Consumer PR, Social Media and Corporate Communications and Netflix in promoting Original content on the service. It’s the chance to be part of changing the entertainment landscape across the globe and to seize the opportunity to take different approaches in managing and executing promotional and publicity campaigns.


The Role 
The Manager will work across several different disciplines that bring Original series, films, docs & unscripted to fruition here at Netflix. They will drive innovative but locally relevant publicity campaigns for our originals to drive our business across the region, including (but not limited to) the UAE, KSA & Egypt. They will independently formulate, and drive creative and executable ideas, communicate priorities and present clear goals to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their team members to do the same. The role will report to the VP of EMEA Originals Publicity.


The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic and understand the market. They will also not be afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches; they will make tough decisions without agonizing and will be candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial. They are scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks at all levels and they thrive in an environment void of bureaucracy and layers.


The day to day responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, formulating and implementing regional strategies across the Middle East & North Africa, writing press releases, managing set visit nominations, scheduling international junkets, liaising with journalists, talent representatives and talent, implementing screening strategy and assisting with the management of agencies across the region.


Qualifications
The successful candidate for the Manager of Original Series Publicity role will likely:
•Have 7-10 years of experience in a Middle Eastern entertainment PR setting - either agency or TV network.
•Possess a keen understanding of new and traditional media.
•Be able & willing to think on a Pan-EMEA level.
•Be able to understand and comfortably interpret business and technology issues.
•Be a clear and concise communicator.
•Have excellent media relationships and experience executing a PR strategy and work well across disciplines to execute campaigns.
•Be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadline and thrive in a high energy, fast-paced environment.
•Have experience managing agencies, be effective in dealing with talent, talent reps, journalists and other media influencers.
•Pack your bags because domestic and international travel is a requirement.
 
To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:
•The ability to think innovatively - connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.
•Succinct Communicator. Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. 
•Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
•Pragmatic, organized and detailed. Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.
•A smart minimalist. Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.
•Has a Point of View. An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.
•Pace moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. 
•Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes. 
•Integrity. Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.
•An Adult. Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


Compensation Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

search_text:
London, United Kingdom Content Financial Planning and Analysis Manager Production Finance, International Originals - UK


The Opportunity
This is your chance to be on the ground floor with a team that is transforming entertainment through original productions, changing the perception of what great content is and how it should be enjoyed and celebrated. Fueled by the broad appeal of the instantaneous enjoyment of unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. It’s a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
The Manager of Production Finance will be instrumental in creating and implementing the production finance goals of the Originals Series team.  The goals include i) providing accurate, timely and complete production budgets and estimated final costs ii) protecting company assets through cash management, policies and procedures and iii) providing shows with the production finance support to facilitate producing great content.  

  • Collaborate with Line Producers, Production Managers, Accounting Staff and the Netflix Originals team to deliver the highest quality original entertainment content.
  • Research, develop and test new technologies that provide the next generation of production finance tools and determine how and when to best incorporate into the production accounting workflow.
  • Hire the most talented production accounting teams with the skillset to provide the highest level of production accounting support on shows that are some of the most ambitious and complex to be ever produced. Accounting teams must be self –motivated, resourceful, dedicated, hard working, focused and strive for only the highest level of professional ethics, consistent mathematical accuracy and completeness, and embody the Netflix ethos.
  • Liaise with Netflix HR, Labor Relations, Content Accounting, Internal Audit, Payroll, Accounts Payable, Treasury, IT to ensure production finance policies and procedures are current and effectively implemented on our productions.
  • Prepare initial production budgets.
  • Manage production incentive workflow and ensure receipt of tax credits or cash.
  • Ensure that insurance claim costs are accurate and adequately supported by schedules, invoices and payroll documents.
  • Manage the cash flow and funding processes.
  • Review production budgets, cost reports, trial balances and petty cash reconciliations prepared by show accountants.
  • Work with show accountants on a day to day basis to drive accurate, complete and timely cost reporting,  protecting and managing show assets and supporting production.
  • Identify problem area as quickly as possible including breakdown in communication between department heads, upm’s, producers and accountants and minimal use of PO’s.
  • Develop relationships with Film Commissioners, CPA audit firms, Accountants, Producers and Payroll Companies to build resources and networks from which to poll industry information and help ensure all production finance processes are current, reasonable and timely.
  • Facilitate the training and mentoring of junior production accounting staff on Netflix shows with the goal of increasing the pool of loyal “star” accounting candidates for future Netflix productions.
  • Keep abreast of current and changing industry trends, evolving technologies, production incentives and changes in crew capacity and infrastructure support in the main worldwide production centers.
  • Travel to production locations where our shows are filming to audit, review work flows, organizational abilities and effectiveness of accounting staff.
    • The Responsibilities
  • Candidates must have 15+ years in scripted television production accounting.
  • Candidates must have 10+ years working as a Lead Production Accountant on local and distant location major studio size productions.
  • Broad understanding of production incentives.
  • Solid understanding of payroll process, PACT/Equity agreements and tax requirements.
  • Expert skill level of Movie Magic Budgeting and either Vista or PSL or Eclipse production accounting systems.
  • College degree in accounting or finance from a well-known university is preferred.
  • Proven ability to lead and manage a team.
  • Solution focused.
  • Ability to understand and articulate issues using creative, production or financial context.
    • Experience

text: Director of Product Innovation - Kids, Teen & Family
description: The Netflix product experience across devices such as SmartTVs, mobile phones, and PCs are where our members around the world discover and watch over 50 billion hours of TV shows and movies every year. Netflix is looking for a leader to drive key areas of our product innovation as we strive to define the future of entertainment discovery and consumption.The focus of this role is to lead our product innovation on the Netflix kids experience globally across all devices. We launched our first dedicated kids experience in early 2011 and the kids experience is now used regularly by tens of millions of our younger members across 190 countries. Kids and parents have unique needs in how they discover and watch TV shows and movies. The opportunity for this leader is to innovate the experience around these specific needs. In addition, Netflix is producing some of the most popular kids content in the world and part of this role is innovating on driving understanding and positioning of original content in the Netflix kids experience. Our rigorous, testing-driven innovation model focuses on exploring and defining great ideas then validating them against our core metrics through live testing. This analytical approach is at the intersection of creativity and analytics and requires a leader with strong right and left brain skills.  Examples of our recent product innovation can be seen here and here and provide a sense of our work and our expectations.About this role...The leader in this role will own and drive key areas of our product innovation work. They will have the responsibility to continually develop metrics-driving improvements to the Netflix kids experience on a global scale. The focus of this role is the kids member experience: all content discovery and playback with a key emphasis on evolving our dedicated kids experience, a safe area for kids that parents can trust. To accomplish this, this leader will work as the cross-functional kids product leader with our engineering, design, consumer insights, data sciences, and content teams to develop and execute their ideas. This role reports to the Vice President of Product Innovation.What you might not know…An important leadership role with the major responsibility of owning our kids product roadmap, this position has no direct reports. Product innovation is so critical to us that we align our product organization around the execution of product innovation and want our product leaders to be free to focus on improving our product experience rather than managing an organization. As a product innovation leader in our comparably small and nimble product organization you can have a tremendous impact on our 118 million members in 190 countries around the world. Our culture is unique and is a key part of our approach to innovation.

Los Gatos, California Design and Product Innovation Product Management Director of Product Innovation - Kids, Teen & Family


The Netflix product experience across devices such as SmartTVs, mobile phones, and PCs are where our members around the world discover and watch over 50 billion hours of TV shows and movies every year. Netflix is looking for a leader to drive key areas of our product innovation as we strive to define the future of entertainment discovery and consumption.


The focus of this role is to lead our product innovation on the Netflix kids experience globally across all devices. We launched our first dedicated kids experience in early 2011 and the kids experience is now used regularly by tens of millions of our younger members across 190 countries. Kids and parents have unique needs in how they discover and watch TV shows and movies. The opportunity for this leader is to innovate the experience around these specific needs. In addition, Netflix is producing some of the most popular kids content in the world and part of this role is innovating on driving understanding and positioning of original content in the Netflix kids experience.


Our rigorous, testing-driven innovation model focuses on exploring and defining great ideas then validating them against our core metrics through live testing. This analytical approach is at the intersection of creativity and analytics and requires a leader with strong right and left brain skills.  Examples of our recent product innovation can be seen here and here and provide a sense of our work and our expectations.


About this role...
The leader in this role will own and drive key areas of our product innovation work. They will have the responsibility to continually develop metrics-driving improvements to the Netflix kids experience on a global scale. The focus of this role is the kids member experience: all content discovery and playback with a key emphasis on evolving our dedicated kids experience, a safe area for kids that parents can trust. To accomplish this, this leader will work as the cross-functional kids product leader with our engineering, design, consumer insights, data sciences, and content teams to develop and execute their ideas. This role reports to the Vice President of Product Innovation.


What you might not know…
An important leadership role with the major responsibility of owning our kids product roadmap, this position has no direct reports. Product innovation is so critical to us that we align our product organization around the execution of product innovation and want our product leaders to be free to focus on improving our product experience rather than managing an organization. As a product innovation leader in our comparably small and nimble product organization you can have a tremendous impact on our 118 million members in 190 countries around the world. Our culture is unique and is a key part of our approach to innovation.

  • Defining and owning our product innovation roadmap for the Netflix kids experience across all Netflix platforms (TV, website, tablet, mobile)
  • Working cross-functionally with teams across Netflix to develop and execute ideas through all aspects of the product development lifecycle including design, development, testing, and productization
  • Working closely with the Netflix kids original content development team to define new product innovation opportunities for our kids experience
  • Owning all final decisions on the kids product experience, look and feel, and execution
  • As a product leader, you are the owner for the kids product area across the company 
    • Key responsibilities
  • Huge enthusiasm for defining and evolving a great internet video experience for kids
  • 7 years experience in areas of product development with demonstrated history defining great consumer experiences
  • Experience and demonstrated leadership working effectively with design and engineering teams
  • Proven instincts about user experience, design, and consumer needs   
  • Understanding of quantitative research methods such as AB testing and analytics
  • A strong critical thinker with a balance of creative and analytical skills
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to excel in a dynamic, intellectual, results-driven environment
  • Direct experience in product design and/or engineering is a big plus
  • Direct experience in kids technology and/or kids entertainment is a big plus
  • A bachelor’s degree; post-graduate degree preferred
  • A passion for TV and movies and defining the future of entertainment

Los Angeles, California Global Product Creative Globalization Localization Manager - Trailers


Come join the team responsible for localization at Netflix! We are a passionate team dedicated to bringing the Netflix experience to international markets. We treat each country we enter differently, since it is not just about translation, it is about providing our audience with an experience that feels local, and we do it at scale.


In this role, you will set the strategy for a vital part of our member experience and engage cross functionally with different stakeholder groups, within the wider company to do so. Closely aligned with your team are a number of cross functional groups you will work with, that will influence how you shape the localization strategy for marketing trailers; roadmap, charters, schedules, budget, tools optimization, quality & QC for our content verticals to guarantee the successful launch of the Netflix experience internationally.


The environment is fast-paced, requiring the ability to work collaboratively with minimal supervision and while managing aggressive deadlines & multiple priorities. You will need to demonstrate excellent problem-solving & communication skills and a passion to improve existing infrastructure, tools and technologies.

  • Managing your team
  • Cross collaboration with other Program Managers, Marketing Operations and Producers
  • Provide thought leadership by identifying areas for growth and improvement

  • Managing resource allocations for the teams roadmap
  • A deep understanding of the content vertical priorities based on analysis of data
  • Coordinating efforts with cross-functional teams such as Content Acquisitions, Marketing Operations & Video Assets to sync launch efforts and schedules
  • Managing communication across the team & unifying the team’s vision, aligned against strategy & core deliverable
  • Establishing and ensuring high quality localization subtitle standards for marketing trailers
  • Planning and maintaining the localization budget for the ecosystem
    • Specific responsibilities will include:
  • 4-5 years of people and organizational management
  • 3-5 years of experience with all areas of subtitle work on marketing trailers; from understanding the deliverables from other groups to ensure quality handover, to managing the volume of marketing trailers, to understanding the file formats used in subtitle creation.
  • 5 years of Localization Project/Program Management utilizing & optimizing CAT tools
  • Ability to work effectively cross-functionally and demonstrated leadership and execution skills.

Marketing Operations at Netflix is focused on establishing a global operational center-of-excellence for cross-functional project management, creative production, and localization of our marketing campaigns.


To support our global expansion, Japan Marketing Operations is looking for an AV Producer to join the team. In this role, you would be responsible for managing the finishing, localization production and delivery processes of our AV Marketing campaigns.  You understand Marketing Finishing and Localization workflows and excel in managing a large volume of assets in a high-speed, high-performance environment.  You are a force of calm and good judgment as well as an adaptable person who revels in change.  


The Role: Based in Japan and reporting to the Senior Manager of Japan Marketing Operations, you will be responsible for driving AV production, building scale, and collaborating cross-functionally with internal partners dedicated to creative, media, regional marketing across both Global and Regional teams.

description: Netflix has changed not only the way the world consumes content, but also how that content is created. Deep partnership and understanding of the business is at the core of our talent acquisition team philosophy. Los Angeles, California Talent and Recruiting Human Resources PR/Publicity Recruiter


Netflix has changed not only the way the world consumes content, but also how that content is created. In keeping with this spirit of innovation, our talent department isn’t a simple “reviewing resumes and screening candidates” function. Instead, it is a true partner to the business, counted on to provide insight about the way our teams should grow and to make meaningful assessments about both the business acumen and culture fit of prospective Netflix hires. We are a company committed to bringing aboard only world class professionals, even as we grow at breakneck pace, and that mission begins with talent acquisition.


Netflix is looking for a full-cycle Recruiter to build our PR/Publicity organizations via creative sourcing, market research, partnership with the business and a critical eye when assessing talent for these groups. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a candidate with either experience recruiting specifically in PR/Publicity or a background working in both PR/Publicity and Recruitment.


This person will have a real and meaningful impact at Netflix, because the way we promote and market our service and content is integral to the success of the business globally. Deep partnership and understanding of the business is at the core of our talent acquisition team philosophy. It allows us to create high impact recruiting strategies and solutions with the flexibility to adapt our approach as the business evolves.  We’re seeking someone who has the passion to utilize their comprehension of the PR/Publicity industry to discover top talent candidates  through our personalized approach to recruiting.

text: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Ads Engineering
description: Team BackgroundThe Ads Engineering teams builds digital advertising solutions for our marketing teams that enable them to promote the Netflix brand around the world and help to drive incremental acquisitions. We leverage our rich first-party data, personalization algorithms and our strength in cloud infrastructure to deliver dynamic ads which are highly customized to the user. Our ad delivery systems continually serves billions of ad impressions in more than 150 countries automatically localized in 20 languages. We also build the tools used to execute and manage campaigns for both machine learning powered personalized ads in addition to curated high execution ads for all premium Netflix Original Shows, Documentaries and Films.Job DescriptionOur platform has helped automate the assembly and delivery of ads and constantly processes new content and changes in existing ones and update the ad serving. We are expanding these capabilities into multiple newer ad platforms, adding more advanced features and continually evolving our platform to address changing business needs. We are looking for a person to work across a broad variety of focus areas such as ad assembly, video transcoding, CDN delivery, metadata systems, front-end architecture and building UI workflows. The product that you work on directly affects how well our marketing teams are able to effectively run global, cross-platforms campaigns at scale. The ideal candidate is a person with solid all-round skills and a prototype mentality, capable of iteratively developing new features.

text: Senior Software Engineer - TV App Performance
description: More than 100 million members in over 190 countries already discover and watch over 50 billion hours of TV shows and movies on Netflix. But there’s a lot more to do. Our continuing mission is to bring great stories to everyone, no matter where they are or what devices they use.Our rigorous innovation model focuses on exploring and defining great ideas then validating them against metrics. This analytical approach is at the intersection of creativity and analytics and requires talented engineers who are experts in their domain, who are curious, and who contribute broadly.We have a culture that helps you do our best work.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering UI Engineering Senior Software Engineer - TV App Performance


More than 100 million members in over 190 countries already discover and watch over 50 billion hours of TV shows and movies on Netflix. But there’s a lot more to do. Our continuing mission is to bring great stories to everyone, no matter where they are or what devices they use.


Our rigorous innovation model focuses on exploring and defining great ideas then validating them against metrics. This analytical approach is at the intersection of creativity and analytics and requires talented engineers who are experts in their domain, who are curious, and who contribute broadly.


We have a culture that helps you do our best work.

  • We have a single app that scales across a broad spectrum of devices, taking advantage of the latest game consoles and high-end smart TVs, but also running performantly on low compute TV devices 
  • Our app comprises a purpose-built SDK written in C++ and a User Interface and Adaptive Streaming implemented in JavaScript
  • The graphics architecture is designed to yield fast and smooth animations across devices
  • We evolve the stack so we can experiment with ideas that have never been tried before
    • Our stack is unique
  • Performance is a top priority for us
  • The app should start blazingly fast so it is better than a TV channel switch
  • We engineer for consistently high frame rate so there’s no jank in animations
  • The UI should respond to user interaction within 100ms so it feels responsive
  • We squeeze more out of limited memory so we can reach more devices 
  • We improve networking so anyone in the world can watch Netflix on their TV even if they’re on a low quality connection
  • We use video throughout the app and the UI should remain responsive and smooth as video plays
    • App performance is key
  • You have the freedom to improve performance by optimizing features written in C++ all the way up to user experience code written in JavaScript - unlike the web where you cannot make substantive browser changes, if at all, here on our team you can optimize performance where it makes best sense
  • Your work can span all dimensions of the app, including CPU, GPU, network, and memory
  • You can test your hypotheses against millions of users in production by leveraging our sophisticated A/B testing techniques and partnering with the science & analytics team
  • Your role does not have strict boundaries, giving you the opportunity to expand your impact where you see value to the business
  • You are a strong critical thinker with a balance of analytical and creative skills
  • You have excellent communication skills and ability to excel in a dynamic, intellectual, results-driven environment
  • We pay top of market. We work to attract the best and brightest, and pay accordingly
    • What to expect


    Do you want to join our team to lead the revolution in internet TV?

text: Content Analyst, Kids, Teen and Family
description: This opening is for a full-time hourly employee to be based in either our Los Angeles OR Los Gatos office.The Editorial Creative Metadata Team is seeking a Kids, Teen, & Family Content Analyst to help categorize television and movies for our 100+ million users. Our team is wild about youth media and we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm! The ideal candidate has in-depth knowledge of entertainment content created for kids, families, and teens, with a strong eye towards determining age-appropriate maturity and themes. The Kids, Teen, & Family Metadata team is responsible for 1) identifying which content belongs in Kids profiles, 2) identifying how content evolves as kids grow up, 3) cataloging shows and movies based on a variety of themes, and 4) applying metadata and ratings to kids, teens, and family content. In this position, you will:• Apply Metadata and Tags to Content: You will categorize youth movies and television shows for different ages and interests based on varying themes and properties.• Apply Global Ratings to Content: Using existing global guidelines, along with Netflix tools for calibrating global sensitivities, you will apply ratings to content produced for kids, teens, and families. • Contribute to Backtagging and Innovation Projects: When metadata guidelines are updated, you will support projects to ensure that new data are applied accurately and appropriately to hundreds of titles. You will also assist with projects that include 1) vetting new material to determine how or if the content is suitable for youth, 2) providing feedback on experimental content analyses, and 3) contributing to product innovations for Netflix Kids, Teen, & Family.• Collaborate on Cross-team Shared Initiatives: The Content Analyst will be positioned as a title expert who is capable of collaborating across teams to support A/B testing needs and to engage in conversations with partners who are interested in positioning titles from marketing and product merch angles. Required of Qualified Candidates:• Extensive knowledge of kids, teen, and family television shows and movies• Ability to collaborate harmoniously with a dynamic variety of team personalities• Zero fear and of, and an infallible willingness to learn and use unique digital tools and systems• Excellent organizational skills, with sharp attention to nuanced details• Ability to converse articulately and confidently in business conversations with partnering stakeholdersNice-to-have of Qualified Candidates:• Qualitative research skills, with a focus on Content Analysis or Thematic Coding• Education in Child or Adolescent Development, Youth Media Studies, or other related fields• Proficiency in a second language beyond English

description: Netflix is the first truly global internet television network and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want.
