original content.About UsThe Content Algorithms team has two key areas of focus.  We build tools and services that allow us to extract metadata from every single frame of video content on the Netflix service.  We use that metadata to find interesting images and video to assist in the product creative and user AB testing experience.  Read more here: https://medium.com/@NetflixTechBlog/ava-the-art-and-science-of-image-discovery-at-netflix-a442f163af6We also build systems to let us use human generated and automatically derived inputs to define, maintain and manipulate fine-grained categorical descriptions for all of our content.  The collective output of all of our work is leveraged extensively by the rest of the Netflix product experience.You can find more details here: http://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2014/01/how-netflix-reverse-engineered-hollywood/282679/ About the RoleWe are looking for someone to help complement some of the existing skills and competencies on our team.  We’re a technically diverse group whose skillset runs the gamut of Node.js/React based UI applications, large scale distributed Java, Cassandra and RDS back-end services, TensorFlow based machine learning, and a suite of C++ based Computer Vision algorithms running at scale leveraging our internal workflow and container infrastructure.  Perhaps you have background in Audio Analysis, or maybe Natural Language Processing.  Or, maybe you're just a ridiculously adept machine learning engineer with a knack for knowing which type of algorithm best suits a specific issue, and a history of shipping solutions.  The role is not about pure research into new methods, it is about building the right composition of existing methods and tools to solve specific business problems that impact our internal users and every once of our subscribers.  If this describes you, and you have a strong product and customer focus, then we'd love to chat with you.About You• You’ve used a deep learning platform like Keras, Caffe, TensorFlow, DeepLearning4J, or Theano.• You’re strong in either Java, C++ or Python; familiarity with existing Netflix OSS is a plus• You have strong fundamentals on statistical machine learning.• You can train models, fine-tune algorithms, and readily adopt latest research for the purpose of shipping AI/ML solutions.• You are concerned about the performance of your algorithms and models as they scale, and how they fit into large ecosystems and workflows of other algorithms.• You are self driven, and willing to ask for help and collaborate with co-workers when problem solving.• You are a continuous learner.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Engineering Senior Software Engineer, Content Algorithms


Netflix is the first truly global internet television network and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want. Netflix currently has over 117 million members in over 190 countries who enjoy more than 1 billion hours of TV shows and movies per week.  In 2018, Netflix will spend over $8 billion produce our own original content.


About Us
The Content Algorithms team has two key areas of focus.  We build tools and services that allow us to extract metadata from every single frame of video content on the Netflix service.  We use that metadata to find interesting images and video to assist in the product creative and user AB testing experience.  


Read more here: https://medium.com/@NetflixTechBlog/ava-the-art-and-science-of-image-discovery-at-netflix-a442f163af6


We also build systems to let us use human generated and automatically derived inputs to define, maintain and manipulate fine-grained categorical descriptions for all of our content.  The collective output of all of our work is leveraged extensively by the rest of the Netflix product experience.


You can find more details here: http://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2014/01/how-netflix-reverse-engineered-hollywood/282679/ 


About the Role
We are looking for someone to help complement some of the existing skills and competencies on our team.  We’re a technically diverse group whose skillset runs the gamut of Node.js/React based UI applications, large scale distributed Java, Cassandra and RDS back-end services, TensorFlow based machine learning, and a suite of C++ based Computer Vision algorithms running at scale leveraging our internal workflow and container infrastructure.  Perhaps you have background in Audio Analysis, or maybe Natural Language Processing.  Or, maybe you're just a ridiculously adept machine learning engineer with a knack for knowing which type of algorithm best suits a specific issue, and a history of shipping solutions.  The role is not about pure research into new methods, it is about building the right composition of existing methods and tools to solve specific business problems that impact our internal users and every once of our subscribers.  If this describes you, and you have a strong product and customer focus, then we'd love to chat with you.


About You
• You’ve used a deep learning platform like Keras, Caffe, TensorFlow, DeepLearning4J, or Theano.
• You’re strong in either Java, C++ or Python; familiarity with existing Netflix OSS is a plus
• You have strong fundamentals on statistical machine learning.
• You can train models, fine-tune algorithms, and readily adopt latest research for the purpose of shipping AI/ML solutions.
• You are concerned about the performance of your algorithms and models as they scale, and how they fit into large ecosystems and workflows of other algorithms.
• You are self driven, and willing to ask for help and collaborate with co-workers when problem solving.
• You are a continuous learner.

Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Global Creative Marketing - APAC International Originals


With 117 million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.  


Originals content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of international originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world.


We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our APAC international originals marketing campaigns. This team is based in our Singapore office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, Tokyo, Mumbai, Amsterdam and Singapore, frequent international travel is a must.
 

  • You have a proven track record of building impactful, world-class 360 creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. 
  • You are a natural leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate creative ideas that people rally around.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, possess a high level of emotional IQ and intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and decision making skills in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing + social media + innovation, and strive to create impactful and effective visual storytelling on mobile, paid social and all other mediums/platforms.
  • You love international TV and film content and have deep knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends both in Asia and globally. 
  • You are a connoisseur of trailers, key art and digital/social media and have solid experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 creative marketing campaigns. 
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager flourish in our unique company culture(see Who We Are).
    • Who are you?
  • Play a key role in building strategy and creative campaigns (e.g. marketing shoots, AV and key visuals, paid media, bespoke social assets) for the launch of APAC international originals.
  • Partner closely with APAC regional marketing teams to develop authentic campaigns that are built on regional insights and connect with local audiences. 
  • Write creative briefs to guide the global creative process and align internal marketing teams on goals and overall strategies. 
  • Project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning internal task force meetings and brainstorm sessions and external filmmaker kickoffs/presentations.
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external stakeholders/partners.
  • Participate in and/or lead lively debates and discussions as you communicate different facets of the campaign to filmmakers, talent and colleagues across the company. 
  • Collaborate with our world class product/engineering team to integrate our originals marketing campaigns within the member product experience. 
    • What will you do?
  • 5+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in entertainment (TV, film, gaming), global lifestyle brand (Nike, Coca-Cola, Apple, etc.) or creative/advertising agency. 
  • A history of team leadership and cross-functional collaboration with both internal and external partners. 
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, social media platforms, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp of marketing / media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • You have international experience, preferably have spent time living and working in Asia. 
  • Fluency in English is mandatory. Fluency/proficiency in an additional regional language is preferred. 
  • Strong interpersonal, creative, presentation, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills

Los Angeles, California Finance Finance Finance Operations Business Partner - Studios


It's an exciting time to join Netflix with over 117 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 140 million hours of TV shows and movies per day including award-winning original content. Our international efforts have brought Netflix to virtually all countries around the globe and we are excited to bring even more of our Originals programming to viewers everywhere. As Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth.


The Opportunity:
We are looking for a finance professional to partner with our Studio Operations teams on end to end finance operations.  The perfect candidate for this role is someone that has a solid understanding of the P2P workflow, a deep knowledge of studio operations and a passion for developing strong cross functional relationships.


This position will provide support to cross-functional business partners as follows:
• Business owners - Embedded resource that understands the nature of the business being supported and owns finance related tasks (end to end P2P support for setting up new vendors, reviewing contracts, creating POs, reviewing invoices, vendor management, expense reporting, etc.)
• Accounts Payable - Create POs where applicable and provide non-PO invoice coding to enable timely and accurate invoice processing
• Accounting - Help facilitate a timely and accurate month-end close by owning the accrual process and explaining variance drivers
• FP&A - Ensure accurate coding to provide meaningful reporting, help track actuals to budget and communicate any expected variances
• IT - Design reporting metrics around studio operations workflows and partner on system enhancements to help automate workflows to scale


Qualities We’re Looking For:
• 7+ years of relevant Finance and/or Accounting experience in Production Finance/Accounting, Studio Finance/Accounting or Real Estate Finance/Accounting
• Experience with purchase orders, as you will deal with these on day 1 and look for ways to optimize the workflows
• Industry experience in a studio environment (especially VFX/Animation) dealing with facilities, build outs, project tracking, capitalization vs. expense, rate cards, etc.
• Relationship builder - Ability to cultivate strong cross functional relationships and communicate effectively with team members and business partners
• Innovation - Enthusiasm for improving and enhancing systems and workflows (learn the existing process and then build/challenge it to better scale for growth while providing meaningful reporting to our business partners)
• Curiosity and passion - Our team members ask probing questions, challenge the status quo, make changes to improve processes, and have fun while doing it; having a positive attitude and never settling for “good enough” are key
• ERP systems experience - experience with Workday Financials or other cloud based ERP systems is a plus
• You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view
• Adaptable - You are comfortable in an ever-changing ecosystem of content, finance and accounting issues and projects
• Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting and/or Finance; MBA and/or CPA a plus

description: At the heart of Netflix technology is the Cloud Computing platform, which serves as the distributed systems foundation for Netflix application development, and powers the viewing experience of millions of customers every day. This Cloud Platform needs to be highly available at scale, robust and resilient.In the Runtime Platform team, we are relentlessly focused on creating a simple, intuitive experience for engineers across Netflix to build and operate their applications at scale.  We do this through providing the platform systems that handle all aspects of RPC (inter-service communication), service discovery, dynamic configuration, and the core Java application frameworks used across engineering.  Our bias is to build OSS software, and to leverage OSS software when possible to achieve our goals.For an example of Runtime Platform's impact on the org, see a recent public presentation about the evolution of RPC and the introduction of "app generation."
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Senior Software Engineer - Runtime Platform


At the heart of Netflix technology is the Cloud Computing platform, which serves as the distributed systems foundation for Netflix application development, and powers the viewing experience of millions of customers every day. This Cloud Platform needs to be highly available at scale, robust and resilient.


In the Runtime Platform team, we are relentlessly focused on creating a simple, intuitive experience for engineers across Netflix to build and operate their applications at scale.  We do this through providing the platform systems that handle all aspects of RPC (inter-service communication), service discovery, dynamic configuration, and the core Java application frameworks used across engineering.  Our bias is to build OSS software, and to leverage OSS software when possible to achieve our goals.


For an example of Runtime Platform's impact on the org, see a recent public presentation about the evolution of RPC and the introduction of "app generation."

  • Own the libraries and frameworks that enable Netflix engineers to build and integrate their highly-available applications into Netflix's massive service-oriented cloud ecosystem.
  • Identify and address the patterns in the application runtime that make it harder for Netflix engineers to productively built and maintain their services at scale.
  • Find innovative new ways to reduce the complexity of the services people build.
  • Take responsibility helping engineers understand and adopt best-practices as we evolve the platform.
  • Own and operate our team's own highly-available infrastructure services (service discovery & dynamic configuration).
    • Key responsibilities:
  • Experience building highly-available services at scale
  • Experience creating and evolving platform libraries/services used by other engineers
  • Experience driving adoption of new technology into existing complex systems
  • Passion for understanding how others build services, and for helping understand and adopt our evolving best-practices.
    • Attributes we are looking for:


    Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  Learn more by reading about it here!

Singapore, Singapore Content Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, APAC Content FP&A


Our members love content. In 2017, Netflix has spent billions of dollars on acquiring and programming content in every window for every taste -- from brand new, never-before-seen Originals to timeless classics that are watched over and over again. In order to build the best service in the world, we look for the best and brightest to drive the analytics behind our strategic business decisions. Netflix operates a financially complex business and believes that it derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing the company.


The Content Planning & Analysis team is looking for a Manager to join its financial planning team. The role will be an integrated business partner to the APAC content acquisition team and be responsible for the financial planning activities related to the company's growing content library. The manager position will reside within the company's Singapore based content management team, work closely with both the Vice President and Director of Content FP&A, and be responsible for building strong financial processes within the region.  This is a newly formed team, previously budgeting and forecasting activities were managed from LA.  It is likely that the team will need additional resources, which would report into this role.


Job Responsibilities

  • Lead the global consolidation of programming expense and cash payments across a broad range of content categories including original productions, film, series, unscripted, and local language content throughout Asia.
  • Preparing guidance and financial update materials for content leads and corporate FP&A team to identify potential shortfalls or surpluses
  • Maintaining schedule of estimated future contractual commitments for accurate disclosure in financial statements and proper capital planning
  • Partnering with finance team to review and modify accounting policies related to amortization and allocation of content rights      

    • P&L and cash management
  • Working with senior leadership within the content organization to translate strategic initiatives into multi-year roadmap with complete cost and capital requirements
  • Preparing dynamic scenario analysis to facilitate discussion when faced with economic trade-offs  

    • Long-range planning and scenario analysis
  • Developing KPIs, metrics and dashboards to understand current programming mix
  • Providing recommendations on how to adjust future spending to track towards investment goals across content categories and geographies  

    • Resource allocation and optimization
  • Working with developers and outside vendors to design and enhance systems to ensure timely, accurate and complete information sharing
  • Improving processes to scale with the growth in original productions and commissions   

    • Process improvement and systems integration
  • Candidates are required to be highly analytical and be strong, effective communicators. Prior experience in corporate finance, investment banking or public accounting preferred. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of superior financial and strategic analysis and delivering actionable recommendations based on this analysis.   
  • The successful candidate must display initiative in anticipating and exceeding the business demands of senior-level business managers. He/She must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.   
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, and be able to work effectively autonomously.   
  • 5 to 10 years of experience in corporate finance, investment bank and/or public accounting   
  • Willingness to travel throughout APAC and globally for business meetings required
  • Prior experience in Media/Entertainment/Tech is a plus

Mumbai, India Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Marketing Planning & Analysis - India


India is one of the highest priority markets for Netflix globally. After launching in market in Jan 2016, the company has grown significantly and gained strong traction with Indian consumers. As our business continues to grow and expand in India, the marketing leadership relies heavily on the Marketing Planning & Analysis (MP&A) team to inform important business decisions with actionable data-driven insights, and we are looking for a talented addition to this team.


In this role, you will need to be highly analytical, a strong problem solver and effective communicator. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results.


The team needs a self-starter, who is able to work effectively, autonomously and drive projects with the India Marketing and Communications teams and cross-functionally with Consumer Insights, Business Development, Science & Algorithms, Payments, etc. You must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers.


The position is based at our India headquarters in Mumbai and involves close coordination with members of the MP&A and marketing teams in both Asia and the US. You will report to the Senior Manager, Marketing Planning & Analysis for APAC, based in Singapore, and will be a key thought partner and go-to person for the Marketing, Social and PR Managers of Netflix India.

  • Perform strategic value-added analyses around growth opportunities, marketing campaigns, media optimization, and core business metrics.
  • Develop actionable digital analytics insights to increase campaign performance.
  • Facilitate marketing planning and the allocation of the marketing budget, and manage in-quarter optimization and adjustments.
  • Monitor subscriber acquisition and retention; analyze key predictors, identify trends and present actionable insights to the Marketing team.
  • Develop insights to support our continued international expansion.
  • Conduct market research, track and compile industry trends and competitive analysis to inform marketing strategies.
  • You will autonomously lead projects from start to finish (i.e., identify areas of opportunity, structure analyses, gather data, generate insights and communicate findings, influence and help partners and stakeholders with execution).
    • About the job:
  • A successful candidate will have a strong track record of identifying key questions, connecting the dots, performing analyses independently, and communicating findings in a clear and concise way.
  • He/she must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers.
  • 4-7 years of experience in a highly analytical environment - top management consulting firm, corporate planning and/or analysis in an entertainment/digital media company, or similarly demanding environment in which modeling and strategic thinking and analyses are performed.
  • Proven track record and enthusiasm for complex problem solving utilizing financial modeling and analysis, including great Excel skills.
  • Strong capabilities for crafting and presenting analyses and insights to senior executives.
  • History of self starting initiatives and an enthusiasm for creating their own work.
  • International experience a plus; you are enthusiastic about working with our partners in both Asia and the US.
  • Top-tier education; MBA a plus (or equivalent years of relevant experience).
  • Prior work experience in Media/Entertainment industry or working in/with Marketing a plus (digital marketing analytics experience a strong plus).
    • About you:

text: Director, Business and Legal Affairs, Kids and Family Programming

Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Dubbing Operations Specialist


The Opportunity
The Dubbing Operations team is responsible for getting those amazing programs to Netflix’s growing international audience. Centered around dubbing/VO production, a great team environment, and cutting-edge technology, this group is critical to our ability to providing the best dubbed experience to our global subscribers. International Dubbing is responsible for supervising all aspects of dubbing production working closely with our Content Creative, Physical Production, and Product Operations teams.


The Role
The ideal candidate is organized and thrives managing a multitude of projects while safeguarding that all requirements are met cross-functionally. You will be working on Netflix's growing catalog, including our Original content, and overseeing the launch and progress of all dubbed assets. Managing dubbing operations includes ensuring external partners have all the working materials needed as well as monitor that all dubbing assets are delivered while taking into account cross-functional timelines and launch dates. Effectiveness is your mission and scalability your passion.

  • Oversee multiple large-scale dubbing projects across a wide range of vendors and languages
  • Build strong relationships with dub studios around the world
  • Maintain communication with post production, editorial and sound teams to ensure the distribution of materials for localization
  • Request bids from our dubbing partners and oversee work assignment as well as facilitate financial tracking and oversight

  • Make sound independent decisions, and know when to escalate issues
  • Advocate, understand, communicate, and exemplify the company's values
    • In this role you will:

  • Prior experience in managing dubbing workflows in the entertainment industry
  • Highly analytical and able to get to the root cause of a problem; able to creatively figure out a solution or propose changes to existing workflows as required
  • Adaptability and resilience to quick changes in priorities, technology, tools and workflow

text: Senior Software Engineer - Partner Workforce Engineering
description: The Netflix service delights more than 100 millions of members around the world with lots of great content, original movies “Bright” and TV shows like "13 Reasons Why" and "Stranger Things", including reboot of old favorites like "Arrested Development" and "Gilmore Girls." As Netflix expands its streaming experience globally, we are faced with complex problems and unique challenges to rapidly and efficiently acquire content. In order to deliver an exciting and engaging experience to millions of users worldwide, we need to be able to capture and curate hundreds of thousands of media assets in a wide variety of types & variations (such as video source files, display imagery, localized audio and subtitles). Netflix scales its content acquisition by working with Partners. Partner Workforce Engineering is responsible to build tools to onboard these partners and freelancers, evaluate and score them, use the scores to build smart routing to direct content requests, do capacity management and scheduling. This ensures high quality and error free deliveries into the Netflix Supply Chain. Our team's focus is on enabling Netflix to quickly add exciting content to its rapidly growing catalog.

description: The complexity and the uniqueness of the Japanese market means there’s so much more to do, and in order to continue to build an outstanding organization, we are growing our own Talent Acquisition team. As a Recruiter based at our Tokyo Office, you will have an outsized impact on Netflix’s success, via the caliber of talent you are able to attract. Talent Acquisition is a massive priority for us, and we operate in a unique environment in which hiring the best -- versus “making the hire” -- is the north star. In order to thrive then, Recruiters need to be deeply expert in the roles they hire, and in the in’s and out’s of the businesses they partner with. They’re able to define what “the best” looks like for a given role and market; to find elite talent; and to constantly drive on the business at every stage of the hiring process -- intake meeting, hiring sync, offer generation, close -- in order to make amazing hires.

text: Senior Product QA Engineer - Messaging Engineering
description: Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with more than 100 million members worldwide enjoying billions of hours of TV shows and movies per month. The Netflix Messaging Engineering team builds the platform, applications, and messages to communicate with Netflix customers across their entire lifecycle.  From  acquisition and onboarding to account changes and personalized content recommendations, the messaging team handles millions of messages a day in almost every country.We send messages across both outbound and in-app messaging channels, including email, push notifications, sms, voice calls, ott apps, and in-app notifications that reach members across a variety of devices. If you have a passion for testing innovative consumer facing products and experiences, enjoy connecting the dots, and using data to drive engineering decisions, this role on the Netflix Messaging Engineering team could be perfect for you. What we do ...Our focus is creating and running Messaging Experience A/B Tests that aim to delight and retain existing members, acquire new customers, and bring back members who have previously enjoyed Netflix. We build these experiences across both outbound and in-product channels, including Emails, Push Notifications, SMS, Voice Calls, Messaging Apps, and In-App Notifications that reach millions of members across a multitude of devices. We test these experiences across multiple dimensions including audience, design, copy, content, timing, frequency, and channels. What you will do ...At Netflix, messaging is part of the core Netflix product. We are unique in the Netflix product as one of few teams that can speak to our customers outside of the Netflix app.  As a senior software engineer in test on this team, you will partner with product managers, designers, developers, and data analysts and help shape and drive the direction of the product. Your passionate ideas are encouraged and expected. You will own the testing strategy, plan, and execution of these experiences that touch outbound channels such as email and push notifications as well  as in product notifications in the Netflix app across a multitude of devices. You will work with our various engineering partners to build automation whenever possible to help the team be nimble while balancing the high quality expected in the Netflix product.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Senior Product QA Engineer - Messaging Engineering


Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with more than 100 million members worldwide enjoying billions of hours of TV shows and movies per month.


The Netflix Messaging Engineering team builds the platform, applications, and messages to communicate with Netflix customers across their entire lifecycle.  From  acquisition and onboarding to account changes and personalized content recommendations, the messaging team handles millions of messages a day in almost every country.


We send messages across both outbound and in-app messaging channels, including email, push notifications, sms, voice calls, ott apps, and in-app notifications that reach members across a variety of devices.


If you have a passion for testing innovative consumer facing products and experiences, enjoy connecting the dots, and using data to drive engineering decisions, this role on the Netflix Messaging Engineering team could be perfect for you.


What we do ...
Our focus is creating and running Messaging Experience A/B Tests that aim to delight and retain existing members, acquire new customers, and bring back members who have previously enjoyed Netflix. We build these experiences across both outbound and in-product channels, including Emails, Push Notifications, SMS, Voice Calls, Messaging Apps, and In-App Notifications that reach millions of members across a multitude of devices. We test these experiences across multiple dimensions including audience, design, copy, content, timing, frequency, and channels.


What you will do ...
At Netflix, messaging is part of the core Netflix product. We are unique in the Netflix product as one of few teams that can speak to our customers outside of the Netflix app.  As a senior software engineer in test on this team, you will partner with product managers, designers, developers, and data analysts and help shape and drive the direction of the product. Your passionate ideas are encouraged and expected. You will own the testing strategy, plan, and execution of these experiences that touch outbound channels such as email and push notifications as well  as in product notifications in the Netflix app across a multitude of devices. You will work with our various engineering partners to build automation whenever possible to help the team be nimble while balancing the high quality expected in the Netflix product.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Director, Events - Originals Publicity


With a growing slate of new projects coming to Netflix, we are looking to fill a role on our publicity team for an events director. We are looking for a grown up, someone who enjoys strategizing and implementing events, and understands that as this group falls under the publicity umbrella and that we see events as a beat in our larger media-driven campaigns. This is a very hands-on role, one that will expect you to both be able to oversee, inspire others with guidance and vision, while also “doing” the work. You should know the playbook backwards and forwards, then we will challenge you to throw that playbook out the window, and push you to innovate with us.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 118 million streaming members in over 190 countries.


The Role
The Director, Events will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing events with the series, documentary and film teams. They will manage a growing team of professionals and be able to drive press/media strategy as it relates to events. The ideal candidate has worked handling premiere (large and small) and awards events for film, TV or entertainment brands, and they have managed growing teams. He/she will be able to communicate with filmmakers, talent representatives, agencies, executives and production partners on efforts. They can formulate, oversee and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because domestic and international travel is a requirement. The ideal candidate is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks
strategically. He/she is not defined by past experiences and eager to put a new spin on what an event can be. (This is real important to us and it should be very important to you!) They can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer, and is able to multi-task and work at a clip pace. Most importantly, they can guide a team to do all of the same and work as autonomous adults. They are organized, thorough and not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that will mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from hiring an agency to plan an event, to maintaining and updating guest lists, to booking a venue themselves for an event or to working a check-in table. They collaborate well with partners that range from the publicists overseeing global strategy to content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and even though
they lead the team, they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and questions values inconsistent with our values. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues.


Qualifications
The successful candidate for Director, Events will have 10+ years of entertainment experience in an agency, studio, network or production company setting. International experience is a bonus. BA/BS required.


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.


Reporting Relationship
The Director of Events reports to the Director of Creative Communications and Industry Relations

As a member of the Policy Escalations team, you will analyze and respond to inquiries regarding Netflix’s privacy practices, produce data for law enforcement requests, perform CS tool evaluations, and provide support to our CS network on matters of Brand protection and other organizational practices.


We are seeking someone who is detail-oriented, has strong judgement, and demonstrates the willingness to get things done. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization and work on a variety of sensitive issues.


The position is based in Los Gatos and reports to the Manager of Policy Escalations and will work in close collaboration with Legal teams, product/engineering, and other cross-functional teams to carry out his/her responsibilities.

  • Partner with the Data Privacy and Security Legal Team on privacy/data protection requests
  • Act as  first point of contact for privacy/data protection inquiries and will investigate and triage where necessary
  • Compile data in accordance with applicable laws and Netflix’s terms of service.
  • Partner with the Law Enforcement and Global Compliance Legal teams on legal requests
  • Communicate both verbally and in writing to law enforcement authorities, consumers, and other Netflix teams
  • Work and communicate cross-functionally with different teams to evaluate, investigate, triage and articulate complex issues in a concise and succinct manner

  • Self-starter who can work independently in an ambiguous landscape
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to review data and identify trends
  • Ability to maintain a positive and constructive attitude, communicate effectively in difficult or high stress situations
  • Receptive to and able to appropriately incorporate feedback to continuously improve workflows and processes
  • Prior significant experience supporting in-house privacy/data protection teams
  • Substantive knowledge of US privacy and security laws as well as a working knowledge of international privacy and data protection laws
  • Ability to communicate and explain legal requirements clearly and effectively
  • Ability to adapt to business needs and thrives in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities
  • 3+ Working knowledge of data protection, information security and brand protection a plus
  • Foreign language fluency (particularly in German, Brazilian Portuguese, and/or Korean) a plus

The Netflix Global Ad Operations team is responsible for architecting and activating all digital media campaigns (including RTB, paid social and reserve media) in support of our campaigns throughout the world. Reporting into the Senior Manager, Global Digital Production, the Global Ad Operations Lead will play a pivotal role in ensuring effective and efficient execution workflow within our campaign operations. With continued international expansion of our marketing strategies and a growing slate of original series and films, it's a great time to join Netflix.

  • Manage the trafficking, set-up and QA of our digital media campaigns for a specific region or set of campaigns
  • Proactively seek out ways to solve for some of our inefficiencies. For example, identify areas in our workflow where an inordinate amount of time is spent on manual, non-value add work and propose potential resolutions.
  • Identify ways to unlock value further upstream in our digital campaign planning, set-up, and optimization processes
  • Maintain a strong relationship with 3rd party ad serving partners, staying abreast on the latest trafficking solutions and certification processes
  • Continually push smooth integration of new creative formats and 3rd party partner technologies
  • Identify and report ad platform UI bugs to ad platform engineers and troubleshoot for resolution
  • Assist programmatic campaign managers and external agency partners with technical issues related to ad serving, tracking, and creative compliance
    • Responsibilities:
  • Experience in ad operations and trafficking with a strong understanding of implementation factors, quality assurance best practices and legal standards
  • Strong technical mind and background. Ability to delve into technical conversations with our ad technology, data science and engineering teams.
  • 3-5 years of Digital Marketing experience
  • Exposure to/experience with programmatic marketing systems (DSP, DMP, ad serving, Social Ads API Platforms, etc.)
  • Familiarity with at least one web debugging tool (Charles, Fiddler, Httpfox, Chrome Developer Tools)
  • Experience with testing new ad product solutions and managing new ad technology platform integrations or migrations
  • Strong grasp of digital marketing best practices
  • Experience working in in Doubleclick Campaign Manager
  • Experience with additional 3rd party ad servers as a strong plus (rich media display, video, mobile)
  • Experience with/exposure to machine-learning-based testing and setting up multivariable & A/B tests within various ad serving platforms
  • Experience with dynamic ad serving and DCO a plus
  • Extraordinarily organized with a strong attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills - as the go-to person for our campaign execution, strong communication skills are a prerequisite for success.
    • Qualifications:
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing and paid social creative.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Production Manager, Post Production - Original Series


We are seeking an experienced Post Production Manager to help manage the owned original series vertical from a post perspective, establish and curate vendor & editorial crew relations, review budgets and support/suggest best practices for post from pre-production through delivery. This position will report to Physical Production in Los Angeles. Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of post production for our owned and licensed original series.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in 190 countries.  With a global reach, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Technical Setup of Show
• Work with Studio Technologies, Post & external production team on defining key 4K dailies and post workflows such as camera capture, HDR color pipeline, master delivery, and final archive.


Budgeting
• Work with Post Supervisors to prepare and vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback internally and externally on viability and risks
• Review creative/scripts & begin defining post budget
• Collaborate with internal/external teams to lock budget
• Track & manage all post related costs, keeping stakeholders apprised of statusUpdate cost reports and trackers on a weekly basis
• Review & approve POs for key post budget items (i.e.: dub stage, DI facility, sound editorial) for Studio productions


Post Scheduling
• Create/Help inform and draft post scheduleCollaborate with internal teams (including Distribution and Localization) & external production team to lock schedule
• Troubleshoot and communicate all changes to schedule to internal/external teams


Staffing/Vendors
• Lead or assist with search and hire of key show post staff
• Determine key post vendors to accommodate creative vision and relationships, tax incentives, budget needs, location issues
• Help maintain/curate preferred vendor list


Content Management
• Set up and attend key creative approval sessions such as final mix playbacks, VFX reviews or color correction reviews
• Schedule and attend Netflix screenings, previews, premieres, etc. Collaborate with show post on setting up theater, arranging engineering when necessary, and rehearsing the content when applicable


Qualifications:
• BA/BS Degree
• 10 Years + as an experienced Post Production Supervisor on a freelance or staff basis having worked with medium and high budget studio, major production company and network series and films
• Ability to handle a fast paced environment supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery)
• Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both HDR and 4K
• Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
• Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting
• Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
• Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
• Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process
• Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

Los Angeles, California Content Production Technical Operations Specialist, Digital Production Assets and Delivery


As Netflix expands its global content creation footprint, we are increasing our investment in original content production across multiple content verticals (features, scripted and unscripted series, documentaries, comedies, etc).  The Post Production team seeks a Specialist to join us in pioneering new and innovative methods of managing digital production assets and delivery.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day. With continued international expansion and a move into original film acquisition and production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
The Specialist, Post Production Delivery & Assets supports Netflix Post Production and Visual Effects teams and helps improve the flow of media from remote productions into the studio archive.

  • Assist in the organization and flow of assets from productions to Netflix’s shared workspaces and archive.
  • Maintain, update, champion the use of our internal content hub to track and manage show asset & paperwork delivery to Netflix.
  • Assist post production team as they audit completion/delivery of post production materials during prep, production, archive and wrap.
  • Liaise with post production teams and partner with Engineering Support to ensure successful onboarding of shows and personnel into Netflix systems, and on-going operational support
  • Work with productions and vendor partners to ensure network connectivity and collaborative infrastructure for post workflows.
  • Produce and maintain accurate reporting of key Production metrics such as status, schedule and validation of production assets and Content Hub uploads
  • Liaise with post production teams and vendors to track productions as they move into delivery stage, and assist in scheduling and prioritizing upload to Content Hub of archive digital assets swiftly, accurately and securely
  • Liaise with post production teams to assist in scheduling and prioritizing delivery of physical production assets to archive, maintaining accurate inventory.
  • Liaise with localization, distribution and marketing internal Netflix partners and vendors to ensure smooth and secure distribution of assets as requiredTrack invoices and create Purchase Orders.
  • Respond to technical and logistical issues related to delivery and manage through completion.
    • Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, effective communicator and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.
  • 4+ years of experience within a medium to high budget studio, network or high volume production company
  • BA/BS Degree
  • Background in editing or supervision, including AVID and other NLE systems required.
  • Knowledge of VFX pipelines and technology helpful.
  • Knowledge of IT network configuration and data management helpful.
  • Familiarity with production and post software such as Shotgun, Pix, as well as newer cloud platforms helpful.
  • Strong organizational and creative problem solving skills with proactive mentality.
  • Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K and HDR
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
  • Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting
  • Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
  • Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
  • Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail
    • Experience and Qualifications


    Compensation
    Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

Los Angeles, California Content Production Technical Solutions Developer


The Role


The Technical Solutions Developer will be working with the business users from various studio departments and enterprise application engineers. With the rapid growth of studio, this role will be responsible for providing a quick/short-term solution to automate highly manual process until the features are evaluated and incorporated into the enterprise ecosystem. Alphaville, Brazil Content Production Regional Security Manager, ​LATAM​


This is your chance to be on the ground floor with a team that is transforming entertainment through original production.  Fueled by the broad appeal of the instantaneous enjoyment of movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to over 100 million members in over 190 countries. With our increasing slate of originals, it's a great time to join Netflix.


Located in the Netflix Sao Paulo office, the Regional Security Manager plans and directs the Netflix security function for the LATAM region under senior management guidance.  Responsible for the development and implementation of the Regional strategic and tactical security planning initiatives to reduce risks, respond to incidents and limit exposure to liability. Ensure that a coordinated security program is successfully executed across the region.  Serves as the most senior authority in regional security matters.  

  • Accountable for the overall strategic planning and implementation of the Regional risk reduction standards and procedures.
  • Identifies significant security risks, designs and implements strategies and programs to safeguard employees as well as prevent and reduce loss to the company’s assets.
  • Directs efforts in the identification of trends or patterns of existent, suspected or potential loss of corporate assets.
  • Develops and manages resource networks in support of regional risk assessments, investigations, intelligence, security systems architecture/design and other programs and services evaluated as enhancements to the security function.
  • Researches and deploys state-of-the-art technology solutions and innovative security management techniques to safeguard the company’s employees, core business, information, and reputation.
  • Briefs senior and executive management on status of regional security issues.
  • Develops and maintains close relationships with high-level law enforcement, intelligence, and private sector counterparts to include in-country and international security agencies.
  • Develops and directs the communications and response process for rapid deployment of information and resources in the event of emergencies and/or security related activity in the region.
  • Develop and implement security education and awareness programs at all organizational levels within the region.
  • Support the special events staff in their efforts to provide appropriate levels of security to all region premieres, junkets, screenings and talent close protection.   
  • Support production regionally.  Provide risk analysis, security recommendations, and vetted local security providers.
  • Support Studio Content Security efforts in the region by; liaising with local productions and content handling vendors, and providing security guidance as directed by Studio Content Security Manager.
    • RESPONSIBILITIES
  • This position requires a high degree of sound, independent judgment and capability.  The incumbent will provide leadership and innovative, world class security solutions to unique, spontaneous and business critical issues that influence the security of employees, as well as the protection of in Region Productions, and facilities.
  • The candidate will have significant experience managing complex security issues confronting corporate organizations in the LATAM region.
  • Ten plus years of management experience in corporate security demonstrating increasing levels of responsibility within an international corporate environment, ideally with a background in the customs, law enforcement or military sectors.
  • Proven ability to influence, manage, and lead others in a complex and diverse work environment.
  • Expert knowledge of specific requirements imposed by various regional government agencies, consulting with members of the global security function, as well as consulting with regional LOB’s and personnel to mitigate security issues.
  • Demonstrated analytical skills necessary for the collection of data and production of security metrics.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage projects internationally.
  • Demonstrated technical depth and breadth of knowledge of security management concepts.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of risk assessment techniques.
  • Highly ethical, with demonstrated ability to handle highly sensitive/confidential information.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and managing an international multi-vendor/consultant network.
  • Demonstrated presentation skills to senior and executive management.
  • Demonstrated ability to make sound decisions in stressful situations.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English. Portuguese and Spanish language skills are an advantage.
    • KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED
  • Bachelor’s degree or international equivalent. Graduate degree preferred.
  • Certified Protection Professional (CPP) preferred.
  • Certified Fraud Examiner(CFE) preferred.
    • EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND

With over 109 million members at the end of Q3 ‘17, and a content budget of $7B in 2018, we continue to look for the best and brightest to lead the analytics that drive strategic business decisions.The Content Strategy & Analysis team is looking for a Senior Manager to join its Singapore-based team. Singapore, Singapore Content Financial Planning and Analysis Senior Manager, Content Strategy & Analysis - APAC


Netflix now operates in all countries around the globe (except China and those sanctioned by the US Government - North Korea, Syria and Crimea). With over 109 million members at the end of Q3 ‘17, and a content budget of $7B in 2018, we continue to look for the best and brightest to lead the analytics that drive strategic business decisions.


The Content Strategy & Analysis team is looking for a Senior Manager to join its Singapore-based team. This team is responsible for developing strategic insights to further the company's Asian content efforts, with a specific focus on valuation, programming strategy and industry intelligence. The team is highly visible across the company and senior leadership relies heavily on the Content Strategy & Analysis team to inform important business decisions.


This role will reside in Netflix’s Singapore office.

  • Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects in partnership with the Creative, Business Affairs and Content Acquisition teams.
  • Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators.
  • Develop deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities.
  • Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders.
  • Develop and manage associate(s) on the team: establish priorities, set objectives, and provide guidance and feedback.
    • Responsibilities:
  • 8-12 years of experience in finance, strategy, and/or consulting roles. For candidates with MBAs, typically we would look for candidates with 3-6 years post-MBA experience.
  • Strong passion for content.
  • Strong communication/presentation skills with experience presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management.
  • Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis.
  • The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. He or she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. The ideal candidate would be prepared to regularly "roll up their sleeves" to perform more routine tasks in the same day that they are asked to prepare analysis and a presentation to the executives of the company. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, and be able to work effectively autonomously.
  • Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages.
  • Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. MBA a plus but not required.

Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR Marketing AV / Post-Production Producer - APAC Marketing Operations


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Operations at Netflix brings creative concepts and strategy to life at global scale through technical innovation. We’re breaking new ground in Asia, and we want like-minded individuals who want to be apart of this revolutionary journey.


To support our expansion, we are looking for a very senior and seasoned, dynamic AV / Post-Production Producer. You would be both hands-on as well as being responsible for managing end-to-end production processes, and drive technical scalable solutions for all our AV marketing needs in the APAC region.


You understand AV Versioning, Finishing and Localisation workflows and excel in managing a large volume of assets in a high-speed, high-performance environment. This means you thrive in a fast-paced environment that requires you to bridge creative, project management and technical needs, whilst being a force of calm and good judgment. You are an adaptable person who revels in change.


Please include a link to your current reel of work.


The Role
Based in Singapore and reporting to the Senior Manager of APAC Marketing Operations, you will be responsible for driving AV production, building scale, and collaborating cross-functionally with internal partners dedicated to creative, media, regional marketing across both Global and Regional teams.

  • Source, Finish and Localize Marketing AV assets for our Global and Regional teams.
  • Able to identify and display strong judgement in order to solve for delivery issues.
  • Know when to switch between being hands-on on urgent tasks and managing both internal and external partners on projects.
  • Own day-to-day communication and escalation with internal AV producer-peers, and external production agencies in order to efficiently manage campaigns and key technical initiatives.
  • Plan and manage internal and external AV production / post-production communication and workflow, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and asset deliverables.
  • Shepherd scope, budget and overall production resources. Responsible for financial planning, and vendor relationship management.
  • Liaise with with external studio partners to source accurate and consistent AV deliverables to facilitate downstream production work.
  • Manage our AV production agency network to assure that we eliminate bottlenecks and produce high-quality creative with appropriate velocity.
  • Subject-matter expert on the latest trends in creative video technologies, new video formats, and global social video ecosystem for paid social platforms.
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines.
  • Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all tracking is implemented correctly, efficiently, deadlines are met, and executions are flawless for scalable and pan-regional campaigns.
  • Work closely with the global & local teams, supporting local implementation and leveraging materials to deploy regional marketing experiences and creative extensions.
  • Strong sense of ownership and maintains a high-level of quality control finesse.
    • Responsibilities include:
  • 8+ of AV Post Production & Servicing experience, with an emphasis on short form content at scale, creative & operational workflows, finishing, and localization.
  • From entertainment studio, post-production house or creative content agency.
  • Experience managing high volume global creative campaigns in parallel, collaborating with diverse geographically dispersed teams to deliver offline and digital video marketing materials.
  • Understanding of the latest AV software, formats and tooling advancements, including Adobe Creative Suite, 4K and HD.
  • Advanced fluency in AV types and formats while understanding the fundamentals of assets management, servicing and trafficking.
  • Proficient in Localization workflows, including graphic packages, subtitling and subtitling/dubbing of short-form content marketing materials.
  • Experience managing a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams.
  • Advance fluency in scalable trafficking and dispatching platforms across Asia, including broadcast TV, cinema, and various privately owned digital out-of-home.
  • Strong network of regional partners and vendors who can help scale efficiently and effectively.
  • Expert in regional AV government and private media clearance practices.
  • Leadership experience is a bonus.
  • Advanced English fluency is mandatory.
  • Fluency in either Korean, Thai, Bahasa Melayu, Cantonese is a bonus although not a requirement.
    • Qualifications:
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing and paid social creative.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and leadership in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are always-solving and forever curious. Equip with positive attitude and possess the ability to motivate partners and vendors in challenging situations.  
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!

text: Business Development Director - Spain, Portugal and Italy
description: Netflix has built a number of partnerships with companies, from mobile and fixed line network operators to Consumer Electronic device manufacturers and distributors, that help us deliver this service around the world. These partnerships have been instrumental in accelerating Netflix’s global growth story. The Business Development team is responsible for leading these partnerships, working closely with colleagues across Netflix to deliver efficient and effective outcomes for Netflix and our partners.As Netflix continues to grow we are looking to hire a new Director of Business Development who will be responsible for building partnerships so that customers can discover, sign up for and watch Netflix through many different screens and services. The candidate should be able to determine which are the right partners, to build the necessary relationships and lead the team through the deal process. Amsterdam, Netherlands Business Development Business Development Business Development Director - Spain, Portugal and Italy


Netflix has built a number of partnerships with companies, from mobile and fixed line network operators to Consumer Electronic device manufacturers and distributors, that help us deliver this service around the world. These partnerships have been instrumental in accelerating Netflix’s global growth story. The Business Development team is responsible for leading these partnerships, working closely with colleagues across Netflix to deliver efficient and effective outcomes for Netflix and our partners.


As Netflix continues to grow we are looking to hire a new Director of Business Development who will be responsible for building partnerships so that customers can discover, sign up for and watch Netflix through many different screens and services. The candidate should be able to determine which are the right partners, to build the necessary relationships and lead the team through the deal process. The candidate will then continue to lead the relationships in the longer term, helping the partnership evolve and helping colleagues in the US and EMEA to evaluate the different opportunities that arise.


We are looking for a stand out Business Development Director, who is passionate about Internet TV and has a fantastic track record in building high value, long lasting, international partnerships.


The role will primarily focus on partnerships in Spain, Portugal and Italy , reporting into the VP, Business Development EMEA and will be based in Amsterdam.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities
•You will manage our partnerships with ISPs, PayTV operators and MNOs and Consumer Electronic partners in Spain, Portugal and Italy, building out the partnerships and working with colleagues in Product, Marketing, Network and Payments to find new ways to drive Netflix membership and viewing in an efficient manner.
•You will also look to develop these relationships into new territories where the partners operate, using Netflix’s global scale to create growth efficiently.
•You will explore new relationships in these territories and in new territories that can help drive membership and viewing in an efficient manner, and that can be scaled across multiple territories.


The Ideal Candidate
•Available to relocate to Amsterdam.
•Strong fit with Netflix culture.
•Proficiency in English, Spanish and Italian is a must.
•Strong experience in Business Development in the MVPD, ISP, CE or adjacent industries, with stand out performance.
•Experience of / deep understanding of retail environment for CE and MVPD/MNO desirable.
•Technical and/or content background desirable.
•Deep understanding of VOD landscape.
*Understanding of, and ability to work closely with, marketing and product colleagues.
•Passion for managing international partnerships.
•Strong performer with high level of self-organization and prioritization abilities.
•Prepared for significant travel.

description: The complexity and the uniqueness of the Japanese market means there’s so much more to do at Netflix Japan, and in order to continue to build an outstanding organization, we are growing our own Talent Acquisition team. Tokyo, Japan Talent and Recruiting Human Resources Recruiting Researcher, Japan


The complexity and the uniqueness of the Japanese market means there’s so much more to do at Netflix Japan, and in order to continue to build an outstanding organization, we are growing our own Talent Acquisition team. As a Recruiter based at our Tokyo Office, you will have an outsized impact on Netflix’s success, via the caliber of talent you are able to attract. 


Talent Acquisition is a massive priority for us, and we operate in a unique environment in which hiring the best -- versus “making the hire” -- is the north star. In order to thrive then, Researchers need to be deeply expert in the roles they hire, and in the in’s and out’s of the businesses they partner with. They’re able to define what “the best” looks like for a given role and market; to find elite talent; and to constantly drive on the business at every stage of the hiring process -- intake meeting, hiring sync, offer generation, close -- in order to make amazing hires.  


The right person has 3-6 years of experience in recruiting and/or research, ideally with experience in global, high-growth and ever-changing roles.

  • Engage key business partners in order to understand the needs of different hiring teams.
  • Define and own the search strategy for attracting top candidates, across competitive research, profile development, networking and direct sourcing.
  • Use market expertise, data, and business acumen to educate and influence hiring managers on how to identify and hire the best talent.
  • Work closely with recruiters to to establish strong, give-and-take partnerships with the businesses we support.
  • Set the agenda for hiring syncs with managers, and own the flow and outcomes of those meetings
  • Ensure candidates understand the opportunity they’re exploring, as well as our culture.
  • Conduct interviews with candidates; pass strong ones directly to hiring managers for interviews.
  • Network and maintain relationships with key talent pools, for short and long-term opportunities.
  • As part of a tightly integrated, global Talent team, partner with peers around the world to contribute to the broader Netflix Talent Acquisition effort.

    • More about the role:
  • Excited to be a part of a unique, high performance culture, the foundations of which are freedom, responsibility and impact
  • A learner, motivated by growth and excited by working with others from whom you can learn 
  • Deeply curious about what makes different businesses tick, allowing you to be effective in supporting different roles and functions in a growing region
  • Tenacious in the pursuit of stellar talent, and creative in using different search strategies and channels, as needed
  • A mature professional, able to keep what is best for Netflix, front and center.
  • Self-directed; unambiguously able to own and drive your work, and to take advantage of the autonomy Netflix allows 
  • Someone who thrives in a fast-paced, quickly-changing environment
  • Someone who enjoys the challenges of hunting for great people
  • Fluent in English and Japanese.

text: Senior Product Designer, Partner Device Lifecycle
description: Netflix runs its applications on a diverse range of devices including smartphones, tablets, game consoles, Smart TVs, and a variety of consumer electronic products. As a result, Netflix works closely with a variety of partners to integrate and launch Netflix applications on these devices, and to ensure that Netflix members have a great experience watching all movies and shows. Imagine the complexity and cost of managing all the aspects of the relationship with these partners on both the business and technical sides. Here at Netflix, we live to push the bar higher and solve problems like these.To help facilitate the relationship and workflow with these partners, we have built a range of tools, some partner-facing and some internally-focused. Our solution is built on the Netflix Ecosystem toolset, which gives our partners access to some amazing tools and services. As a member of the Partner Ecosystems Tools team, you will work with many teams and touch practically all aspects of Netflix services.This web application toolset includes:• “Internet of Things (IOT)” devices - a set of devices to aid in the automation of consumer electronics.• Analytics - a real time analytics tool that allows users to quickly see trends in millions of records of test data that is cross-referenced across several databases . • Netflix Test Studio - a powerful device testing suite that enables hundreds of devices to be tested from anywhere in the world. • Partner Device Portal - a comprehensive CRM system that provides administrative interfaces for the settings and properties of all devices, which serves as the gateway for all devices into Netflix. The tools that we are building are a key differentiator in the marketplace for Netflix. As a Senior User Experience Designer, you will craft the next generation of these tools, ensure they help our varied users achieve their goals, and drive a coherent visual and interactive design across them. You will be key in driving new initiatives on the team and in collaborating with engineers and our stakeholders to develop and iterate upon new concepts.

This empowerment comes with maximizing efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.
