text: Distributed Systems Engineer - Playback Data Systems
description: Netflix is leading the disruption of linear television and has the largest subscription based streaming entertainment service. It has 117+ million subscribers in 190+ countries and across thousands of devices that consume over 140 million hours of video every single day. And we believe that we have just scratched the surface in international markets. One result of all of this usage is lots of rich data to foster data-informed innovation.ImpactThe Playback Data Systems (PDS) team builds and operates infrastructure to collect and  process data about playback experiences. We help power experiences where members can watch movies on their TV and then seamlessly continue watching from where they left off, on a phone while they are on the move. We provide high quality data to our partners that is critical in enhancing playback experience via experimentation, improving discoverability of relevant content via personalized recommendations, assessing and improving system health as well as influencing business partnerships with Netflix device partners.  You can see highlights of some of the team’s work and approaches:Scaling time series data storage (techblog)Netflix’s Viewing Data Microservices (conference talk)Learn more about the team (slideshare)How you will helpAs an engineer on the team you will learn and contribute to handling over 2.5 million events/sec via a scalable cloud based distributed architecture and process multiple TBs/sec of data across thousands of nodes. You will be passionate about ensuring that the data is of high quality so that you and others can reliably use it to deliver business functionality. You will think of creative ways to scale the systems at sub-linear cost by addressing complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive solutions. You will be curious and collaborate with cross functional partners to increase your team’s impact. You will evangelize your solutions and takeaways while actively seeking different perspectives from your team and partners. You will be comfortable making decisions under uncertainty so that others can depend on you to see things through to completion. You will take a lot of pride in your work and will operate what you build.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Distributed Systems Engineer - Playback Data Systems


Netflix is leading the disruption of linear television and has the largest subscription based streaming entertainment service. It has 117+ million subscribers in 190+ countries and across thousands of devices that consume over 140 million hours of video every single day. And we believe that we have just scratched the surface in international markets. One result of all of this usage is lots of rich data to foster data-informed innovation.


Impact
The Playback Data Systems (PDS) team builds and operates infrastructure to collect and  process data about playback experiences. We help power experiences where members can watch movies on their TV and then seamlessly continue watching from where they left off, on a phone while they are on the move. We provide high quality data to our partners that is critical in enhancing playback experience via experimentation, improving discoverability of relevant content via personalized recommendations, assessing and improving system health as well as influencing business partnerships with Netflix device partners.  


You can see highlights of some of the team’s work and approaches:
Scaling time series data storage (techblog)
Netflix’s Viewing Data Microservices (conference talk)
Learn more about the team (slideshare)


How you will help
As an engineer on the team you will learn and contribute to handling over 2.5 million events/sec via a scalable cloud based distributed architecture and process multiple TBs/sec of data across thousands of nodes. You will be passionate about ensuring that the data is of high quality so that you and others can reliably use it to deliver business functionality. You will think of creative ways to scale the systems at sub-linear cost by addressing complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive solutions. You will be curious and collaborate with cross functional partners to increase your team’s impact. You will evangelize your solutions and takeaways while actively seeking different perspectives from your team and partners. You will be comfortable making decisions under uncertainty so that others can depend on you to see things through to completion. You will take a lot of pride in your work and will operate what you build.

  • Building, testing and operating fault tolerant distributed systems.
  • Web services (REST, gRPC), data modeling and communication (JSON/XML)
  • Data structures, object oriented design and programming (Java/C#/C++/etc).
    • We are looking for someone with experience in
  • Handling large datasets using distributed data system techniques such as eventual consistency, partitioning and caching.
  • Pub-sub (Kafka) and stream processing (Spark/Flink/Cloud Dataflow/etc) systems.
  • Cloud based architectures (AWS/Azure/etc)
    • Even better if you have experience with any or all of


    Netflix offers a creative culture that values freedom and responsibility. You can learn more via the Culture At Netflix.

Mumbai, India Marketing and PR Marketing Creative Production Lead, Marketing Operations - India


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Operations at Netflix brings creative concepts and strategy to life at global scale through technical innovation. We’re breaking new ground in Asia, and we want like-minded individuals who want to be apart of this revolutionary journey.


We are looking for a very seasoned, dynamic and effectively bilingual Integrated Producer to lead creative innovation, concepting and production of best-in-class marketing and advertising campaigns for the India (IN). In this role, you will be responsible for leading the end-to-end creative and production processes of our local market campaign initiatives, with a predominant digital, video and social focus. This means you thrive in a fast-paced environment that requires you to bridge BOTH creative and technical needs. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain, and as well as an effective communicator.


The Role
Reporting to the Senior Manager of APAC Marketing Operations, you will join a team of Integrated Producers to lead and manage the production of creative materials for online and offline campaigns in Asia Pacific markets which are tailor made to each country’s needs.

  • Drive creative innovation across India, managing and owning local agency relationships to maintain industry leading creative executions that help further our brand and connect new fans to Netflix Original titles. 
  • Lead, plan and manage internal and external local integrated production communications and workflows, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and assets delivery, whilst always managing expectations.
  • Be an in-market local expert and drive communications and best practices about best-in-market activations, in-market technical capabilities and cultural nuances back with global teams.
  • Manage localization, production process and creative approvals of advertising materials (including clearances, delivery, trafficking, etc.) within India.
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines.
  • Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all tracking is implemented correctly, efficiently, deadlines are met, and executions are flawless.
  • Work closely with the global teams, supporting local implementation of global campaigns, leveraging global materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions.
  • Work closely with the other regional teams, supporting local implementation of other regional campaigns, leveraging regional materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions.
    • Responsibilities include:
  • At least 8 years of experience, preferably at an entertainment brand, advertising or creative content agency with an emphasis on integrated production including online and offline video, high impact display takeovers, rich media, OOH, and paid social campaigns.
  • Expert knowledge of marketing campaign and localization workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for both Video and Digital materials.
  • Ability to translate creative ideas through to technical and native executions, for various ad serving platforms and proprietary publisher platforms.
  • High competency and proven track record of building high performance digital marketing experiences across display, social, mobile and online video channels.
  • Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams, preferably across wider Asia Pacific. Global experience is a bonus.
  • Hands on experience working with Doubleclick and other 3rd party ad serving platforms, QA & trafficking processes and experience troubleshooting directly with local Publisher teams.
  • Knowledgeable of and familiar with leading digital and advertising agencies in India and wider Asia Pacific.
  • Expert knowledge of the trends and limitations of the evolving India digital marketing ecosystem, including exposure to/experience with programmatic buying and paid social platforms.
  • Experience working in India and regional APAC markets. Global experience is a bonus.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Fluency in any of the following languages will be advantageous: Knowledge of local Indian languages

  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing and paid social creative.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and leadership in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are always-solving and forever curious.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!

Netflix International  is looking for a Front Desk coordinator.


This is an exciting opportunity, working in a modern and dynamic environment for a Company that encourages Freedom and Responsibility.  Our European Headquarters is a fast-paced growing operation with a variety of Receptionist/Facilities needs, and we are looking for a hands-on customer focused individual to help keep pace with our growth and exciting work environment.


The successful candidate will be first and foremost proactive and creative with a cheerful disposition.  Reporting  to the Manager of Workplace Operations, the facilities coordinator will act as the first point of contact for the office being stationed at the front desk.

text: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Partner Environment
description: Netflix runs its application on a diverse range of consumer electronic products from smartphones to game consoles. As a result, Netflix works closely with a variety of partners to integrate and launch the Netflix application; This ensures that Netflix members have a great experience steaming our content. Imagine the complexity and cost to ensure all of these devices running the Netflix application are built to the highest standards. Our Partner Environment team is at the center of automation and development for our partners and works to increase levels of quality and decrease friction.   In this role, you will be building out an advanced platform to automate the Netflix experience across the device ecosystem.  This platform is made up of a series of hardware, software and cloud components that are used to control and replicate real-world conditions for devices in the wild.  For example, duplicating remote functions and controlling the device’s network and power, thereby allowing cameras, microphones, and other types of sensors to interface with the device. This all results in unbiased data and higher quality devices delivered faster to the customer.You would also be helping other engineers at Netflix bring their ideas to reality. Teams at Netflix have used the platform to build custom photosensors, hardware diagnostic solutions and even benchmarking tools. This platform acts as a bridge between consumer electronics and Netflix test services.

Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Specialist, Digital Production Assets and Delivery


As Netflix expands its global content creation footprint, we are increasing our investment in original content production across multiple content verticals (features, scripted and unscripted series, documentaries, comedies, etc).  The Post Production team seeks a Specialist to join us in pioneering new and innovative methods of managing digital production assets and delivery.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day. With continued international expansion and a move into original film acquisition and production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
Specialist, Digital Production Assets & Delivery supports Netflix Post Production teams with the flow of media from productions & vendors into the studio archive.

  • Oversee OCF, Editorial, Audio & final DI archive in to Netflix’s Content Hub archive system
  • Assist in the organization and flow of assets from productions, mainly editorial & vendors, to Netflix’s Content Hub archive.
  • Maintain, update & champion the use of Content Hub to track and manage show asset delivery to Netflix.
  • Assist post production teams as they audit completion/delivery of post production materials during production, archive and wrap.

  • Work with productions and vendor partners to ensure network connectivity and collaborative infrastructure for post workflows.
  • Produce and maintain accurate reporting of key Production metrics such as status, schedule and validation of production assets and Content Hub uploads.
  • Liaise with post production teams and vendors to assist in scheduling and prioritizing uploads to Content Hub swiftly, accurately and securely.
  • Liaise with post production teams to assist in scheduling delivery of physical production assets to archive, maintaining accurate inventory and security.
  • Track invoices and create Purchase Orders as needed.
    • Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

description: It's no accident that Netflix provides one of the smoothest and best-integrated streaming video experiences across the hundreds of devices we support.  Netflix takes its data seriously and leverages it as part of our core culture to make product decisions and we've only scratched the surface!Want to help? search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure Senior Data Engineer, Playback


It's no accident that Netflix provides one of the smoothest and best-integrated streaming video experiences across the hundreds of devices we support.  Netflix takes its data seriously and leverages it as part of our core culture to make product decisions and we've only scratched the surface!


Want to help? We're looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work directly with client engineering teams, data scientists, analytic engineers and other data engineers across several business verticals to build better data capabilities around the usage and performance of the Netflix streaming video experience. The best person will have a strong engineering background with the ability to tie engineering initiatives and business impact with the personal drive and motivation to own the most visible data domain.

  • You’ll take ownership of the most visible data domain and become a subject matter expert regarding playback data and client telemetry to partner engineering teams, your immediate peers and other data-focused teams.
  • Transform raw data from different sources (both batch and near-real-time) and using different tools (Spark, Hadoop, Redshift, Kafka, internal systems) into intuitive core data models that balance scalability and performance.
  • Design architectural patterns to validate and consume source data in the spirit of data quality in a self-serve analytical culture.
  • Build robust data pipelines and improve them to support the growing needs of our business and evolve how we perceive a viewing session.
  • Build and experiment with different tools and technology, sharing learnings with the larger team, building paved path solutions for the organization and encourage sharing via the open source community.
  • We need to process data more quickly than ever to enable rapid experimentation in an increasingly nimble engineering organization. You’ll help implement our business logic to be compatible with real-time/stream processing frameworks.
    • What you'll do
  • Experience building production data pipelines (using Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.) on large-scale datasets. You should have an unmistakable passion for elegant and intuitive dataset design. Hands on and deep experience with schema design and data modeling.
  • Programming proficiency in at least one major language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python). You have a software engineering mindset and strive to write elegant, maintainable code and you're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks.
  • Analytical mindset to bring together engineering solutions and business impact and have autonomy in managing cross-functional projects.
  • Strong SQL skills and knowledge and familiarity with other distributed data stores (ElasticSearch & Druid).
  • Excellent communication to effectively collaborate with partners and stakeholders.
  • Ambitious and willing to take action, but not stubborn. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes.
  • You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines.
    • Who you are


    Netflix Culture


    Our culture is unique, and we live by our values. You will need to be comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements will be vague, and iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart risks. Learn more about Netflix’s culture.

description: The Netflix device security team is growing and we want you to be part of it. This is not your typical security engineering job. We are an engineering team full of innovators, living on the cutting edge, creating solutions for a dynamic world and proactively evolving the security of an entire industry.THE OPPORTUNITYThe Netflix device security team is seeking a Senior Platform Security Engineer to represent Netflix to our device partners and work with internal engineering teams to architect new solutions to further the cause of platform security. The person in this role will proactively address security threats and evolve the device security ecosystem, working with OEMs, chip manufacturers and chip IP licensing companies to advance security technologies needed to keep our subscribers safe from the dangers of the open Internet.You will be responsible for the security of Netflix streaming devices, help device manufacturers design their hardware and software, and proactively evolve security requirements and implementations in SDK code as new threats to streaming security arise. Netflix has built a great reputation with our device partners and you will start out with a lot of influence in how they build products.

We partner with the studio to provide a wide range of solutions for the creative process. Our team is a diverse group of engineers and industry experts building solutions to enable content creation across the globe.


As Netflix creates more and more programming around the world leveraging new video and audio production technology, the studio’s internal production infrastructure needs are rapidly expanding and evolving to support creative development and production execution.

  • Contribute to the internal production technology strategy and workflow.
  • Design and execute the implementation and support of the digital content production pipeline.
  • Engage internal groups (Production, IT, Networks, Facilities, Content Security) and external production teams (vendors, contractors) to implement the above, acting as the liaison/translator between users/operational and technical teams.
  • Devise a strategy to scale the technical pipeline requirements as needed.
  • Evaluate new software solutions and technology for production.
    • As part of the Post Production Engineering group, you will:
  • 7-10 years of experience in motion picture visual effects and/or animation production, leading pipeline teams and initiatives, interacting with creatives, technicians and artists.
  • Experience designing building and supporting pipelines connecting tool sets like Avid, Nuke, ProTools, After Effects, Photoshop, Premiere, and Maya, along with tools for review and render-farm management.
  • Understanding of cloud storage and computing.
  • Working knowledge of data management, and content security best practices.
  • The communication skills to clearly articulate and document technical processes.
  • A passion for sound and the moving image.
    • Qualifications:


    About You
    You have a deep understanding of content creation technology and best practices that cultivate quality, scalability, and efficiency. You are passionate about building exceptional tools to support the creative process. You can work openly with artists and technologists, fine-tuning the solutions to meet their sometimes exacting expectations. Your passion and curiosity drive you to seek and test new products and paradigms to serve evolving needs.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Science and Analytics Senior Analytics Engineer - Studio Production


Netflix is seeking a versatile analytics engineer who is ready to tackle data analysis, reporting and visualization challenges in a refreshingly new problem space - Studio Production Science & Analytics.


Netflix has released over 600 Originals and plans to spend over $7B on content this year. Each one of these TV shows or movies is a complex production operation in itself that consumes and generates tremendous amounts of data. For the first time in history, we have an opportunity to organize, analyze and visualize this data at scale in ways never done before.

  • How do we scale the Netflix Studio as we create thousands of hours of Original content?
  • How do we bring joy to our global customer base by optimizing content localization?
  • What internal and external data can we use to improve content quality on our service?
  • As a Senior Analytics Engineer - Studio Production, you will get to answer these kinds of questions from our Hollywood office at the Bronson Studios, where the first talking feature film was filmed in 1927.
    • Some examples of questions one can examine here with data include --
  • Creatively explore how to use data to continually add value to Netflix. Translate ad hoc questions into flexible methodologies that scale to answer broad problems across the organization
  • Be a bridge between the business and technology, enabling insight that can empower better decision-making
  • Build flexible, insightful tools, dashboards, and reports that enable everyone at Netflix to be an analyst
  • Be comfortable outside of your comfort zone - explore new technologies, make your own tool, jump into ETL when needed, or find a new way to address an old problem
  • Partner with various technical and creative stakeholders to understand and deliver for their data analysis needs
  • Embody and steward the Netflix culture
    • As a Senior Analytics Engineer working in this space, you will…
  • Proven track record of data analysis, reporting & visualization (Tableau, D3, etc.)
  • Expertise in SQL required
  • Experience in Big Data technologies a plus (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto etc.)
  • Scripting experience in Python, Bash etc. a plus
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, or related quantitative field. Not a rigid litmus test.

The Team

Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Social Media Coordinator - Southern Europe


Developing an audience and cultivating a brand are not easy. You have to be committed to your community 100% and give that brand life for it to thrive. If that gets your heart racing, it might be your turn to join Netflix!


Responsibilities
We are hiring a Social Media Marketing Coordinator to help us set and own our brand social strategy and develop our audience presence in Southern Europe, with a specific focus on Portugal and Greece and support to managers executing strategy in Spain and Italy. The coordinator will be tapped into emerging platforms, aware of other successful campaigns, and will have a vision for success in a competitive landscape. As a member of our lean and agile team, the successful employee will be as comfortable firing off a humorous tweet as they are writing strategy and producing a major campaign for an original show.


This person will be working closely with external agencies sitting across different regions to put forth big ideas, stunning creative, and spot on copy in support of new content, the product, and the brand. The winning candidate will also be responsible for integrating social media into campaigns from our counterparts in PR and Marketing.


Fluent in the language of Instagram stories, Facebook live and 140 (or 280) characters, the successful candidate is equally able to set social strategy, develop tone of voice, write a script, or fire off a well-timed social post.


Skills required
The successful candidate for this position will likely have a minimum of 3 years’ experience working in-house, at an agency or another company with a proven track record of generating earned word of mouth with socially driven campaigns. He/She has to be fluent in English and Portuguese or Greek.


We expect this person to have a creative mindset, but also good organizational skills and the flexibility you need to interact with different people and cultures, both within the company and with external partners, someone who’s willing to invest time in the community and get his/her hands dirty. The Netflix culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and intellectual curiosity. Read our culture memo to learn what it’s actually like working for Netflix.To excel in this environment, you must be independently minded, have impeccable creative taste, and strong instinct for stories that will get fans talking about Netflix and our shows more passionately and frequently than ever before. If this sounds like you, then maybe you’ll take the crown.

text: Senior Data Engineer - A/B Testing Experimentation Platform
description: Ever wonder how Netflix serves a great streaming experience with high-quality video and minimal playback interruptions? Or how we are confident that major UI redesigns across thousands of devices are well received? It’s because new ideas are constantly being explored across all aspects of the Netflix product, including our UI experience, recommendation/search algorithms, sign-up flows, messaging, adaptive streaming algorithms, etc. To ensure that these ideas deliver experiences our subscribers love, we diligently test and measure the impact of all these proposed enhancements using ABlaze, Netflix’s Experimentation Platform.  Given the size and complexity of our datasets, this analysis is no trivial task. Our platform must process data for A/B test analysis across 100M+ subscribers and over 100M+ hours of video streamed every day. Our current infrastructure has served us well, but now that Netflix is in almost every country around the world, it’s time to evolve and scale.Consequently, we’re re-architecting our data pipelines to provide our users with more flexible self-serve experimentation analysis capabilities. This means allowing them to specify their own data sources, metrics, dimensions, and statistical tests, and finally choose from a variety of data visualization options in order to construct reusable reports for each experimentation area.Since almost every product decision at Netflix depends on A/B test analysis, your efforts on this team will impact improvements throughout our product and therefore the experience of the millions of our users across the globe.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure Senior Data Engineer - A/B Testing Experimentation Platform


Ever wonder how Netflix serves a great streaming experience with high-quality video and minimal playback interruptions? Or how we are confident that major UI redesigns across thousands of devices are well received?


It’s because new ideas are constantly being explored across all aspects of the Netflix product, including our UI experience, recommendation/search algorithms, sign-up flows, messaging, adaptive streaming algorithms, etc. To ensure that these ideas deliver experiences our subscribers love, we diligently test and measure the impact of all these proposed enhancements using ABlaze, Netflix’s Experimentation Platform.  


Given the size and complexity of our datasets, this analysis is no trivial task. Our platform must process data for A/B test analysis across 100M+ subscribers and over 100M+ hours of video streamed every day. Our current infrastructure has served us well, but now that Netflix is in almost every country around the world, it’s time to evolve and scale.


Consequently, we’re re-architecting our data pipelines to provide our users with more flexible self-serve experimentation analysis capabilities. This means allowing them to specify their own data sources, metrics, dimensions, and statistical tests, and finally choose from a variety of data visualization options in order to construct reusable reports for each experimentation area.


Since almost every product decision at Netflix depends on A/B test analysis, your efforts on this team will impact improvements throughout our product and therefore the experience of the millions of our users across the globe.

  • Partnering with internal customers. You’ll partner with teams across Netflix to understand and enable their analysis needs. You should be comfortable in an environment of context, not control, where you’ll receive context on your users’ needs and drive follow up conversations to help you and your peers decide how to best serve those needs.
  • Prototype and productize configurable data pipelines as part of a team of experienced data engineers who are continually learning from each other and collectively improving our craft.  
    • What You’ll Be Doing:
  • You have at least 5 years of experience in a data-­driven environment designing and building distributed data processing systems
  • You have experience building production data pipelines (using Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.) on large scale datasets. You should have an unmistakable passion for elegant and intuitive dataset design. You have deep hands-on experience with schema design and data modeling (using datastores such as Druid, ElasticSearch, etc.).
  • You have proficiency programming in Java and/or Scala. You strive to write beautiful code and you're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks.
  • You're ambitious and quick to take action, while also open to new ideas. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes.
  • You enjoy staying current with technology and continually strive to be better at your craft.
  • Experience with stream processing technologies (e.g. Spark Streaming, Kafka, Flink) is a major plus.
  • Some exposure to analytics, statistics, or A/B or Multivariate testing is also a plus
    • Your Skills & Characteristics:
  • We expect a lot. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it here.
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. You can read more about our stance on diversity here.

text: Social Media Manager - India (Series, Films, Docs)
description: Narcos, Stranger Things and The Crown are just a handful of the shows, films, docs and comedies streaming on Netflix. As our content slate continues to grow, we're looking for a Social Media Manager to run title campaigns on behalf of Netflix originals for the Indian market. After our global launch last year, we are enthusiastic about our growth opportunity in India and are looking to scale the social media team. The social media manager for global series, docs and films will lead strategy and creative for local positioning and will be responsible for launching campaigns that get people so excited for the Netflix original titles that they sign up. The successful candidate will display the curiosity to learn the Netflix business, analyse high volumes of information quickly, and make smart choices. We are looking for a marketer who is not afraid to lean in to risk, take initiative and make big bets. The manager will be responsible for our entertainment campaigns in India and should be fearless in bearing that responsibility.The manager will be well-versed with both the Indian entertainment landscape as well as Hollywood. Their strategy should leverage local insight to make global shows relevant and exciting for the Indian audience. The manager shouldn’t be afraid of volume of work and should be able to prioritise effectively. Intuition drives great creative but so does data and analytics, the candidate should be comfortable using analytics to measure what success looks like and identify where our next win is. Creatively, the manager will be able to define what a localised campaign will look like for India based with the goal of driving word of mouth for our titles. With our strong brand and titles, we try to earn as many impressions as we can get before buying them. The candidate must be an avid fan of entertainment - both global and local and be able to glean insights as to what would make a title work in India. The right hire will have a solid understanding of the Indian entertainment landscape and consumer insights. They will need to be strong storytellers who can reflect the quality of our global originals. The manager will work closely with the originals team in Hollywood to make our shows relevant for Indian viewers. They will also develop relationships with key opinion leaders and leverage owned and more importantly earned platforms to drive brand messaging.The India social manager (series, film and docs) will manage agencies, develop creative, and even work with talent from time to time to make our global originals appeal to the Indian audience. He or she will need to have impeccable taste, vision for how to stand out from the competition, and a strong instinct for ideas that will get consumers talking.

After our global launch last year, we are enthusiastic about our growth opportunity in India and are looking to scale the social media team. 


The social media manager for global series, docs and films will lead strategy and creative for local positioning and will be responsible for launching campaigns that get people so excited for the Netflix original titles that they sign up. The successful candidate will display the curiosity to learn the Netflix business, analyse high volumes of information quickly, and make smart choices. Their strategy should leverage local insight to make global shows relevant and exciting for the Indian audience. Intuition drives great creative but so does data and analytics, the candidate should be comfortable using analytics to measure what success looks like and identify where our next win is.

  • We love a good pun

text: Visual Communications Manager, Consumer PR - EMEA
description: Netflix delights more than 100 million members across the globe in being able to instantly watch unlimited movies and TV shows. In Europe our potential for growth has never been greater, and there’s never been a more promising time to join Netflix.We are seeking an individual to lead the creative visual material strategies and execution of Netflix brand campaigns across EMEA, with the goal of editorial coverage through assets such as videos and photos.The TeamThe Visual Communications team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: AV asset creation & global communication strategy. We specialise in capturing and producing the creative materials that shape, enhance and support our content and PR brand campaigns. Simply put, we create PR stories that are newsworthy, and that compel consumers to join Netflix and watch our shows.The RoleThis role is part of the Visual Communications team but will work alongside the EMEA Consumer PR team who are responsible for developing press stories, narratives and campaigns around the role Netflix plays in transforming entertainment. They connect our Original content to the viewing behaviours and insights that will garner press pick up and earned media. This role will oversee creative strategy, development and execution across campaigns that are unique to specific EMEA markets, as well as localising global campaigns for EMEA consumers. They will also drive communication with the other regional Consumer PR teams in addition to cross-functional partners across publicity, marketing & social media. What We’re Looking ForSuccess in this position requires a deep understanding of how to achieve brand impact in the consumer press, a fluency around our content, and a creative mind who can take a press story and translate it into visual assets.  The ideal candidate will have expertise in creating visually-led campaigns that work across all types of media, that are regionally sensitive and deliver on the brand story.  The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative and self motivated personality, and a succinct communicator with strong project management background. Being a team player with a positive attitude and willingness to be flexible and get the job done is essential, as is the ability to strategically plan and execute on multiple projects simultaneously. We don’t focus on job titles at Netflix but hire outstanding high performers who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same.

This role will oversee creative strategy, development and execution across campaigns that are unique to specific EMEA markets, as well as localising global campaigns for EMEA consumers. They will also drive communication with the other regional Consumer PR teams in addition to cross-functional partners across publicity, marketing & social media.


What We’re Looking For
Success in this position requires a deep understanding of how to achieve brand impact in the consumer press, a fluency around our content, and a creative mind who can take a press story and translate it into visual assets.  The ideal candidate will have expertise in creating visually-led campaigns that work across all types of media, that are regionally sensitive and deliver on the brand story.  
The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative and self motivated personality, and a succinct communicator with strong project management background. Being a team player with a positive attitude and willingness to be flexible and get the job done is essential, as is the ability to strategically plan and execute on multiple projects simultaneously.


We don’t focus on job titles at Netflix but hire outstanding high performers who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same.

  • 8+ years background in a  senior consumer-facing editorial or brand PR role.
  • Understand the photography/video industry and how press outlets use AV assets.
  • Experience working with EMEA markets is preferred.
  • Fluent English is a requirement to be successful in our office but additional language skills are a huge plus!
    • Additional skills and Requirements:


    This job is based in Amsterdam and reports to the Visual Communications Manager, Originals Publicity EMEA.

text: Senior Support Engineer Localization - Content Platform
description: Content Platform Engineering (CPE) develops technology and operations for most aspects of streaming content that make Netflix a great global service. We power discovery, personalization, video encoding and quality, internationalization, localization, and marketing for the best streaming library in the world.  Every day, we solve complex problems around scalability and global content and innovate on the tool's, data model, and pipeline that make up our content platform. As Netflix expands its global content creation footprint, we are increasing our investment in original content production across multiple content verticals (features, scripted and unscripted series, documentaries, comedies, and international productions).   In response to this growth, our engineering and production teams are working collaboratively to build a virtual studio in the cloud - pioneering new approaches to movie production, optimizing pitches, production schedules, subtitling, and digital asset management for our Original content and with that comes innovative ways to support those new applications.The Opportunity:The Support team in Content Platform Engineering is looking for a talented Senior Support Engineer to support the studio in the cloud within Netflix. Our team is responsible for managing the entire media pipeline, from ingest to encoding to publishing and beyond. We also provide first line support into the engineering teams, with the ability to troubleshoot problems and unblock critical business functions. Initially, this Senior Support Engineer will be tasked with learning Global Technologies related tools, a proprietary set of tools created by the Netflix team. Leaning on a strong background in localization, this Senior Support Engineer will then be tasked with supporting Content and Product Localization teams. Over time, there will be additional opportunities to learn more about other tools used by the Netflix organization in order to ensure that a title goes live. If you love to provide support and solve day to day operational challenges, you will love working with our team. Join the team that is raising the bar and defining the future of global streaming entertainment!

description: The opportunityUltra-high quality audio, timed text and video sources, received in formats such as IMF, QuickTime and W3C TTML, are transformed by the Netflix content processing system into a suite of delivery formats (e.g., ISO Base Media File Format) providing a ubiquitous streaming experience to our global audience. The Cloud Media Systems team develops cloud-scale tools for the multimedia systems layer of our media trans-coding pipeline - we define and implement ingest specifications for audio, video and timed text content sources; and develop tools for audio/video/text processing, packaging, and encryption (DRM). The unrivalled scale of content ingestion at Netflix exposes unique challenges - our active participation in standardization forums such as SMPTE, W3C Timed Text Working Group (TTWG) and Alliance for Open Media (AOM) as well as contribution to open source software (OSS) development activities enables us to obtain scalable industry-wide solutions.   Given the increasing volume of original programming, Netflix is well on its way to becoming a “cloud studio”, owning the content production chain from greenlight to master source creation. To support this effort, the Cloud Media Systems is building a media analysis pipeline from the ground up. This system enables in-depth multi-modal analysis (e.g., computer vision, signal processing and natural language processing) on our media sources and enables persisting this information in a highly queryable multimedia repository. We are using data modeling techniques that are grounded in the knowledge of multimedia systems for efficient storage, retrieval and querying of this analysis data.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Engineering Senior Software Engineer, Video Systems


The opportunity
Ultra-high quality audio, timed text and video sources, received in formats such as IMF, QuickTime and W3C TTML, are transformed by the Netflix content processing system into a suite of delivery formats (e.g., ISO Base Media File Format) providing a ubiquitous streaming experience to our global audience. The Cloud Media Systems team develops cloud-scale tools for the multimedia systems layer of our media trans-coding pipeline - we define and implement ingest specifications for audio, video and timed text content sources; and develop tools for audio/video/text processing, packaging, and encryption (DRM). The unrivalled scale of content ingestion at Netflix exposes unique challenges - our active participation in standardization forums such as SMPTE, W3C Timed Text Working Group (TTWG) and Alliance for Open Media (AOM) as well as contribution to open source software (OSS) development activities enables us to obtain scalable industry-wide solutions.   


Given the increasing volume of original programming, Netflix is well on its way to becoming a “cloud studio”, owning the content production chain from greenlight to master source creation. To support this effort, the Cloud Media Systems is building a media analysis pipeline from the ground up. This system enables in-depth multi-modal analysis (e.g., computer vision, signal processing and natural language processing) on our media sources and enables persisting this information in a highly queryable multimedia repository. We are using data modeling techniques that are grounded in the knowledge of multimedia systems for efficient storage, retrieval and querying of this analysis data.

  • You exhibit leadership abilities and flexibility - you like to work hands on and self directed in a fast paced, freedom and responsibility environment and make objective decisions with the goal of furthering Netflix business
  • You are creative - you thrive in a setting that empowers you to go out of the box and apply your expertise to solve big technical challenges
  • You are an expert in OO programming (Java, C++, C# or Python). You have a strong passion for software development and you constantly strive towards becoming a better software engineer  - employing the right techniques for the problem at hand
  • You are incremental in your approach to software development and take full responsibility for the quality of your code and end-to-end testing
  • You have in-depth experience with multimedia compression, delivery, playback and processing systems
  • Working knowledge of multimedia systems layer standards such as ISO.IEC 13818-1 (MPEG Transport and Program Streams), ISO.IEC 14496-12 (ISO base media file format), ISO.IEC 14496-10 (H.264), ISO.IEC 23008 (HEVC), SMPTE 2067 (IMF), SMPTE-377 (MXF), W3C TTML1/2 (Timed Text Markup Language) and Unicode
  • Involvement in an open-source multimedia project such as FFMpeg or GStreamer is a big plus
  • Experience with as well as scalable RESTful web services (Java backend technologies preferred) as well as various persistence technologies ranging from key-value to document to column-family to graph datastores is a plus
    • About you
  • Design and develop highly scalable systems layer tools such as readers/parsers, and writers for a variety of stream formats such as QuickTime, IMF, MPEG2TS, MP4, W3C TTML, H264, H265, AAC, AV1
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with teams such as content operations and streaming client engineering to define new ingest and streaming specifications
  • Participate in standardization forums ranging including SMPTE, W3C TTWG, AOM and MPEG as well as related OSS activities
    • You will

Singapore, Singapore Engineering Partner Devices Singapore Certification Program Manager


The Netflix Certification Team directly impacts the quality of consumer electronic products that millions of people around the world use every day to enjoy Netflix.


After having Netflix integrated on every relevant TV, Blu-Ray Player, Streaming Box, and Streaming Stick, our next frontier is the growth of technical engagements with pan-Asian operators and telcos. We are aiming to reach our current and future members in Asia on devices they already know and use: their cable, and satellite set top boxes, or MVPDs.


Netflix is looking for a Certification Program Manager. In this role, you would utilize your excellent communication and technical skills to streamline the certification process for our partners. From teaching partners the Netflix certification process and test automation tools, to answering their questions, analyzing test results, and root causing test failures - for our partners you would be the window into Netflix certification.


While working with partner companies to meet the very high Netflix quality bar, you would also work closely with teams in Los Gatos, California. The certification team is located there, as well as other engineering teams responsible for the SDK, UI, and other key functions.


If you have the skill and passion for audio/video consumer electronics devices such as IPTV, cable and satellite set top boxes, then this job is for you!

  • Coach partners through the certification process.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams in Singapore and Los Gatos. Create solutions and remove roadblocks that enable us to scale the certification process across MVPDs.
  • Determine probable root causes of test failures and drive resolutions.
  • Take on special projects designed to drive the Netflix Certifications process forward.

  • Passionate about product quality.
  • Brilliant in your delivery of technical solutions.
  • Pragmatic about what is best, both technically and for the business.
  • Energetic and versatile in a dynamic work environment.
  • Knowledgeable in consumer streaming media applications.
  • Clear, professional, and diplomatic in communication.
  • Efficient when working independently.
  • Distinguishable when working on a team.

About the team
Netflix is watched across the world in over 26 languages. Every piece of text that appears on our product is localized, along with other content like knowledge base articles, product emails, press releases, and others. And making this all happen is the Globalization Technologies & Infrastructure team. We build the platform - including but not limited to translation memory, customized online CAT editors, content sensitive context tools, data pipelines, and quality tools -  that allows all kinds of text artifacts to be localized resulting in a superlative user experience.

description: Netflix is responsible for over one-third of internet traffic at peak times and we’re working collaboratively with ISPs to deploy Open Connect, Netflix’s Content Delivery Network.  Open Connect delivers 100% of our video traffic today, and we’re continually adding functionality to support more advanced applications and further improve the quality of experience for our customers.  We have a global network connecting 75+ sites and thousands of partners, maintaining and building those sites takes technical know-how, the ability to manage complex projects, and excellent communication skills.  We're seeking an experienced Datacenter Deployment Engineer to join the team and help us grow the Content Delivery Network at Netflix.The person who is suited for this role is a self-starter, who can coordinate milestones across teams and functions with a globally distributed team.  You need to be able to step away from the equipment; instead of "doing" -- you will conceptualize and document the steps to be taken to complete a complex datacenter deployment, build, or upgrade.  You will coordinate the work of remote hands partners across the globe making sure they deliver consistent excellence, shepherding their work making sure that the steps you have laid out are followed.  You will take learnings from each deployment and engagement to improving our runbooks.You expect the best from yourself, your partners, and your vendors.  To be successful, you act independently but understand the importance of communicating and aligning with your peers. You work tightly with your cohorts to make sure there are clear handoffs and consistent documentation. The result of your work is amazing video delivery that translates into millions and millions of happy Netflix users around the world.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Delivery Data Center Deployment Engineer


Netflix is responsible for over one-third of internet traffic at peak times and we’re working collaboratively with ISPs to deploy Open Connect, Netflix’s Content Delivery Network.  Open Connect delivers 100% of our video traffic today, and we’re continually adding functionality to support more advanced applications and further improve the quality of experience for our customers.  


We have a global network connecting 75+ sites and thousands of partners, maintaining and building those sites takes technical know-how, the ability to manage complex projects, and excellent communication skills.  We're seeking an experienced Datacenter Deployment Engineer to join the team and help us grow the Content Delivery Network at Netflix.


The person who is suited for this role is a self-starter, who can coordinate milestones across teams and functions with a globally distributed team.  You need to be able to step away from the equipment; instead of "doing" -- you will conceptualize and document the steps to be taken to complete a complex datacenter deployment, build, or upgrade.  You will coordinate the work of remote hands partners across the globe making sure they deliver consistent excellence, shepherding their work making sure that the steps you have laid out are followed.  You will take learnings from each deployment and engagement to improving our runbooks.


You expect the best from yourself, your partners, and your vendors.  To be successful, you act independently but understand the importance of communicating and aligning with your peers. You work tightly with your cohorts to make sure there are clear handoffs and consistent documentation. The result of your work is amazing video delivery that translates into millions and millions of happy Netflix users around the world.

  • Comfortable with not being onsite doing the actual work, but instead, planning and documenting the work to be executed by remote hand partners.
  • Thrive and enjoy working in a high performance, fast-paced environment.
  • Fierce attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently.
  • Effective collaborator with excellent communication skills;  able to articulate complex ideas in a direct, concise way.
  • Develop and seek process improvements and strategies to further automate and streamline deployment processes.
  • Excel at time and project management.
  • Ability to troubleshoot issues remotely -- coordinating and communicate with remote hands, vendors, and other teams to quickly isolate and remediate..
    • You will be successful in this role if you are
  • Project Management -- installation of network and server equipment in new and existing Netflix Open Connect POPs. Make sure external tasks and deliverables are completed in order to complete delivery on time.
  • Work with remote hands vendors to develop a scope-of-work and manage tasks like server installations, network card installation, network device chassis swaps, etc.
  • Document installations -- elevations, power consumption, cabling deployed, and other relevant site specific info.
  • Vendor management and accountability -- evaluate and select remote hands and rack and stack.  Hold them accountable to the standards and requirements we have established.
  • Ordering and specifying various lengths and requirements of custom structured cabling per deployment.
  • Review expected site builds and augment dates, plan shipping timing, routes, and carriers, ensuring on time and efficient delivery.
  • Communicate with Provisioning, Logistics, Operations and Network Engineering teams to streamline work of the various stakeholders.
  • Work with data center vendors to ensure reliable and functional facilities per Netflix standards.
  • Remotely configure data center hardware (servers, network appliances, etc.) for operations, to include firmware installation/updates/settings, IP addressing, and other I/O settings.
  • Reduce potential risks to upcoming projects timelines, by identifying issues and providing solutions.
  • Communicate with a globally distributed team: email, chat, IM, SMS, phone.
    • Your Responsibilities
  • Team player with the ability to build peer, and external relationships.
  • Support a global organization; Able to time shift to lead or support projects executed in other time zones.
  • Able to travel when required globally. (Occasional)
  • Able to lift/move 45 lbs equipment with some regularity.
  • Ability to participate in team on-call.
    • Required Skills
  • 3+ years of experience in a Datacenter environment with Command Line Interface (CLI) on Systems and networking appliances.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills -- Able to provide detailed instructions for contemporaries to follow and execute.
  • Understand the usage of patch panels, fiber optic connectors, optic types and form factors. Know the difference between LC, SC, MTP, CFP2, QSFP, SFP+, and RTFM
  • Basic understanding of high power optics and attenuation related to DWDM systems.
  • Understanding of power standards and related mathematics - kW power/heat load and its relation to voltage and amperage, applications of single phase, three phase, DC, etc.
    • Bonus Skills

description: Netflix is looking to develop the industry’s next generation of Production Finance Coordinators who will reside within the company's originals team in Hollywood, California. To that end, we’ve built our first Junior Executive Training Program (JET). This is an entry-level production finance position with rotations through our in-house production headquarters as well as on-set of our original productions. For half of the year, JET coordinators will support, from our office on Sunset, Netflix Production Finance Executives and Production Finance Associates. The other half of the year you’ll be on set of a Netflix Original production, working as a member of the production accounting team. Coordinators will be assigned to a specific content group including Series, Features, Documentaries, Stand-Up, Talk Shows, and Unscripted productions. Exceptional Coordinators will have the opportunity to develop into Production Finance Associates. This is a three-year rotational program composed of hands-on work, educational seminars, and mentorship. Our next JET class is scheduled to begin July 2018.

text: Manager Consumer PR - Middle East and North Africa
description: It's an amazing time to join the Netflix PR EMEA team as we continue to transform entertainment. Over the past few years, we have moved from being a distributor to a programmer; from being a US tech company to a global leader in the entertainment landscape, from a brand that markets price value to one that talks about the joy of watching. If you are a passionate, creative storyteller who is not afraid of a challenge, keep reading!We are looking for a talented public relations expert with a strong understanding and relationship with consumer media and influencers across Middle East and North Africa (MENA). The MENA Consumer PR Manager will be a member of a seasoned group of professionals helping formulate, execute, and sustain a PR strategy for Netflix. The role is strategically critical to building on the company success in a fast-changing, highly competitive global landscape. The role will focus on innovation around how we engage traditional and digital media, influencers and content creators. The Manager Consumer PR, Middle East and North Africa will be a key partner to CorpTech PR Manager, META, as will existing members of the regional team leading Marketing, Social, Publicity… This role  is based in Amsterdam and has strong cross-functional interaction with broader team with a high level of visibility and impact within the business.

  • Work in close collaboration with internal stakeholders (Marketing, Social, Publicity…) and external agencies to establish strong 360 plans
    • The Consumer PR Manager role will focus on:

  • Have a deep understanding and expertise in Middle Eastern and North African media landscape -- day-to-day media contacts in broadcast, print and digital are a must.
  • Have experience managing PR media campaigns from strategy development through execution including fluency in social media and marketing
  • Be able to work independently and understand how to build and maintain relationships with key journalists, social media press and different kinds of influencers.
  • Be confident and creative in writing, capable of crafting everything from executive messaging to consumer facing newsletters, press releases and everything in between.
  • Possess the ability to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts that translate to media.

  • Succinct communicator.
  • Great writer and talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Doesn't need to "check with the agency" on every issue or for every answer. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
  • Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed. Has a big capacity to both think and 'do'. Flourishes in a 'hands on' role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.
  • A smart minimalist. Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that. Does not need or desire big budgets for big results. Believes one great person on the team is more valuable than 3 to 5 OK people---and wants to be that great person.

description: About the Team Netflix engineers ship thousands of lines of code every day. Their work translates into new product features, delivery of Originals content, or algorithms for our internal telemetry system. The Developer Productivity team develops, deploys and supports the software that allows engineers to develop and publish their code with ease. The team is expanding and has enormous momentum toward building first class continuous integration capabilities. The Netflix continuous integration infrastructure enables feature velocity and enhanced productivity to optimize the daily activities of an engineer. On the Developer Productivity team, you’ll be playing the role of both software engineer and operations engineer. You’ll be automating infrastructure to maintain the stability, integrity and performance of all test and production environments as well as building services and plugins to bridge the gaps in our existing tools. Your work will have a worldwide impact and the unique opportunity to influence the culture of development and collaboration across multiple teams.About the Role This is an exciting role demanding a strong background in software engineering, build automation, continuous integration and collaboration. This role will challenge you to operate at a tactical level, while managing high availability and maintaining infrastructure to maximize performance in distributed builds. search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Senior Software Engineer - Continuous Integration


About the Team
Netflix engineers ship thousands of lines of code every day. Their work translates into new product features, delivery of Originals content, or algorithms for our internal telemetry system. The Developer Productivity team develops, deploys and supports the software that allows engineers to develop and publish their code with ease.


The team is expanding and has enormous momentum toward building first class continuous integration capabilities. As a result, we are currently seeking a Continuous Integration Engineer to join our growing organization.  We are seeking engineers with a passion for building reliable and highly available solutions for our continuous integration  infrastructure.


The Netflix continuous integration infrastructure enables feature velocity and enhanced productivity to optimize the daily activities of an engineer. On the Developer Productivity team, you’ll be playing the role of both software engineer and operations engineer. You’ll be automating infrastructure to maintain the stability, integrity and performance of all test and production environments as well as building services and plugins to bridge the gaps in our existing tools. Your work will have a worldwide impact and the unique opportunity to influence the culture of development and collaboration across multiple teams.


About the Role
This is an exciting role demanding a strong background in software engineering, build automation, continuous integration and collaboration. This role will challenge you to operate at a tactical level, while managing high availability and maintaining infrastructure to maximize performance in distributed builds. It requires deep insight into the software development lifecycle for production services and also gives you freedom with the responsibility to complete your goals.

  • Address complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive designs
  • Work at all phases of the software development lifecycle (planning, design, implementation, deployment, and support)
  • Contribute to solutions that address problems inherent in sharing and integrating code at scale
  • Increase the velocity of the build process
  • Operate and improve the existing CI infrastructure
  • Participate in an on-call support rotation for the team's services
  • Collaborate effectively with teammates and technical partners
  • Communicate technical ideas and direction across the organization
    • Responsibilities
  • Senior-level software development
  • Strong JVM programming skills -- OO languages such as Java, Kotlin, or Groovy
  • Build automation  -- using tools such as Gradle, Maven, Webpack or Gulp
  • Continuous Integration -- supporting Jenkins, TravisCI, CircleCI or similar tools
  • Test automation -- unit testing, TDD, testing pyramid
  • Running services in production
    • Qualifications
  • Exposure to cloud infrastructures, such as AWS, GCE or Azure
  • Exposure to operating distributed systems at scale
  • Experience working with API’s
  • Experience resolving dependency conflicts
  • Building internal developer tools
  • Coaching engineers on tools and best practices
  • Developing Jenkins plugin
    • Nice-to-haves
  • Nebula
  • How We Build Code at Netflix
  • Towards true continuous integration: distributed repositories and dependencies
  • Dependencies, distributed code and engineering velocity
  • Engineering Tools presentations

    Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility. You can learn more via the culture slides and “who we are” section of jobs.netflix.com.

text: Manager, Content Strategy & Analysis - Original Films
description: Our members love movies. Working closely with the Business Affairs and Creative teams, the team is primarily responsible for deal valuation, greenlight models, programming strategy and analytics, competitive analysis and user behavioral analysis. This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior management within the organization. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Content Strategy & Analysis - Original Films


Our members love movies. In 2017, Netflix spent billions of dollars on acquiring and programming movies in every window for every taste -- from brand new, never-before-seen Original films to timeless classics that are watched over and over again. In order to build the best movie service in the world, we look for the best and brightest to drive the analytics for strategic business decisions. Netflix operates a financially complex business and believes that it derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing the company.


The Content Strategy & Analysis team is looking for a Manager to lead Strategic and Financial Analysis for our Original film initiative. Working closely with the Business Affairs and Creative teams, the team is primarily responsible for deal valuation, greenlight models, programming strategy and analytics, competitive analysis and user behavioral analysis.


This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior management within the organization. Senior leadership depends heavily on the Content Strategy & Analysis group to accurately model and forecast the business as well as lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform important business decisions.


This role will reside in Netflix's Los Angeles office.   

  • Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects (i.e., greenlight models) in partnership with the Creative, Business Affairs and Content Acquisition teams
  • Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators
  • Develop deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities
  • Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders
  • Develop and manage associate(s) on the team: establish priorities, set objectives, and provide guidance and feedback
    • RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • 6-9 years of experience in finance, strategy, and/or consulting roles. For candidates with MBAs, typically we would look at candidates with 1-4 years post-MBA experience
  • Expertise in the Film industry (having worked in a studio, production company, agency, distributor) is a plus though not required  
  • Strong communication/presentation skills with track record of presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management clearly and concisely
  • Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis
  • The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. He or she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. The ideal candidate would be prepared to regularly "roll up their sleeves" to perform more routine tasks in the same day that they are asked to prepare analysis and a presentation to the executives of the company. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, and be able to work effectively autonomously.
  • Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages
  • Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. MBA a plus but not required.
    • QUALIFICATIONS:


    Due to the nature and scope of this role, we will need to run a background check on you prior to starting with us.

description: Netflix is seeking a versatile data science practitioner who is ready to tackle data analysis and modeling challenges in a refreshingly new problem space - Studio Production Science and Analytics.Netflix has released over 600 Originals and plans to spend over $7B on content this year. Each one of these TV shows or movies is a complex production operation in itself that consumes and generates tremendous amounts of data. For the first time in history, we have an opportunity to organize, analyze and model this data at scale in ways never done before. Some examples of questions one can examine here with data include:• Are we using our studio space efficiently?• What stages of a given production pipeline are likely to fail?• What interventions in production pipeline lead to best quality outcomes?As a Senior Data Scientist - Studio Production, you will get to answer these kinds of questions from our Hollywood office at the Bronson Studios, where the first talking feature film was filmed in 1927.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Science and Analytics Senior Data Scientist - Studio Production


Netflix is seeking a versatile data science practitioner who is ready to tackle data analysis and modeling challenges in a refreshingly new problem space - Studio Production Science and Analytics.


Netflix has released over 600 Originals and plans to spend over $7B on content this year. Each one of these TV shows or movies is a complex production operation in itself that consumes and generates tremendous amounts of data. For the first time in history, we have an opportunity to organize, analyze and model this data at scale in ways never done before.


Some examples of questions one can examine here with data include:
• Are we using our studio space efficiently?
• What stages of a given production pipeline are likely to fail?
• What interventions in production pipeline lead to best quality outcomes?


As a Senior Data Scientist - Studio Production, you will get to answer these kinds of questions from our Hollywood office at the Bronson Studios, where the first talking feature film was filmed in 1927.

  • Partner with various technical and creative stakeholders to understand and deliver for their data analysis needs
  • Run exploratory analyses into ambiguous problems and define metrics to build a quantitative understanding of our business
  • Build machine learning systems to guide decision making
  • Do whatever it takes to deliver business value with data, be it building a data pipeline, a report, a dashboard or a predictive model
  • Embody and steward the Netflix culture
    • As a Senior Data Scientist working in this space, you will…
  • Proven track record of practicing data science at scale
  • Expertise in practical aspects of applied machine learning
  • Expertise in various aspects of data engineering (SQL, Hadoop, Spark etc.)
  • Experience in building tools, dashboard and reporting (web apps, Tableau)
  • Strong programming skills in Scala, Python or similar languages
  • PhD/MS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, or related quantitative field.
    • Qualifications:
