search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Coordinator, Talent Relations


Netflix is looking for a Coordinator to support our growing Talent Relations team in charge of building the ultimate talent experience for our actors, directors and producers.  From David Fincher’s MINDHUNTER to stand-up icon Dave Chappelle, to David Ayer and Will Smith’s Bright to Bryan Fogel’s Icarus,, we are looking for someone who has experience working with talent, rapidly consumes entertainment, and is passionate and curious about the growing global entertainment landscape. This person should be excited to help grow Netflix into the best place for talent to work in our industry.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is a great opportunity to join a team that is building the largest Internet entertainment service  in the world, with a chance to work with the brightest filmmakers and actors around the world, using the latest technology.  


The Role
As a member of a seasoned group of professionals based in the Hollywood office, the Coordinator of Talent Relations will play a key supporting role in helping facilitate and execute programs and communication vehicles when it comes to ensuring talent (actors, producers, etc.) are informed and engaged.  She/he will be responsible for owning and managing a high volume of talent gifting for awards, life moments and production (start and wrap of production) and building relationships with consultants, vendors, and brands. She/he will also facilitate sponsorships and donations on behalf of the company including submission paperwork and executional follow-through.  Additional varied and timely tasks include but are not limited to: tracking and updating talent data, charts and lists on the google drive; booking a heavy amount of travel and hair and make-up; tracking deal memos; creating itineraries; helping plan, coordinate and staff internal and external events including premieres, press days, junkets; tracking costs for department budget.


The ideal candidate exhibits consistent sound judgement and maturity in business communications and decision making, even when faced with ambiguity.   He or she is organized, creative, and intelligent.  She/he is personable, a heightened listener and a real doer, and is able to multi-task and work efficiently, independently and with speed. They are not afraid to get their hands dirty.  They collaborate well with partners that range from content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. They aren’t timid about assessing their work when they are done to explore what they could have done differently or better. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style. They are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and question values inconsistent with our values and Netflix culture. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues.  Talent relations is not a 9 to 5 job and will require willingness to work evenings and on weekend.  International travel also required.




Qualifications
The successful candidate will have at least 3 years of entertainment experience in an agency, studio, network, production or journalism setting. They have worked directly and successfully with talent have relationships with talent representatives.  The ideal candidate is high energy, motivated with strong relationship-building capabilities and a capacity to work in a very fast-paced environment.  BA/BS required.


To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


Creative
Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


Succinct Communicator
Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


A smart minimalist
Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.


Has a Point of View
An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


Pace
Moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


Integrity
Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


An Adult
Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


COMPENSATION
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.


REPORTING RELATIONSHIP
The Coordinator, Talent Relations, reports to the Director of Talent Relations.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Manager, Post Production - Comedy


We are seeking an experienced Post Production Manager to help manage the Comedy Specials vertical from a post perspective, establish and curate vendor & editorial crew relations, review budgets and support/suggest best practices for post from pre-production through delivery. Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of post production for our owned and licensed original series.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 117 million streaming members in 190 countries.  With a global reach, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


Technical Setup of Show
• Work with Production Technologies, Distribution and Localization teams, and external production & post team on defining key post workflows such as camera capture, HDR color pipeline, master delivery, and final archive - with a high emphasis on 4k and on multicam, live-to-tape workflows
• Set up workflow for internal reviews of content, cut views
• Manage communication of cut schedule to all key stakeholders
• Evaluate new technical initiatives and the applied viability on a project-to-project basis


Budgeting
• Work with Post Supervisors, Line Producers, and EIC’s to prepare and vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback internally and externally on viability and risks
• Review creative and define post budget and strategy
• Collaborate with internal/external teams to lock budget
• Track & manage all post related costs, keeping stakeholders apprised of status


Post Scheduling
• Assess schedules and potential efficiencies.
• Inform on and draft post schedules when needed
• Collaborate with internal teams (including Distribution and Localization) & external production team to lock and manage schedule
• Troubleshoot and communicate all changes to schedule to internal/external teams


Staffing/Vendors
• Review & approve facilities for graphics, VFX, animation, color, and sound
• Search for and approve and key hires (post producer, post supervisor, editors, assistant editors)
• Determine key post vendors to accommodate creative vision and relationships, tax incentives, budget needs, location issues
• Help maintain/curate preferred vendor list
• Help maintain/curate preferred staff list


Content Management
• Set up and attend key creative approval sessions such as final mix playbacks, VFX reviews or color correction reviews
• Schedule and attend Netflix screenings, previews, premieres, etc. Collaborate with show post on setting up theater, arranging engineering when necessary, and rehearsing the content when applicable
• Assess and communicate all deliverables, ensuring prompt delivery and technical compliance


Qualifications:
• BA/BS Degree
• 10 Years + as a Head of Post or experienced Post Production Supervisor working on a freelance or staff basis, having worked with medium and high budget studio, major production company and network series and films
• Ability to handle a fast paced environment supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery)
• Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K and HDR
• Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
• Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting
• Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
• Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
• Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process
• Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task
• Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Movie Magic Budgeting, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail
• Working knowledge of UHD/4K cameras, UHD/4K workflows, Avid, Final Cut Pro, Premiere, Resolve, Baselight, Nucoda, Pablo Rio, After Effects, ProTools, IMF, DCP


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

text: Senior Software Engineer - Digital Marketing Infrastructure
description: On Jan 6, 2016, Netflix announced the creation of the first global Internet TV network. But our journey has just begun. Our marketing department is tasked with building awareness of Netflix across the globe. The Digital Marketing Infrastructure (DMI) team is building a platform that enables rapid execution of marketing concepts. We partner directly with Netflix Marketing, PR, Social and many other teams within Netflix. Our applications also enable external partner agencies to build trailers and localize them. Our goal is to build applications to enable Netflix Global Marketing teams operate fast and at scale. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software engineer who can innovate at the leading edge of technology building highly scalable digital asset management systems supporting uploads for terabytes of data and millions of files amongst other things.

Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering Senior Software Engineer - Digital Marketing Infrastructure


On Jan 6, 2016, Netflix announced the creation of the first global Internet TV network. But our journey has just begun. Our marketing department is tasked with building awareness of Netflix across the globe. The Digital Marketing Infrastructure (DMI) team is building a platform that enables rapid execution of marketing concepts. We partner directly with Netflix Marketing, PR, Social and many other teams within Netflix. Our applications also enable external partner agencies to build trailers and localize them. Our goal is to build applications to enable Netflix Global Marketing teams operate fast and at scale.


We are looking for an experienced Senior Software engineer who can innovate at the leading edge of technology building highly scalable digital asset management systems supporting uploads for terabytes of data and millions of files amongst other things.

  • We are a small, lean and tightly-knit team.
  • We are very agile with a strong focus on innovation and technology.
  • We work closely with Netflix Marketing to define, shape and implement our Digital Marketing Infrastructure toolset.

  • Take full ownership of a product or feature from conception to launch.

  • Solid experience with JVM based languages (Java/Kotlin/Scala).
  • Experience building and using RESTful APIs.
  • Experience working with SQL and noSQL data stores and Hibernate or other ORM technologies.
  • Strong analytical and debugging skills and willingness to pick up new technologies.
  • Willingness to collaborate and work with cross-functional teams for api integrations
  • Ability to iterate fast to have a quick turnaround time for fast moving customers.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills.
    • Minimum Qualifications
  • Prior experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS or Azure or other).
  • Experience with Kafka or similar frameworks.
  • Some experience with Javascript technologies
    • Preferred Qualifications
  • Engineering for Marketing Effectiveness

description: We call our IT team at Netflix Nerds.  Nerd - an expert in a technical field.  Being a Nerd at Netflix means more than an expert in a technical field.  It also means being passionate about the job of a Nerd and the technology we use.  Read below to find out what being a Nerd at Netflix means and see if you are what we’re looking for.  Netflix is on the hunt for a smart, motivated and customer service centric individual to take on the role of a Nerd who will provide exceptional technology support to our employee base. This position will be based out of our Tokyo office.  The Nerds team is responsible for over five thousand systems globally. With corporate offices located in Los Gatos, Los Angeles, New York, London, Amsterdam, Singapore, Taiwan, Tokyo, and Sao Paulo, the team is constantly challenged. While responsible for all employee technology platforms and services throughout the company, the team is also highly encouraged to constantly review and refresh the technology, with great opportunity to innovate in Netflix's unique “fast paced environment.”As a Nerd based out of our Tokyo office you are responsible for the employee experience, providing world class support and resolving every technology issue that comes your way. You are an expert in all of our internal technologies and must ensure Netflix employees stay highly productive in the most secure environment possible. These requests can come in via tickets, email, walkups, chat, phone calls and automated alerts. This position will involve tasks such as supporting cloud and desktop software, troubleshooting conference and screening room AV, access requests, provisioning/deprovisioning accounts and hardware, deploying and upgrading mobile devices, inventory management, supporting off site events, resolving printer issues, along with projects, training on applications and security practices, and documentation. Daily duties can consist of prioritizing, resolving, routing and scheduling all incoming internal technology support requests. The Nerd must also set expectations with the ticket requester, and ensure all ticket information is logged correctly.

Tokyo, Japan Employee Technology Employee Technology NERD, Japan


We call our IT team at Netflix Nerds.  Nerd - an expert in a technical field.  Being a Nerd at Netflix means more than an expert in a technical field.  It also means being passionate about the job of a Nerd and the technology we use.  Read below to find out what being a Nerd at Netflix means and see if you are what we’re looking for.  
Netflix is on the hunt for a smart, motivated and customer service centric individual to take on the role of a Nerd who will provide exceptional technology support to our employee base. This position will be based out of our Tokyo office.  


The Nerds team is responsible for over five thousand systems globally. With corporate offices located in Los Gatos, Los Angeles, New York, London, Amsterdam, Singapore, Taiwan, Tokyo, and Sao Paulo, the team is constantly challenged. While responsible for all employee technology platforms and services throughout the company, the team is also highly encouraged to constantly review and refresh the technology, with great opportunity to innovate in Netflix's unique “fast paced environment.”


As a Nerd based out of our Tokyo office you are responsible for the employee experience, providing world class support and resolving every technology issue that comes your way. You are an expert in all of our internal technologies and must ensure Netflix employees stay highly productive in the most secure environment possible. 


These requests can come in via tickets, email, walkups, chat, phone calls and automated alerts. This position will involve tasks such as supporting cloud and desktop software, troubleshooting conference and screening room AV, access requests, provisioning/deprovisioning accounts and hardware, deploying and upgrading mobile devices, inventory management, supporting off site events, resolving printer issues, along with projects, training on applications and security practices, and documentation. Daily duties can consist of prioritizing, resolving, routing and scheduling all incoming internal technology support requests. The Nerd must also set expectations with the ticket requester, and ensure all ticket information is logged correctly.

  • A minimum of 5 years of IT or Desktop Support/System Administration
  • Strong fundamentals in networking protocols and troubleshooting
  • Familiarity in distributed computing environment concepts; local and network based user and group accounts and permissions
  • IT management experience or background in maintaining an office infrastructure independently. 
  • Experience in racking and installing networking equipment and servers and working in a MDF room
  • Knowledge of best practices around data security
  • Experience supporting Cloud and SaaS Applications and SSO, including Google Apps for the Enterprise (Gmail, Calendaring, Drive, Sites, Groups and Google +)
  • In depth knowledge of and the ability to perform advanced troubleshooting on Mac OS, Chrome OS, Windows 7, 8 & 10, Linux, and various applications including Office and Adobe suites
  • Solid working knowledge of Mac, Lenovo and Chromebook hardware including laptops & desktops
  • Mobile device support including iPhone and Android
  • Audio/Video knowledge and troubleshooting conference room technology including Google Hangouts, Google Meet , Chromebox for Meetings, and Crestron
  • Experience with partnering with external vendors to maintain the office technology
  • Experience with supporting people remotely
  • Experience in group and 1:1 training

    • Recommended Experience:
  • Japanese and English speaking required
  • Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision; must be a self-motivated self-starter that can initiate ideas and take ownership of work
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly and with minimal guidance
  • Ability to partner effectively with business leaders and cross functional teams
  • Thrives on technical challenges and takes pride in solving them
  • Strategic thinking both technically and business-wise
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Capable of following and composing process and procedure documentation, training users in complex topics, and interacting positively with upper management
  • Patience and a desire to provide world class customer service 
  • Ability to read customers and make great judgement calls

    • Recommended Skills:

description: How can you know that millions of hours of sound, playing from all directions, in hundreds of languages, sounds perfect to a hundred million pairs of ears? The Audio team at Netflix is working to answer that question. We work with studios to get the best content using the latest audio technology. We train algorithms to analyze audio content for clarity, quality and correctness. Then we package all of that up to create audio streams for thousands of device types and over 100 million Netflix customers.We meet this challenge with a leading-edge, distributed, cloud-based workflow, excellent software development practices, and a strong intuition on what works for a scalable production system. This Audio team is small and scrappy. But the ever increasing catalog and ways to experience Netflix content is pushing the team to grow.About YouYou are a self-driven software engineer who thrives in an environment of managed chaos. You have excellent software development skills and a background in audio processing. You constantly strive to improve yourself and the team. You are eager to apply your expertise in solving cutting-edge audio and speech processing challenges, impacting what millions of people hear everyday. You might play an instrument, love music, or generally enjoy the experience of sound.This RoleYou will develop and test audio applications, shepherding projects through prototyping, development, cloud execution, and customer feedback improvements. You will be held to a standard of bit-for-bit perfect audio and 100 million satisfied listeners. Working with a variety of teams, your will create flexible multimedia processing systems that analyze and interpret data, support nascent platforms and usages, and produces great sound.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Engineering Senior Software Engineer - Audio Algorithms


How can you know that millions of hours of sound, playing from all directions, in hundreds of languages, sounds perfect to a hundred million pairs of ears? The Audio team at Netflix is working to answer that question. We work with studios to get the best content using the latest audio technology. We train algorithms to analyze audio content for clarity, quality and correctness. Then we package all of that up to create audio streams for thousands of device types and over 100 million Netflix customers.


We meet this challenge with a leading-edge, distributed, cloud-based workflow, excellent software development practices, and a strong intuition on what works for a scalable production system. This Audio team is small and scrappy. But the ever increasing catalog and ways to experience Netflix content is pushing the team to grow.


About You
You are a self-driven software engineer who thrives in an environment of managed chaos. You have excellent software development skills and a background in audio processing. You constantly strive to improve yourself and the team. You are eager to apply your expertise in solving cutting-edge audio and speech processing challenges, impacting what millions of people hear everyday. You might play an instrument, love music, or generally enjoy the experience of sound.


This Role
You will develop and test audio applications, shepherding projects through prototyping, development, cloud execution, and customer feedback improvements. You will be held to a standard of bit-for-bit perfect audio and 100 million satisfied listeners. Working with a variety of teams, your will create flexible multimedia processing systems that analyze and interpret data, support nascent platforms and usages, and produces great sound.

  • 5+ years experience in software development, with excellent debugging and problem solving skills.
  • Expert in C++ or Java and object-oriented programming.
  • Experience with large-scale distributed systems and cloud-computing using tools such as Docker, Swagger and AWS.
  • Ability to guide multi-faceted projects working with engineers with diverse backgrounds, in multiple teams, and having a variety of skill sets.
    • Essential Qualifications
  • BS or MS in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
  • Familiarity of speech processing, audio content analysis, or machine learning applied to audio.
  • Development expertise in audio streaming and multimedia frameworks such as ffmpeg, gStreamer, MLT, JACK, CoreAudio, AudioKit or similar.
  • Comfortable with the developers’ scaffolding of version control, databases, automated deployment, testing, and continuous integration such as Git, Jenkins, Spinnaker, Elastic and Cassandra.
    • Auspicious Qualifications

Singapore, Singapore Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Marketing Planning & Analysis - APAC


As Netflix continues to grow and expand, we are looking for a talented team member to support Marketing Planning & Analysis in the Asia Pacific region (APAC). Marketing leadership relies heavily on the Marketing Planning & Analysis team to inform important business decisions with actionable data-driven insights.
In this role, you will need to be highly analytical, a strong problem solver and effective communicator. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results.
The team needs a self-starter, who is able to work effectively, autonomously and drive projects with the APAC Marketing team and cross-functionally with Consumer Insights, Data Science & Engineering, Science & Algorithms, Payments, etc. You must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers.
The position is based at our Asia headquarters in Singapore and involves close coordination with members of the APAC marketing team in both Asia and the US. You will report to the Director, Marketing Planning & Analysis for APAC, based in Singapore, and will be a key thought partner and go-to person for the Marketing Directors of Netflix’s Asian markets, and the APAC Marketing VP.

  • Perform strategic value-added analyses around growth opportunities, marketing campaigns, media optimization, and core business metrics
  • Develop actionable digital analytics insights to increase campaign performance
  • Facilitate marketing planning and the allocation of the marketing budget, and manage in-quarter optimization and adjustments
  • Monitor subscriber acquisition and retention; analyze key predictors, identify trends and present actionable insights to the Marketing team
  • Develop insights to support our continued international expansion
  • Conduct market research, track and compile industry trends and competitive analysis to inform marketing strategies
  • You will autonomously lead projects from start to finish (i.e., identify areas of opportunity, structure analyses, gather data, generate insights and communicate findings, influence and help partners and stakeholders with execution).
    • About the job
  • A successful candidate will have a strong track record of identifying key questions, connecting the dots, performing analyses independently, and communicating findings in a clear and concise way. He/she must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers.
  • 4-7 years of experience in a highly analytical environment - top management consulting firm, corporate planning and/or analysis in an entertainment/digital media company, or similarly demanding environment in which modeling and strategic thinking and analyses are performed
  • Proven track record and enthusiasm for complex problem solving utilizing financial modeling and analysis, including great Excel skills
  • Strong capabilities for crafting and presenting analyses and insights to senior executives
  • History of self starting initiatives and an enthusiasm for creating their own work
  • International experience a plus; you are enthusiastic about working with our partners in both Asia and the US
  • Top-tier education; MBA a plus (or equivalent years of relevant experience)
  • Prior work experience in Media/Entertainment industry or working in/with Marketing a plus (digital marketing analytics experience a strong plus)
  • Thai, Vietnamese and Bahasa Indonesian language skills would be a plus

description: THE OPPORTUNITYWith over 100 Million subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. Our international efforts have brought Netflix around the globe to virtually all countries and we’re excited to bring even more of our Originals programming to our viewers around the globe.Netflix seeks a seasoned production music attorney as in a Counsel, Music role to help support our expanding slate of Originals content and our domestic and international expansion strategy.The successful candidate will work in the company's Music Group, which is part of the Business & Legal Affairs Team based in Los Angeles. The Music Group is located in Los Angeles, London and Berlin and is responsible for all of Netflix’s global music business and strategy, from the production and licensing of Netflix Originals to the administration of Netflix’s repertoire of music and through to the distribution of the Netflix service globally. This exciting role focuses on the production side and will be responsible for structuring, negotiating and drafting agreements with the composers, songwriters, artists and performers who create music for Netflix's Original film, series and documentary content and with the record companies and music publishers who license music. He or she will handle music contract and copyright related matters as they arise, will likely need to dig into local law and practice in various International territories, and should be extremely comfortable working independently, counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. He or she will have an innate ability to maintain organization and focus that fuels his/her effectiveness in successfully juggling multiple projects. The successful candidate will also thrive in an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process yet have the ability to work with organizations or institutions who may not hold the same beliefs. If you are this candidate, you love working in an environment where freedom and responsibility are a tenet, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates.  That curiosity is a plus if you seek a role which offers unique opportunities to expand and grow beyond your immediate area of expertise, and to collaborate with colleagues in our domestic and international offices who share your passion for music, copyright and the entertainment industry. As Counsel, your vast music production experience enables you to handle any situation or crisis that may be encountered on a production. You expertly navigate those situations to arrive at the best solution for the production and the studio. You understand the dynamics among showrunners, executive producers, line producers, producers, finance, production, post production, credits, labor, marketing, publicity, content localization, business affairs and legal affairs and know when and how to engage and align the appropriate teams when a music issue calls. You are comfortable evaluating risk and have the confidence to make quick decisions when faced with the exigencies of production.This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of entertainment.This role is based in Netflix's Los Angeles office and reports to the Senior Counsel of the Music Group, part of the Business & Legal Affairs team at Netflix.REQUIREMENTSThe successful candidate will have:  8+ years of film/series production music experience, including immersion in structuring, negotiating and drafting composer, performer and featured artist agreements, master use and synchronization license agreements, music producer agreements, record company and music publishing waivers and soundtrack album agreements; in-depth knowledge of music copyright and the film/series production process - from script to budget to music clearance/licensing to composer engagement/recording through to delivery, cue sheets, music publishing administration and launch; practical knowledge of the music and technology industries (including active relationships with music agents, managers, music publishers, record companies and music libraries); and understanding of the evolving theatrical, VOD, TV, syndication and home video landscapes. International market experience and international production experience is a plus. Experience providing in-house support in a film or television production company is highly preferred.

THE OPPORTUNITY
With over 100 Million subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. Netflix seeks a seasoned production music attorney as in a Counsel, Music role to help support our expanding slate of Originals content and our domestic and international expansion strategy.


The successful candidate will work in the company's Music Group, which is part of the Business & Legal Affairs Team based in Los Angeles. The Music Group is located in Los Angeles, London and Berlin and is responsible for all of Netflix’s global music business and strategy, from the production and licensing of Netflix Originals to the administration of Netflix’s repertoire of music and through to the distribution of the Netflix service globally. This exciting role focuses on the production side and will be responsible for structuring, negotiating and drafting agreements with the composers, songwriters, artists and performers who create music for Netflix's Original film, series and documentary content and with the record companies and music publishers who license music. He or she will handle music contract and copyright related matters as they arise, will likely need to dig into local law and practice in various International territories, and should be extremely comfortable working independently, counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. He or she will have an innate ability to maintain organization and focus that fuels his/her effectiveness in successfully juggling multiple projects. The successful candidate will also thrive in an environment that places thoughtful efficiency over process yet have the ability to work with organizations or institutions who may not hold the same beliefs. If you are this candidate, you love working in an environment where freedom and responsibility are a tenet, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates.  That curiosity is a plus if you seek a role which offers unique opportunities to expand and grow beyond your immediate area of expertise, and to collaborate with colleagues in our domestic and international offices who share your passion for music, copyright and the entertainment industry. 


As Counsel, your vast music production experience enables you to handle any situation or crisis that may be encountered on a production. You expertly navigate those situations to arrive at the best solution for the production and the studio. You understand the dynamics among showrunners, executive producers, line producers, producers, finance, production, post production, credits, labor, marketing, publicity, content localization, business affairs and legal affairs and know when and how to engage and align the appropriate teams when a music issue calls. You are comfortable evaluating risk and have the confidence to make quick decisions when faced with the exigencies of production.


This is an opportunity to be part of a public company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of entertainment.


This role is based in Netflix's Los Angeles office and reports to the Senior Counsel of the Music Group, part of the Business & Legal Affairs team at Netflix.


REQUIREMENTS
The successful candidate will have:  8+ years of film/series production music experience, including immersion in structuring, negotiating and drafting composer, performer and featured artist agreements, master use and synchronization license agreements, music producer agreements, record company and music publishing waivers and soundtrack album agreements; in-depth knowledge of music copyright and the film/series production process - from script to budget to music clearance/licensing to composer engagement/recording through to delivery, cue sheets, music publishing administration and launch; practical knowledge of the music and technology industries (including active relationships with music agents, managers, music publishers, record companies and music libraries); and understanding of the evolving theatrical, VOD, TV, syndication and home video landscapes. International market experience and international production experience is a plus. Experience providing in-house support in a film or television production company is highly preferred.

  • Clear, concise communication skills.
  • Strong analytical capabilities and judgment, even when the rules are unclear and the issues are of first impression.
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced production environment.
  • Ability to pivot quickly and fluidly, think practically and be solution-oriented.
  • Curiosity and willingness to tackle matters outside area of expertise.

description: With over 93 million subscribers across the globe, Netflix has been delivering joy one stream at a time on pretty much any connected device. About UsThe Web UI team is responsible for building out the netflix.com experience for users to discover content. We also build the website application as a platform for our internal partners to integrate product features for Netflix Originals promotions and trailer video playback. We are passionate about building the best experience on the web, across different browsers and operating systems. We use React and Node.js to craft an immersive single page app that is used by millions of people worldwide to stream their favorite shows and movies. With native browser streaming, our challenge is to create a highly optimized application that can run on a variety of devices and networks. We want our diverse users from all over the world to experience the best possible browsing and viewing experience on the web. We work with internal partners ranging from product managers, designers, data scientists, streaming algorithms teams, and at times, with content creators, to build exciting new features and AB tests. The versatility of the web platform enables us to test our state-of-the-art product features quickly, to gain valuable insight that can be applied across all of our Netflix streaming applications. Here are some projects our team has been working on:The Road to ES2015 in ProductionChasing 60 fps React and Flow
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering UI Engineering Sr Software Engineer - WebUI


With over 93 million subscribers across the globe, Netflix has been delivering joy one stream at a time on pretty much any connected device.
 
About Us
The Web UI team is responsible for building out the netflix.com experience for users to discover content. We also build the website application as a platform for our internal partners to integrate product features for Netflix Originals promotions and trailer video playback.
 
We are passionate about building the best experience on the web, across different browsers and operating systems. We use React and Node.js to craft an immersive single page app that is used by millions of people worldwide to stream their favorite shows and movies. With native browser streaming, our challenge is to create a highly optimized application that can run on a variety of devices and networks. We want our diverse users from all over the world to experience the best possible browsing and viewing experience on the web.
 
We work with internal partners ranging from product managers, designers, data scientists, streaming algorithms teams, and at times, with content creators, to build exciting new features and AB tests. Multi-team collaboration and solid project management skills are essential to the success of this role.

These short-lived campaign sites are critical to promoting Netflix Originals and often contain a ‘fun factor’ - i.e: contests, games, interactive media. Our mission is to support these sites by allowing digital assets to seamlessly be deployed within Netflix’s cloud environment while adhering to a framework that maintains Netflix’s security and operational standards.

You will be on the front lines collaborating with design, marketing, and infrastructure teams from around the world to gather site requirements, conceptualize design, and ultimately deliver an end product. Los Angeles, California Finance Financial Planning and Analysis Senior Financial Analyst - Content FP&A


With Netflix service and award-winning Originals content in more than 190 countries, we continue to change entertainment around the world. Operating in a financially complex space, Netflix derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach we take to managing the company.


The Content Planning & Analysis group is looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join its team. This role will be the primary point person to support senior management in all budgeting and forecasting related areas. Senior leadership depends heavily on the Content Planning & Analysis group to accurately model and forecast the business as well as to lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform important business decisions.


RESPONSIBILITIES
This role will be based out of our Hollywood office and be responsible for analysis used in Netflix financial content planning and strategic decision-making, specifically:
- Supporting near-term and long-term P&L forecasts
- Supporting key portions of the company's free cash flow forecast
- Developing insightful presentations that summarize this data and facilitate decision-making for senior Netflix management
- Performing financial scenario analysis to support senior management's strategic decision making


QUALIFICATIONS
Candidates are required to be highly analytical and be strong, effective communicators. Prior experience in financial planning & analysis in the entertainment industry, management consulting, investment banking, or Big 4 accounting is preferred. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of superior financial and strategic analysis and developing/delivering recommendations based on this analysis. 
The successful candidate must display initiative in anticipating and exceeding the business demands of senior-level business managers. This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. 
Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively autonomously.

  • 4 to 7 years of experience
  • Extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative financial analysis
  • Superior proficiency with Excel & complex financial modeling
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Sound working knowledge of the related accounting guidance preferred
  • Bachelor's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature, preferably Business, Economics, or Mathematics
    • REQUIREMENTS

text: Senior Software Engineer - Localization Core Services
description: With our global footprint, it is imperative that we provide a hyper-personal experience for our customers. One aspect of personalization is to let customers watch our content in their preferred language. Netflix is investing heavily in machine learning technologies that will help get our content localized in shorter time and good quality.  The Localization Core Services team is seeking a passionate and talented server side engineer.  In this role, you will build business critical applications/tools that leverage machine learning models developed by our researchers in the field of natural language processing, machine translation, speech and vision. description: THE OPPORTUNITYAt Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment with one simple goal: to bring people joy.  Our international efforts have brought Netflix’s service and award-winning Originals programming to viewers in over 190 countries. To bring joy to global audiences, we need truly global content.  That doesn’t always come from Hollywood.  So our content legal team is in search of an experienced IP attorney in Europe to handle a wide range of IP issues that arise from the creation of Netflix original content across Europe.  In this position, working from Amsterdam or London, you will be the first Content IP lawyer outside of Los Angeles with a unique opportunity to launch (and eventually build!) a nimble team that will take the lead in Europe on things like rights acquisition, copyright, chain-of-title, title clearance, production clearance of content, IP enforcement, IP claims defense, moral rights, defamation, and trademarks.  This role will closely collaborate with the creative, business, marketing and other legal teams that work together to create Netflix’s great content. As a seasoned entertainment IP attorney, the breadth of your experience enables you to handle any situation that may be encountered on a production. You’ve seen it all and aren’t phased by the last minute surprises that inevitably arise when developing, shooting, or marketing a film, series or documentary.  You expertly navigate those situations while allowing your studio colleagues to fulfill their creative and business goals. You understand the dynamics among showrunners, executive producers, line producers, finance, post-production, marketing and creative, and know when and how to align the appropriate teams when IP issue arise. You’re comfortable evaluating risk with imperfect information and have the confidence to make quick decisions.  Your expert eye for detail and exceptional organizational talents mean that you are able to improve upon systems to gain efficiency. You are passionate about the entertainment industry and are excited to learn more about the business from a non-traditional perspective.  Above all, you have an opinion and are willing to voice it. The successful candidate will love working in an environment where freedom, responsibility, and curiosity are mandates.  That candidate will also thrive in an workplace that values thoughtful efficiency more than process, and innovation more than convention.The role will report to Senior Counsel, Content and Brand IP based in Los Angeles.  Frequent travel throughout Europe will be required, in addition to quarterly travel to California.

You’ve seen it all and aren’t phased by the last minute surprises that inevitably arise when developing, shooting, or marketing a film, series or documentary.  You expertly navigate those situations while allowing your studio colleagues to fulfill their creative and business goals. You understand the dynamics among showrunners, executive producers, line producers, finance, post-production, marketing and creative, and know when and how to align the appropriate teams when IP issue arise. You’re comfortable evaluating risk with imperfect information and have the confidence to make quick decisions.  Your expert eye for detail and exceptional organizational talents mean that you are able to improve upon systems to gain efficiency. You are passionate about the entertainment industry and are excited to learn more about the business from a non-traditional perspective.  Above all, you have an opinion and are willing to voice it.


The successful candidate will love working in an environment where freedom, responsibility, and curiosity are mandates.  That candidate will also thrive in an workplace that values thoughtful efficiency more than process, and innovation more than convention.
The role will report to Senior Counsel, Content and Brand IP based in Los Angeles.  Frequent travel throughout Europe will be required, in addition to quarterly travel to California.

  • Identify IP-related risks in our content and communicate them to the necessary stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with business and legal affairs teams to acquire and develop IP, then shepherd it through production and distribution.
  • Conduct and analyze trademark clearances, including multi-jurisdiction searches. Manage claims of IP infringement at the pre-litigation stage.
  • Develop strong relationships with leading law firms that specialize in entertainment and IP and oversee their work.
  • Create and implement production clearance strategies for European content.
  • Rapidly respond to production clearance issues.
  • Serve as internal, cross-functional expert on all areas of European IP law.
    • Responsibilities:
  • 10+ years of intellectual property law, including significant experience in the entertainment industry.
  • An extensive network of contacts in the European media industry.
  • Deep knowledge of filmed entertainment and the production process.
  • Deep understanding of EU IP law, as well as IP law in one or more individual member states, including copyright, moral rights, fair use, rights of publicity/privacy, and freedom of speech.
  • Experience managing heavy workflow independently.
  • Experience building and managing teams.
  • Outstanding  communication skills and a bias toward creative thinking.
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably on multiple projects under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment.
  • Highly collaborative and responds positively to change and new ideas.
  • Curious and eager to tackle matters outside area of expertise.
  • Fluency in German or French a strong plus, but isn’t required.
  • Sense of humor!
    • Requirements:

Singapore, Singapore Talent and Recruiting Human Resources Talent Coordinator, APAC - Singapore


Talent acquisition is a huge priority at Netflix, and as a Talent Coordinator you will be responsible for arranging onsite interviews and delivering a seamless candidate and employee experience, from interview to hire. You will have the chance to interact with candidates from across the globe, and will help define what a strong candidate experience looks like in one of our highest-growth regions.


On another level, the Talent Coordinator serves as the glue of the broader recruiting team; binding our efforts together, and ensuring the quality of the experience which internal and external partners have with us.

  • Partner directly with recruiters, researchers, and hiring managers to coordinate interviews and onboarding
  • Prioritize, organize, and manage multiple schedules efficiently, in a fast-paced environment
  • Provide a concierge-level travel experience; manage external travel agencies, as well as legal and hotel partnerships
  • Work with cross-functional partners (Facilities, Employee Services, Administrative Assistants, Client Technology Services, etc.) to provide a high-touch candidate experience
  • Post new jobs to both internal and external job boards
  • Other talent-related projects
    • Some of what you’ll do:
  • Excited about Talent/HR/Recruiting, as a function
  • Self-motivated; can take initiative and follows through reliably
  • Accustomed to multitasking, prioritizing and meeting multiple tight deadlines
  • Extremely organized, detail-oriented, and highly-curious
  • Passionate about providing strong customer service
  • A team-player, who can give and take new and constructive ideas and feedback, directly
  • A stellar communicator, w/ strong written and spoken cross-cultural communication skills
    • We want someone who is:
  • BA/BS required or equivalent higher education degree
  • 2-4 years of relevant experience; HR and/or client service experience ideal
  • The ability to communicate effectively with internal and external partners, and to anticipate the needs of both groups
  • Experience with Gmail, Google Calendar, etc is highly preferred
    • Education & Experience:
  • Our ability to hire in APAC, and hire well, will have a huge impact on the overall success of Netflix
  • You in turn will have an outsized impact on how well we recruit: on the experience which candidates, recruiters, interviewers and hiring managers all enjoy
  • Be a part of a unique, high performance culture centered around freedom, responsibility and impact.

search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR PR Originals Publicity Manager - Nordics & Benelux


Do you live and breathe entertainment?
Are you an entertainment publicity expert in the Nordics & Benelux regions with an international curiosity & mindset?Do you enjoy strategizing publicity and promotional campaigns and re-evaluate campaigns that you have worked on to appraise what you could have done different or better?


If so, we may have just the opportunity for you:


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million streaming members across the globe. With continued international expansion and a move into original content acquisition and production underway, it’s a great time to join the Netflix team.


The Originals Publicity Manager - Nordics & Benelux will be based in Amsterdam and will work as part of the EMEA Originals Publicity team to formulate and implement strategy across Northern Europe for the growing slate of Netflix Originals originating from the territory. The candidate will report into the Vice President of EMEA Originals Publicity. The position will provide a critical link between local agencies and Netflix in promoting Original content on the service. It’s the chance to be part of changing the entertainment landscape across the globe and to seize the opportunity to take different approaches in managing and executing promotional and publicity campaigns.


The Role
The Originals Publicity Manager - Nordics & Benelux will work across several different disciplines that bring Original series, films & documentaries to fruition here at Netflix. They will drive innovative publicity campaigns and collaborate with cross-functional partners for our local Originals, whilst drawing our incredible slate of Original content across the world  to drive our business in Northern Europe. They will independently formulate, and drive creative and executable ideas, communicate priorities and present clear goals to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their team members to do the same.


The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic and understand the market. They will also not be afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches; they will make tough decisions without agonizing and will be candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial. They are scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks at all levels and they thrive in an environment void of bureaucracy and layers.


The day to day responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, formulating and implementing local publicity campaigns, managing & leading PR agencies, managing set visits, scheduling local and international junkets, liaising with journalists, talent representatives and talent, implementing screening strategy and writing press releases.

  • Have 7-10 years of experience in a local or international entertainment PR setting - either agency, distributor or TV network - and a familiarity with local festivals and awards space
  • Possess a keen understanding of new and traditional media
  • Be able & willing to think on an international level
  • Be able to understand and comfortably interpret business and technology challenges
  • Be a clear and concise communicator
  • Have excellent media relationships, experience managing agencies and the ability to deal effectively with talent, talent reps, journalists and other media influencers
  • Work well across disciplines to execute campaigns
  • Be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadline and thrive in a high energy, fast-paced environment
  • Pack your bags because domestic and international travel is a requirement
    • The successful candidate for the Originals Publicity Manager - Nordics & Benelux role will likely:
  • The ability to think innovatively - connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.
  • Succinct Communicator. Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
  • Pragmatic, organized and detailed. Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.
  • A smart minimalist. Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.
  • Has a Point of View. An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.
  • Pace moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once.
  • Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.
  • Integrity. Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.
  • An Adult. Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.
    • To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:

description: Netflix is hiring a Social Media Editor to set and own our brand social strategy and develop our platform presences in the Nordics.Looking after a small social media team and working closely with external agencies and our internal marketing, PR, content, product and consumer insights teams, this person will be a thought leader in creating culture as well as being fascinated by brand building, tech and entertainment.Fluent in the language of 140 (or 280) characters, the successful candidate is equally able to set social strategy, develop tone of voice, write a script, or fire off a well-timed social post. First and foremost, this is a strategic role. We are not looking for community managers or someone to lead the department of doing cool stuff for no good reason. We need someone who can work creatively and strategically to identify the right platforms to speak to the right audiences - and help Netflix speak to them in the right way to grow earned media. Someone with a strong and well-informed point of view in critically analysing the latest social media trends and tactics and knowing which we can harness to help grow earned media in the Nordics.  The Netflix culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and intellectual curiosity. Read our culture memo to learn what it’s actually like working for Netflix in the Nordics. To excel in this environment, you must be independently minded, have impeccable creative taste, and strong instinct for stories that will get fans talking about Netflix and our shows more passionately and frequently than ever before.The successful candidate for this position will likely have a minimum of five years’ experience working in-house, at an agency or another company with a proven track record of generating earned word of mouth. Experience in building strategic editorial plans is a must. Fluency in English is a must, Swedish is highly preferred. If this sounds like you, then maybe we’d give you our Toblerone.

Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Manager Social Media - Nordics


Netflix is hiring a Social Media Editor to set and own our brand social strategy and develop our platform presences in the Nordics.


Looking after a small social media team and working closely with external agencies and our internal marketing, PR, content, product and consumer insights teams, this person will be a thought leader in creating culture as well as being fascinated by brand building, tech and entertainment.


Fluent in the language of 140 (or 280) characters, the successful candidate is equally able to set social strategy, develop tone of voice, write a script, or fire off a well-timed social post.


First and foremost, this is a strategic role. We are not looking for community managers or someone to lead the department of doing cool stuff for no good reason. We need someone who can work creatively and strategically to identify the right platforms to speak to the right audiences - and help Netflix speak to them in the right way to grow earned media. Someone with a strong and well-informed point of view in critically analysing the latest social media trends and tactics and knowing which we can harness to help grow earned media in the Nordics.  


The Netflix culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and intellectual curiosity. Read our culture memo to learn what it’s actually like working for Netflix in the Nordics.


To excel in this environment, you must be independently minded, have impeccable creative taste, and strong instinct for stories that will get fans talking about Netflix and our shows more passionately and frequently than ever before.


The successful candidate for this position will likely have a minimum of five years’ experience working in-house, at an agency or another company with a proven track record of generating earned word of mouth. Experience in building strategic editorial plans is a must. Fluency in English is a must, Swedish is highly preferred.


If this sounds like you, then maybe we’d give you our Toblerone.

  • Meticulous about the details. Every single one of them

  • A proactive and positive thinker and a contributor to the team
  • Creative and has the ability to think innovatively

  • Effective in dealing with global PR agencies, talent reps and internal executives

    • The Successful Candidate Is:

    COMPENSATION
    Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

Do you have a genuine affinity, love and appreciation for documentaries? Do you regularly binge true crime, food, art and nature series? Is awards season your favorite time of year?  If so, you may just be the perfect candidate to join our originals publicity team, working on our original documentary series initiative.


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 109 million streaming members in over 190 countries. With continued international expansion and ongoing original documentary acquisition and production, it’s a great time to join Netflix.


We currently have a unique opportunity for the right candidate to help handle original docu-series for the online leader. It’s a chance to join a thriving team and support powerful projects by managing and executing promotional and publicity campaigns for an integral part of our business.


The Role
The Manager of Original Documentary Publicity will work very closely with several different disciplines that are bringing originals docs and docu-series to fruition here at Netflix, balancing consumer-driven and awards-emphasis campaigns.


The ideal candidate will have a point-of-view and in the spirit of Netflix and the company’s philosophy, can drive a disruptive approach to handling campaigns in support of original docu-series.


The candidate sees this unique challenge as an opportunity to innovate and to re-invent traditional publicity and awards campaigns on behalf of documentary, and is able to drive and execute new ideas that take an unorthodox approach in the space. They will also be able to pivot and adapt to shifting priorities without missing a beat.
 
The ideal candidate is not someone who wants to follow the standard playbook to promote these projects. He/she is able to communicate priorities and present clear goals to stakeholders.


The candidate will have a strong work ethic and has a proven track record with both consumer and awards campaigns; along with an understanding of the documentary market and festival landscape. They use sound judgment to make wise decisions, and they think strategically.


The ideal candidate will also not be afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches; they will make tough decisions without agonizing and will be candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial.


The role will report to the Director of Original Documentary Publicity.


The day to day responsibilities will include but are not limited to: formulating and implementing PR and awards campaign strategies and messaging; developing press materials; strategizing junket opportunities; planning Q+As, screenings and tastemaker events; liaising with journalists, talent representatives and talent; and on-boarding and managing agencies.  


The role requires US and international travel.

  • The ideal candidate is familiar with the Netflix culture deck and is eager to work among like-minded colleagues and embrace the company's philosophies.

  • He/she will have experience with Emmy awards campaigns, anddeep industry and guild relationships in the awards space.

-Work to prepare and/or vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback internally and externally on viability and risks
-Review creative/scripts & begin defining post budget
-Collaborate with internal/external teams to lock budget
-Track & manage all post related costs, keeping stakeholders apprised of status
-Update cost reports and trackers on a weekly basis
-Review & approve POs for key post budget items (i.e.: dub stage, DI facility, sound editorial) for Studio productions
Post Scheduling
-Create/Help inform and draft post schedule
-Collaborate with internal teams (including Distribution and Localization) & external production team to lock schedule
-Troubleshoot and communicate all changes to schedule to internal/external teams
Staffing/Vendors
-Lead or assist with search and hire of key show post staff
-Determine key post vendors to accommodate creative vision and relationships, tax incentives, budget needs, location issues
-Help maintain/curate preferred vendor list 
Content Management
-Attend key creative approval sessions such as final mix playbacks, VFX reviews or color correction reviews when necessary.
-Facilitate Netflix screenings, previews, premieres, etc.  Collaborate with show post and Netflix Marketing/PR on setting up theater, arranging engineering when necessary, and rehearsing the content when applicable


Qualifications:
-BA/BS Degree
-10 Years + as an experienced Post Production Producer or Supervisor on a freelance or staff basis having worked with medium and high budget studio, major production company and network series and films.  
-Experience interfacing with third party production companies and licensing arrangements helpful.
-Ability to handle a fast paced environment supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery)
-Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both HDR and 4K
-Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
-Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting
-Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
-Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
-Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process
-Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task


Compensation
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

description: At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch.  Our international efforts have brought Netflix around the globe to virtually all countries and we’re excited to bring even more of our Originals programming to our viewers.   With over 100 Million subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix.  Netflix seeks an experienced Music Contract Administrator to help support our expanding slate of Originals content (Series, Film, Documentary, Comedy, Unscripted and Kids programming).  This role will have broad responsibility for managing the tracking, organization, distribution and processing of a high volume of contracts for the Music Team, from signature to distribution,  archiving, processing and arranging for payment. This is not your traditional Contract Administrator role:  you will manage vital components of our music contract administration process, not just “contract management,” and have visibility into all facets of our music business and the larger scope of Netflix’s expansion.   If this sounds intriguing, read on for the details...As a seasoned Music Contract Administrator, you know the ins-and-outs of the music industry, and its jargon is second nature to you. You know exactly what it takes to use music in a production, you understand the significance of master use and synchronization licenses and you know what a composer agreement and music supervisor agreement covers.  Your organizational skills are unparalleled and in your view, there’s no contract detail that’s too small or insignificant.  Your expert eye for detail means you know how to review music agreements (be they master use or synchronization licenses, composer agreements, music supervisor agreements, producer or songwriter agreements) for the key information needed for contract administration purposes, and flag any critical information that’s missing.    Your  organization talents mean that you’re not fazed by a high volume of contracts and, in fact, you seek a role that provides an opportunity to learn more about the business and to take on more than traditional contract management responsibilities, with a strong voice in shaping our contract management systems.  If so far this sounds not only undaunting, but exciting, this is the role you’ve been looking for. The successful candidate will be one who seeks out these values.  He or she thrives in an environment where freedom and responsibility are a tenet, and passion, innovation and curiosity are mandates. He or she places thoughtful efficiency over process yet knows how to work with organizations or institutions who may not hold the same beliefs.  This role is based in Netflix's Los Angeles office and reports to one of the Managers, Music Licensing of the Music Group, part of the Business & Legal Affairs team at Netflix.   The Music Group is based in Los Angeles, London and Berlin and is responsible for all of Netflix’s global music business and strategy, from the production and licensing of Netflix Originals through to the distribution of the Netflix service globally.

Master’s Degree a plus.-  4+ years’ experience in one or more of the following areas: Program Management, Product Management, Project Management, Product Marketing or Customer Support.-  Experience in gathering business insights and identifying trends from data, including a combination of data from multiple sources.-  Excellent writing and communication skills.-  Strong user experience focus and experience, preferably with consumer web or related products.-  Experience in working with global teams across different time zones.-  Familiarity with customer service environment a huge plus.-  Desired qualities: Innovative thinking, curious, action oriented, ability to drive improvements, strong relationship builder, excellent analytical and problem solving skills, superior communication skills, highly adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Los Gatos, California Customer Service Customer Service Product Support Operations Manager


At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our members need our help from time to time, and that’s where our Global Customer Service (CS) organization focuses; providing amazing interactions with our subscribers around the world.  Our goal is excellence, simplicity and getting our members back to streaming. Netflix is looking for a talented Product Support Operations Manager to join our Product Support Operations (PSO) team in Los Gatos. 


The Product Support Operations team is the bridge between Netflix CS teams and our partners in Product, Marketing, and other business functions, focusing on agent/operational readiness, customer self-service, facilitating insights, and driving improvements to the customer and agent experience. Product Support Operations Managers (PSOMs) are aligned by functional areas and are deep subject matter experts, advocates for the customer/agent experience, data-savvy influencers, and great communicators.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Provide key customer insights and feedback to the Product teams and other internal and external business partners and inform consumer product development with a clear understanding of how people use and feel about our product and what is driving customer service contacts, and advocating for a better user experience.
- Responsible for operational readiness and effective communication of product features and changes to customer service agents through internal Knowledge Base content and other communication channels. 
- Responsible for creation and updates of relevant Help Center content (help.netflix.com) and self-service tooling to ensure customers who seek help will find resolution to the most frequently asked questions 
- Leveraging multiple data sources to provide data-driven analysis and recommendations.


QUALIFICATIONS:
- BS/BA degree required. Master’s Degree a plus.
- 4+ years’ experience in one or more of the following areas: Program Management, Product Management, Project Management, Product Marketing or Customer Support.
- Experience in gathering business insights and identifying trends from data, including a combination of data from multiple sources.
- Excellent writing and communication skills.
- Strong user experience focus and experience, preferably with consumer web or related products.
- Experience in working with global teams across different time zones.
- Familiarity with customer service environment a huge plus.
- Desired qualities: Innovative thinking, curious, action oriented, ability to drive improvements, strong relationship builder, excellent analytical and problem solving skills, superior communication skills, highly adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
