description: The Company and Product Strategy: Instant streaming is a core part of Netflix's strategy for the future. Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and is now available on 100s of products. Our partnerships include global television makers Samsung, LG, and Sony as well as many of the world’s operators like Comcast, Virgin Media, and Orange. The Netflix Device Platform makes this possible. About the role: We are looking for a technology leader to help our partners build a world-class Netflix solution. In order to help our partners add the Netflix instant streaming service quickly to their device, we work very closely with the engineering teams to quickly overcome any and all challenges.  As part of a small team of experienced engineers, you will assist partner engineers who are integrating our SDK into their new products.  The functionality of our platform includes streaming and playback, dynamic UI, security and partner specific adaptation for new types of devices. You will need to have broad technical knowledge and understanding in all of these areas to be successful in this role. You’ll apply your experience in software development to a wide variety of technical challenges to achieve the goal of helping our partners bring their products to market on time with the highest quality. You can find more details on the role in this video.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Partner Devices Senior Software Engineer, Partner Engineering


The Company and Product Strategy:
 
Instant streaming is a core part of Netflix's strategy for the future. Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and is now available on 100s of products. Our partnerships include global television makers Samsung, LG, and Sony as well as many of the world’s operators like Comcast, Virgin Media, and Orange. The Netflix Device Platform makes this possible.
 
About the role:
 
We are looking for a technology leader to help our partners build a world-class Netflix solution.
 
In order to help our partners add the Netflix instant streaming service quickly to their device, we work very closely with the engineering teams to quickly overcome any and all challenges.  As part of a small team of experienced engineers, you will assist partner engineers who are integrating our SDK into their new products.  The functionality of our platform includes streaming and playback, dynamic UI, security and partner specific adaptation for new types of devices. You will need to have broad technical knowledge and understanding in all of these areas to be successful in this role. It’s an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing focuses on creating demand for the content you can only watch on Netflix and we are pioneering the way in which we use big data, analytics and advanced data science to optimize our global marketing.


The Programmatic Marketing Science & Analytics team focuses on evaluating the effectiveness of our marketing across our programmatic media channels (e.g., Facebook). We are looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer to join our team that will lead analytical projects (e.g., ad hoc analysis, ad hoc modeling, insights tool development) and provide our programmatic team with insights at scale. As a member of this team, you’ll be enabling our business partners with well-formed solutions to enable decision-making across our portfolio of programmatic channels.

  • Be a strategic partner and work with business stakeholders to define high impact analytical problems and find innovative ways to solve these problems with data

Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR PR Originals Publicity Manager, Series - EMEA


Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million streaming members across the globe. With continued international expansion and a move into original series acquisition and production underway, it’s a great time to join Netflix.


The Opportunity


Do you live and breathe entertainment?
Are you an entertainment publicity expert in a particular European territory with a pan-European curiosity?
Or are you a European publicist with working knowledge of a local media landscape and a strategic mind?
Do you enjoy strategising publicity and promotional campaigns?
Do you re-evaluate publicity campaigns that you have worked on to appraise what you could have done different or better?


If so, we may have just the opportunity for you:


The Originals Publicity Manager, Series - EMEA will be based in Amsterdam and will work as part of the Originals Publicity team to formulate and implement strategy across Europe for the growing slate of Netflix Original series. The position will provide a critical link between agencies in Europe and Netflix in promoting Original series content on the service. It’s the chance to be part of changing the entertainment landscape across the globe and to seize the opportunity to take different approaches in managing and executing promotional and publicity campaigns.


The Manager will work across several different disciplines that bring Original series to fruition here at Netflix. They will independently formulate and drive creative and executable ideas, communicate priorities and present clear goals to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their team members to do the same. The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic and understand the market. They will also not be afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches; they will make tough decisions without agonising and will be candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial. They are scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks at all levels and they thrive in an environment devoid of bureaucracy and layers.


Day to day responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: formulating and implementing European strategy, writing press releases, managing set visit nominations, scheduling international junkets, liaising with journalists, talent representatives and talent, implementing screening strategy and assisting with the management of agencies across Europe.

  • The successful candidate for the Original Series Publicity Manager - Europe role will likely:
  • Have 7-10 years of experience in an entertainment PR setting - either agency, studio or TV network.
  • Possess a keen understanding of new and traditional media.
  • Be able to understand and comfortably interpret business and technology issues.
  • Be a clear and concise communicatorHave excellent media relationships and experience executing a PR strategy.
  • Be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadline and thrive in a high energy, fast-paced environment while working well across disciplines to execute campaigns.
  • Have experience managing agencies and be effective in dealing with talent, talent reps, journalists and other media influencers.
  • Proficiency in English is a must. A second language is preferable.
  • Pack your bags because domestic and international travel is a requirement.
    • Qualifications
  • A concise communicator and a smart minimalist. Great writer and clear talker. Can organise, summarise, clarify and communicate ideas succinctly and accurately.
  • An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
  • The ability to innovate - connecting the dots where others cannot. Able to draw insight from information. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.
  • Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Pace moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.
  • Pragmatic, organised and detailed. Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’.
  • Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels.
  • Integrity. Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.
  • Is a mature adult, motivated by what is best for Netflix.
    • To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:

description: Netflix is responsible for over one-third of internet traffic at peak times and we’re working collaboratively with ISPs to deploy Open Connect, Netflix’s Content Delivery Network.  Open Connect delivers 100% of our video traffic today, and we’re continually adding functionality to support more advanced applications and further improve the quality of experience for our customers. To support this, we have a backbone network with sites around the globe and thousands of ISP partners, and this continues to grow as Netflix delivers more and more content to people in over 190 countries around the world. In order to protect our assets from the baddies, we’re seeking a Senior Security Engineer to help us build data driven security capabilities ranging from DDoS detection technologies to predictive analytics and beyond.  You are first and foremost a consummate software developer with a deep understanding of data mining, security architecture and analytics, as well as network protocol and architecture concepts at scale.   You are passionate about your work and the technologies that make it possible.  This passion has led you to build highly intelligent, scalable security capabilities and controls, powering some of the best security operation centers in the world. You will be building detective models and controls using data and automation as your main building blocks, creating the visibility and logic necessary to detect, prevent and respond to the threats and vulnerabilities that we’re exposed to.  As part of a small team, you will see the impact of your work not only within Netflix, but also on an ever changing, global security and threat landscape.   You won’t be alone in this bold effort and will be supported by top security design and architecture professionals.

Los Gatos, California Security Content Delivery Senior Security Engineer, Open Connect


Netflix is responsible for over one-third of internet traffic at peak times and we’re working collaboratively with ISPs to deploy Open Connect, Netflix’s Content Delivery Network.  Open Connect delivers 100% of our video traffic today, and we’re continually adding functionality to support more advanced applications and further improve the quality of experience for our customers.
 
To support this, we have a backbone network with sites around the globe and thousands of ISP partners, and this continues to grow as Netflix delivers more and more content to people in over 190 countries around the world.
 
In order to protect our assets from the baddies, we’re seeking a Senior Security Engineer to help us build data driven security capabilities ranging from DDoS detection technologies to predictive analytics and beyond.  You are first and foremost a consummate software developer with a deep understanding of data mining, security architecture and analytics, as well as network protocol and architecture concepts at scale.  
 
You are passionate about your work and the technologies that make it possible.  This passion has led you to build highly intelligent, scalable security capabilities and controls, powering some of the best security operation centers in the world.
 
You will be building detective models and controls using data and automation as your main building blocks, creating the visibility and logic necessary to detect, prevent and respond to the threats and vulnerabilities that we’re exposed to.  As part of a small team, you will see the impact of your work not only within Netflix, but also on an ever changing, global security and threat landscape.  
 
You won’t be alone in this bold effort and will be supported by top security design and architecture professionals.

  • Understand and deeply focus on the real-world benefit your systems and products will have on our security posture and our ability to detect and respond
  • Be driven by, and have a bias toward, autonomy:  you’ll be given a lot of context on the problems we’re trying to solve, but you’ll need to figure out how to solve them
  • Be invested in the long-term view:  while we need to deliver value this month and this quarter, we need to avoid technical debt and other forms of unnecessary complications that will serve us poorly in the future
  • Have a demonstrated track record in building highly intelligent, sophisticated, data-driven security capabilities at scale
  • Be comfortable continuously pushing well-tested code
  • Demonstrate expertise with Python:  great programmers can learn and become experts in any language, but our codebase is almost entirely Python and our engineers should ideally be knowledgeable with the vagaries of the language
  • Be comfortable with cloud environments or very large scale datacenter environments as well as big data analytics concepts and the application there of
  • Be fluent in some GNU/Linux distribution
  • Have great verbal and written communication skills
    • We need you to
  • Big Data and Analytics
  • Automation and Orchestration
  • Network Security and Architecture
  • Security Operations and Intelligence
  • AWS/Cloud Technologies (Lambda, Kinesis, ElasticSearch, EMR, KMS, etc)
  • Python 3
  • Ansible

Alphaville, Brazil Marketing and PR Marketing Marketing Manager, ​Brazil​​


With 109 million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture focused on high performance and continuous improvement, the company is the world’s biggest Internet television network, present in 190 countries, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day.


This global success came in the wake of systematic investments in multiple international markets, ultimately transforming Netflix into a lovebrand and a vigorous business outside the United States. In this trajectory, Latin America stood out as one of the most promising regions for our long term global expansion plans, having Brazil  as its biggest and more dynamic market.


We have bold plans for our future in the country, requiring stronger support in the teams responsible for putting them in motion, Marketing included. With that in mind, we're seeking to complement our talent pool in São Paulo with incredible talent - people passionate for entertainment who excel at strategic and creative thinking.


​

  • Integrated marketing experience at an entertainment company (TV, Studios and Games segments), a global lifestyle brand (Nike, Apple, Heineken), technology (Microsoft, IBM, Samsung, LG) or digital-era brands (Google, Airbnb, Spotify, Uber, Nubank).
  • Deep knowledge of the market specific dynamic: culture, entertainment landscape and consumer behavior.
  • Experience being the strategic lead on digital/integrated campaigns at an agency or on the client-side.
  • Holistic approach to successfully build out campaigns in a digital first environment, using offline media, other channels and events as amplifiers.
  • A bold advertising mind, capable of balancing data driven strategic thinking with breakthrough creative vision. We aim to hit our business goals and delight our consumers at the same time with our campaigns.
  • Deep understanding of local pop culture and how we can leverage local values, references and icons to make Netflix more relevant and exciting for the Brazilian audience.
  • Experience in multi-cultural offices with the ability to navigate cultural differences. We're seeking to transform our office in São Paulo into a regional and more diverse Netflix hub.
  • 8+ years of experience working on Consumer Goods/Entertainment Marketing groups, Strategic Planning, Media Planning or Creative departments at Advertising Agencies or Media Businesses.
  • Bachelor degree in a relevant field.
  • Fluency in spoken and written English.
    • The experiences and skills that would make you a great candidate:
  • Someone who loves entertainment and is capable of infusing this passion into what he/she does everyday.
  • Someone who naturally aligns with our culture, not only capable of thriving in it, but can help us keep it coherent and ever expanding.
  • A doer: an entrepreneurial and self-motivated collaborator in a fast paced and multifaceted environment who is capable of being impactful without the support of a large team of direct reports. This person is able to work both independently and in close collaboration with a wide array of stakeholders.
  • A selfless, collaborative Marketing professional who will naturally go beyond roles and titles to get great work done.
  • Someone curious about the many aspects that make Netflix a successful company and who thinks cross-functionally to execute our plans and achieve our goals.
  • Someone open to learn on a daily basis with the continuous flux of change that defines our business segment and marketing philosophy.

At Netflix, the big data platform is at the core of driving our product decisions that directly impact our customer experience when they watch Netflix.
 
To support these business needs, we operate one of the largest big data infrastructures in the AWS cloud. In addition to relying on big data compute engines like Spark, Presto, and Flink, we also build an ecosystem of tools and services that allow all Netflix teams to leverage the platform as a cohesive service. To learn more, here is our recent talk (slides or video) that describes our big data infrastructure.
 
Our platform runs tens of thousands of jobs and processes over a trillion events every day. We support over a thousand data analysts, data scientists, and engineers across the company.
 
As a member of the team, you will help drive operational excellence for this ecosystem of complex large-scale systems by re-imagining how we would automate and build tools to lower operational barriers, improve clarity on problematic areas, and improve reliability of the platform.

  • Evangelize best practices around collaboration and reliability to all partner teams.

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to engage partner teams effectively
  • Strong automation mindset and passion to identify strategies to mitigate going forward
  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms (particularly AWS) a plus

description: Netflix’s business in EMEA continues to grow rapidly and with that we continue to place a huge amount of effort in building out teams across multiple functions and EMEA markets to support this growth. The Netflix Talent Acquisition team partners closely with the business to define talent needs, build staffing strategies, and execute on identifying best in class talent for the business.  At Netflix, Talent Acquisition is a core business function with a true seat at the table, and as a result we need strategic problem solvers to help us build the teams that will in turn build the world’s best global internet TV service. The EMEA Talent Acquisition team is looking for a Market Intelligence Analyst (MIA) to support our rapid pace of hiring. search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Talent and Recruiting Human Resources Market Intelligence Analyst - EMEA


Netflix’s business in EMEA continues to grow rapidly and with that we continue to place a huge amount of effort in building out teams across multiple functions and EMEA markets to support this growth. The Netflix Talent Acquisition team partners closely with the business to define talent needs, build staffing strategies, and execute on identifying best in class talent for the business.  At Netflix, Talent Acquisition is a core business function with a true seat at the table, and as a result we need strategic problem solvers to help us build the teams that will in turn build the world’s best global internet TV service.


The EMEA Talent Acquisition team is looking for a Market Intelligence Analyst (MIA) to support our rapid pace of hiring. Working closely with Recruiters and Recruiting Researchers, the MIA will be an industry expert, providing in-depth market research, competitive analysis and overall industry insight to the TA team and the business.  This is a new function within our team, so the role will be what you make it. You will get to figure out how to create maximum impact, and will play a huge role in defining what success looks like.


THE ROLE
A successful MIA will develop a deep understanding of our business, build intel and insight around key EMEA markets, provide relevant industry intelligence and build relationships with passive talent across the EMEA region.  This role will partner both with the directly with the Talent Acquisition team and leaders across the business, with the goal of equipping both with better insights to expedite our recruitment efforts.


THE RESPONSIBILITIES
• Partner with the EMEA Talent Acquisition team in designing and implementing effective research strategies to map out talent movement and talent trends across multiple functions and industries;
• Partner with researchers, recruiters, and business groups to build and maintain current and future candidate pipelines;
• Conduct public research and collect data on competitors in the marketplace and create up-to-date organizational charts and talent maps;
• Conduct compensation benchmarking and compile concise compensation reports;
• Prepare and present relevant insights that may impact recruitment efforts in certain markets or industries;
• Be the eyes and ears to industry news;
• Collect, collate, and input data into our Applicant Tracking System (Lever)
• Support ad hoc projects like events or networking functions


THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
We are looking for a proactive and critical thinker with a passion for research and entertainment. The successful candidate will have the ability to process and synthesize complex information effectively and communicate in a concise manner.  We need someone who is comfortable with ambiguity, as this is a new function in our organization. The role will be what you make it. You will get to figure out how to create maximum impact, and will play a huge role in defining what success looks like.


REQUIREMENTS
• University degree is required.
• Experience in the entertainment industry is preferred, but you have to be passionate about and interested in TV and film entertainment at the least.
• The ability to make the leap from information to insight is key.  To be successful you’ll need to excel in not only gathering great data, but leveraging it to inform and influence decisions.  We need you to connect the dots when others cannot, creating actionable research and networking projects based on real business problems.
• Desire to be in a role that is hands on as much as it is strategic, adding value at different levels.  Strong attention to detail is a must.
• Ability to move quickly and prioritize.  You’ll have multiple projects going at once, so it’s crucial that you have the ability to think and work quickly, prioritize effectively and can pivot easily in the midst of frequent changes.

Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Content Marketing Manager, Latin America


It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix has grown to over 109 million members in over 190 countries with the Latin American region a critical piece of our international expansion. People are discovering Netflix every day in Latin America, and we want to speak with them in a very unique way, we want them to love our content. Netflix is leading the way in developing amazing Original series, movies, documentaries and other types of content for all kinds of audience.


The Content Marketing Manager will report to the Senior Content Marketing Manager - Latin America and we have the focus to help create breakthrough campaigns for the region for our vast catalog of Global Originals titles. The manager will have close interaction with the local markets’ team in region (based in Sao Paulo and in Los Angeles) besides the LATAM cross functional teams: Publicity, PR and Social.

  • You are a natural team leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate the needs for the region to the Global teams.
  • A natural team captain, you will lead the cross functional discussions and alignment for the marketing campaigns.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and demonstrate strong judgment and solution-driven skills.
  • You are passionate and curious and are opened for candid feedback about your performance and see as a way of growth.
  • You love TV and film content and have some knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends both in LATAM and globally.
    • Who are you?
  • Marketing Strategy - you will partner with the local Marketing managers to define the strategies for the launch of Netflix Originals series, movies, documentaries, comedy specials, etc., in Latin America.
  • Creative Campaign - you will kick off  the regional creative brief to guide the creative process and align with local marketing teams and cross functional teams on goals for the campaigns. You will be responsible for bringing the regional POV in conversations with Global teams, identifying opportunities, strategic positioning and creative directions to assure the global creative development attents the regional needs.
  • Campaign Management - project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning brainstorm sessions. Global Title Lead - work cross functionally with peers in Global Creative, Content Creative, PR, Social Media, Publicity and Partner Marketing to ensure campaign message is consistent across multi platforms and channels.
  • Production - understanding of offline and online production in order to work with the regional integrated producers in the production and deployment of the marketing campaign.
  • Long Term Planning - assess opportunities for the region and identify the titles that would resonate in the markets through partnerships with Consumer Insights team, data analysis and other sources of information available within the organization.
    • Key Responsibilities:
  • 5+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in entertainment (TV, film). Natural team leadership skills with the ability to conceptualize and articulate a marketing strategy on a consistent basis.
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external partners.
  • Ability to effectively provide input on creative development from a local and regional market perspective
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp of traditional media as well: OOH, stunts/activations, print, etc.
  • Strong analytical skills and understanding of AB testing methodologies
  • Experience working with or in Latin America region
  • Fluency in English is mandatory. Fluency/proficiency in Spanish is preferred.
  • Strong interpersonal, strategic, presentation, problem solving, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills
    • Qualifications

text: Senior Analytics Engineer, Content Delivery Network
description: Netflix makes up 1/3 of internet traffic, and we're proud to deliver content that over 109 million customers enjoy globally. Behind the scenes, Netflix video is delivered by Open Connect, a custom-built content delivery network that connects to thousands of ISPs around the world. Decisions on how to improve streaming performance for our customers and evolve Open Connect's architecture are driven by data. We're looking for someone to transform petabytes of incoming data on streaming performance and network efficiency into intelligent analytic tools that deliver clear, actionable information to executives, engineers and analytic teams within Netflix. You'll automate our way to faster decision-making and create analytic products we'll wonder how we ever managed without. We track every customer action and each byte of data transferred, so you'll work with data at incredible scale and collaborate with best-in-class data engineers and analytic experts. You'll become an authority in the world of video streaming delivery (no prior knowledge necessary, but curiosity to learn is a must). Open Connect operates like a startup within Netflix, and the projects you'll work on will be truly impactful.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Science and Analytics Senior Analytics Engineer, Content Delivery Network


Netflix makes up 1/3 of internet traffic, and we're proud to deliver content that over 109 million customers enjoy globally. Behind the scenes, Netflix video is delivered by Open Connect, a custom-built content delivery network that connects to thousands of ISPs around the world.
 
Decisions on how to improve streaming performance for our customers and evolve Open Connect's architecture are driven by data. We're looking for someone to transform petabytes of incoming data on streaming performance and network efficiency into intelligent analytic tools that deliver clear, actionable information to executives, engineers and analytic teams within Netflix.
 
You'll automate our way to faster decision-making and create analytic products we'll wonder how we ever managed without. We track every customer action and each byte of data transferred, so you'll work with data at incredible scale and collaborate with best-in-class data engineers and analytic experts. You'll become an authority in the world of video streaming delivery (no prior knowledge necessary, but curiosity to learn is a must). Open Connect operates like a startup within Netflix, and the projects you'll work on will be truly impactful.

  • Implement anomaly detection to surface metric shifts across multi-dimensional, highly cardinal time series data
  • Work with and contribute to internal tools for visualization and interaction with large datasets (sub-second response on billions of records)
  • Create a holistic picture of end-to-end customer experience, from loading the Netflix app through playing a title, that informs multiple teams about opportunities to improve the Netflix product
  • Take ownership and increase automation of the complex data that drives the highly visibleISP Speed Index, a site publishing Netflix streaming speeds for ISPs across the globe
    • What you will do:
  • Comfort self-managing on projects that are often cross-functional and ambiguous
  • Data manipulation (SQL, Python)
  • Data processing at scale (Scala, Hive or Java)
  • Large-scale storage and retrieval (Hadoop, ElasticSearch or Druid)
  • Visualization techniques and tools (JavaScript libraries, Tableau)
  • Applied statistics
    • Who you are:


    Our culture is unique, and we live by our values. You will need to be comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements will be vague, and iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart risks. Learn more about Netflix’s culture.

description: It’s not often there’s an opportunity to join a company that is changing consumer habits all over the world, and transforming an entire industry at the same time. The Social Manager, Anime role at Netflix is a blend of strategy and creative, responsible for launching social campaigns that get people so excited for Netflix anime titles that they sign up and watch.From a strategy standpoint, the anime manager will need to understand the Japanese market, our broad Netflix business goals, and local social media behavior to find ways to win the word of mouth game in one of our most important growth markets. The successful candidate will display the curiosity to learn the Netflix business, understand our anime strategy, and make smart creative choices to land our titles in the zeitgeist. Creatively, our goal on the marketing team is to build campaigns that drive earned media and social conversation. The social leader will manage agencies, develop creative, and work with producers and talent to execute a creative vision. He or she will need to have impeccable taste, vision for how to stand out from the competition, and a strong instinct for ideas that will get consumers talking. In addition to building campaigns, the successful manager will be a thought-partner to our content, publicity, and marketing teams, and build strong relationships with our production partners to enable creative innovation.The right hire will bring a deep knowledge of the social media landscape, including a strong understanding not only of their features and technology, but of the new consumer behaviors emerging everyday. We work in a fast-moving environment like a newsroom, constantly mining conversation for insights and ideas, and shaping how consumers and media think about us.The manager will have 7+ years of experience with some combination of consumer brand, media, entertainment, and agency work in marketing and communications. Our culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read the culture memo. If it resonates for you, maybe you’re the right person to join our Netflix team.

description: Netflix is constantly breaking new ground. We have become a world-class content production company. We are upturning conventions in content distribution, letting users "binge watch" and releasing movies onto our service on the same day as theaters. We have an award winning engineering organization and our international expansion is happening at a breathtaking pace. More than all of those, we are a loved brand because we put our users at the forefront of everything we do. Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and has since expanded to all relevant connected screens in the home, including operators’ set-top boxes. Our reach and ease-of-use is enhanced through strong partnerships with many of the world's most innovative TV Operators such as Comcast, Liberty Global, Orange, Vodafone or Altice. The Netflix Partner Engagement Management team makes this possible and is looking to continue to innovate in this field. We're looking for a best-of-the-best leader to own our relationships with top-tier operators in EMEA and their technology partners. You'll manage all aspects of your product partnerships to deliver an amazing Netflix experience across a range of devices.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Partner Devices Partner Engagement Manager, EMEA


Netflix is constantly breaking new ground. We have become a world-class content production company. We are upturning conventions in content distribution, letting users "binge watch" and releasing movies onto our service on the same day as theaters. We have an award winning engineering organization and our international expansion is happening at a breathtaking pace. More than all of those, we are a loved brand because we put our users at the forefront of everything we do.
 
Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and has since expanded to all relevant connected screens in the home, including operators’ set-top boxes. Our reach and ease-of-use is enhanced through strong partnerships with many of the world's most innovative TV Operators such as Comcast, Liberty Global, Orange, Vodafone or Altice. The Netflix Partner Engagement Management team makes this possible and is looking to continue to innovate in this field.
 
We're looking for a best-of-the-best leader to own our relationships with top-tier operators in EMEA and their technology partners. You'll manage all aspects of your product partnerships to deliver an amazing Netflix experience across a range of devices.

  • Have deep technical ability, with the capacity to acquire new technology concepts quickly
  • Define & implement engagement strategy with senior executives across cultures
  • Influence product designs and overall user experience, without leaning on authority
  • Synthesize and streamline business and technology solutions that strengthen our partnerships while advancing our service
  • Be a collaborative leader, capable of driving internal & external stakeholders to consensus while balancing product / technology needs with longer term relationship objectives
  • Lead with confidence and with little supervision.
  • Be an excellent team builder with top-notch listening and presentation skills and crisp oral and written communications
    • You will:
  • 10+ years experience building & managing long term strategic relationships with leading operators in EMEA
  • Proven track record of managing multi-party projects, or technology ecosystems
  • Strong technology background, ideally including hands on work in embedded software and platforms
  • Under-the-hood knowledge of operator technology, especially set-top-boxes but also home gateways and middleware; platform-level experience with video-centric CE devices such as TVs or game consoles is also highly relevant
  • Successfully led and delivered full lifecycle implementation projects and has played a key role in roll-out and ramp-up of significant consumer-facing software or services, especially for pay-TV, video or music
  • Data-driven analysis and decision-making, informed by a passion for metrics
    • Ideal candidate:


    This is a senior position with cross-functional responsibility and a hand in defining and executing strategic initiatives. You will be based in our Headquarters in Los Gatos, CA. and travel about 10 to 15% of  your time.  Our culture is a key part of our approach to innovation. You'll be a leader in a high-performance organization that's really, truly changing how the world watches movies and TV. Our mad dash to integrate Netflix into all devices was just the start. Now things start to get interesting as we build on established relationships with key partners and continue to expand the Netflix service in each EMEA market.

description: As part of a creative team within the product organization, the Originals Creative Producer is in a unique position to blend the data based A/B testing realm with the highly creative world of Netflix Originals. The Originals Producer position uses both the left and right brain equally and requires a personality and skill set that can easily go from art to science and back again. The Product Creative team creates compelling assets to connect our subscribers to the original Netflix content they love, and also brainstorms, coordinates, and socializes with multiple stakeholder teams to ensure a seamless launch on a global scale.  Through a  partnership with our Content Acquisition team and the Marketing teams you will develop beautiful, inspiring creative in the form of static artwork, graphics and video elements to tell a story and engage audiences in our brand.  This is your chance to help transform how EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) Originals are presented, consumed and perceived by 100 million+ members across 190 countries. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of this effort. This role is based in our Amsterdam office but requires frequent travel to our headquarters in Los Gatos and Office in Los Angeles.Responsibilities The International Originals Creative Producer is responsible for launching Netflix original shows, series that are created in countries across EMEA, on the Netflix streaming service; overseeing the lifespan of a show from ideation to product deployment across multiple platforms.  You will leverage content, marketing, PR, social campaign elements, product strategy and testing to create a suite of valuable assets to surprise and delight our 100M Netflix subscribers. Success is not only based on creating the most varied and visually stimulating cache of assets but also coordinating across numerous internal and external stakeholder groups; being able to form close relationships with various groups within Netflix is just as critical as with studio and showrunner partners in EMEA. You'll create strong partnerships with creative directors, agencies, studios in local markets and other cross-functional teams to define the creative look and feel of a title—telling a story through static artwork, motion, graphics and video elements.  Garnering a extremely deep understanding of product strategy will be inherent to your success as well.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Global Product Creative Producers Originals Creative Producer - EMEA


As part of a creative team within the product organization, the Originals Creative Producer is in a unique position to blend the data based A/B testing realm with the highly creative world of Netflix Originals. The Originals Producer position uses both the left and right brain equally and requires a personality and skill set that can easily go from art to science and back again. The Product Creative team creates compelling assets to connect our subscribers to the original Netflix content they love, and also brainstorms, coordinates, and socializes with multiple stakeholder teams to ensure a seamless launch on a global scale.  Through a  partnership with our Content Acquisition team and the Marketing teams you will develop beautiful, inspiring creative in the form of static artwork, graphics and video elements to tell a story and engage audiences in our brand.
 
This is your chance to help transform how EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) Originals are presented, consumed and perceived by 100 million+ members across 190 countries. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of this effort.
 
This role is based in our Amsterdam office but requires frequent travel to our headquarters in Los Gatos and Office in Los Angeles.


Responsibilities
The International Originals Creative Producer is responsible for launching Netflix original shows, series that are created in countries across EMEA, on the Netflix streaming service; overseeing the lifespan of a show from ideation to product deployment across multiple platforms.  You will leverage content, marketing, PR, social campaign elements, product strategy and testing to create a suite of valuable assets to surprise and delight our 100M Netflix subscribers. Success is not only based on creating the most varied and visually stimulating cache of assets but also coordinating across numerous internal and external stakeholder groups; being able to form close relationships with various groups within Netflix is just as critical as with studio and showrunner partners in EMEA. You'll create strong partnerships with creative directors, agencies, studios in local markets and other cross-functional teams to define the creative look and feel of a title—telling a story through static artwork, motion, graphics and video elements.  Garnering a extremely deep understanding of product strategy will be inherent to your success as well.

  • Write a creative strategy based on data and insights from partner teams
  • Work cross-functionally to source, direct, and create compelling imagery and motion assets
  • Collaborate with agencies, graphic designers, motion designers, and art directors to elevate the creative and enhance content discovery across multiple titles across different genres
  • Clearly understand product priorities and be able to distinguish them  from marketing priorities
  • Create project schedules, effectively managing timelines from conception through successful launch and beyond, communicating milestones to key stakeholders
  • Continue to proactively learn about product creative strategy and also be able to educate cross-functional partners and internal team members on the latest product developments
  • Build and strengthen partner relationships as liaison to studio partners, PR, Marketing, Product, Content Operations, Content Acquisition, Content Platform Engineering and Legal teams
  • Manage artwork localization and global branding of titles
  • Reviewing artwork performance metrics, analyzing winning trends, and determining a path for better creative
  • Work with engineers to determine the best tools or modifications to current tools to improve workflow
  • Access reporting tools to analyze asset performance
  • Conceptualize A/B test hypotheses against the current workflow Looking above the horizon to understand the big picture of what Netflix is trying to achieve and spearhead new tests and projects
    • Day-to-day Functions
  • Fluency in speaking and writing in one or more foreign languages -  French, German, Italian or Spanish (Spain) are a plus
  • 7+ years in a creative digital environment. Entertainment and/or gaming experience is a plus.
  • Have International experience, preferably have spent time living and working in European territory(ies)
  • Ability to travel internationally to Netflix’s offices in Los Angeles
  • Awareness of global/local content trends within the market is a plus.
  • Exemplary organizational skills with a disciplined approach to project management.
  • Ability to create clear, effective briefs grounded in data and insights
  • Great interpersonal skills with ability to voice opinions and give feedback.
  • Must be capable and conversant in all aspects of a digital creative and image production workflow.
  • Prior project management, team leadership, or creative agency campaign supervision experience.
  • The soft skills to be able to recognize when to challenge conventional thinking, and also to accept feedback on ideas and work product.
  • Experience using a Digital Asset Management system or similar tools to propagate and track assets through an operational workflow.
  • Understanding and eye for great visual design and the ability to translate design specs into finalized assets.
  • Basic proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Understand, advocate, and embody the company’s values and team goals.
  • Using metrics and testing for more informed creative.
  • Healthy interactions with marketing teams, creative agency, and/or production house, as well as familiarity with studio/network campaigns or entertainment branding.
  • Excel as an individual contributor with global purview.
    • Qualifications


    Netflix is the world's leading Internet television network with members enjoying more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies each day.

description: Netflix is at the forefront of data-driven companies. From optimizing global content spend to delivering bufferless streaming worldwide, data is used to power decisions and fuel experiments -- and we’re just getting started. We’re investing in self-service solutions for our data platform to dramatically increase analytical capabilities across the entire company. And we need your help.  We’re looking for an exceptional technologist to own the onboarding experience for our data platform.  Netflix has built an industry-leading data platform in the cloud to enable experimentation and analysis. This platform is flexible, scalable, and powerful. It’s also complex and constantly evolving. Our 60-petabyte data warehouse contains thousands of tables. We support dozens of tools and services, many of which are internally developed. There are multiple ways to accomplish any given task, each with their own unique pros and cons. Documentation is scarce and frequently outdated.  Your role is to ensure everyone at Netflix knows how to self-serve analytics in this complex environment.  This is a new role with the potential for high visibility and significant impact. You’ll be working closely with both technical leaders and business leaders across all verticals of the company.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure Technical Evangelist


Netflix is at the forefront of data-driven companies. From optimizing global content spend to delivering bufferless streaming worldwide, data is used to power decisions and fuel experiments -- and we’re just getting started. We’re investing in self-service solutions for our data platform to dramatically increase analytical capabilities across the entire company. And we need your help.
 
We’re looking for an exceptional technologist to own the onboarding experience for our data platform.
 
Netflix has built an industry-leading data platform in the cloud to enable experimentation and analysis. This platform is flexible, scalable, and powerful. It’s also complex and constantly evolving. Our 60-petabyte data warehouse contains thousands of tables. We support dozens of tools and services, many of which are internally developed. There are multiple ways to accomplish any given task, each with their own unique pros and cons. Documentation is scarce and frequently outdated.
 
Your role is to ensure everyone at Netflix knows how to self-serve analytics in this complex environment.
 
This is a new role with the potential for high visibility and significant impact. You’ll be working closely with both technical leaders and business leaders across all verticals of the company.

  • Learning, and staying current on, the tech stack for Netflix’s data platform
  • Strategizing effective training strategies for different roles and tasks
  • Writing & maintaining training materials -- including tutorials, how-to guides, and code samples
  • Delivering hands-on training to our talented business users from around the globe
  • Evangelizing our “paved path” to our internal technical community
  • Surfacing impactful opportunities to improve our self-service tooling
  • Giving talks at major technical conferences (optional)
    • How will you spend your days?
  • You are passionate about the possibilities of data, and you find joy in providing people with the tools and knowledge to use data successfully.
  • You have a gift for making complex topics easy to understand.
  • You have exceptional communication skills. Your writing style is concise yet friendly, and you have no problem speaking to a full room of people.
  • You enjoy learning new technologies. You’re constantly digging deeper or exploring something new.
  • You love freedom and hate being micromanaged. Given context, you're capable of self-direction.
  • You deliver results quickly with iteration, instead of waiting for perfection, and you actively solicit feedback.
    • Who are you?
  • You understand all phases of the analytics lifecycle, and you have 5+ years of deep experience with one or more phases (data engineering, data viz, data analysis, etc.).
  • You have achieved mastery of at least one major technology or language related to the analytics lifecycle.
  • You understand ‘big data’ and distributed processing concepts, and you have hands-on experience with Hadoop technologies such as Spark or Presto.
  • You can write complex SQL in your sleep, and you have no problem hacking around in Python.
  • You have worked with numerous data technologies (RBDMS, NoSQL, MPP, Hadoop, etc.) and can fluidly navigate complex technology stacks.
  • Experience with advanced analytics (PA, ML, or AI) is a plus but not required.
    • What do you know? (This is not a rigorous litmus test.)

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, Content FP&A


Our members love content. In 2017, Netflix has spent billions of dollars on acquiring and programming content in every window for every taste -- from brand new, never-before-seen Originals to timeless classics that are watched over and over again. In order to build the best service in the world, we look for the best and brightest to drive the analytics behind our strategic business decisions. Netflix operates a financially complex business and believes that it derives a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach it takes to managing the company.


The Content Planning & Analysis team is looking for a Manager to join its financial planning team. The role will be an integrated business partner to the global content acquisition team and be responsible for the financial planning activities related to the company's growing content library. The manager position will reside within the company's Hollywood-based content management team, work closely with both the Vice President and Director of Content Planning & Analysis, and oversee a team of 3-4 people.


Job Responsibilities

  • Lead the global consolidation of programming expense and cash payments across a broad range of categories including original productions, film, series, unscripted, kids and local language content
  • Preparing guidance and financial update materials for content leads and corporate FP&A team to identify potential shortfalls or surpluses
  • Maintaining schedule of estimated future contractual commitments for accurate disclosure in financial statements and proper capital planning
  • Partnering with finance team to review and modify accounting policies related to amortization and allocation of content rights      
    • P&L and cash management
  • Working with senior leadership within the content organization to translate strategic initiatives into multi-year roadmap with complete cost and capital requirements
  • Preparing dynamic scenario analysis to facilitate discussion when faced with economic trade-offs  
    • Long-range planning and scenario analysis
  • Developing KPIs, metrics and dashboards to understand current programming mix
  • Providing recommendations on how to adjust future spending to track towards investment goals across content categories and geographies  
    • Resource allocation and optimization
  • Working with developers and outside vendors to design and enhance systems to ensure timely, accurate and complete information sharing
  • Improving processes to scale with the growth in original productions and commissions   
    • Process improvement and systems integration
  • Candidates are required to be highly analytical and be strong, effective communicators. Prior experience in corporate finance, investment banking or public accounting preferred. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of superior financial and strategic analysis and delivering actionable recommendations based on this analysis.   
  • The successful candidate must display initiative in anticipating and exceeding the business demands of senior-level business managers. He/She must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.   
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, and be able to work effectively autonomously.   
  • 8 to 15 years of experience in corporate finance, investment bank and/or public accounting   
  • Prior experience in Media/Entertainment/Tech is a plus   
  • Prior experience in Professional Services strongly preferred  
  • Extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative financial analysis
  • Financial system development experience is not required, but must have proficiency working with automated reporting tools (i.e., Hyperion, SAP, Workday financials, etc.)     
  • Superior proficiency with Excel; complex financial modeling   
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills   
  • 4-year degree in relevant field with strong academic performance, MBA preferred
    • Other requirements

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Visual Communications Manager, Original Films


Visual Communications Manager, Original Film
Do you love entertainment publicity? Are you an avid fan of film? Are you incredibly organized and always trying to solve problems and make things run more efficiently and effectively? Do you enjoy behind behind-the-scenes content and find yourself flipping through your favorite entertainment magazine captivated by the photos? If you answered yes to the above, we may have the perfect job for you…


The Role
We are seeking an individual to lead strategic global publicity campaigns driven by creative materials -photography, featurettes, clips, etc. The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative personality and a strong project management background.  The Visual Communications team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: asset creation & global communication strategy. We specialize in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our global publicity campaigns for our Netflix Original Films.


This role works across photo and creative content/EPK, utilizing knowledge of TV/film productions, talent/filmmaker relations, and publicity events as part of the Netflix Originals Publicity team.   A successful candidate is someone who is willing to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. They must have a strong project management background and are able to strategically plan and execute across multiple projects simultaneously. This candidate must be extremely well organized, creative, a succinct communicator, a team player and thrive in a fast-paced environment. They must be self-motivated, possess integrity and able to work autonomously across multiple teams.  The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same.


This job is based in Los Angeles and reports to the Visual Communications Manager, Original Films Publicity.


Here at Netflix, we don't have rules and regulations. We hire adults who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work, and we expect high performance in return.

  • Develop and execute a global strategy, per project/title, to capture, produce and utilize creative material to enhance and support the publicity campaign throughout its lifecycle
  • Oversee a slate of Netflix Original Film projects
  • Drive communication with lead campaign publicist counterpart, marketing/social teams, showrunners/filmmakers and talent reps
  • Hire and oversee unit photographers and video crews, including script and schedule review and communication with production
  • Produce strong creative materials that shape and enhance the overall publicity campaign
  • Assist with the asset management and servicing of material
  • Oversee photography/video needs for premieres, events and photo shoots
  • Manage budgets
    • Responsibilities of the role include:
  • 8+ years experience at a network or studio
  • Experience working in film industry preferred
  • Strategic thought-partner
  • Strong team player
  • Deadline-oriented with strong time management skills
  • Strong eye for producing visual assets
  • Experience working with international markets is preferred
  • Ability to handle high volume of complex projects and tasks for multiple people and departments simultaneously and manage competing priorities
  • Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail
  • Must possess solid organizational, effective time management and excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with internal and external teams
  • Understand and interest in Federal copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes
  • Understand the photography/video industry
  • Strong knowledge in digital file specs & size formats
  • Extensive knowledge of Adobe Suite including Photoshop and Pro is preferred
    • Skills and Requirements:


    To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


    Creative
    Demonstrate the ability to think innovatively - connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


    Succinct Communicator
    Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


    Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
    Has a big capacity to both think and 'do'. Flourishes in a 'hands on' role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


    A Smart Minimalist
    Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.


    Has a Point of View
    An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


    Pace
    Moves at a nice pace and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


    Integrity
    Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


    An Adult
    Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Programmatic Marketing (Americas)


The Netflix global programmatic marketing team is responsible for architecting and activating programmatic media (RTB, paid social and paid search) in support of our campaigns throughout the world. The Manager, Programmatic Marketing will play a lead role in the planning, activation and optimization of our programmatic efforts (RTB and paid social).


THE ROLE:
- Serve as the tactical programmatic lead for a number of marketing campaigns with a focus on launching our Original Series and Features
- Drive the insights generation, set-up, management, and optimization of the paid social and RTB initiatives that pertain to these campaigns
- Create and execute rigorous test campaigns to understand the drivers of impact
- Create thoughtful recommendations - backed by data - of new tactics and partners to elevate performance against our KPIs
- Analyze and set the direction with regard to our usage of various creative assets
- In concert with other members of the programmatic team and overall Netflix marketing organization, take a "big picture" perspective and seek to maximize our total digital marketing return


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
- At least 2 years in a hands-on role managing social and/or programmatic campaigns at an agency, marketer, FMP/Social Ads API platform, or DSP
- At least 3-4 years of total marketing experience
- Substantial experience pulling data and generating advanced reports within a FMP/Social Ads API, a DSP User Interface, or (ideally) both
- High attention to detail, top-notch analytical skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions
- Strong grasp of the overall digital marketing ecosystem and the role that paid social and programmatic play within
- A passion for the entertainment business and a strong understanding of popular culture
- Excellent communication skills...you will be the go-to- person for our campaign strategy team as it pertains to their campaigns.
- Interpersonal skills are a prerequisite for success.
- A strong belief in our culture. We live by our values, so it's worth learning more about them at jobs.netflix.com


DESIRABLE SKILLS:
- Experience with traditional/reserve digital media buying
- Experience with or significant exposure to paid or organic search marketing
- Exposure to offline marketing channels & tactics




Due to the nature and scope of this role, we will need to run a background check prior to starting with us.

text: Manager Creative Marketing International Originals - DACH
description: With 100+ million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries. Originals content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of international originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world. We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our EMEA international originals marketing campaigns. This team is based in our Amsterdam office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, London and Amsterdam, frequent international travel is a must.

With 100+ million streaming members worldwide, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. Powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement, this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading the global marketing campaigns for the world’s biggest Internet TV network, serving more than 125 million hours of content every day in 190 countries.


Originals content is core to our ongoing global success, and to support this global expansion we are quickly growing our slate of international originals. These originals are produced in local language, using local production companies and talent. We believe that creating local original content will help us delight and win over local audiences while also building love for Netflix around the world. 


We are looking for an experienced marketing executive to join the team responsible for the strategic and creative development of our EMEA international originals marketing campaigns. This team is based in our Amsterdam office, but you will be a part of the global creative team that sits in Los Angeles. Because this role requires close interaction and collaboration with various cross-functional teams in Los Angeles, Los Gatos, London and Amsterdam, frequent international travel is a must.

  • You have a proven track record of building impactful, world-class 360 creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist.
  • You are a natural team leader with an ability to build strategic foundations, conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate creative ideas that people rally around.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, possess a high level of emotional IQ and intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and decision making skills in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing + innovation, and  strive to create impactful and effective visual storytelling on mobile, paid social all other mediums/platforms.
  • You love international TV and film content and have deep knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends both in Europe and globally.
  • You are a connoisseur of trailers, key art and digital/social media and have solid experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 creative marketing campaigns.
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are).

  • Play a key role in building strategy and creative campaigns (e.g. marketing shoots, AV and key visuals, paid assets) for the launch of EMEA international originals.
  • Partner closely with EMEA regional marketing teams to develop authentic campaigns that are built on regional insights and connect with local audiences.
  • Write creative briefs to guide the global creative process and align internal marketing teams on goals and overall strategies.
  • Project management of campaign cross-functional initiatives including (but not limited to) leading, organizing, mobilizing and planning internal task force meetings and brainstorm sessions and external filmmaker kickoffs/presentations.
  • Demonstrate mastery of verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills, as you will lead meetings and manage workflow with many internal and external stakeholders/partners.
  • Participate in and/or lead lively debates and discussions as you communicate different facets of the campaign to filmmakers, talent and colleagues across the company.
  • Collaborate with our world class product/engineering team to integrate our originals marketing campaigns within the member product experience.
    • What will you do?
  • Fluency in English and German is mandatory. 
  • 5+ years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably with a background in entertainment (TV, film, gaming), global lifestyle brand (Nike, Coca-Cola, Apple, etc.) or creative/advertising agency.
  • A history of team leadership and cross-functional collaboration with both internal and external partners.
  • Native understanding of digital advertising (direct video, mobile, paid social, display, rich media, VOD) with strong grasp of marketing / media analytics and how to apply data to test and optimize campaigns.
  • You have international experience, preferably have spent time living and working in Europe.
  • Strong interpersonal, creative, presentation, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, analytical and conflict resolution skills.

Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Production Campaign Operations Manager - EMEA


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. Marketing Operations at Netflix is focused on establishing a global operational center-of-excellence for cross-functional project management, creative production and localization of our marketing campaigns.


To support our continued global expansion we are looking for an experienced Marketing Operations Manager to oversee campaign project management of our EMEA focused International Original production needs. In this role you will be responsible for managing the cross functional end-to-end production process of all our promotional assets, supporting our marketing, publicity and social teams. This means that you thrive in environment that requires you to bridge competing priorities between global, regional and local cross functional stakeholders.


The Role
Reporting to the Sr. Manager of EMEA Marketing Operations, you will work closely with producers in our AV, Design, Digital and Regional production teams and external production agencies to manage Netflix’s operational campaign needs.  You will serve as the go-to partner to all cross functional stakeholders, facilitating alignment between global and local teams dedicated to creative, localization, strategy, media, marketing, publicity and social.

  • Lead and manage cross-functional EMEA and global communications and workflows for our EMEA International Original titles, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and asset deliverables
  • Support our international originals creative team by planning overall campaign production timelines, project deliverables and resources

  • Oversee our campaign project management to assure that we eliminate time sensitive bottlenecks and produce high-quality creative with appropriate velocity
  • Manage day-to-day escalations and troubleshooting of production issues
  • Oversee creative productions scope, budget, and resources
    • Responsibilities include:
  • 8+ years of marketing account management and creative production experience at an entertainment brand or advertising or media agency with an emphasis on entertainment and video production including online and offline
  • Expert knowledge of marketing campaign and localization workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for both Video and Digital materials
  • Fluent in Video and Digital types and formats while understanding the fundamentals of assets management, servicing and ad trafficking
  • High competency and proven track record of project management high profile global campaigns

You'll create strong partnerships with creative directors, agencies, studios and other cross-functional teams to define the creative look and feel of a title—telling a story through static artwork, motion, graphics and video elements.  Garnering a extremely deep understanding of product strategy will be inherent to your success as well.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Global Product Creative Producers IC Originals Creative Producer


As part of a creative team within the product organization, the Originals Creative Producer is in a unique position to blend the data based A/B testing realm with the highly creative world of Netflix Originals. The Originals Producer position uses both the left and right brain equally and requires a personality and skill set that can easily go from art to science and back again. The Product Creative team creates compelling assets to connect our subscribers to the original Netflix content they love, and also brainstorms, coordinates, and socializes with multiple stakeholder teams to ensure a seamless launch on a global scale. 


This is your chance to help transform how Netflix Originals are presented, consumed and perceived by 100 million+ members across 190 countries. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of this effort.


Responsibilities 


The Originals Creative Producer is responsible for launching Netflix original shows, series, and movies on the Netflix streaming service; overseeing the lifespan of a show from ideation to product deployment across multiple platforms.  You will leverage content, marketing, PR, social campaign elements, product strategy and testing to create a suite of valuable assets to surprise and delight our 100M Netflix subscribers. 


Success is not only based on creating the most varied and visually stimulating cache of assets but also coordinating across numerous internal and external stakeholder groups; being able to form close relationships with various groups within Netflix is just as critical as with studio and showrunner partners. You'll create strong partnerships with creative directors, agencies, studios and other cross-functional teams to define the creative look and feel of a title—telling a story through static artwork, motion, graphics and video elements.  Garnering a extremely deep understanding of product strategy will be inherent to your success as well.

  •  Write a creative strategy based on data and insights from partner teams
  • Work cross-functionally to source, direct, and create compelling imagery and motion assets
  • Collaborate with agencies, graphic designers, motion designers, and art directors to elevate the creative and enhance content discovery across multiple titles across different genres
  • Clearly understand product priorities and be able to distinguish them  from marketing priorities
  • Create project schedules, effectively managing timelines from conception through successful launch and beyond, communicating milestones to key stakeholders
  • Continue to proactively learn about product creative strategy and also be able to educate cross-functional partners and internal team members on the latest product developments
  • Build and strengthen partner relationships as liaison to studio partners, PR, Marketing, Product, Content Operations, Content Acquisition, Content Platform Engineering and Legal teams
  • Manage artwork localization and global branding of titles
  • Reviewing artwork performance metrics, analyzing winning trends, and determining a path for better creative
  • Work with engineers to determine the best tools or modifications to current tools to improve workflow
  • Access reporting tools to analyze asset performance
  • Conceptualize A/B test hypotheses against the current workflow Looking above the horizon to understand the big picture of what Netflix is trying to achieve and spearhead new tests and projects
    • Day-to-day Functions
  • 7+ years in a creative digital environment. Entertainment and/or gaming experience is a plus.
  • Exemplary organizational skills with a disciplined approach to project management.
  • Ability to create clear, effective briefs grounded in data and insights
  • Great interpersonal skills with ability to voice opinions and give feedback.
  • Must be capable and conversant in all aspects of a digital creative and image production workflow.
  • Prior project management, team leadership, or creative agency campaign supervision experience.
  • The soft skills to be able to recognize when to challenge conventional thinking, and also to accept feedback on ideas and work product.
  • Experience using a Digital Asset Management system or similar tools to propagate and track assets through an operational workflow.
  • Understanding and eye for great visual design and the ability to translate design specs into finalized assets.
  • Basic proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Understand, advocate, and embody the company’s values and team goals.
  • Ability to travel to our headquarters in Northern California for collaboration at least 2x per month.
  • Using metrics and testing for more informed creative.
  • Healthy interactions with marketing teams, creative agency, and/or production house, as well as familiarity with studio/network campaigns or entertainment branding.
  • Excel as an individual contributor with global purview.
  • Fluency in a second language a plus.
