search_text:
Los Angeles, California Global Product Creative Operations Manager Agency Program Manager, Conceptual


Can you evaluate an agency’s ability to look at a spec and turn it into a story? Are you connected on LinkedIn to multiple Art Directors? Are you just at home within a PSD as you are within a spreadsheet? If so read on...
 
The Team
Product Creative Infrastructure’s mission is creative execution at scale: specifically, how do we ensure the most visually compelling discovery experience and connect our members to the content they love. Our team partners with studios, external creative agencies and internal cross-functional teams to design and deploy all media representing titles on the Netflix service. We also take creative risks, test what we know to be true and strive to keep creating new, innovative member experiences through visual assets.
 
The Role
As the agency program manager for our conceptual agencies, you will manage the strategy for our diverse roster of creative agencies. You will build and strengthen relationships, educate agencies on our style and approach, drive strategy with data and innovation, and seek high quality creative with like-minded partners.  Paramount to this is fostering strong cross-functional partner relationships and seeking to curate a roster of agencies that will help achieve our vision of a great customer experience.

  • Review artwork performance metrics, analyze winning trends, and determine a path for better creative and more efficient workflows.
  • Drive contractual agreements and rate card negotiations as new agencies are onboarded and new assets are rolled out.
  • Lead onboarding meetings with agencies to set up delivery protocols and quality expectations.
  • Strengthen external agency relationships by providing context around quality expectations and asset innovations.
  • Communicate the purpose and workflow of the Agency Partnerships program across internal cross-functional teams.
  • Gather and act upon weekly feedback from our Product Creative Producers who are accountable for the artwork these agencies generate.
  • Negotiate Master Service Agreements, Statements of Work and other key contractual agreements with agencies.
    • A Typical Day Might Include:
  • Minimum 5 years of experience cultivating and improving external agency and cross-functional relationships, preferably in an entertainment or technology environment.
  • Prior project management, team leadership, or creative agency experience.
  • Experience using a Digital Asset Management system or similar tools to propagate and track assets through an operational workflow.
  • Understanding and eye for great visual design and the ability to translate design specs into finalized assets.
  • Understand, advocate, and embody the company’s values and team goals.
  • Basic proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite a plus.
    • The Right Stuff:

It's an exciting time for Netflix with continued rapid expansion into original programming and around the world; it's a great time to join our team. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Director, Publicity - Latin America


The Opportunity


We are looking for a talented Public Relations professional based in Los Angeles who is an expert publicity strategist with an understanding of the different countries, cultures & idiosyncrasies of the markets in the Latin America region.  This position offers the chance to help shape the publicity strategy for Netflix original series and films in Latin America, working with a team that is transforming entertainment through quality series and films that launch worldwide with all episodes available at once, and an innovative platform that enables viewers to watch anytime, on any device. With popular series such as Marvel’s Daredevil, Orange is the New Black, Narcos and many more.


The Role


The Director will help create, shape, execute and manage Latin American campaigns for series and films, adapting global strategies for the needs of their markets and making use of multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print and online. They will focus on creating cultural moments and high impact campaigns, explore new tactics of promoting series, and will be able to communicate different facets of their campaigns to agencies and other audiences across Netflix. She or he will manage a team of publicists, based in Hollywood, who work with agencies in region (where applicable) to pitch media, secure opportunities and cover set visits or help plan and work junkets.  He/she will serve as the expert on the regions they manage, able to convey cultural needs and nuances that impact the global campaign. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because travel is a requirement.


They will collaborate closely with our Content, Brand PR, Marketing and Social teams to create big wins in the region. He/she will work in lockstep with the US originals publicity team that handles the global strategies for aforementioned campaigns. He/she will also oversee publicity efforts for our growing slate of original series produced in Latin America, including Club de Cuervos, 3%, Ingobernable and more. This position will be part of the originals publicity leadership team, helping direct the activities of the department and determining overall strategy and budgeting, with input into awards, events, internal communications, talent relations and more.


Strong candidates are good collaborators, clear communicators and can handle a high volume of work. They are curious and ask questions, and also contribute effectively outside of their specialty. Successful candidates will have a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and question values inconsistent with our values and Netflix culture. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues.


Qualifications


The successful candidate for the role will likely possess 7+ years in corporate or agency settings. Of particular interest are candidates with Broad knowledge of TV, international publicity, entertainment, pop culture & lifestyle trends, etc. in general and Latin America.


To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


Creative
Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


Succinct Communicator
Great writer and talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Doesn’t need to “check with the agency” on every issue or for every answer. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail, highly organized and drama-free.


A Smart Minimalist
Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that. Does not need or desire big budgets for big results. Believes one great person on the team is more valuable than 3 to 5 OK people---and wants to be that great person.


Has a Point of View
An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.
PaceMoves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done on short timeframes.


Languages
Ability to speak/write in Spanish & English is essential. Portuguese is a plus.


An Adult
Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


Compensation
Realizing the importance of the position, Netflix will offer an attractive compensation package.


Reporting Relationship
The Director, Originals Publicity – LatAm reports to the PR Director for Latin America

description: The OpportunityFueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading promotional campaigns for such a fast growing and highly admired company, with a chance to strategize, plan and execute events alongside a team that is working on series and films that feature high production value from the brightest filmmakers and actors in the industry, using the latest technology. The RoleThe successful candidate will  play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing events for the publicity team, which crosses documentaries, series and film. They are a member of a small, seasoned group of professionals, who will be based in our Amsterdam office & orientating around our EMEA business. The Manager will work alongside the team that is helping to create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for our content, meaning that he/she will have to be in sync and show a curiosity about promotional efforts and contribute to improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas. The ideal candidate has worked handling events for film, TV or entertainment brands. If they have experience working in film or television awards campaigns, that is a bonus. He/she will be able to strategize & execute as part of a varied group of internal stakeholders. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because international travel is a requirement. She/he is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. He/she can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer. They are organized, thorough and not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that will mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from hiring an agency to plan an event, to maintaining and updating guest lists, to booking a venue themselves for an event or to working a check-in table. The responsibility is wide-ranging. They collaborate well with partners that range from the publicists overseeing local and pan-regional campaign strategy to content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and questions values inconsistent with our values.  QualificationsThe successful candidate for Events Manager EMEA will have at least 7+ years of entertainment experience organizing, planning, executing and staffing events at an agency, studio, network or with a brand. BA/BS required.CompensationNetflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

text: Senior Software Engineer in Test - Android Platform
description: Netflix is the world’s leading video streaming subscription service, available in (almost) every country. The Netflix applications are among the most widely used applications on the Android platform, and run on a wide variety of devices including phones & tablets but also TVs, set-top boxes and VR headsets. The Android platform team focuses on providing software foundations in the areas of multimedia, streaming, networking, security, and app frameworks. As a member of the development team, you will lead the efforts to automate the testing of the core application components and the associated Node endpoints. You will write automated tests for both existing and new features. You will also serve as an automation evangelist within the team by proposing changes to the software design to make app components easier to test, and assisting greybox testers and developers in writing test code that follows industry best practices. Join our team and take on this unique opportunity to have a direct impact on the quality of Android applications used by millions of Netflix subscribers. If you love the challenges of supporting the Android diverse ecosystem (think fragmentation), if you are passionate about automating testing, and if you have the corresponding skills and experience, we want to talk to you!

text: Senior Machine Learning Scientist, Content Programming
description: Who are we? Netflix is in a totally new phase of its evolution. We are combining the worlds of tech and entertainment to create hundreds of new Netflix titles that satisfy audiences all over the globe. We are reinventing content categories and breaking down barriers with bold, creative decisions. A critical piece of how we spend billions of dollars on content is understanding our catalog of content and how subscribers interact with that content- in other words, how do we best program our service to satisfy the diverse tastes of audiences all around the globe? As a scientist on the Content Development & Programming team, you will apply state of the art data science techniques to transform Big Data into actionable models that inform which types of content we will create in order to satisfy 100 million current members (and a billion more who aren’t yet members).

Netflix is in a totally new phase of its evolution. We are combining the worlds of tech and entertainment to create hundreds of new Netflix titles that satisfy audiences all over the globe. A critical piece of how we spend billions of dollars on content is understanding our catalog of content and how subscribers interact with that content- in other words, how do we best program our service to satisfy the diverse tastes of audiences all around the globe? As a scientist on the Content Development & Programming team, you will apply state of the art data science techniques to transform Big Data into actionable models that inform which types of content we will create in order to satisfy 100 million current members (and a billion more who aren’t yet members).

description: Netflix is on the hunt for a Director to grow and lead the social media team for Japan. If you’re the kind of person who wants to change how global viewers experience TV and movies, is passionate about how consumers behave online, follows the tech firms, and loves movies and TV, then perhaps you’ll take the crown. This is a management position. The Director will lead a team of Netflix employees and agency partners, and will need to inspire our highly skilled group of social experts to perform their best. We’re seeking an individual with a high EQ, who can navigate the intersection of Netflix and Japanese business cultures. It will require strong partnership and collaboration with other Japan and California based leaders in marketing and comms, biz dev, product, and content. The role reports to the VP of Global Social Media.The successful candidate will show the curiosity to learn about the Netflix business quickly to ensure campaigns impact the business goals in one of our newest and most important growth markets. The right leader will guide the team as they build the social conversation amid a rapidly changing entertainment landscape - and a tricky social media market - establishing the SVOD category, creating word of mouth, attracting new members, and building the brand reputation.It’s also a highly creative role. We believe that the power of an endorsed impression is more valuable than a paid advertisement, and we work to earn as many impressions as possible before buying them. The Director will work closely with the regional leaders and agencies to make a broad set of Netflix original titles as shareable as possible in the Japanese market, creating cultural phenomena and igniting fan behavior in the process. The Director will need to have impeccable creative taste, vision, and a strong instinct for stories that will get consumers talking.The right hire will bring a deep knowledge of the social media landscape, including strong relationships with social media platforms and understanding the new consumer behaviors emerging everyday. In particular, the person will need to innovate and push the envelope when it comes to entertainment campaigns in Japan. The Director will have 10 years’ experience with some combination of consumer brand, media, entertainment, and agency work in marketing and communications, and several years experience managing a team.If all of the above sounds like your cup of tea, the Netflix culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read the Netflix culture deck. If it resonates for you, maybe you’re the right person to join the Netflix leadership team.
search_text:
Tokyo, Japan Marketing and PR Marketing Head of Social Media - Japan


Netflix is on the hunt for a Director to grow and lead the social media team for Japan. If you’re the kind of person who wants to change how global viewers experience TV and movies, is passionate about how consumers behave online, follows the tech firms, and loves movies and TV, then perhaps you’ll take the crown.


This is a management position. The Director will lead a team of Netflix employees and agency partners, and will need to inspire our highly skilled group of social experts to perform their best. We’re seeking an individual with a high EQ, who can navigate the intersection of Netflix and Japanese business cultures. It will require strong partnership and collaboration with other Japan and California based leaders in marketing and comms, biz dev, product, and content. The role reports to the VP of Global Social Media.


The successful candidate will show the curiosity to learn about the Netflix business quickly to ensure campaigns impact the business goals in one of our newest and most important growth markets. The right leader will guide the team as they build the social conversation amid a rapidly changing entertainment landscape - and a tricky social media market - establishing the SVOD category, creating word of mouth, attracting new members, and building the brand reputation.


It’s also a highly creative role. We believe that the power of an endorsed impression is more valuable than a paid advertisement, and we work to earn as many impressions as possible before buying them. The Director will work closely with the regional leaders and agencies to make a broad set of Netflix original titles as shareable as possible in the Japanese market, creating cultural phenomena and igniting fan behavior in the process. The Director will need to have impeccable creative taste, vision, and a strong instinct for stories that will get consumers talking.


The right hire will bring a deep knowledge of the social media landscape, including strong relationships with social media platforms and understanding the new consumer behaviors emerging everyday. In particular, the person will need to innovate and push the envelope when it comes to entertainment campaigns in Japan. The Director will have 10 years’ experience with some combination of consumer brand, media, entertainment, and agency work in marketing and communications, and several years experience managing a team.


If all of the above sounds like your cup of tea, the Netflix culture attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read the Netflix culture deck. If it resonates for you, maybe you’re the right person to join the Netflix leadership team.

description: Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, reaching over 100 million subscribers in more than 190 countries and territories around the world. At the center of every single title that launches on the service is a huge effort across multiple teams to curate and deliver the best representation of that title from the artwork to the synopsis. The Content Engineering team builds a suite of tools to scale the operations behind taking a title live, while building the world’s deepest catalog of information about tv shows and movies. As part of the Content Engineering Design Team, you will be designing the future of our tools to manage and enhance our catalog of data, which is leveraged everywhere from production to the service. About UsIn many ways we still act like a start up. We make decisions based on data, observing and reacting to how systems are impacted by our choices. The organization is flat, process is minimal, individual responsibility is big, and there is an emphasis on keeping non-productive influences out of the everyday decision process. About YouYou are a natural leader.You have exceptional communication skills.You know how to bring multiple stakeholders to the table to understand and solve problems.You have tremendous visual design skills and the ability to tell a story. You know how to take complicated workflows and make them elegant. You have the patience to build something magical.You can juggle multiple top-priority tasks and efficiently focus on delivery.

Los Gatos, California Engineering Content Engineering Product Designer - Content Platform


Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, reaching over 100 million subscribers in more than 190 countries and territories around the world. Our subscribers consume over five billion hours of video a quarter and account for third of the downstream Internet traffic. At the center of every single title that launches on the service is a huge effort across multiple teams to curate and deliver the best representation of that title from the artwork to the synopsis.
 
The Content Engineering team builds a suite of tools to scale the operations behind taking a title live, while building the world’s deepest catalog of information about tv shows and movies. As part of the Content Engineering Design Team, you will be designing the future of our tools to manage and enhance our catalog of data, which is leveraged everywhere from production to the service.
 
About Us
In many ways we still act like a start up. You’ll work closely across engineering, product, and stakeholders to exchange ideas leading to rapid testing and iteration. We make decisions based on data, observing and reacting to how systems are impacted by our choices.
 
The organization is flat, process is minimal, individual responsibility is big, and there is an emphasis on keeping non-productive influences out of the everyday decision process.
 
About You
You are a natural leader.
You have exceptional communication skills.
You know how to bring multiple stakeholders to the table to understand and solve problems.
You have tremendous visual design skills and the ability to tell a story.
You know how to take complicated workflows and make them elegant.
You have the patience to build something magical.
You can juggle multiple top-priority tasks and efficiently focus on delivery.

  • 8+ years of Product Design experience working on a mix of consumer and enterprise products
  • Experience designing authoring and management tools
  • Understanding of complex workflows designed to scale across diverse, global teams
  • Multiple successful product launches that drove meaningful impact to the business
  • Ability to rapidly ideate and produce multiple UX/UI concepts
  • Experience working directly with stakeholders to drive consensus and mine for value

  • Experience working in continuous delivery environments where the pace is fast

text: Manager, Global Creative Marketing - Original Films
description: Do you live and breathe entertainment? Do you stay on top of the latest and greatest movie marketing campaigns across all genres?  Are you motivated by seeing your creative strategy have a direct impact on the overall business goals? Do you crave autonomy over your campaigns? If this resonates, then the opportunity to join our global creative marketing team and work on our growing film initiative could be the job for you!The OpportunityIt’s the chance to be on the ground floor with a team that will handle original features globally for the online leader, changing the perception of Netflix films and how they should be enjoyed and celebrated.  It’s a chance to be fearless and unconventional, try new things, lean into the unknown and turn a movie marketing campaign on its head.  It’s an opportunity where you actually get to experience the direct impact your work has on the business. Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 110 million streaming members in over 190 countries. The RoleThe Manager of GCM Original Films will work across several different disciplines that are building audiences and demand for dozens of original feature films. We are looking for a team member who knows how to build and execute on a creative strategy that goes beyond cookie cutter tactics and elevates our films to must watch status across the globe. We are looking for someone who will be a champion of the films that they’re working on, who will clearly and effectively communicate your strategy, objectives and creative work to get others as excited as you are about your titles and your work. The ideal candidate is not just a movie marketer, but a Netflix marketer, representing and understanding our brand. They must have a solid business acumen and a strong work ethic. This leader will understand the film market, be intellectually curious about entertainment and technology, and relate that knowledge to their campaigns. They think strategically and will run with campaigns or new ideas that haven’t yet been achieved or previously attempted (and have fun with it). As such, they are a bold risk taker, not afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches. They are candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial.  The ideal candidate thrives in an environment of freedom, takes initiative, and uses sound judgement to independently make wise decisions. They are scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks at all levels -- ALL -- and they succeed in an environment void of bureaucracy and layers. The role will report to the Senior Manager, GCM Original Films.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Global Creative Marketing - Original Films


Do you live and breathe entertainment? Do you stay on top of the latest and greatest movie marketing campaigns across all genres?  Are you motivated by seeing your creative strategy have a direct impact on the overall business goals? Do you crave autonomy over your campaigns? If this resonates, then the opportunity to join our global creative marketing team and work on our growing film initiative could be the job for you!


The Opportunity
It’s the chance to be on the ground floor with a team that will handle original features globally for the online leader, changing the perception of Netflix films and how they should be enjoyed and celebrated.  It’s a chance to be fearless and unconventional, try new things, lean into the unknown and turn a movie marketing campaign on its head.  It’s an opportunity where you actually get to experience the direct impact your work has on the business.


Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 110 million streaming members in over 190 countries.


The Role
The Manager of GCM Original Films will work across several different disciplines that are building audiences and demand for dozens of original feature films. We are looking for a team member who knows how to build and execute on a creative strategy that goes beyond cookie cutter tactics and elevates our films to must watch status across the globe. We are looking for someone who will be a champion of the films that they’re working on, who will clearly and effectively communicate your strategy, objectives and creative work to get others as excited as you are about your titles and your work.


The ideal candidate is not just a movie marketer, but a Netflix marketer, representing and understanding our brand. They must have a solid business acumen and a strong work ethic. This leader will understand the film market, be intellectually curious about entertainment and technology, and relate that knowledge to their campaigns. They think strategically and will run with campaigns or new ideas that haven’t yet been achieved or previously attempted (and have fun with it). As such, they are a bold risk taker, not afraid to challenge prevailing assumptions when warranted, and suggest better approaches. They are candid and direct, even when that approach might be controversial.  The ideal candidate thrives in an environment of freedom, takes initiative, and uses sound judgement to independently make wise decisions. They are scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks at all levels -- ALL -- and they succeed in an environment void of bureaucracy and layers. The role will report to the Senior Manager, GCM Original Films.

  • The ideal candidate is a strong leader familiar with the Netflix culture deck and is eager to work among like-minded colleagues and embrace the company's philosophies.
  • They will have at least 6-7 years of entertainment experience, preferably focused on movies, and will be able to successfully strategize and communicate innovative marketing campaigns and work well across disciplines to execute on said campaigns.
  • Has a native understanding of digital and social media, but believes in telling stories through great ideas regardless of the medium.
  • Has led 360 creative on marketing campaigns, including print, television, digital, and social. Understands the essence of what connects consumers to entertainment brands outside of traditional marketing tactics
  • Experience working on awards campaigns is a plus.
  • The role is global, so international experience is a bonus but not a deal breaker.
  • The ideal candidate is high energy, motivated, has strong relationship-building capabilities and a capacity to work in a very fast-paced environment.
    • Qualifications


    To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


    Creative
    Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


    Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
    Has a big capacity to both think and ‘do’. Flourishes in a ‘hands on’ role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


    A smart minimalist
    Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.


    Has a Point of View
    An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


    Pace
    Moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


    Integrity
    Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


    An Adult
    Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.


    COMPENSATION
    Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.

search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure IC Senior Data Engineer, Product


The product data engineering team is responsible for nearly all of the large, web-scale datasets used at Netflix for analyzing the product experience. This means that we build datasets for the purpose of analysis, and collaborate with predictive modeling experts to build production data pipelines.
 
Given the size/complexity of our datasets this is not a trivial task. Nearly every engineer at Netflix depends on this data, and as a member of this team you would be at the center of product innovation. This includes projects like:
 
• Determining the efficacy of our original content targeting algorithms
• Building datasets in partnership with the catalog ranking (and page construction) teams
• Creating source datasets for a/b testing
• Establishing new patterns for efficient processing of O(10B) record datasets
• Defining metrics for tracking how customers are interacting with the service
• Partner with UI engineering teams to enable new customer experiences
 
The perfect person will have a background in a quantitative/technical field, will have rich experience working with large data sets, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making.

  • Partnering with internal customers. At times you will partner with every team at Netflix to enable new projects and analyses.
  • Design, prototype, and productize data pipelines used for making product decisions.
  • Build/Deploy/Improve internal-built data tools. You will be expected to contribute to internal tools that enable efficiency throughout Netflix. These tools will be used for both analysis and data processing.  As these tools mature you will be encouraged to make them available via open source.
    • Responsibilities:
  • Experience building production data pipelines (using Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) on web-scale datasets. You should have an unmistakable passion for elegant and intuitive dataset design. Hands on and deep experience with schema design and data modeling.
  • Programming proficiency in at least one major language (e.g. Java, Scala). You strive to write beautiful code and you're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks.
  • You are a well-rounded, top performer who is able to process data at scale and work strategically with partners.
  • You're ambitious and willing to take action, but not stubborn. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes.
  • You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines.
    • Skills & Characteristics:
  • We expect a lot.  Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at jobs.netflix.com.
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
    • Two more things to know:

description: Netflix recently surpassed 100 million global subscribers—here’s Reed Hastings celebrating with a steak at Denny’s–and we’re just getting started! Help Netflix reach our next 100 million subscribers as a Senior Data Scientist on the Content Experience team. You will drive research surrounding Netflix’s original content experiences including connecting audiences to our fast-growing kids product and our innovative interactive storytelling platforms. Ultimately, your job will be to help Netflix introduce new stories to the world.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Science and Analytics IC Senior Data Scientist, Product Research


Netflix recently surpassed 100 million global subscribers—here’s Reed Hastings celebrating with a steak at Denny’s–and we’re just getting started! Help Netflix reach our next 100 million subscribers as a Senior Data Scientist on the Content Experience team. You will drive research surrounding Netflix’s original content experiences including connecting audiences to our fast-growing kids product and our innovative interactive storytelling platforms. Ultimately, your job will be to help Netflix introduce new stories to the world.

  • You will develop experimentation methods and statistical models, define metrics, and analyze experiments to help Netflix improve user experience. For instance, you will run experiments to understand how people’s conversations with their friends and family drives content engagement and enjoyment
  • You will partner with Product Managers to influence Netflix’s innovation strategy by studying the way our members are currently using the product and using Netflix’s large-scale data to identify key insights that will motivate product improvements, experiments, and innovation. For example, you will find insights on how kids grow up with Netflix to inform our kids innovation strategy
  • You will collaborate with user experience/interface designers, algorithm developers, other scientists, and engineers to solve Netflix’s most challenging and rewarding problems.   
    • What you'll do
  • You love freedom and hate being micromanaged
  • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it
  • You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without guidelines
  • You can frame loose business problems, turning them into concrete recommendations
  • You have an advanced degree in a quantitative or computational field (e.g., statistics, econometrics, psychophysics, math, computer science, engineering, neuroscience, etc.), experience with empirical methods, and 2 or more years of industry experience in quantitative analytics, data science, or another similar role
  • You are passionate about experimentation, hypothesis testing, and causal inference (quasi-experimentation methods a strong plus!)
  • You have expertise applying linear models, probability theory, and sampling methods to solve business problems; you are familiar with a diverse set of machine learning models and approaches
  • You are feel at home using R and/or Python, relational databases/SQL, and large-scale data technologies like Spark, Presto, and Redshift
    • Who you are


    Who we are
     
    Our culture is unique, and we live by our values. You will need to be comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements will be vague, and iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart risks. Learn more about Netflix’s culture.

text: Senior Software Engineer - Content Metadata Engineering
description: Netflix is leading the disruption of Internet television.  We have the largest global subscription based video on demand entertainment service in the world. Our subscribers consume over five billion hours of video a quarter and account for about 33% of the downstream Internet traffic in North America. Subscribers enjoy Netflix on more than 1,000 different device types. Supporting this global brand presents significant engineering challenges. At the center of those challenges is the Netflix Content Platform team, responsible for putting together the product streamed by our customers. The Content Metadata Engineering team develops systems that allow creative teams in Netflix to  elevate our metadata thus improving the Netflix experience. If you are a software engineer/architect,with experience building distributed and scalable architectures, we'd love to tell you more about this amazing opportunity! Our International expansion as well as the increase in Original content has brought in very interesting challenges to our tool set such as high scalability, availability, security, maintainability and innovation. We will be delivering solutions leveraging the cloud infrastructure to meet these challenges. THE CULTURE            When you get up in the morning and think about your work for the day, are you excited? Can't wait to get started? Do you feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Do your co-workers know who you are, what you do, and that you do it exceptionally well? Do you want to work with smart people who love to solve hard problems? This is the kind of environment that we value at Netflix. High performance is not only noticed but required.
search_text:

At the center of those challenges is the Netflix Content Platform team, responsible for putting together the product streamed by our customers.
 
The Content Metadata Engineering team develops systems that allow creative teams in Netflix to  elevate our metadata thus improving the Netflix experience. Our International expansion as well as the increase in Original content has brought in very interesting challenges to our tool set such as high scalability, availability, security, maintainability and innovation. THE CULTURE            
When you get up in the morning and think about your work for the day, are you excited? Can't wait to get started? Do you want to work with smart people who love to solve hard problems? This is the kind of environment that we value at Netflix. High performance is not only noticed but required.

  • Expertise in Data Structures, Algorithms and Concurrency
  • Experience building Micro Services
  • Knowledge of different Data Storage technologies such as Cassandra, Redis, Riak, HBase, RDBMS, Elastic Search, etc.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Visual Communications Manager, Original Documentaries


Do you love entertainment? Are you an avid fan of documentaries? Are you unapologetically guilty of flipping through your favorite entertainment magazine captivated by the photos?


The Role


We are seeking an individual to lead strategic Global publicity campaigns driven by creative materials -photography, featurettes, clips, etc. The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative personality and a strong project management background.  The Visual Communications team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: asset creation & global communication strategy. We specialize in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our Global publicity campaigns for our Netflix Original content including series, films, and documentaries.


This role works across photo and creative content/EPK, utilizing knowledge of TV/film productions, talent/filmmaker relations, and publicity events as part of the Netflix Originals Publicity team.   A successful candidate is someone who is willing to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. They must have a strong project management background and are able to strategically plan and execute across multiple projects simultaneously. This candidate must be extremely well organized, creative, a succinct communicator, a team player and thrive in a fast-paced environment. They must be self-motivated, possess integrity and able to work autonomously across multiple teams.  The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same.


This job is based in Los Angeles and reports to the Visual Communications Manager, Originals Publicity.


Here at Netflix, we don't have rules and regulations. We hire adults who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work, and we expect high performance in return.

  • Develop and execute a global strategy, per project/title, to capture, produce and utilize creative material to enhance and support the publicity campaign throughout its lifecycle
  • Oversee a slate of documentaries & docu-series projects
  • Drive communication with lead campaign publicist counterpart, marketing/social teams, showrunners/filmmakers and talent reps
  • Hire and oversee unit photographers and video crews, including script and schedule review and communication with production
  • Produce strong creative materials that shape and enhance the overall publicity campaign
  • Assist with the asset management and servicing of material
  • Oversee photography/video needs for premieres, events and photo shoots
  • Manage budgets
    • Responsibilities of the role include:
  • 8+ years experience at a network or studio
  • Experience working in documentary films, specialty films, series or docu-series preferred
  • Strategic thought-partner
  • Strong team player
  • Deadline-oriented with strong time management skills
  • Strong eye for producing visual assets
  • Experience working with international markets is preferred
  • Ability to handle high volume of complex projects and tasks for multiple people and departments simultaneously and manage competing priorities
  • Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail
  • Must possess solid organizational, effective time management and excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with internal and external teams
  • Understand and interest in Federal copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes
  • Understand the photography/video industryStrong knowledge in digital file specs & size formats
  • Extensive knowledge of Adobe Suite including Photoshop and Pro is preferred
    • Skills and Requirements:


    To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics:


    Creative
    Demonstrate the ability to think innovatively - connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


    Succinct Communicator
    Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.


    Pragmatic, Organized and Detailed
    Has a big capacity to both think and 'do'. Flourishes in a 'hands on' role, adding value at different levels. Is strong on detail and highly organized.


    A Smart Minimalist
    Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.


    Has a Point of View
    An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


    Pace
    Moves at a nice pace and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


    Integrity
    Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


    An Adult
    Is a mature, fully-formed adult with a happy, well balanced life. Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.

text: Senior Software Engineer - Open Connect Platform
description: The Team Open Connect is a critical group within Netflix that builds and manages a content delivery network (CDN) handling more than one third of North American internet traffic at peak times!  We are available in 190+ countries and partner with ISPs all over the world to provide our 100 million subscriber base with the ultimate streaming quality.  During our most recent peak, late last year, we had over 340 million viewing hours in a single day!The RoleYou should have a strong intuition for analyzing business processes, recognizing automation and integration points, and will be helping contribute to the technical vision for our suite of applications and services.  This suite empowers our stakeholders by playing a pivotal role in automation, configuration, management, monitoring, and forecasting for our ever-growing Open Connect initiative.In this position, you will have the opportunity to work on a range of areas such as: adding API support to enable real-time data visualization and search, building scalable data pipelines to ingest data from a wide variety of sources, and creating systems which provide efficiency and transparency to our CDN operations.  All of which will have direct and immediate impact to one of the core operating functions of Netflix, delivering incredible content!

text: Tech Ops Specialist, Production Ops - Singapore
description: As a Tech Ops Specialist at Netflix, you will be responsible for providing exceptional support to our production accountants and growing APAC productions in our Singapore office. We want to empower the production landscape, utilizing never-before-seen streamlined, efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.  We’re looking for a TECH OPS SPECIALIST willing to pioneer the advancement of technology into Netflix productions. This requires extreme flexibility, unending creativity and a proactive approach to transforming the production culture.  You will serve as a liaison between Netflix teams and the productions to assist in infusing technology and gaining proper adoption of our in-house technology solutions.  This role operates within the system deployment side of Production Operations, part of the Netflix Production team. Tech Ops Specialists will report to the Manager of Production Technology. The Tech Ops Specialist will be an ambassador of Netflix production technology. He/She will embody the passion for transformation and workflow advancements utilizing brand new creative technologies. This role will be a point of contact for technology support for our productions with expertise in how productions utilize software now and in the future. The Tech Ops Specialist is one part production, one part cloud-based software, and one part hardware infrastructure. He/She must have a working knowledge of current web-based software trends, both within entertainment and outside of entertainment. He/She will assess technical infrastructure needs for production build-outs (stages and offices) and provide hardware via internal resources and external vendors. Passion for change and creative thinking is a must.

text: Senior Software Engineer - HTML5 Video Player
description: Join the team that creates the Web’s most seamless video playback experience and see your work reach over one hundred million subscribers around the world!  WHAT SETS US APART  The Browser Player team implements the adaptive and secure media streaming engine for browsers, the Windows 10 app, and Chromecast devices.  Our technology stack is built on top of HTML5 and Javascript features like Media Source Extensions (MSE) and Encrypted Media Extensions (EME). Today we support all major browser vendors and work closely with them to design and incorporate new technologies. One way this has allowed us to advance the state of the art for video streaming is by supporting Ultra HD 4K and HDR on Windows 10. As part of our day-to-day work we collaborate with networking, encoding, security, and data science teams to deliver the best possible video streaming experience. Additionally, we partner with other engineering teams to bring video playback to all parts of the Netflix experience and to create innovative experiences like the recent launch of our interactive kids shows.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Streaming Client Senior Software Engineer - HTML5 Video Player


Join the team that creates the Web’s most seamless video playback experience and see your work reach over one hundred million subscribers around the world!
 
WHAT SETS US APART 
 
The Browser Player team implements the adaptive and secure media streaming engine for browsers, the Windows 10 app, and Chromecast devices.  Our technology stack is built on top of HTML5 and Javascript features like Media Source Extensions (MSE) and Encrypted Media Extensions (EME). Today we support all major browser vendors and work closely with them to design and incorporate new technologies. One way this has allowed us to advance the state of the art for video streaming is by supporting Ultra HD 4K and HDR on Windows 10.
 
As part of our day-to-day work we collaborate with networking, encoding, security, and data science teams to deliver the best possible video streaming experience. Additionally, we partner with other engineering teams to bring video playback to all parts of the Netflix experience and to create innovative experiences like the recent launch of our interactive kids shows.  

  • Address complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive design that results in a maintainable code base
  • Work at all phases of the software development lifecycle: planning, design, implementation, deployment and support
  • Effectively drive technical collaboration and communication with internal and external engineering teams
  • Refactor code opportunistically (you are comfortable changing tires on a moving vehicle)
    • IF YOU CAN…
  • 7+ years of relevant software development experience
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience
  • Exceptional JavaScript, HTTP, object oriented design and programming skills
  • Experience with modular JavaScript (or TypeScript), asynchronous constructs, functional paradigms and unit testing
  • Experience with developing connected applications and evolving them rapidly to support changing business needs
    • IF YOU HAVE…
  • TypeScript, ES6, Node.js, and beyond
  • Object Oriented Design
  • Test-driven development and continuous integration
  • Streaming video concepts
    • IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN…


    … Then you have what it takes to tackle the challenge of bringing Netflix to our next hundred million customers around the globe. Netflix offers a culture that values freedom and responsibility, enabling us to do our best work. Learn more about life at Netflix and join us!

text: Senior Software Engineer, Adaptive Streaming Mobile
description: We obsess over great playback experiences. We want playback to start immediately, at great quality, and we never want playback to stop unexpectedly. On the Streaming Algorithms team, we design algorithms that adapt to ever changing network conditions to provide an amazing streaming experience.  Most of the world’s population is consuming video on their smartphones - and in many places, exclusively on their smartphones.  As we continue our global expansion at Netflix, the quality of streaming video on mobile devices is a top priority.   We are looking for a senior engineer to improve the streaming quality of experience (QoE) on mobile devices, especially Android.  In this role, you would be responsible for developing new video streaming algorithms for millions of mobile devices as well as conducting controlled experiments in the field to validate improvements.  You would join our streaming algorithms team, whose members work across the spectrum of networking, video streaming, big data, and engineering.  It’s an exciting time to join this team; the science is new and we’re making big progress at a rapid pace.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Streaming Client Senior Software Engineer, Adaptive Streaming Mobile


We obsess over great playback experiences. We want playback to start immediately, at great quality, and we never want playback to stop unexpectedly. On the Streaming Algorithms team, we design algorithms that adapt to ever changing network conditions to provide an amazing streaming experience. 
 
Most of the world’s population is consuming video on their smartphones - and in many places, exclusively on their smartphones.  As we continue our global expansion at Netflix, the quality of streaming video on mobile devices is a top priority.  
 
We are looking for a senior engineer to improve the streaming quality of experience (QoE) on mobile devices, especially Android.  In this role, you would be responsible for developing new video streaming algorithms for millions of mobile devices as well as conducting controlled experiments in the field to validate improvements.  You would join our streaming algorithms team, whose members work across the spectrum of networking, video streaming, big data, and engineering.  It’s an exciting time to join this team; the science is new and we’re making big progress at a rapid pace.

  • You have direct experience with mobile networking, and ideally with rate control or congestion control algorithms
  • You have a proven ability to develop large scale applications
  • You are fluent in statistics and data science
  • You exhibit a bias to action, avoid analysis paralysis, and are willing to take smart risks
    • More about you:
  • Design and implement new streaming algorithms as well as improvements to existing algorithms
  • Run controlled experiments on millions of streaming sessions to validate improvements
  • Design metrics that capture the viewer’s experience as well as the system performance
  • Work cross-functionally with other teams on adaptive streaming
    • What you will do:
  • 10+ years of relevant software engineering experience
  • Expert with at least one of: Java, C/C++, or JavaScript
  • Knowledge of high-level streaming protocols and/or low-level
  • Experience with cellular and/or wifi networking standards
  • Experience shipping software on behalf of a major brand at scale is a big plus
  • Experience with video is a big plus
    • The ideal candidate will have the following experience:


    A few words about the company and the team: 
     
    This is a great time to be at Netflix!  We continue to grow around the world and we believe that our culture of Freedom and Responsibility enables us to do our best work. The organization is flat, process is minimal, and there's an emphasis on keeping non-productive influences out.  Every day, we make decisions with far-reaching technical and product impact.

description: Netflix is the leading online video subscription service, reaching millions of US and international households. Netflix became well known as a data driven company for our personalized recommendations, but our use of data doesn't stop there. From testing new features for the website to measuring performance across many devices to making wise choices about content, we use our petabytes of data to move the business forward. To do that we have built a big data platform that, along with the rest of our infrastructure, lives in the cloud and will continue to grow with us as we expand.This platform is used by engineers, analysts and data scientists to leverage our data to do interesting and impactful analysis and allow Netflix to continue to innovate. The Data Experience team is working to make it as easy and efficient as possible to work with all of this data. We’re building a cohesive experience to make information more accessible, insightful and actionable by improving discovery, surfacing context and enabling self-service. To deliver a meaningful user experience, we are building a lightweight browser-based application that provides our stakeholders a consistent way to interact with the big data platform. Our work will enable engineers to leverage complex relationships between massive datasets while providing them a way to extend the platform by reusing features and patterns. We are looking for someone who is deeply technical, obsesses over tiny details, and has an unwavering passion for building delightful products. The ideal candidate should be an expert in developing reusable components and features for browser-based apps.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data, Analytics, and Algorithms Data Engineering and Infrastructure IC Data Experience - Senior UX Engineer


Netflix is the leading online video subscription service, reaching millions of US and international households. Netflix became well known as a data driven company for our personalized recommendations, but our use of data doesn't stop there. From testing new features for the website to measuring performance across many devices to making wise choices about content, we use our petabytes of data to move the business forward. To do that we have built a big data platform that, along with the rest of our infrastructure, lives in the cloud and will continue to grow with us as we expand.


This platform is used by engineers, analysts and data scientists to leverage our data to do interesting and impactful analysis and allow Netflix to continue to innovate. The Data Experience team is working to make it as easy and efficient as possible to work with all of this data. We’re building a cohesive experience to make information more accessible, insightful and actionable by improving discovery, surfacing context and enabling self-service.


To deliver a meaningful user experience, we are building a lightweight browser-based application that provides our stakeholders a consistent way to interact with the big data platform. Our work will enable engineers to leverage complex relationships between massive datasets while providing them a way to extend the platform by reusing features and patterns.


We are looking for someone who is deeply technical, obsesses over tiny details, and has an unwavering passion for building delightful products. The ideal candidate should be an expert in developing reusable components and features for browser-based apps.

  • Value simplicity and clarity in design. Our engineering strongly reflects this value.
  • Have a strong background in front-end development and familiarity with working across the stack.
  • Want to build a stunning front-end experience.
  • Enjoy staying up to date with the changing JavaScript ecosystem.
  • Want to build a platform to solve interesting data problems.
  • Passionate about microinteractions that lead to delightful experiences.
  • Pride yourself in building reusable assets that the community can leverage.
  • Are self-led but highly aligned with your teammates; we develop fast, and align daily.
    • This may be your dream job if you:
  • Modern JavaScript standards and web fundamentals.
  • Building data-intensive and interactive web applications.
  • Contributing to a reusable style guide and UI toolkit.
  • Leveraging HTML5 and CSS and can make the right choices when building responsive UI applications.
  • The intricacies of the DOM and have command over the APIs and their performance implications.
  • Design tools like Sketch, Adobe XD as a plus.
    • We’re looking for you to have experience with:


    We need you to bring strong development expertise and an appreciation for delivering delightful designs to help us build meaningful solutions. You will need an excellent ability to communicate across our team and the organization. Your experience can come from a variety of places including work experience, formal or informal education. You will have ample opportunities to grow professionally, to contribute both inside and outside of Netflix, and to enable Netflix to bring moments of joy around the world.


    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Within the Marketing Operations team, we are looking for an Integrated Producer to lead creative innovation, concepting and production of best-in-class marketing campaigns for the EMEA market. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the end-to-end production process of our market specific campaign initiatives with a digital and social focus. This means that you thrive in environment that requires you to bridge creative and technical needs. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain. You have a keen ability to balance focus on delivery, excellent creative taste and understanding strategic media context.


The Role 
Based in Amsterdam and reporting to the Senior Manager of EMEA Marketing Operations, you will join a team of Integrated Producers to ensure creative materials for online campaigns in Scandinavian and Benelux markets are tailor made to each country’s needs.

  • Support local implementation of global campaigns, leveraging global materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions.
  • Plan and manage internal and external local integrated production communications and workflows, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and assets delivery.
  • Manage localization, production process and creative approvals of advertising materials in multiple languages (including clearances, delivery, trafficking, etc.).
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines.
  • Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all tracking is implemented correctly, efficiently, deadlines are met, and executions are flawless.
  • Drive creative innovation across the EMEA market, managing local agency relationships to maintain industry leading creative executions that help further our brand and connect new fans to Netflix Original titles.
    • Responsibilities include:
  • Fluency in English is a must. Additional Swedish or another Scandinavian language is mandatory too.
  • Strong experience, preferably at an entertainment brand, advertising or media agency with an emphasis on integrated production including online and offline video, high impact display takeovers, rich media and paid social campaigns.
  • Expert knowledge of marketing campaign and localization workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for both Video and Digital materials.
  • Ability to translate creative ideas through to technical and native executions, for various ad serving platforms and proprietary publisher platforms.
  • High competency and proven track record of building high performance digital marketing experiences across display, social, mobile and online video channels.
  • Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams.
  • Hands on experience working with Doubleclick and other 3rd party ad serving platforms, QA & trafficking processes and experience troubleshooting directly with local teams.
  • Knowledgeable of and familiar with leading digital and advertising agencies in Europe.
  • Expert knowledge of the trends and limitations of the evolving global digital marketing ecosystem, including exposure to/experience with programmatic buying and paid social platforms.

This means that you thrive in environment that requires you to bridge creative, technical and analytical teams. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain.


The Role
Reporting to the Director of Global Marketing Production, you will lead a team of digital producers and ad operations leads to manage Netflix’s digital campaigns across the globe. You will be responsible for driving digital innovation throughout our marketing organization, positioning the team for scale delivery against our growing volume of Global and UCAN digital marketing campaigns and deep collaboration cross-functionally with teams dedicated to creative, media, regional marketing, social, advertising technology, and engineering.

  • Lead a team of 10+ to build and deliver best-in-class digital campaigns for Netflix Original titles
  • Driving digital infrastructure roadmaps with our engineering team, including testing and automation efforts.
  • Plan and manage internal and external digital production communications and workflows, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and asset deliverables.
  • Refine agency vendor practices and cultivate best-in-class partner relationships that align with business needs and produce high-quality creative with appropriate velocity.   
  • Lead business relationships and escalation path for external production and ad serving affiliates in order to efficiently manage dynamic initiatives and eliminate friction points.
  • Cross collaborate with creative, engineering, strategy and media teams to drive production innovation and testing, share key learnings and establish thought leadership.
  • Evolve our digital production model to include agile versioning and scalability to multiple platforms. These include reserved, programmatic, mobile and social creative types.
  • Shepherd scope, budget, and overall digital production resources.
    • Responsibilities:
  • 10+ of digital marketing and advertising production experience, with an emphasis on dynamic display, video and paid social for desktop and mobile platforms.
  • Ability to translate creative ideas through to technical and native digital executions with various technologies and proprietary publisher platforms.
  • Strong understanding of the underlying infrastructure of digital creative including fluency with dynamic creative development, execution and delivery.
  • Expert knowledge of the trends and limitations of the evolving global digital marketing ecosystem, including experience with publishers, programmatic ad buying, paid/organic social platforms and dynamic creative technologies.
  • Experience managing a high volume of campaign types in parallel, while collaborating with diverse geographically dispersed teams.
  • Experience working with 3rd party serving platforms, QA & ad trafficking processes.
  • University Degree, Post Graduate qualifications in related field preferred.
    • Qualifications:
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.  
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing creative and have an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • You are a natural team leader, with the ability to conceptualize and articulate creative production and trafficking workflow that all will rally around.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!
    • Personality Attributes:
