text: Manager, Originals Series Publicity - US Hispanic
description: Netflix is looking for a Publicity Manager with expertise in the US Hispanic market to handle publicity for its original series and develop and execute strategy for its UCAN region (US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand). We need someone who is equipped and excited to spearhead publicity campaigns, autonomously with passion and creativity. With great original series like Marvel’s The Defenders, The Crown, Stranger Things, Ingobernable, Master of None, Narcos and more on the horizon, the Manager, Originals Series Publicity will be responsible for strategizing and executing innovative campaigns from top to bottom.  We need big thinkers who can put their traditional publicity know-how to work against a broader regional strategy that they contribute to, aligning closely with social and marketing.  The OpportunityFueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading and handling publicity campaigns for the largest Internet TV network in the world, with a chance to work on series that feature high production value from the brightest filmmakers and actors around the world, using the latest technology.   The RoleThe Manager for Originals Series Publicity, US Hispanic, will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing publicity campaigns for series - not just for Netflix shows but also for its broader slate across the UCAN region.  They will us their deep knowledge of the US Hispanic market to help prioritize support as well as devise and execute publicity for Spanish and LATAM local original series as well as original series with US Hispanic media and consumer appeal; they will break out talent that appeals to the US Hispanic market through earned media and strong existing press relationships; they will devise a US Hispanic market strategy; they will work closely with members of the LATAM teams for in market slate events with US Hispanic crossover and own relationships with the US Hispanic media on behalf of Netflix’ series. The Manager will help create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for series, making use of multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print and online. He/she will play a critical role in communicating with showrunners, talent and production company partners during production up to and beyond launch. They will focus on creating cultural moments and high impact campaigns, explore new tactics of promoting series, and will be able to communicate different facets of their campaigns to executives, showrunners, talent and talent representatives.  She or he will pitch media, secure opportunities and cover set visits or help plan and work junkets.  She or he has also worked alongside agencies, or has managed agencies on projects. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. This person will also be involved in the awards campaign, strategy and submission process for their shows.  The ideal candidate is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. He/she is doesn’t fall back on PR 101 tactics and is eager to put a new spin on what a series campaign can be.  They can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer, and is able to multi-task and work at a clip pace. They are not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that could mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from writing a strategy, writing a series announcement, booking travel or negotiating hair and make-up. They collaborate well with partners that range from content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. They aren’t timid about assessing their work when they are done to explore what they could have done differently or better.  A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style. They are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and question values inconsistent with our values and Netflix culture. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues. QualificationsThe successful candidate for Manager, Originals Publicity, US Hispanic will have at least 7-9 years of entertainment experience in an agency, studio, network or  journalism setting. They are fluent in Spanish. They have relationships with key US Hispanic media as well as the ability to build and maintain connections with key journalists and social media influencers. BA/BS required.COMPENSATIONNetflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.REPORTING RELATIONSHIPThe Manager, Originals Publicity, US Hispanic, reports to the Director of UCAN Publicity.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR PR Manager, Originals Series Publicity - US Hispanic


Netflix is looking for a Publicity Manager with expertise in the US Hispanic market to handle publicity for its original series and develop and execute strategy for its UCAN region (US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand). We need someone who is equipped and excited to spearhead publicity campaigns, autonomously with passion and creativity. With great original series like Marvel’s The Defenders, The Crown, Stranger Things, Ingobernable, Master of None, Narcos and more on the horizon, the Manager, Originals Series Publicity will be responsible for strategizing and executing innovative campaigns from top to bottom.  We need big thinkers who can put their traditional publicity know-how to work against a broader regional strategy that they contribute to, aligning closely with social and marketing.  


The Opportunity
Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have 100 million streaming members in over 190 countries. This is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading and handling publicity campaigns for the largest Internet TV network in the world, with a chance to work on series that feature high production value from the brightest filmmakers and actors around the world, using the latest technology.   


The Role
The Manager for Originals Series Publicity, US Hispanic, will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing publicity campaigns for series - not just for Netflix shows but also for its broader slate across the UCAN region.  


They will us their deep knowledge of the US Hispanic market to help prioritize support as well as devise and execute publicity for Spanish and LATAM local original series as well as original series with US Hispanic media and consumer appeal; they will break out talent that appeals to the US Hispanic market through earned media and strong existing press relationships; they will devise a US Hispanic market strategy; they will work closely with members of the LATAM teams for in market slate events with US Hispanic crossover and own relationships with the US Hispanic media on behalf of Netflix’ series. 


The Manager will help create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for series, making use of multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print and online. He/she will play a critical role in communicating with showrunners, talent and production company partners during production up to and beyond launch. They will focus on creating cultural moments and high impact campaigns, explore new tactics of promoting series, and will be able to communicate different facets of their campaigns to executives, showrunners, talent and talent representatives.  She or he will pitch media, secure opportunities and cover set visits or help plan and work junkets.  She or he has also worked alongside agencies, or has managed agencies on projects. They can formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. This person will also be involved in the awards campaign, strategy and submission process for their shows.  


The ideal candidate is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. He/she is doesn’t fall back on PR 101 tactics and is eager to put a new spin on what a series campaign can be.  They can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. He or she is a good listener and a real doer, and is able to multi-task and work at a clip pace. They are not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that could mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from writing a strategy, writing a series announcement, booking travel or negotiating hair and make-up. They collaborate well with partners that range from content/programming to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and they are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. They aren’t timid about assessing their work when they are done to explore what they could have done differently or better.  A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style. They are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and question values inconsistent with our values and Netflix culture. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they’re tactful in handling such issues. 


Qualifications
The successful candidate for Manager, Originals Publicity, US Hispanic will have at least 7-9 years of entertainment experience in an agency, studio, network or  journalism setting. They are fluent in Spanish. They have relationships with key US Hispanic media as well as the ability to build and maintain connections with key journalists and social media influencers. BA/BS required.


COMPENSATION
Netflix offers an attractive compensation package consisting of base salary, stock options, 401K (with match), comprehensive benefits and relocation.


REPORTING RELATIONSHIP
The Manager, Originals Publicity, US Hispanic, reports to the Director of UCAN Publicity.

text: Senior Software Engineer - Playback and Edge Access Services
description: Are you excited to design software solutions that continuously delight tens of millions of customers across 190+ countries around the world?  Do you have a passion for addressing the scale that comes with processing billions of requests daily?  Are you driven to create elegantly simple designs for tough architectural problems and inspiring others to do the same?  If so, we would love to talk to you!The Playback Access team at Netflix is looking for an experienced, passionate, and self-motivated engineer to help us build the systems that enable secure access to the Netflix content.  Our team develops Netflix’s cloud-based device and user authentication and content access systems. Through collaboration with the security engineering teams at Netflix, you will design distributed systems that implement security solutions for device and user authentication.  Our systems are in the critical path for the Netflix service, so we must design them to be highly scalable and resilient to failure.To be successful in this role, you must have excellent distributed systems software development and DevOps skills, and excel in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment.  You must be curious about current technologies, judicious in how you apply them, and be a quick learner who shares learnings with your stunning colleagues.  Ideally, you will have experience with security technologies and applications such as TLS, cryptographic key exchange and user and/or device authentication.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering IC Senior Software Engineer - Playback and Edge Access Services


Are you excited to design software solutions that continuously delight tens of millions of customers across 190+ countries around the world?  Do you have a passion for addressing the scale that comes with processing billions of requests daily?  Are you driven to create elegantly simple designs for tough architectural problems and inspiring others to do the same?  If so, we would love to talk to you!


The Playback Access team at Netflix is looking for an experienced, passionate, and self-motivated engineer to help us build the systems that enable secure access to the Netflix content.  Our team develops Netflix’s cloud-based device and user authentication and content access systems. Through collaboration with the security engineering teams at Netflix, you will design distributed systems that implement security solutions for device and user authentication.  Our systems are in the critical path for the Netflix service, so we must design them to be highly scalable and resilient to failure.


To be successful in this role, you must have excellent distributed systems software development and DevOps skills, and excel in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment.  You must be curious about current technologies, judicious in how you apply them, and be a quick learner who shares learnings with your stunning colleagues.  Ideally, you will have experience with security technologies and applications such as TLS, cryptographic key exchange and user and/or device authentication.

  • Address complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive design
  • Work at all phases of the development lifecycle (design, implementation, deployment and support)
  • Collaborate effectively with teammates and technical partners
  • Communicate technical ideas in cross-functional settings
  • Take end-to-end ownership of major features and components: from inception to operational support
  • Innovate rapidly to evolve systems in support of changing business needs
  • Utilize test-driven development and continuous integration practices
  • Have sharp attention to detail and openness to critique through code and design reviews
  • Perform opportunistic code refactoring (you are comfortable changing tires on a moving vehicle)
    • Responsibilities:
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience
  • 7+ years of relevant software development experience
  • Solid understanding of OOP/OOD principles, design patterns and data structures
  • Exceptional Java programming skills
  • Experience writing scalable web services
  • Experience with state-of-the art development tools and techniques
    • Required Skills & Experience:
  • Experience with cloud-based architectures at scale
  • Experience building and deploying applications using Amazon Web Services
  • Experience with distributed key-value persistence store environments
  • Experience with security concerns / technologies and protocols (SSL, key management, authN/authZ)
  • Experience with C#, C++, JavaScript, Python, Clojure and/or Groovy
    • Bonus Assets:
  • You have worked on and love to solve tough engineering problems
  • You are passionate about building distributed, reliable, scalable, performant microservices
  • You like to ship and support solutions that you design and build
  • You like to move fast, you thrive in a fast-paced environment of innovation and cross-team collaboration
  • You are comfortable taking calculated risks
  • You are curious about technology and love to learn and grow as an engineer
  • You enjoy mentoring and/or helping others develop their skills
  • You enjoy working collaboratively with other engineers
  • You communicate well, both written and verbally
    • About You:


    About Us
    Netflix is the leading provider of subscription streaming video, reaching over 95 million subscribers around the world. Netflix accounts for over one third of the Internet's downstream traffic during peak hours in North America, and we support more than 1,900 different device types. We have a strong commitment to open source and our software and is used by many companies.
    Netflix offers a unique culture that values freedom and responsibility.  Do you want to be excited to go to work in the morning? Feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Do you want to work with smart people who love to solve the hardest problems Netflix faces? This is the kind of environment that we value at Netflix. High performance is not only noticed but required. Freedom and responsibility aren’t just buzzwords, but how we operate every day.  Key values for our team include:


    • We value freedom and responsibility and context over control
    • We are loosely coupled but tightly aligned with our partners
    • We move quickly and work in small, rapid iterations
    • We automate mundane tasks
    • We love to keep learning
    • We get things done
    • We have fun!

search_text:
Alphaville, Brazil Marketing and PR PR Manager, Consumer PR - Latin America


Netflix is looking for a talented Public Relations professional with a strong understanding of the consumer and media landscape in Latin America. The Consumer PR Manager will support our initiatives for the Southern Latin America markets (Argentina/ Chile) based out of our Sao Paulo office. We are looking for someone who rapidly consume entertainment and is passionate and curious about the growing global entertainment landscape.


The role
The successful candidate will help build the Netflix brand and its service throughout Southern Latin America making use of multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print, and online. Working with agency partners, this professional will be critical in promoting Netflix as a Brand including how we fit into people's lives through our content, our technology and our unique service. Working closely with the Publicity team, Marketing, and Social Media, this person will help build integrated Brand PR into 360 brand and show campaigns. The role has strong cross functional interaction with teams in Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia with a high level of visibility and impact within the business.

  • Have experience working on global teams and managing global PR campaigns.
  • Love brands, appreciate a good brief and understand what to do with a genuine insight.
  • Understand how to build and maintain relationships with key journalists and different kinds of influencers on behalf of Netflix
  • Be capable as serving as a company spokesperson among press
  • Be confident and creative in their writing, capable of crafting everything from executive messaging to consumer facing newsletters, press releases and everything in between
  • Really loves entertainment...being a TV, movie or Netflix junkie is even better.
  • Be a native Spanish speaker. Portuguese is a plus
  • Be an amazing administrator, skilled at managing multiple tasks simultaneously and work well under pressure.
  • Speak fluent Spanish with strong written and verbal communication skills. Be a clear, candid and succinct communicator. Capable of crafting from executive messaging to consumer facing newsletters, press releases. Portuguese is a plus.
  • Be able to function autonomously and effectively as part of a loosely coupled, but highly-aligned team.
    • Understanding of the intersection between PR and social within the digital landscape is key. In addition, the Manager must:


    The Opportunity
    To support a growing team that guides public relations strategy for a fast growing and widely-admired brand. Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly watch TV shows and movies, Netflix has grown to over 100 million members in over 190 countries enjoying more than 125 million hours of TV shows and movies per day, including original series, documentaries and feature films. It’s a great time to join Netflix.


    Creative
    Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture and help refine compelling creative ideas and concepts.


    Succinct Communicator
    Great writer and clear talker. Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately. Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions. Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.

    A smart minimalist
    Keeps things simple. Knows that global communications can be made complex---and will resist and prevent that.


    Has a Point of View
    An independent thinker willing and able to express and support a point of view.


    Pace
    Moves at a nice clip and enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course, be scrappy and get things done within short timeframes.


    Integrity
    Has sound judgment, and will question actions inconsistent with company values.


    REPORTING RELATIONSHIP
    The Manager Consumer PR, Latin America reports to the Director - Consumer PR

Amsterdam, Netherlands Content Production Manager, Physical Production - EMEA


We are seeking an experienced Production Executive to help manage both internal and third party co-productions from an International Originals perspective to support international original series. Responsibilities include establishing and curating vendor & staff/crew relations, reviewing budgets and supporting/suggesting best practices from pre production through delivery. This position will report in to the Director, International Originals Production in Los Angeles. Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of production with our International Original series projects.


The Opportunity: Fueled by the broad appeal of being able to instantly enjoy unlimited movies and TV shows, Netflix has grown to have over 100 million streaming members worldwide. With continued international expansion and a move into original film acquisition and production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix.


The Role: A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative.

description: At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our members need our help from time to time, and that’s where our Global Customer Service (CS) organization focuses; providing amazing interactions with our subscribers around the world.  Our goal is excellence, simplicity and getting our members back to streaming. Netflix is looking for a talented Certification Assessment Developer to join our Global CS Learning & Development (L&D) team in Los Gatos.Netflix’s CS Global Learning & Development team provides service and tools training for both internal and external BPO call centers around the globe, having a direct impact on our customers and the business. search_text:
Los Gatos, California Customer Service Customer Service Certification Assessment Developer


At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Our members need our help from time to time, and that’s where our Global Customer Service (CS) organization focuses; providing amazing interactions with our subscribers around the world.  Our goal is excellence, simplicity and getting our members back to streaming. Netflix is looking for a talented Certification Assessment Developer to join our Global CS Learning & Development (L&D) team in Los Gatos.


Netflix’s CS Global Learning & Development team provides service and tools training for both internal and external BPO call centers around the globe, having a direct impact on our customers and the business. This role reports into the Manager of the L&D Services team and will contribute to the evolution of our CS certification program as we expand to new audiences.

  • Program Management: Define, document, and maintain the scope of the project. Communicate effectively with key stakeholders and teammates in meetings and through email. Perform risk assessment and mitigation. Create, track, and maintain project plans. Develop a trusting partnership and commitment with clients, partners, and stakeholders.
  • Assessment Development: Manage the development of learning evaluations from end-to-end, creating the tools, items, assessments, and instruments necessary in order to certify employees in various knowledge, skills, or competencies. Identify appropriate evaluation methods such as surveys, multiple-choice tests, simulations, performance assessments, etc. as needed. Provide subject matter expertise to colleagues and stakeholders regarding monitoring and evaluation concepts, methods, and systems, and drive the evolution of the overall evaluation and certification strategy.
  • Job Analysis Studies: Manage the process for collecting information on the important work-related aspects of a job using a variety of inputs. Perform gap analysis for performance problems, opportunities, or innovations. Prioritize the importance of identified gaps and recommend interventions. Document and present the methods, findings, and recommendations for addressing the performance gaps.
  • Data Analysis: Conduct statistical analyses to support assessment development and validation, pass point setting, and assessment scoring. Conduct qualitative data gathering techniques including interviewing and focus groups.
    • Responsibilities
  • Master’s degree in Industrial-Organizational Psychology or related degree (or Bachelor’s degree with extensive years relevant experience)
  • 4-6 years experience designing soft skills and/or tools assessments for a variety of jobs
  • Experience in educational measurement, test construction, and/or psycho-metrics
  • Experience using statistical, spreadsheet, and/or web-based assessment development applications
  • Knowledge of Item Response Theory
  • Experience with certification programs and the assessment development process
  • Experience with traditional and performance-based assessment
    • Requirements
  • Experience with assessment gamification a plus

search_text:
Los Gatos, California Engineering Product Engineering IC Senior Software Engineer - Recommendations


The Opportunity


Netflix is the world's first global internet television network, known for its personalization technologies. This year, Netflix will invest $6 billion in content and will create over 1000 hours of original content with great Hollywood talents like Angelina Jolie and Martin Scorsese. The Netflix service delights more than 100 millions of members around the world with original movies and TV shows like "13 Reasons Why" and "Stranger Things", including reboot of old favorites like "Arrested Development" and "Gilmore Girls."


The Recommendations team develops algorithms and builds the recommendation systems that drive personalization to over 100 million of members across the globe, connecting our members and helping them discover great story telling on Netflix.


Here are some examples of the types of things we work on:


• Design & develop the next generation of web services that serve video recommendations
• Build large-scale distributed computation on Spark for producing targeting scores and predictions
• Innovate on personalization algorithm through A/B testing
• Provide accessibility to scores to other clients like Homepage, Consumer Science & Messaging
• Construct visualization that provides insights to recommendation data


Who We Are Looking For


You are an accomplished and passionate software engineer. You shine in a high-performance culture.


You want to engineer scalable and resilient Recommendation Systems. You’re excited by collaborating with product managers, UI engineers, data analysts and research engineers across product organizations to innovate personalization through A/B testing. You want to impact large-scale pipelines and systems that process terabytes of data. You exhibit leadership skills and want to drive technical direction for next generation systems that generate the demand of our next big original series.


We're looking for someone who has most of the following and is willing to learn the rest on the job as needed:

  • Strong verbal and written communication
  • Excel in fast-paced & dynamic environment
  • 5+ years of experience with hands-on, server side development
  • Expertise in JVM based languages (Java, Scala)
  • Expertise in concurrent programming and data structures
  • Proven skills in object-oriented development
    • Minimum:
  • Proficiency in design and development of RESTful webservices
  • Proficiency in SQL or a SQL-like language and experience with Hadoop technologies like Hive & Spark
  • Experience in AWS cloud computing
  • Experience in large scale distributed systems
  • Exposure to AB/Testing
  • Exposure to analytics, statistics, big data
  • Exposure to machine learning
    • Preferred:

Netflix is a subscription based Internet streaming service with over 100 million members across 190 countries. Membership platform is a critical system that manages 100+ million memberships and enables customers to subscribe via Netflix App and Partner channels like iTunes, T-Mobile etc.


The Membership engineering team builds the infrastructure services and tools to enable a great customer experience on all the platforms, from the TV App to Mobile App to Customer service. Our services abstract the complexity around subscriber signup, member pricing, gifts and promotions, membership lifecycle and operate at scale to enable critical functions like concurrent streams, video quality, etc.

Alphaville, Brazil Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Social Media - Brazil


Are you beyond The Process? Unafraid of the Upside Down? The Daredevil trying to make the social space a better place?


Netflix is looking for a Social Media Manager to lead social marketing and communications for Netflix Originals in Brazil. This position is based in São Paulo. Different from the Social Brand Manager at the helm of @Netflix social properties, the Originals Social Manager is tasked with building social fandom around our key global shows like Orange Is the New Black, House of Cards, Stranger Things or Narcos.


While we regard community management as an essential and key function for this role, social managers at Netflix do a lot more than just publishing and replying to fans. Netflix social managers have a holistic view of the company and work closely with regional marketing and PR teams, as well as with other members of the social team tasked with building communities around our original shows.


As such, social managers also function as social strategists in charge of developing and executing campaigns designed to both sustain and bolster positive social engagement around key shows with an emphasis on high-impact executions capable of generating social spikes and earned media.

  • Adapting and complementing global campaigns and social strategies to increase their cultural and local relevance. This effort reaches far beyond simple localization and focuses instead on leveraging market and cultural insights to produce high-impact creative like this and this.
  • Effective partnering with marketing and PR counterparts to build cross-functional campaigns and strategies.
  • Determining and managing budgets for agency retainers, stunts and other campaign tactics like influencer outreach and social creator programs.
  • Providing social insights to determine if specific shows have social potential in the market.
  • Managing existing agencies in the region and adjust or end relationships with vendors as needed in order to ensure high quality standards and effective investment.
  • Ensuring the creation of monthly analytic reports on audience growth, best performing tactics and key conversational threads with the aim to improve strategy or engineer cultural moments.
  • Identify content creators and social influencers in key market and work on establishing partnerships rather than merely transactional relationships with them.
  • Build relationship within representatives of key social platforms to procure first-to- market social strategies and tactics.
  • Interfacing with the Programmatic media buying team to provide the right social ad creative for specific target audiences.
    • Specific responsibilities include:


    Our ideal candidate will be:


    Deeply knowledgeable about social media in Brazil. The manager will be tapped into emerging platforms, aware of other successful campaigns, and will have a vision for success in a competitive landscape. As a member of our lean and agile team, the successful employee will be as comfortable firing off a humorous tweet as they are writing strategy and producing a major campaign for an original show.


    Creative. Our social channels are one of the best tools we have to nurture relationships with members and make Netflix a brand people love so much they want to change their Facebook status to being “In a serious relationship with Netflix.” We need someone who can put forth big ideas, stunning creative, and spot on copy in support of new content, the product, and the brand. The winning manager will also be responsible for integrating social media into campaigns from our counterparts in PR and Marketing.


    Able to demonstrate a proven track record in project management. The candidate will have experience working with agencies and will have run successful campaigns for a major brand or entertainment property either in house or at an agency.


    An adult. Every tweet is an official statement from the brand. Our winning candidate will have a deep understanding of the business context and will make intelligent decisions that benefit the long term value of the brand. The candidate will also represent the social team in regional markets and to other departments, working closely with Netflix Marketing, PR, Product, Content Licensing, Customer Service, and Insights groups. The manager will exhibit quick thinking, great calm, excellent taste, and a good sense of humor.


    Fun. At the end of the day, we’re selling entertainment. The successful manager will be someone who loves TV and film more than sharks love blood, and can speak naturally about the entertainment business, buzzworthy new TV shows, and the latest Oscar bait, as well as understanding how to connect these with the national conversation in noteworthy and innovative ways.


    Qualifications: The candidate will have a bachelor’s degree and a minimum of five years’ experience working in a corporate, agency, or studio setting focused on social media and digital marketing communications.

description: At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Like our customers, we love movies and TV shows and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want.  Netflix is one of the most talked about entertainment brands on social. We are looking for an experienced Senior Researcher who can sift through millions of conversations about our series, films, and brand, and listen for insightful nuggets that help us better understand how consumers are engaging with and talking about us and our shows across EMEA. We don’t get distracted by job titles, but good to know that a Senior Researcher is a valued consumer consultant, whose voice carries weight. This person will partner with our regional marketing team to help them understand what people have to say, to help them tell incredible stories and to help them develop world class campaigns. We believe that an expert focus in a region helps to decode local culture, guide the overall process and we are looking for an expert in the EMEA region with deeper knowledge in the at least 3 or 4 of the larger European markets. Experience in other markets across the broader region too would be a bonus.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Consumer Insights Senior Researcher, Social Listening - EMEA


At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to watch. Like our customers, we love movies and TV shows and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want.  


Netflix is one of the most talked about entertainment brands on social. We are looking for an experienced Senior Researcher who can sift through millions of conversations about our series, films, and brand, and listen for insightful nuggets that help us better understand how consumers are engaging with and talking about us and our shows across EMEA. We don’t get distracted by job titles, but good to know that a Senior Researcher is a valued consumer consultant, whose voice carries weight. This person will partner with our regional marketing team to help them understand what people have to say, to help them tell incredible stories and to help them develop world class campaigns. We believe that an expert focus in a region helps to decode local culture, guide the overall process and we are looking for an expert in the EMEA region with deeper knowledge in the at least 3 or 4 of the larger European markets. Experience in other markets across the broader region too would be a bonus.



  • A social listening expert - you are well versed in the fundamentals of social listening, and can apply those fundamentals to a suite of social listening tools (Crimson Hexagon, Sysomos, Netbase, Brandwatch, etc.)
  • Fluent in Boolean - you are proficient in crafting advanced boolean queries that cast a wide net but weed out irrelevant chatter
  • Familiar with social platforms’ native insights offerings (Facebook Insights, Facebook Audience Insights, Twitter Analytics, YouTube Analytics, etc.)
  • Understands how consumer behavior varies across different social networks
    • Has a strong background in social media analytics:
  • You are skeptical of an insight until you thoroughly investigate the underlying data
  • You treat tentpole moments (new series announcements, trailers, series launch) as “breaking news” and quickly identify and socialize valid insights
  • You are a serial hypothesis tester - instead of looking for specific answers, you like to explore the social web to uncover behaviors, and validate those behaviors with social data
  • You are a trend hunter - you know how and where to spot emerging trends
    • Approaches social analytics as investigative journalism:
  • You are curious about social data and its implications, and have a finger on the pulse of industry trends and innovations
    • Is passionate about the social data industry:
  • Goes beyond cookie-cutter analysis and collaborates with internal partners to provide bespoke solutions
  • Understands how to turn consumer insights from “he said she said” into actionable findings that move the business forward
  • Looks for big themes - connects the dots and surface learnings from past research to apply today.
  • Has experience socializing research findings across different departments - PR, social, creative - and can pivot to the needs of each
  • Is a phenomenal communicator, written and verbal - can write concise, thoughtful summaries on short timelines for executive audiences
  • Grasps overall business objectives and larger strategic context of any work that is done
  • Is aware of the nuances of social data, and closely partners with other researchers on the consumer insights team to tell a rounded story
    • Is a standout internal consultant:
  • Is a self-starter (proactive and can work autonomously), but also loves working in a team and wants to avoid a silo environment
    • Is a great team member:
  • At least 7 years of hands-on social analytics experience at a global brand, agency, consulting firm, studio, or media publisher
  • A social media native - consumes social media as a user and studies it as a researcher
  • Experience in working with global teams across different timezones
  • Bachelor’s Degree required
  • Proficient in presentation, spreadsheet or word processing software (ideally some experience with the Google Drive suite)
  • Experience presenting / socialising insights at all levels of an organisation (and esp. to non-researchers)
  • Familiarity with BI software (Tableau, Micro Strategy) a plus
  • Proficiency in English, and an additional European language a strong plus
    • Essential qualifications:

description: As a Tech Ops Specialist at Netflix, you will be responsible for providing exceptional support to our production accountants and growing productions in our LA based studio. We want to empower the production landscape, utilizing never-before-seen streamlined, efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.  We’re looking for TECH OPS SPECIALISTS willing to pioneer the advancement of technology into Netflix productions. This requires extreme flexibility, unending creativity and a proactive approach to transforming the production culture.  You will serve as a liaison between Netflix teams and the productions to assist in infusing technology and gaining proper adoption of our in-house technology solutions.  This role operates within the system deployment side of Production Operations, part of the Netflix Production team. Tech Ops Specialists will report to the Manager of Production Technology.The Tech Ops Specialist will be an ambassador of Netflix production technology. He/She will embody the passion for transformation and workflow advancements utilizing brand new creative technologies. This role will be a point of contact for technology support for our productions with expertise in how productions utilize software now and in the future. The Tech Ops Specialist is one part production, one part cloud-based software, and one part hardware infrastructure. He/She must have a working knowledge of current web-based software trends, both within entertainment and outside of entertainment. He/She will assess technical infrastructure needs for production build-outs (stages and offices) and provide hardware via internal resources and external vendors. Passion for change and creative thinking is a must.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Post Production Tech Ops Specialist, Production Operations (LA)


As a Tech Ops Specialist at Netflix, you will be responsible for providing exceptional support to our production accountants and growing productions in our LA based studio. We want to empower the production landscape, utilizing never-before-seen streamlined, efficiencies individually and as a whole to facilitate creation of the world’s best streaming content.  We’re looking for TECH OPS SPECIALISTS willing to pioneer the advancement of technology into Netflix productions. This requires extreme flexibility, unending creativity and a proactive approach to transforming the production culture.  You will serve as a liaison between Netflix teams and the productions to assist in infusing technology and gaining proper adoption of our in-house technology solutions.  This role operates within the system deployment side of Production Operations, part of the Netflix Production team. Tech Ops Specialists will report to the Manager of Production Technology.


The Tech Ops Specialist will be an ambassador of Netflix production technology. He/She will embody the passion for transformation and workflow advancements utilizing brand new creative technologies. This role will be a point of contact for technology support for our productions with expertise in how productions utilize software now and in the future. The Tech Ops Specialist is one part production, one part cloud-based software, and one part hardware infrastructure. He/She must have a working knowledge of current web-based software trends, both within entertainment and outside of entertainment. He/She will assess technical infrastructure needs for production build-outs (stages and offices) and provide hardware via internal resources and external vendors. Passion for change and creative thinking is a must.



  • Production Technology POC
    • -Act as the primary technical point of contact and develop personal relationships related to the advancement of technology with our productions.
    -Work within production security guidelines to encourage safe collaboration of Netflix production data.
  • Product
    • -Create a feedback loop for production tools in order to develop a mastery of production software and the workflows.
  • Training
    • -Production specific G-Suite training.
    -Build training material: devise creative, unique, and scalable training solutions and support techniques for our production personnel.
  • Support
    • -Single POC for production technology needs: support requests will come in via tickets, emails, phone calls and automated alerts.
    -As technology develops, operationalize support models and generate run-book plans for remote support.
    -Work hand-in-hand with NERDS remote support and DevOps engineering support via support escalation models.
  • IT
    • -IT support for the production accountants
    -Own the automation of the on-premise hardware requests (i.e. vending machines)
    -Build out IT technology needs for new stages
    -Administration for G-Suite and internal technology solutions on top of the Google platform.
    -IT equipment procurement and delivery: Imaging machines, maintaining stock, configuring and troubleshooting printers and scanners and equipment deliveries.  
    -Refine all methods of hardware selection, inventory management and IT vendor relations by partnering with NERDS and Purchasing.
  • Production Office Build-Outs
    • -Partner with productions, Systems Management, Network Infrastructure, and A/V on assessing and delivering on technical infrastructure needs.
    -Deploy production office technology (computers, printers, AV, applications, wireless) to our productions.
    -Partner with third party sources vendors when applicable.
    RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Entertainment Industry Experience
    • -5-10+ years within entertainment production technology including experience with production office applications (Scenechronize, Final Draft, Office, etc.)
    -Keen understanding of current production, post, vfx, prod accounting workflows and how technology is used (and will be used in future) and a knowledge of production/post production infrastructure requirements.
  • IT
    • -A minimum of 3 years of IT or Desktop Support/System Administration
    -Familiarity with fundamental networking/distributed computing environment concepts; local and network based user and group accounts and permissions
    -Knowledge of imaging and sys mgmt software including Landesk and Jamf
    -Experience supporting Cloud and SaaS Applications and SSO: G-Suite including Gmail, Calendaring, Drive, Sites, and Groups and AWS.
    -In depth knowledge of and the ability to perform advanced troubleshooting on Mac OS, Windows 7,8 & 10, and various applications including Office and Adobe software
    -Solid working knowledge of Mac and Lenovo hardware including laptops & desktops
    -Mobile device support including iPhone, Android, Windows
    REQUIREMENTS
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly and with minimal guidance.
  • Thrives on technical challenges and takes pride in solving them.
  • Strategic thinking both technically and business-wise.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision; must be a self-motivated self-starter that can initiate ideas.
  • Strong ability to dive into the unknown and create clarity amid chaos.
  • Experience with supporting people remotely.
  • Flexible amid an ever-changing and growing environment.
  • Working knowledge of Google Apps Script or other scripting languages a big plus.

    Candidates need to be drivers in good standing as travel is required.

description: It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 117 million members in over 190 countries and we won’t stop there. Asia has become a very strategic market for us and the driver of our Netflix’s growth in the future. We have ambitious plans to grow our business and subscriber base in the region - that’s where you come in.We are seeking a world-class leader to join the Global Payments and Asia leadership team. You will have the opportunity to solve one of the most exciting business challenges for Netflix in Asia - Asia is so unique and diverse when it comes to payments and we can't grow the business in Asia without the ability to understand and address consumer’s payments needs here. Netflix is among the largest recurrence payments company in the world, and we hope to ultimately elevate our payments capability in Asia to the scale of our future growth. You will be the ambassador for Netflix in the payments / fintech ecosystem in Asia and the voice of Asia to our global team. You will have the opportunity to create, own and lead the payments strategy for this unique and dynamic region. The Director of Payments, Asia is a high visibility position which will reside in Singapore and report to the VP of Global Payments in Los Gatos, California.In order to be successful at Netflix, you must be able to anticipate and meet ever increasing business demands while demonstrating strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.  You must thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results all while exhibiting the highest level of professional integrity.
search_text:
Singapore, Singapore Finance Business Development Director of Payments - Asia


It's an amazing time to be joining the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 117 million members in over 190 countries and we won’t stop there. Asia has become a very strategic market for us and the driver of our Netflix’s growth in the future. We have ambitious plans to grow our business and subscriber base in the region - that’s where you come in.


We are seeking a world-class leader to join the Global Payments and Asia leadership team. You will have the opportunity to solve one of the most exciting business challenges for Netflix in Asia - Asia is so unique and diverse when it comes to payments and we can't grow the business in Asia without the ability to understand and address consumer’s payments needs here. Netflix is among the largest recurrence payments company in the world, and we hope to ultimately elevate our payments capability in Asia to the scale of our future growth. You will be the ambassador for Netflix in the payments / fintech ecosystem in Asia and the voice of Asia to our global team. You will have the opportunity to create, own and lead the payments strategy for this unique and dynamic region. The Director of Payments, Asia is a high visibility position which will reside in Singapore and report to the VP of Global Payments in Los Gatos, California.


In order to be successful at Netflix, you must be able to anticipate and meet ever increasing business demands while demonstrating strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.  You must thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results all while exhibiting the highest level of professional integrity.

  • Who is comfortable defining and executing the payments strategy for the Asia region. You are confident interacting with all levels of the organization and are comfortable debating controversial topics with cross-functional stakeholders and executives without any hand holding.
  • Who doesn’t care about titles - you care about getting things done.  Netflix is a flat organization, which means even leadership is often asked to take on additional responsibilities at lightning speeds without any pretenses.
  • Who can manage cross-functional teams to operationalize the region’s payment strategy.

Netflix is the leading video streaming service globally, and the Netflix web client application is one of the most widely used apps in the Windows Store. Our mission is to provide a great experience to all users in a variety of devices, from desktop/laptop, to tablets and phones. We are constantly focused on enhancing our consumer experience around the world by building out new product features and improving performance.
 
If you are a software engineer interested in participating in developing web based applications from UI, platform to our backend endpoints in the cloud, you may be a good fit for our engineering team. Additionally, you would own all aspects of the development cycle, from participating in the design, and test driven development.

  • A passion for learning and working effectively in a nimble environment.

    • Bonus if you have experience with:




     More about Netflix


    This is a great time to be at Netflix!  The organization is flat, process is minimal, and there’s an emphasis on keeping non-productive influences out.  Every day, we make decisions with far-reaching technical and product impact as we build this new business and delight our members with a whole new way of enjoying movies and TV.


    We recently updated our culture doc that describes how we work; it’s worth a read to find out how we manage via context rather than control.

search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and PR Marketing Manager, Social Media - Latin America


Are you the one they better call on for all things social? Unafraid of the Upside Down? The Daredevil trying to make the social space a better place?


Netflix is looking for a Social Media Manager to lead social marketing and communications for Netflix Originals in Latin America, with special emphasis in Mexico and Colombia. This position will be based in Los Angeles. Different from the Social Brand Manager at the helm of @Netflix social properties, the Originals Social Manager is tasked with building social fandom around our key global shows like Orange Is the New Black, House of Cards, Stranger Things or Narcos.


While we regard community management as an essential and key function for this role, social managers at Netflix do a lot more than just publishing and replying to fans. Netflix social managers have a holistic view of the company and work closely with regional marketing and PR teams, as well as with other members of the social team tasked with building communities around our original shows.


As such, social managers also function as social strategists in charge of developing and executing campaigns designed to both sustain and bolster positive social engagement around key shows with an emphasis on high-impact executions capable of generating social spikes and earned media.

  • Adapting and complementing global campaigns and social strategies to increase their cultural and local relevance. This effort reaches far beyond content localization and focuses instead on leveraging market and cultural insights to produce high-impact creative like this and this.
  • Effective partnering with marketing and PR counterparts to build cross-functional campaigns and strategies.
  • Determining and managing budgets for agency retainers, stunts and other campaign tactics like influencer outreach and social creator programs.
  • Providing social insights to determine if specific shows have social potential in the market.
  • Managing existing agencies in the region and adjust or end relationships with vendors as needed in order to ensure high quality standards and effective investment.
  • Ensuring the creation of monthly analytic reports on audience growth, best performing tactics and key conversational threads with the aim to improve strategy or engineer cultural moments.
  • Identify content creators and social influencers in key market and work on establishing partnerships rather than merely transactional relationships with them.
  • Build relationship within representatives of key social platforms to procure first-to- market social strategies and tactics.
  • Interfacing with the Programmatic media buying team to provide the right social ad creative for specific target audiences.
    • Specific responsibilities include:


    Our ideal candidate will be:


    Deeply knowledgeable about social media in Latin America​. The manager will be tapped into emerging platforms, aware of other successful campaigns, and will have a vision for success in a competitive landscape. As a member of our lean and agile team, the successful employee will be as comfortable firing off a humorous tweet as they are writing strategy and producing a major campaign for an original show.


    Creative​. Our social channels are one of the best tools we have to nurture relationships with members and make Netflix a brand people love so much they want to change their Facebook status to being “In a serious relationship with Netflix.” We need someone who can put forth big ideas, stunning creative, and spot on copy in support of new content, the product, and the brand. The winning manager will also be responsible for integrating social media into campaigns from our counterparts in PR and Marketing.


    Able to demonstrate a proven track record in project management. ​The candidate will have experience working with agencies and will have run successful campaigns for a major brand or entertainment property either in house or at an agency.


    An adult.​ Every tweet is an official statement from the brand. Our winning candidate will have a deep understanding of the business context and will make intelligent decisions that benefit the long term value of the brand. The candidate will also represent the social team in regional markets and to other departments, working closely with Netflix Marketing, PR, Product, Content Licensing, Customer Service, and Insights groups. The manager will exhibit quick thinking, great calm, excellent taste, and a good sense of humor.


    Fun​. At the end of the day, we’re selling entertainment. The successful manager will be someone who loves TV and film more than sharks love blood, and can speak naturally about the entertainment business, buzzworthy new TV shows, and the latest Oscar bait, as well as understanding how to connect these with the national conversation in noteworthy and innovative ways.


    Qualifications: The candidate will have a bachelor’s degree and a minimum of five years’ experience working in a corporate, agency, or studio setting focused on social media and digital marketing communications.

description: It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. The Marketing Operations team at Netflix brings creative concepts and strategy to life at global scale through technical innovation. We’re breaking new ground in Asia, and we want like-minded individuals who want to be apart of this revolutionary journey.We are looking for a very seasoned, dynamic and effectively Digital Producer to lead digital innovation and production of best-in-class marketing and advertising campaigns for the Pan-APAC region. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the end-to-end digital and production processes of our campaign initiatives, with a predominant digital, video and social focus. This means you thrive in a fast-paced environment that requires you to bridge BOTH creative and technical needs. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain, and as well as an effective communicator.The RoleBased in Singapore and reporting to the Senior Manager of APAC Marketing Operations, you will join a team of Integrated and Digital Producers to ensure digital creative materials for online campaigns in Asia Pacific markets are tailor made to each country’s needs, as well as providing support on all end-to-end digital production as part of our Global Digital Campaigns.
search_text:
Singapore, Singapore Marketing and PR Marketing Pan-APAC Digital Producer - APAC


It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. The Marketing Operations team at Netflix brings creative concepts and strategy to life at global scale through technical innovation. We’re breaking new ground in Asia, and we want like-minded individuals who want to be apart of this revolutionary journey.


We are looking for a very seasoned, dynamic and effectively Digital Producer to lead digital innovation and production of best-in-class marketing and advertising campaigns for the Pan-APAC region. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the end-to-end digital and production processes of our campaign initiatives, with a predominant digital, video and social focus. This means you thrive in a fast-paced environment that requires you to bridge BOTH creative and technical needs. You are an avid user of both your left and right brain, and as well as an effective communicator.


The Role
Based in Singapore and reporting to the Senior Manager of APAC Marketing Operations, you will join a team of Integrated and Digital Producers to ensure digital creative materials for online campaigns in Asia Pacific markets are tailor made to each country’s needs, as well as providing support on all end-to-end digital production as part of our Global Digital Campaigns.

  • Drive digital creative innovation across Pan-APAC, managing and owning local agency relationships to maintain digital creative executions that help further our brand and connect new fans to Netflix Original titles.
  • Manage digital production and oversee delivery of assets, focusing on dynamic display, rich media, online video, mobile and social creative types.
  • Lead communications during the project lifecycle to ensure that external agencies and internal stakeholders from Creative, Media, Production and Regional Marketing are aligned.
  • Be an in-market local digital expert, driving communications about best-in-class activations, technical and cultural nuances with global teams.
  • Manage localization, production process and creative approvals of advertising materials (including clearances, delivery, AdOps, trafficking, etc.) across Pan-APAC.
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines.
  • Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all digital tracking is implemented correctly, efficiently, deadlines are met, and executions are flawless.
  • Work closely with the global and regional teams, supporting local implementation of global campaigns, leveraging global materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions.
    • Responsibilities include:
  • At least 7+ years of online marketing and display advertising experience, preferably at an entertainment brand, advertising or creative content agency with an emphasis on display, rich media, video and paid social for desktop and mobile platforms.
  • Strong leadership and communication skills, managing cross-functional stakeholders across multiple touch points.
  • Fluency of digital creative technology and marketing best practices, IAB standards, programmatic and dynamic creative development.
  • Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams, whilst being meticulous with the details.
  • Ability to translate creative ideas through to technical and native executions, for various ad serving platforms and proprietary publisher platforms.
  • High competency and proven track record of building high performance digital marketing experiences across display, social, mobile and online video channels.
  • Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams, preferably across wider Asia Pacific. Global experience is a bonus.
  • Hands on experience working with Doubleclick and other 3rd party ad serving platforms, QA & trafficking processes and experience troubleshooting directly with local Publisher teams.
  • Experience with QA and troubleshooting directly with Publisher teams.
  • Experience producing custom tools and proprietary systems to solve business challenges.
  • Knowledgeable of and familiar with leading digital agencies across Asia Pacific.
  • Expert knowledge of the trends and limitations of the evolving APAC digital marketing ecosystem, including exposure to/experience with programmatic buying and paid social platforms.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Fluency in any of Asian languages will be advantageous, including Korean, Cantonese, Bahasa Melayu, Bahasa Indonesian or Thai.
    • Qualifications:
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. 
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing and paid social creative.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and leadership in the face of ambiguity.
  • You are always-solving and forever curious.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge!
    • Personality Attributes:

search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Marketing and PR Marketing Senior Manager Partner Marketing - France


Netflix is revolutionizing the world of entertainment around the world both for consumers and for partners: we want our shows to be ubiquitous, granting access to them to everybody with any device and any operator. 


We have an amazing opportunity to join the EMEA Partner Marketing team as a Senior Partner Marketing Manager - France. The ideal candidate would be responsible for managing the local partner marketing campaigns and relationships with partners ranging from MVPD's to ISP's and device partners such as Google, Samsung, LG, PlayStation and Apple.


We are looking for a seasoned professional who has experience managing and growing relationships with partners and is passionate about owning the full life cycle of content partner marketing projects from idea to execution.

  • Own the marketing relationship with our partners in France.
  • Work closely cross functionally with our business development, marketing and product teams 
  • Provide seamless and strategic support to partners and maximize Netflix exposure on their marketing channels and engagement on partner devices to create best in class launches and campaigns
  • Collaborate with partner marketing creative teams to elevate the Netflix brand and introduce our content to consumers in unique and unexpected ways
  • Activate deals by developing and launching creative partner marketing programs that advance exposure for Netflix content or the brand in a way that also benefits our partners
  • Drive integration between broader content and brand programs at Netflix and our strategic partners
  • Evaluate performance against marketing goals with partners through established review rhythm and define corrective actions to improve effectiveness and results

    • While the role will be based in our Amsterdam office, it will  require frequent travel in the region
    Essential duties and responsibilities:
  • Extensive knowledge and experience in France in linked industries like consumer entertainment and/or gaming
  • Strong experience in consumer marketing with natural partner management and influencing skills
  • Natural partner engagement skills with the ability to develop rapport and translate established partner relationships to programs that impact the business.
  • Ability to analyze and apply data to business strategy and goals.
  • Experience and passion for building great content partner marketing programs that are unique and scalable.
  • Experience working with Entertainment properties (movies, tv series, video games, music, etc) is essential.
  • Experience working across different regions and cultures, in industries like consumer electronics and/or telco is a plus.
  • Ability to manage multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously without the support of a large team, working both independently and in close collaboration with a wide variety of stakeholders.
  • Strong cross-team collaboration skills and ability to promote innovation through a creative collaboration process that transforms different input into one actionable output. 
  • A desire to thrive in our unique culture.
  • An ability to effectively provide input on creative development from a local market perspective.
  • Strong level of independence and efficiency while maintaining a high-degree of organization.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Bachelor's degree - Advanced degree.
  • Native level of French and excellent written and oral communication skills in English is required
  • Pay TV and Entertainment background is a plus
